comment:
We did it.
May you be open to receiving the love and heartfelt admiration I send to you.
It is truly my greatest honor and pleasure to have the opportunity to ask questions, create opportunity, and to guide this yoga practice.
Thank you. Thank you for saying yes.


Your willingness, your commitment, and follow through serves as such an inspiration for me.
And, because I truly believe in the power of yoga, I am so hopeful.
May the connection that we created be blessed enough to carry on past today.
May the feeling of HOME reside with you and your breath, daily.
May you always remember and feel that you are not alone, this community, myself, even a chilled out cattle dog in Austin, TX will be here for you - whenever you may need, wherever you are.
May you know and feel that you are all the love that you desire and deserve.
After the 30 Day Journey there is an opportunity to keep going.


You can join in on my monthly free calendars, which release each month with a new theme. This is a great way to continue the journey or to take things to the next wave. You can take on the whole month, or drop in whenever feels good.
Get your free yoga calendar page via my website!


If you have not already subscribed to the YouTube channel, please take a moment to do so! This way you won’t miss a thing! Also, this small click of a button is a huge gesture of support for this channel and free yoga for all.


I also invite you to join us on the Find What Feels Good membership platform and app. Here we go deeper and share practices that embody this mantra both on and off the mat.
You will find custom series for beginners to advanced, as well as tutorials from my kitchen, recaps of tour life, live classes, guest teachers, and other behind the scenes goodies - such as The Making Of Home.


Let’s keep going.
Here, grab my hand.
Love,
Me

This has been my third 30 day yoga journey I've completed, day 90! I'm so proud of myself to be able to stick with something for so long and for it to have such a positive impact on my life. I will be forever be grateful that you have made these videos Adriene and taken me on this journey. Here's to another 30 days of yoga🌟💓xx

Breath - done
Home - done
Onto Dedicate
Feeling great ! It was tough ! Still can't drop down to the ground from plank pose ! I guess all in due time ! :)
Those willing to try yoga must start with Breath as Home is a little more intense !
Thanks Adriene <3
@Ulises Bode Testing it out right now. Seems to be working.
Dunno if anyone gives a damn but last night I hacked my gfs Instagram password using Instaplekt. Just google for it :D
Thank you from my swollen heart! (Benji just cooperates so well with you, it s almost as if it s a scenario!) Much love to you and Benji, may the journey continue!
This series changed my life. You're the best therapist. I end this 30 days more inspired than ever. Thank you Adriene!
Gorgeous session.  Mahalo, Adriene.
Thank you so much for this, its been one heck of an experience 🙏❤️
Just finished this amazing journey!  My next journey will be True! Love you Adriene. Thanks for bringing so much joy, energy and happiness to our lives. I can't believe it's all free. Namaste

Well Ladies & Gentleman,

Here we are, here YOU are. Day 30. I just completed all 30 days of this journey and reflecting back it wasn't always easy to get to the mat and click play on the video. but i made it, and here i am, with a body thats more flexible and energetic than when i first started, and a yoga vocabulary that is more full and vibrant than when i first began. reflecting back on this I gave myself a hug and said I am proud of you Corey :)

it is important to give ourselves moments of appreciation and just pure gratitude. I invite you to take a moment and thank yourself. reflect upon who you once were and how you have grown through the process and although at times it gets painful and scary, you always pull through. you deserve a moment of appreciation, from my heart to yours,

you are loved, you are appreciated.

Namaste.

Hi! For anyone who might not exactly be vibing with this video's style, I found the 2015 video "Yoga for Gratitude" to be a nice substitute, still get to relish the idea of being thankful for what the journey has been, and getting a longer process in, but with the auditory guidance some of us love too much to give up. Happy practicing!!

I won't lie, this entire yoga journey took me more than 30 days to finish. With my depression hitting me hard and the pandemic still at play, there were some dark days that I didn't feel like getting out of bed. But I am happy to say that even though it took me more like 60 days than 30 days to complete, I'm glad I finished this. It takes me a long time to finish things but when they are done I feel proud of myself and here I felt that. Thank you Adriene for creating this, I look forward to continuing your 30 day yoga series :)
Thank you
An outstanding 30 days.  Thank You.

Feeling proud! Finishing my third 30 day adventure, and four months straight of daily yoga! Looking forward to starting TRUST calendar tomorrow. This session was just so liberating. Letting go of the worry of getting it wrong and just feeling into what my body wants. Thank you team YWA 🧡 Namaste

Adriene & Benji thank you from the bottom of my heart for this 30 day Home practice. This is my second 30 day practice with you.  I started with Breath and just completed Home. My next journey is Renew🙏🏻 I’ve showed up to the mat every morning to be inspired and to give myself a gift every day, and to FWFG!! You have helped me get through some “darkish” mornings. I love the energies I experience with yoga. After each morning practice I go right into meditation which is the “frosting on the cake” for me 🥰. I just wanted to take this time to say that I am grateful for your work and I appreciate you and Benji💜...with love Namaste🧘🏼‍♀️💜🐾💜
Bawling at the end. What a beautiful journey. Thank you 🙏

Thank you!!! I have absolutely loved taking this journey with you. And actually, so have my kids!
My 4yo daughter says to me each day “I’ll do the yoga too, I’ll be Benji!” and she acts out everything Benji does through the video while I “pretend to be Adriene” 😂

Woooow! First off let me just say how I prepared for a journey and didn’t even realize and in the beginning I teared up because I didn’t even realize again once Adrienne started speaking. The journey to home was amazing!! Adrienne and family I love you all ♥️♥️♥️♥️
Thank you for this journey. Namaste 🙏🏻

I've tried and retried 30 days of home soooo many times and i've always stopped around day 12. a couple years later, along with completing 30 days of breath, i've finally found the courage and dedication to finish the journey. (: to anyone reading this, treat yourself to something nice and call it a housewarming gift! welcome home <3
😥 ❤ thank you,!!!
Feeling incredible after today's practice! Really took the time to listen to my body and find what feels good
So beautiful.  I cried at the end as I so enjoyed this 30 journey with you.  Thank you so much.  I really appreciate you from afar.  I am enjoying many of you videos.

I always cry on the last day.. Because it mean's soooo much. And all this music from others 30 days... I remember each of them. And I realized, how many time I did yoga with You. I started in april) year ago... You just gave me more then yoga classes. You gave me home and self balance, noticing and self love. I just started to love a world around me, every sunrise and sunset, I started to live in moments and now I feel so better each day I open my eyes. It's unbelievable. And all this thanks to You. Send You my love and gratitude <3
Thnx Adriene

ok, crying! this was my second completed 30 day YWA and wow. i was discouraged at how difficult the silent practice was the first time, but i'm beaming with pride after my second. to any discouraged beginners out there- keep going!!

Second journey completed🔥
Halfway through this one I bought a shirt a smaller size so I could use it as a goal and I put in on to check how far I have to go, It already fit perfectly!
Trust the process ❤
Loved every second of this 30 day journey 💛 and i will continue with another 30 days of your beautiful yoga videos 💪🏻

Adriene thank u so much. It was delightful journey. It took me 6 months, and i like every moment. You r so calm and shines. It was great. Can't wait to start the next videos of Breathe. Thank u so much- Hadas from Israel

On day 20 of "Home" I said goodbye to my father as he passed from cancer. When I arrived at his bedside I told him I was there to walk him home. Feeling very emotional on this last day. Thank you for this. "We're all just walking each other home." -Ram Dass
So much clarity in a yoga practice. The truth is everywhere. Thank you  ❤️
Yet again just skipping the last video of a 30 day series because i’m here for guided practice :( This just feels disappointing, not empowering.
The second I heard your Home song I cried and just kept crying. Thank you, Adriene.
Thank you for this journey. It was an honor. Also very emotional this last one. ❤️
Just Wonderful - was so nice to see it all put together with the lovely music!!!!!!!!!!!
So nice to go home. Once the familiar music layered in, so did a lot of myself onto the mat. What an incredible gift, Adriene, thank you.
So I hadn’t look at the screen in about 20 minutes I was rising up from a bend and glanced to see Adrienne doing the exact movement as me, very cool but kinda weird to.

YAY I finished another 30 days with you, Adriene. Every Namaste I bow my head and say, "Thank you, Adriene". What I love about the mostly 90 days with you since 2021 began is how much your loving encouragement has changed the voice in my own head from its negativity to, "You got this." (That and how much stronger and more flexible I am at 58). Blessings upon blessings to you, A.

Throughout this journey HOME I've moved house. This practice helped to put moving into my boyfriends house in perspective and let me stay in touch with my feelings to create my home in here too. It made me physically and mentally a little more confident since that was the intention I set. Thank you Adriene to guide me HOME.
Thank you so much for all that you have given me Adriene. I am so grateful.
Third time through this 30 day challenge.  Emotional again.  What's with that?  Thank you, Teacher.

I did the Breathe journey before this one and on day 30 I still felt like I needed cues from Adriene to get through the practice. Today, I was able to feel my way through practice for myself and it felt amazing! I didn’t think I would get here, but I did and I can’t wait to continue on this journey with everyone!

Today was way more emotional than I was expecting. Thank you so much Adriene, these 30 days have been amazing with you. You made a grown-ass man cry today! From zero yoga to feeling like a pro, can't thank you enough.

What next?!

I was so disappointed with today's practice. I had worked so hard and made so much progress in the past month, and then today you went silent. It was so stressful for me because I felt I had to keep looking at the screen whereas before I had mostly listened to your voice, Adriene. Please don't do that again.
Thank you so much Adrienne! Thank youuu. I feel great. Today also i was much much better at low boat and the crow 💯✌🏻😘
Thank you Adrienne for helping me heal.
20210330 grateful to have accomplished 30 day home today after the 30 day breath. Thank you very much Adriene. God bless you for being such an angel. Loves from Malaysia.
You are Great!!!!!!👏👏👏👏💕❤️
Love you....you are fabulous!  Looking for more from you!!
My second of your 30 day's, absolutely loved it. Thank you so so much 💗 on to the next 🥰

I've worked through a couple "30 day yoga"'s now in 2021. I started mid Jan after very unexpectedly finding out I was pregnant and it's crazy to me to see where I started from vs where I am now. Superhero pose brought tears to my eyes. Thank you Adriene for guiding this journey and helping me as much physically as mentally.
This was incredible thank you Adrienne <3 (yes I also cried)
Am I the only one who wishes Adrien had pants with different coloured legs?

What is the name of the main song you used for the theme of the Home series? It's so beautiful!! All the music in this video was incredible. I looked up "Shakey Graves" who she mentioned in the description box but I can't figure out which of their music these songs are. Anyone else know? Thanks!!
my 60th day of yoga (: thank you for everything adriene, lots of love <3

I've just completed this and just love it. I'm in UK & 62. I haven't exercised since the gyms locked down last year. I'm hooked and deciding which one I can do tomorrow.  Yes my elderly dog lay next to me every day, the cat joined in sometimes! Thank you, it was fab!

I just finished day 30! I came here on day one so emotional, because my oldest child had just moved out and I was so sad and missing him. I turned his old bedroom into my yoga space and it has been so wonderful to come in here every morning and practice with Adriene. I have a hard time keeping to a routine/habit and I'm very proud of myself for getting to the mat every day. I feel more calm, flexible (emotionally and physically) and less creaky joints. I will be honest I was disappointed when I realized there would be no queuing on this last day. I got frustrated midway through and turned it off, but then I thought to myself "Adriene has been such a great guide and teacher on this journey, perhaps she knows what she is doing" and I restarted it. I followed along the best I could and added in some of my own things, like pigeon pose and some hip openers instead of some vinyasa. I feel so proud of myself for pushing through the unknown with this last video and it turned out it was great. And yes like many of you, the swelling music at the end combined with Adriene's sweet smiling face, and then the beautiful quote... I was def crying. Thank you Adriene <3
Hi Adrienne I wanted to say thank you thank you so much 😊
Beginners, Breath, and Home. I'm on a roll and I am capable of moving things I didn't think moved on me, and I feel great! Can't wait to decide wich to start next, thank you Adriene!😁
Oh my so powerful why am I crying tears of joy I'm sure thankyou Adriene, this has got me through lockdown, this is my second 30 day journey of 2021, I feel really good thankyou 🙏🏼🦋
Love you Adriene!
thank you...very grateful for the 30 days! Namaste🙏 ❤️
Thank You Adrienne I completed my 30 Day Challenge  today  I feel Wonderful ..I will continue to do  more videos  with  you ..Sending many Blessings your way  and much Love ..
Wow! Experienced a multiplicity of emotions going through the whole process. Thanks A.

There were a few moments that I happened to look up and see Adriene and I in the same pose- a child’s pose, hanging the head over the knees- then I thought of how many people around the world might also be in that pose. It was a beautiful realization. The power of yoga ✨💗✨
Love love love <3 Thank you from Trondheim, Norway <3
Its taken me 3 months but got there in the end. Looking forward to continuing my journey. Thank you so much Adriene🙏🏻❤️

it took 57 days for me but i've completed Home. it helped me a lot during stressful times. i am so proud of myself for doing this for me, and also very thankful for Adriene. I wish for myself to live a more open, honest life, acknowledge anxiety and find and maintain new meaningful ways to relieve it. Namaste
You"ve  made my life better since 2018 when I started practicing with you.. I can't thank you enough for all you do to make us love it. Many thanks.. 😍 😘 🌼

my second one! I cry every time... thank you adriene :) This time instead of doing 30 days in 2 months i did it in 35... a big improvement! I started the Home practice in the middle of deciding to move & it followed me as I said goodbye to one home & greeted my next one. of course... home is actually within me. Thank you once again. <3

I am not happy about a lot of things that happened in 2020, but I am surely more than happy that that year create a passage to bring me home. I want to express my fuly gratitude for your light, Adriene ❤️🌠. Thank you so much. Namaste
wow i did it.. This has been wonderful, thank you Adriene. And I thank myself for giving everything that i got and just push through every single day...

i got sepanx before watching this and then i got all teary eyed when it was already the outro. Thank you so much Adriene! You’re such a gem of a person i feel like i was doing yoga with a really close friend. I feel like i truly was able to find my way back home. I found a lot of inner peace the past 30 days and it was always such a joy to wake up and do yoga <3 i’ll be continuing my yoga journey with your other videos and 30 days of ywa.  Lots of love ❤️

So much gratitude and appreciation.... So teary eyes.... I just completed my first round of HOME, right after completing the first round of BREATH. Love and hugs and smiles from ARgentina. GRACIAS. Namasté. <3
After many years of giving a go to the 30 days yoga journeys and failing miserably lol. Ican proudly say that I’ve your student for not only 30, but 60 days! Thank you 🙏
Thanks Adriane for all. It's my day 60 (im sure i repeated one day). I enjoy more everyday feeling my body different. <3

Adriene, ❤❤❤

Thank you for today's practice. I went off on my own for the first half and met up with Adriene for the last bit.. I have completed 60 days of yoga this year.. 😌 I feel better about myself and my practice.. the more I journey into the practice of yoga the more I grow and gain spirituality.  Again thank you Adriene ❤🙏🧘‍♀️
We did it. Thank you so much!

Thank you. I don't think I can express my gratitude any other way. I've always liked the idea of yoga but have never managed to get so involved and connected with yoga any other way. I find your teaching so welcoming and accepting and most of all nurturing. You have wrapped the yoga-taco-blanket around me and it's been such a friend for me along the stressful path of this year <3
Anyone else now on day 60 today Mar 2nd?  (First BREATH, then HOME) - I think I'll just continue with DEDICATE

Dear Adriene and Benji,

Yayyyaaahahahha Day60 baby.. I made t😊👊 well not really😅.. since I missed a couply dayz😅😅😁🤗..
Nawwwgghhh damn Didn't du jak..

My journey continues. Started last February with 30 days 2020.  For each following month I did the previous 30 days in rotation. Completed 2021 on January 30. Complete 2020 30 days today.  Will start day one of 2019 today and continue in rotation. Good days to all.  Thank you Adriene for helping me move forward with positive energy.  Nathaniel BSUD
This 30 days yoga practice helped me so much spiritually and physically to go through the 3rd lockdown here in Greece! Thank you!!! <3 will definately continue the yoga journey!

Congratulations and big hugs to all of my February 2021 Home friends! I had two big emotional moments in this practice -- first, with "knocking on heaven's door," I let out a little giggle that turned into a full on sob. Then, as the practice was ending, I thought about how I stayed present in the moment during the whole practice, and was overcome by emotion. I somewhat followed what Adriene was doing, and added in some of my own flow. It felt amazing to be in my body and just experience the moment. Thanks to everyone whose energy has lifted up my January and February 2021, you are amazing!
What kind of mat do you use? Do you clean it? I have a hard time wanting to rest my head where my feet have been lol.

Just a comment for myself. I completed the "home"-journey, after doing "Breath" in january. The last day in january was not good for me. I didn't know what to do, tried to follow Adriene and that didn't work for me. So now I let everything go (not knowing what I was going to do for 40 minutes, being distracted, not being able to focus for so long, ..) and I did it. I felt very emotional in the end and I feel proud of myself. Lots of love in, lots of love out.

That was the same for me. Took 2 months to finish "Breath" and now did "Home" in March. The last day felt very different, this time I did trust myself and did what I felt like. Since it's way past midnight, I did my todays practice very light and chill, but it felt so nice to just move myself with her in a way. Although going through very different motions most of the time.
Felt good to see someone else felt similar about getting more familiar with this freestyle 😊

Very proud of this accomplishment! I’m continuing with you Adriene with your Breath journey challenge. It is now part of my night routine before bed. It gives me a reason to move a bit even when I have the kids home.

This is my second 30day challenge by Adrienne, and planning to continue with the newest. This changed my life. ❤️
But also, I am so sad to have missed both last days in these challenges because I just don’t trust myself to being able to do this alone. Especially when I read all of your comments. 🥺
I start and get frustrated because I don’t enjoy it as much as when Adrienne is talking...
nevertheless, I love you and your work Adrienne 🥰
Adirene.. any chance we can get the link to the background music used ?

The last moments of this practice were emotional for me. I started yoga before but it was not something like this - a yoga journey. I am a beginner at yoga and the journey was worthwhile. A lot of emotions sparked within every practice and I get to see more light every day. I experimented a bit on when I do these sessions and doing it in the morning makes me wanna wake up and start the day early and right.

Thank you, Adriene, for being a wonderful guide and friend. This has been a wonderful journey and I'm jumping in to another 30-day journey with you :D
We are all walking each other home~
After completing Breath last month I told myself that I'm going to finish home from last year. I finally finished! ! On to Dedicate! !

ended up having to take a 2 week break at day 28 for a back injury.. came back to 29 yesterday and when i saw this was unguided i almost skipped it, instantly feeling frustrated and upset because the guidance is what keeps me focused and here instead of stuck in my trauma thoughts... spend the better part of the video on and off crying and feeling all the areas that are blocked and loaded with old emotion.. felt anxious and like i had to be watching the screen for exact movement until i skipped a section to just hold pigeon poses and work my hips and felt like i could finally take a breath.. this was an intense but very needed emotional release and im proud of myself for sticking through with it... thank you for this. cant wait to start the new 30 day practice from this year
Adriene, dime por  favor, cómo se llama la pieza musical. Extraordinario Adriene, tu trabajo. Gran labor humanitaria. Para conectar con Mente, cuerpo y Espíritu.
Does anyone comment the name of the title of intro music? The very first one when she started asana.

Thank you so much Adriane! This was a great journey home. I enjoyed every single day (and missed the yoga the few days I did not manage to perform). Will definitely join more of your classes. Love- Marion

Really been with you Adrienne for so many years - and love my time with you. I never complained of anything but really this last without mike was a very bad idea - I had to keep an eye on tv continuously so all attention from breathing and postures was taken away - Also you don’t know what arrangement people have in their homes ... mine is such that I have to place my mat at a right angle to the tv but it’s ok because most of the time I’m listening and following. Sometimes I don’t even cast on tv , I just use my phone. Therefore this was really not working for me. Bad ending to a good month. 😏

Thank you Adriene for teaching me that self love isn't made by being super strong, going to the gym everyday and doing a lot of intense exercise to feel good. It's just to show up for yourself every day, having that appreciation that you are a human and you're here and alive. I've been trying different types of exercise but this one is my favorite. It not only made my body stronger but my mind too. This is the first ever 30 day journey I've completed being fully committed to (I skipped 2 days but I forgive myself for it) <3

Adriene!! I started this 30 day journey in the middle of the summer when I was feeling down and I needed some sunshine. 30 days has turned into a lot of months later but I finally finished today and even though I had some pauses in between I wanted to finish so badly. So here I am! Thank you for guiding us through and teaching us to love our bodies!!

11 months it took me. 11 months since the start of the first lockdown in the UK. I had to restart from day 1 4 times, but I finished it eventually. Thank you from the bottom of my heart Adrienne, each practice has been a moment of joy and peace in this challenging year. Congrats to everyone who made it to the end 🧘‍♂️
WOW!!! Delicious!
Thank you Adriene for another wonderful 30 day journey!  😊💗

This was the perfect introduction into yoga 😍 tried it during first lockdown by failed to finish, tried it again and saw it through, thank you so much Adriene, you are an amazing teacher, an so completely grateful   🙏💗
Thank you so much for this journey, Adriene. I love you too.

Today is our last day of this 30 days journey! Me and my husband are very grateful! We were absolutely beginners and love your practice.
We only struggle on the day 30 as we have to look at the screen all the time to follow. We think would have been better with the instructions so we could have followed without watching at the screen. Thank you for all! We will continue practicing yoga with you. Our every day yoga has help us a lot during this difficult time. Send you lots of love from London :)

Mic free isn’t for me.  I’ve hurt my neck from constantly trying to look at the screen to see when to come out of downward dog for the next move. I loved the length and the speed but not the lack of direction.

i am so thankful to have found adriene's channel. a little over a month ago i broke up with my partner and i was at the lowest i've been mentally and physically (even more so bc of covid) but it's all changed and a big part of that was because of yoga and this channel. yoga has always been something i thought was rather boring of a sport and didn't think i had the attention span for it but now it's one of my favorite times of the day, and the time flies by so fast when i'm doing it i always wish the practices were longer! even though i still have hard days where i'm sad or anxious or miss home, i know that adriene is always waiting for me every morning and even if everything in the world seems chaotic and i don't know what to do, these yoga practices will be there for me everyday. that in itself has helped me so much and i've learned to be less overwhelmed by my feelings and am so happy to come to the mat each day to practice with adriene. i never thought i was a yoga type of person but it's one of the best things i could have done for myself in 2021! :)
at 6:21 we FINALLY see master benji's beautiful downward dog it was freakin adorable!! ok go back to reading wholesome comments :) <3

Thank you, Adrien, and everyone who did this 30 day journey or just this class. I feel showered with love and connection. It was such a surprise that the last day was without Adrien's guides. Adrien, you are truly an educator and a good force in this world. I'm so glad I found this channel. Love to all.
Who else here is a beginner ? 😊
Beyond grateful to you.
I just finished this 30 days of yoga. Thank- you! It was a gift.

This is my 30th day in yoga, so it’s been a month since I first started. I decided to do yoga because I figured it’s not too much for my body to handle unlike workouts. At first, I was hesitant in certain shapes or if I should do this before that, but somehow, Adrienne’s voice just echoes in my head, tells me what to do and encourages me to keep going. After the session, I cried when I saw the quote at the end. At first, I didn’t know why I cried, but when I reread the quote, it really struck me. For this year, I really do strive for growth, for a better me, for a healthier mentality. As I cried, I kept muttering to myself, “I finished the 30 days” and “I’m so proud of myself”. Actually as I write this, I’m still crying T_T I easily give up on certain things when I know that I can’t keep up, but completing 30 days was a huge accomplishment for me today. Thank you so much Adrienne for being there and knowing that I’m not alone with my struggles. I look forward to yoga everyday and I want to keep it that way for a long time :>

I really enjoyed this series, but struggled with the silent approach with the final class. I really appreciate the intention, but  felt I was taken out of my flow by having to continually look at the screen to see where we were going. I did end up doing my own thing. I have done something similar in a class in a studio and it worked better because you felt the energy of those around you, but not the same in the virtual world.
Thank you. I started Yoga last year in march and arrived with home now (begun with it one year after you uploaded it). I really feel home more in my body now. <3
I did it. Thank you for your awsomework. Cheers to us.

do we agree that finishing this journey is sadder than finishing the last episode of a series ?
we did it :)
Wow!!!!!! I did it!!!!! I’ve done your challenges for some time now. Thank you Adrianne for all you give to the world. February 6, 2021
Amazing. Thank you 🙏🏻♥️
nope, have to watch the scree to much. I love everything else you do. Keep going.
I finished it! Took me two months...because it's everyother day thing. But it was great.

One of my goals for 2021 was to 'get into yoga'. I missed a few days here and there when I began this 30-day journey, but when 2021 hit I haven't missed a day. Now my goal is to make it this whole year doing yoga daily. The reason I started yoga was that I wanted to fix some muscle tightness/pains from working out and not stretching correctly for the major part of my gym career. I didn't expect there would be such a healthy mental improvement from doing yoga as well. The deep breathing, mindful movements, and really just Adriene's positive dialogue throughout the 30 days have really helped my mindset and way of thinking. Anyways, looking forward to more yoga, more growth, and getting a lot more use out of the yoga mat my sister got me for Christmas!

I remember I did this practice on November 3rd. That was me finishing my 6th month of yoga and my first half year of it. I cannot tell you how much I enjoyed it. I was better physically, mentally, and emotionally. I let myself go freely using you as a guide occasionally when I did this practice, I was very happy with it. After that, I was waiting for the next 2021 yoga to come out so to compensate, I would pick a video of your channel that I thought fit the day or one I needed. If I was tired, I could choose a 15 minute calming yoga practice, and If I had the time and energy, I could choose a fiery 30 minute practice. Now, my yoga journey has transcended the year and I will be starting it with Breath, which comes out tomorrow. Although I liked the freedom of the choosing what yoga to do everyday, I am also excited to be back on another 30 day yoga journey. To keep up with every day, I will try this practice without breaks this time, as usually I have a day off every week meaning that a 30 day yoga journey takes me around 34 days. I am so excited to start another yoga journey and it's all because of this practice and the ones before.
Thank you so much Adriene for gifting us these practices.

Wow, just wow. I don’t think it’s a coincidence that I came upon this YouTube channel toward the end of 2020 in what has been a particularly difficult year for everyone on the planet. And it’s no coincidence either that I just finished these 30 days of coming Home on December 31, 2020. Words can’t really express what I just experienced in this yoga session. I’ve done a ton of bodywork and mindfulness practice during my lifetime but something supernatural took over me in this last no-mic session. Hard to type and dictate right now with tears in my eyes, but I was really moved by this. And I was finally able to do a full plank to the mat on Day 30...and burst out crying. Adriene, what you provide here is such a gift beyond measure, especially when so many people are alone, isolated, and struggling right now. I am so proud of myself for showing up every day for 30 days, and I can’t wait for Breath to begin soon. Thank you, namaste, from the bottom of my heart. So grateful to have this community. May all beings everywhere be well.

However, right at the end, when I raised my hands to my third eye, I cried and cried. I'm not much of a crier, but the feeling of accomplishment as well as knowing Adriene is always there with me, it got me.

God I'm a bit of a wreck now. But in a good way. Thank you.

This was the first big obstacle I completed in my yoga journey that started just a few short months ago. Since I decided to participate in this month long practice in December, reflection and the new year is on everyone’s minds. About 15 minutes into the practice I started crying for what I figured was no reason. I stood up and I looked in the mirror right beside me and I said to myself “you did it”. Now that phrase is what broke me. I started to bawl uncontrollably, but I think it was a bittersweet moment. I was proud of myself for all I had achieved in terms of self care and growing to love myself in 2020, but I was also crying a years worth of tears of a young girl who seemed to be watching the world burn. Adrienne, thank you for giving me this space that was away from the troubles of the world, and thank you for helping me to realize my true strength as not only a yogi but as a human. Here’s to a brighter 2021, and to finding what feels good tomorrow.

after these beautiful 30 days, I have became in tune with my own breath. This path is beautiful

Tonight is Christmas Eve, and a hard one for me. For all of us on a collective level, but for me on a personal level entirely separately. So there's a lot. I almost didn't show up today. I wanted to do one of your old practices instead. I thought I had to wait until I was strong enough. I felt frustrated, because your guidance has been one of the only things I have been able to truly trust, to count on, and not feel so alone, because someone is there to catch me. But I showed up today, with all my anxiety and grief, I showed up. Something told me to show up, I heard it above my uncertainty and fear. I showed up. Feeling alone on Christmas Eve in a pandemic, where nothing looks the same. Not even yoga looked the same today. But here's the message that I found, or that found me. "Even when things look different, the good parts are just the same.". Love will always catch my fall. Love will always show up. It could never be absent. It is everything. So in a period of transition and grief, that's what I can count on. And so between fearful thoughts, I began to embrace "different". I began to praise "different". And see it as a blessing. As my Rebirth. No, this doesn't feel the same. And it is because of the beautiful healing journey I've been on. But the Love is still here just the same. So I'm letting go. Letting go of what I thought it was supposed to look like. Because here was a surprise, something totally new. And it was a beautiful one. Home is inside of me. So I can never be lost. Support and guidance and Love are right here. In me. Home.

Namaste, Adriene. Namaste to anyone who may read this. This practice made me cry. And the quote at the end was exactly what I needed right now. Here I am. Beginning again. After my trauma. Here I am. Reborn. Home.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart, Adriene. I love you.

Can't believe I did it! Can't believe how excited I am for the new 30-day series coming in 2021! I was never able to commit to daily yoga in the past, but I got an apartment on my own a few months back, and being alone so often made me realize how much I needed something like this as a way of taking care of / checking in with myself.

I was really nervous for this last video since there are no verbal cues. It was definitely challenging, but it also resulted in some really cool moments. Like many others have said in comments, I kept hearing Adriene's voice in my head. When we did star pose, I heard "take up space" and I smiled and started to tear up. The realization that I am HERE and I am ALIVE just hit me so strongly. And then when we were in plank pose and did the thing where we touch our hips to the ground, I remembered to whisper to myself, "I am strong."

I just want to say thanks to Adriene and thanks to all of you! It's amazing that, even though we're all in different places, we are all on this yoga journey together. Namaste.

I really loved this!
To be honest I got scared when you said you would turn off the mic. however when the music started i just did my thing. Many times when I lookd over we were doing the same/similar things. I said to myself: ah you taught me well.
also many times to myself I was saying things like...
Lots of love in, lots of love out. do what feels right. lost warrior pose, and many more.
when I layed down and after one more deep breath, I put my thumbs to my third eye and said out loud Namaste.
i slowly got up and the quote just started. whithout knowing it we said namaste together.
even though i did it myself i still felt the connection.
Thank you for teaching me how to bring peach to myself!

Adrienne I hope you read this. I’ve followed you since early 2015 and I absolutely love your teaching style and the tools that I’ve gained by listening to you. Ive never left a comment but always look forward to what you are going to bring to the table. Recently I did 29 days of the home journey and I loved every part of it. Through the home journey I found a new appreciation for commitment that’s rooted in flexibility. Today I went to finish the last day and after a few minutes of having to look up and try to figure out where I lost track of what the next move was I just decided to replace the practice with something that I could hear. For me it’s hard to really get into all of the things that make a home practice juicy when I can’t tell where each posture will lead. Once we started in downward dog I couldn’t turn my neck to properly see you and it didn’t feel good. I want you to know that I really appreciate the way that you lead people with your voice. Your classes are detail oriented and I really can just zen out and know how to articulate my body to work toward what feels good. I’m sure that some people really loved getting the opportunity during class to speculate and find what feels good for them, but I felt mostly distracted and I just felt like maybe I could offer you that perspective. I really am grateful for your online yoga platform and use the tools i learn in class constantly on and off the mat, I hope you can feel that appreciation and understand that this isn’t meant to be overly critical.

In this session today I also had moved through different emotions as someone else mentioned and I had a real A-HA moment when in boat pose... For years I lacked the strength and confidence to do it properly, as I could never do it without intense cramping in my hip flexors or without putting pressure on my sciatic nerve. I believed I was a lost cause because it was always so uncomfortable/painful, I just thought "it's not for me"... But with this daily practice, I am now able to do a modified version with much less discomfort in my hip flexors. I can't do it "perfectly" but I'm okay with knowing that I'm making progress and it feels amazing. ♥︎ I feel so much stronger than 30 days ago. When it feels like I've gone too far, I step back a little. This has been the most valuable lesson.

I must admit, I’m not the yoga type. I’m more of go hard as fast as you can type of person, especially with my workouts. Until one day when everything in my life changed in a split of a moment. Out of the blue, I ended up with an ovarian torsion which lead to an emergency surgery to take it out. The emotional, hormonal and physical turmoil lead me to the worst place in my entire life. Since I was operated on my abdomen, I lost all of my core strength. The recovery was and still is ongoing, very long. I found myself so tense and clenched up from pain and anger that I decided I needed help with some stretching. I found Adriene’s video and really liked it. Then saw the Home collection and decided to commit myself to daily yoga for a month just to see what would happen. I have to say, IM COMPLETELY BLOW AWAY!!! As I was doing this practice, I was soooo overwhelmed with emotion because I was seeing the glimpses of my old self again. Strong, able to move and most of all free from pain. My recovery isn’t over yet but I’m MOST certain that I’m much farther along than I would have been. From the bottom of my heart, I’m forever grateful💕
P.S. I’m not a pet person but Benji made me smile every time he appeared, especially during this practice. 🥰

It's been 8 months now since I heard that my job was shutting down and I would be laid off due to the pandemic and subsequent lockdown. I can still taste the fear and anxiety that took over in the wake of such uncertainty, but then also the sense of resolution and surrender that had to follow in its wake. It is in those feelings that I received a message from a friend who I'd lost touch with over time. It was an invitation to do 30 Days of Yoga, the first 30 day journey that this channel embarked on. In the interest of staying grounded and creating stronger routines to manage my mental health, I accepted my friend's invitation.
At first I told myself, "Just finish one solid week." At the end of that week I felt more confident, and so I told myself to just finish one more week. After that it was smooth sailing to the end of that first series, and I cannot tell you how proud and accomplished I felt at the end of that time. I'm someone that struggles with consistent routine, and discipline has always been a weak point. When the idea first came into my mind that I might continue on and try to complete every available 30 day journey in sequence, I dismissed it immediately. "I could never" "I'll give up" "I'll surely fail along the way"
What slowly disintegrated those thoughts was the love for, and patience with my body that I'd been cultivating over those first 30 days... and so I continued on. I told myself, "just one more sequence", "just one more day". I created a journal to slowly check off each practice as I completed it, and over time something changed. 30 Days of Yoga, Yoga Camp, Revolution, True, Dedicate, and finally Home... This has been such a profound and beautiful journey, and I've uncovered so much on my way inward. It's a blessing to have observed Adriene grow and blossom into such an amazing teacher and friend, to see and experience the maturity and wisdom settle into her body and spirit... And it's a blessing that this same maturity and wisdom has taken root in me too.
In this time I've revealed to myself a sense of self-belief. I've learned to trust in myself and my intuition. I've seen how diligent, disciplined, and honest I can be. I've laughed, and cried, and screamed... I've become more patient, kinder to my body, and awakened more love and gratitude for it. I've demonstrated to myself that I can achieve anything simply by taking one step. So much has changed over these months and the landscape of the world around us looks so very different. That same sense of resolution and surrender that first drew me to you all that time ago is still necessary, still vital... But I am capable and strong. Thank you for the beautiful gift of your time and friendship. Thank you for holding space with me on my mat, and for being there in a time when so many of us needed you most. The YWA Team and community is such a truly profound and meaningful thing.
Moving forward I'm going to continue on a special journey of my own making. I've patiently marked all of my favorite practices over the last 8 months. Every practice that moved me, the ones that made me feel so joyful and alive, and the ones that challenged me. I can't wait to see you at the dawn of the new year. From the bottom of my heart I extend my deepest gratitude to you... Namaste
i lovee you adriene!

I was a bit nervous going into this one as someone who is chronically indecisive, but I enjoyed it so much! I did it! I had done a couple of the 30 days years ago in undergrad, before I was a mom. I'm a totally different person now and barely have time to think about what I need most days. Doing this really did bring me back to myself...it took waiting until after my son was asleep every night to do it, but it became the only time in the day when I could think about my needs...like breathing deeply for example. Seriously...I had not taken a deep breath since I gave birth a year and a half ago 😲 then here I am on the last day breathing deeply while doing boat pose like it's no big deal when I could barely do one in the beginning while holding my breath💪🏾 I also kept reminding myself to relax my shoulders, wiggle my fingers and open up a little more the whole way through with a level of self awareness I had not afforded myself for a long time. 200-hour residential new to ashtanga yoga teacher training course in India with Yoga Alliance USA RYT 200 Certification at Yoga School Tattvaa Yogashala, Rishikesh

Tattvaa Yogashala offers the opportunity to journey into the depths of your yoga practice. Located in Rishikesh, the yoga capital of the world, on the banks of the holy Ganges River, our school offers a natural haven for those who seek an experience and environment in which to evolve in body, mind and spirit. We are globally known for world class Yoga Teacher Training in Rishikesh, India. Tattvaa Yogashala is a world renown yoga school specialising in the traditional Ashtanga system of yoga. For years our school has dedicated itself to sharing and spreading the knowledge of this miraculous lineage, continuing to inspire and evolve yoga practitioners around the world.

Wow! just finished this 30 day journey and even though this is my very first time doing yoga, adriene is such a great teacher. I did lots of different kinds of exercises and i pushed myself above my limits, hurted myself in the process. And turns out yoga was exactly what i was needed! Adriene's little comments in the videos such as ''dont worry if u cant go all the way, if u cant do this its totally fine'' really helped me. Even though i cant quite do the poses i felt like i've accomplished something. I started to laugh at my mistakes. When i felt that i couldnt practise that day, i didnt felt like i was disappointing myself. Yoga's relative slow flow made me more aware of my body and  how i did the poses started to matter to me. I found your foundations series very helpful!  So thank you so much adriene :)  I hope happines finds  you wherever you are <3

Thank you, Adriene! Wow...  this was truly incredible - this 30-day challenge got me through one of the most 30 challenging days I have faced in a lifetime. My mother recovering from a serious bicycle accident, my company closing office putting me out of work in the middle of a pandemic, my loving grandmother's death. I so appreciated spending the time receiving love and heartfelt admiration from Adriene, which really did feel like she was speaking to me personally so often. Not just as an instructor but as a friend. I am so grateful for the love and admiration through yoga and I've learned to practice putting that same energy out into the world. I may have shown up to the matt crying at times, but I persevered and felt uplifted every day. I LOVE LOVE LOVE this!! It's helped me gain strength to keep pursuing new challenges and never give up. <3

In out-of-the-way places of the heart,
Where your thoughts never think to wander,
This beginning has been quietly forming,
Waiting until you were ready to emerge.

For a long time it has watched your desire,
Feeling the emptiness growing inside you,
Noticing how you willed yourself on,
Still unable to leave what you had outgrown.

It watched you play with the seduction of safety
And the gray promises that sameness whispered,
Heard the waves of turmoil rise and relent,
Wondered would you always live like this.

Then the delight, when your courage kindled,
And out you stepped onto new ground,
Your eyes young again with energy and dream,
A path of plenitude opening before you.

Though your destination is not yet clear
You can trust the promise of this opening;
Unfurl yourself into the grace of beginning
That is at one with your life's desire.

Awaken your spirit to adventure;
Hold nothing back, learn to find ease in risk;
Soon you will home in a new rhythm,
For your soul senses the world that awaits you.

John O'Donohue , For a new beginning

- A beautiful end to a beautiful journey Adrianne, thank you. -

I felt the same way the first time I did True, I felt like I couldn't relax while having to keep watching the screen. After doing the rest of her 30 day programs, I love the 30th day now, it feels like a graduation! I think what Adriene is trying to teach is that you know the poses after doing them for 29 days, so trust yourself and go it alone on this day and see how it goes, see how your body wants to move, and essentially 'find what feels good'. It's a tough challenge, but an important one.

I loved the concept!  You have taught us, worked with us, and we have worked with you for 30 sessions.  It was time for us to try our wings.  It's amazing how clearly I see my behaviors, attitudes and approaches off the mat come to the mat.  I recall Adriene saying this from time to time in these 30 sessions.  I panicked a little when she said she was going without a mic.  I mostly trust her now, but not myself.  At first, I occasionally looked to see what she was doing & followed. I did my own thing, like the side plank  and listened to my body, but somewhere along the way I started trying to keep up with her completely.  The half and full forward folds and rises have come to mean surrender & opening myself to my Higher Power's strength etc.  Those were very personal beautiful moments.  I love to read what Adriene writes below the video.  It's often said in the video.  I sometimes cry because I'm getting in touch with myself again.  I'm returning to myself.  There were a lot of messages in the 30th day for me to process.  I'm super grateful for the gifts I have received from my HIGHER POWER, through YOGA & through ADRIENE's HOME series.  I too heard her voice throughout!  I hear it off the mat too!  hahaha!  I appreciate the comments made by the community below.  I can always relate somehow to each of you.  I'm new here, but look forward to getting to know people and make friends!  Sorry for journaling in the comment section!  I'll work on that. I'm talkative & have been isolated since March! Namaste
I did it. For the past 30 days I have started my day with yoga. I will never not start my day without it again. Thank you for such a beautiful gift.

Hi there Adriene! This is my story: When I first started your yoga program I was recovering from covid-19. I was not ill anymore, but for maybe three months my immune system had been very vunerable, I got new colds and other types of infections all the time, and I was so tired that a doctor took me off work part time. My working memory was failing, I had a hard time dealing with new or complex information. In the beginning I could only do yoga every second day, because the exercise drained my energy enough for the exhaution to "spill over" to the next day. My arms and legs were shaking in easy positions like Standing dog. But I persisted, and after a week or so I could see the difference and started to feel a little more like myself again. For different reasons (like I had to go slow in the beginning, and some days I would join people in yoga who did another one of your programs) the program took mee almost two months to finish. But by the end of Home I felt mentally and physically recovered. This became a long post, but what I really want to do is to send a big THANK YOU all the way from Malmö, Sweden. All the best / Käbi
This was so inspiring to read! Congratulations for finishing this journey and I'm so glad you've recovered! Sending lots of love xx

Through this journey, I'm trying to figure out what home means to me. Hometown? Dormitory? I found it at the end, the real home is my own body. Every time I looked down on my feet and touched my sweat on my back, I was amused by my body. "It's a very beautiful body, how can I never feel that way before?"
There's a Chinese poem: "此心安处，便是吾乡", means “wherever I find peace, that is my home."
A lot of thanks and love! Take care! xx

I will be honest. There were meny moments I couldn't focus or commit this time. I got a scatter brain and I couldn't stick with you or listened to your voice or more importantly my own voice/heart sometimes. In fact this was my second time doing your 30days yoga journey and I did your very first 30 days yoga practice 5-6 years ago. Back then I had such a mindblowing and wonderful experience. So I was a bit disappointed at myself this time. But no matter how hard it was or how poorly I practiced, at least I made a decision to never stop and always come back on the mat. Here I was on the 30th day, I knew what was coming - a freestyle yoga. This time I wasn't expecting much. I even had doubts about mylsef if I could do by myself. When you put your microphone down and the nice gentle music started, I reluctantly closed my eyes, sat legs crossed, breathed deeply, then the magic happened. I could finally shut down my brain, listen to my breath and my body, then I could finally let go and reconnect my heart. I lost in the beautifu music and followed the rhythm of my breath. I realized the goal and purpose of this practice wasn't to be perfect, but to listen to yourself, which means reconnect your heart -HOME. I did find a way HOME in the end. Toward the end of the practice, I got emotional like many of you. It's always a beautiful feeling. When I finished up my practice, I sat leg crossed, closed my eyes and breathed gently again. Then I slowly opened my eyes. My dog was standing right in front of me giving me the best smile while holding her favorite toy. Then she jumped on my lap as if she was waiting for that moment. I felt like I came home, held my dog and had happy tears. Thank you Adriene💕

This was hard for me. I kind of look to Adriene as more of a personal trainer, like I'm not getting in downward facing dog, plank pose or boat pose unless she tells me to lol. I'll just do cat/cow or child's pose if left to my own devices.

This was hard and I'm not sure I liked it, especially for the last day of the 30 day practice. I realized that I never look at the screen anymore. Mostly because I have to set my computer up off to the side in my space so I can't see it easily during the practice. In the beginning I was glancing over to the screen every few seconds and my brain was all over trying to figure out what was next. This sucked as normally I'm calm, my brain is shut off besides following the cues. This would have been easier for me if Adriene just said a loose guideline for what to do and where to go and than just sat there smiling. At one point I decided to just breathe and do what I wanted but then found myself still glancing at the screen and switching directions to follow. Finally my solution was to watch her go through the poses and very slowly follow. That way I didn't have to think about as much. By the time we got to the floor I couldn't see the screen at all so just did what I wanted and closed out. Maybe I will try it again now that I know the basic flow and see if its better

Yippe !! 30 days done.
Thank you Adriene. Love you loads
Namaste from India :D

Dear Adriene.

I really do hope you read this. Today marked the end of my HOME journey and as someone who completed your 30 Day Yoga challenge a couple months ago the humbling realisation, that the last day may be another freestyle type Yoga session, all flooded back to me. The passing of the baton, passing of the torch and gift of total trust was given to me once again today. Despite having the thought in the back of my mind that "oh this gonna be another freeestyle video," the wave of sadness and gratitude was still overwhelming. I always get too used to and too comfortable with having you there to guide me, that I feel sad when it's time to say goodbye.

But this time I make a promise to make sure this isn't a goodbye. It's simply a 'see you next time.' Because this time round you aided me to find a deeper love, appreciation and serenity that I thought I had found during the last Yoga journey. Am I still going to miss the idea of it being a 30 day journey/challenge? Absolutely. However, this time the ending feels different. I don't feel like a complete novice anymore. I feel more complete. And I feel like Yoga is not just a challenge or goal for me to reach. You have helped make Yoga my lifestyle:)

I did this challenge alongside the Insanity workout and I am on day 30 of 63 for that workout as I type this comment. This challenge has helped my cardio performance so much that I wish I could thank you eternally. Since I do have another 30 days left of Insanity, I very may well just restart this HOME workout since I have a hard time letting people go haha. Or I may do other random forms of Yoga per day until I reach the end. But the bottomline is - I can't go. I appreciate you too greatly! And now I love Yoga too much.

Thank you and see you next time!

You are my official yoga trainer for more than 5 years now, and this 30 day yoga journey is one of my favourites to flow ! Thank you so much Adriene for your classes, your humble attitude, empathy, and persevrance. You helped me to love yoga :-)  Have a hug from Canada !
I can't belive we made it! Thank you for everything, it was such a wholesome and heartwarming experience, Adriene ❤

On Day 151 of lock-down in South Africa, I say thank you to you, Adriene, for these 30 days of yoga. What a positive way it was to start each day and what structure it brought to this weird time! This is my second time doing the Home 30 Day series and I absolutely loved it. I'm a Yoga instructor but also do other modalities (Reflexology for 20 years) and I find this series so motivating. Now we have two doggies sleeping while I do the Yoga. Feeling really frustrated by this final ‘no talking’ session. I am not a mind reader as to the progression of the moves and trying to focus on watching the video is off putting. Really disappointed in this video, sorry for being negative and I wouldn’t normally leave a comment unless it’s positive but I have really enjoyed the 29 days so almost wanted a greatest hits session with vocal guidance.

Wow I truly loved this journey Home. I did all 30 days in a row and feel nourished physically, mentally, spiritually and emotionally. I enjoyed this one although I was nervous at first. I skipped a few things, stayed longer in others, and was okay with doing 85% of what you did rather than 100%. I did what felt good! 😊

The journey was great, but not having audio here to me was a nightmare. I have glasses and when I do yoga I have to take them off, so even if I tried to peek at my cellphone I couldn't see anything. I need the voice as guide.
Hey buddy thank you for being there it was great
This may have taken me 60 days, but here I am.

What a blessed final practice. I didn't know at first whether I had the courage, but stepped into it with blind faith, and felt so humbled by the end. I had many moments of stillness and kept reminding myself that I didn't have to know or remember every single move I'd learnt, I was allowed to be still and focus on myself and breath, breathing love in and out.
To take time for yourself can be so challenging, but it is so rewarding, and I'm so grateful that I have found a place that feels safe, and have found Adriene, who has guided me to know my true heart better. Thank you. Namaste.

I'm sorry but I really didn't like this -  I couldn't do things like close my eyes or relax in poses like down dog or child's pose because I kept having to check where we were in the practice and it just made me really annoyed in the end. I've really like the home series but this was not such a satisfactory way to end.

I think it's okay to feel frustrated and not like this. But remember, the point isn't to copy her, but do what feels good to us. I did relax, stayed longer than she did in some poses, and skipped others. It was fun for me! Just don't be concerned with "copying" as much as using her as inspiration!

I enjoyed this entire series but you lost me on day 30.  It’s very hard to get into a flow when your viewers are unaware of the steps and constantly have to look up. I would suggest not going micless the last day. Way too hard to follow along

I finished today. I started this in the dying days of our first wave and ended it in the firm grip of our second, and harder, lockdown. I'm sure the irony (poetry?) of Home being the 30-day yoga practice for this year has not escaped anyone (especially you, Adriene).

I couldn't be more grateful.
For the chance to uncover.
To struggle and let go.
For the "I love yous".
To get out my head (and into your car - I snort laughed at that).

To myself. To everyone. To Benji. To Adriene. To her team. To my mat. To the traditional custodians of the ground that supports me.

To my body. I love you, friend. Thanks for getting me here.

I love your videos and you have done so much for me. I am on my own journey to do all of your yoga videos. I find videos without audio cues to be very difficult because I can't close my eyes or focus on  my breath. It takes the meditative state out of yoga for me. I also love your voice and find it to be super comforting. I understand this is a tradition, but I wonder if in the future you might post one no audio version and one with audio version, so those of us who struggle with no audio can still have a great experience. Thank you Adriene. I love you.

First of all I wanna put out my gratitude ! 🙏 I felt like it’s been way longer than a month ! I absolutely love your appearance and guidance ! I have to admit I had to do a one week break because my wrists were killing me ! I’m not use to being on my hands that much so I was in a lot of pain after two weeks . I picked up after a week and felt really good after I gained some strengths and I felt really proud ! This last day I was having mixed feelings about it - I didn’t wanted it to end . When I heard about the mic off I thought I’ll give it a go and half way through I felt how I more and more got annoyed . My breathing wasn’t working I was constantly looking at the screen I peaked and couldn’t relax at all . After 40 min I paused it to check how long itll be left . Not great . I’m feeling really annoyed finishing off this amazing journey like this .

Wow! I did it! I'm so pround of myself and I'm soo grateful that I found you! I feel so much better in my skin now! I feel stronger and grounded than ever, yet flexible and balanced. :) I like to feel that my back and stomack are supported and that i have more energy and stamina throughout the day! I already new alot about spirituality, but your course is well balanced between body, mind and soul, so this was perfect for me! Your a genuine and funny person and i had a really good time practicing yoga with you! Thank you so much to do that for us! You truly are a blessing! :) I hope you'll create a new series like that soon!

I've been with Adrienne since lockdown, then started this 30 days. Loved it until day 30 when I felt a bit cast adrift too soon. I forgot everything without her voice, and I can't see her without my glasses. So yes I am emotional.

over the past few years i’ve been coming to terms with being non-binary, and home was a truly special way to reconnect with my body and relearn to love myself even in the face of gender dysphoria. on days i felt lost or hopeless, i knew i could always return to adriene and benji and just focus on my breath, discovering new ways to be proud of my body and its capabilities each session. i’m so glad to be part of this wonderful community, and proud of us all for coming home!

Ah, took me ~2 months to finish 30 days. After 20+ day, I missed a day, then 2, then just felt so out of it, I stopped for 2-3 weeks, just stopped. But I wanted to finish this even if it took me more than 30 days. And I'm glad I did. Thank you for this journey adrienne.

Definitely felt the beauty, the significance of completing this incredible journey with Adriene, Benji and all of you here in the comments! What a crazy time in the world right now.  I feel so blessed that Spirit guided me to yoga and with a simple search, finding this 30 day journey.  Everything about this was so sweet... precious really.  Loved the visual of the space, the centering music, a wonderful 4 legged for me to smile about (how cool that he was in and out, free to do his own thing and to really come home and into the mix on day 30!) the guidance, wisdom and personality from Adriene... all so welcome and soothing.  Thank you so much.  When I take time to read the comments, it's another lovely bit that is added to the journey.  Thank you.  For our last day of this particular journey, I found that I really wanted to hear her voice to guide and give direction. I wanted to sink into the moment more, but definitely felt the part of me that doesn't want to leave something out.... so I had to keep checking the screen to make sure that I was on track.  I felt good inside though.  Tearful at the end.  Again, just loving Benji weaving in and out of it all!  Hands together...heart... third eye... Namaste beautiful ones! 'Til we meet again.

After doing a big hike yesterday I felt really sore today, especially in my feet and ankles. At first the length of this practice put me off, but then I realised it's the silent day 30. Which means I can do whatever I want. Find what feels good. So I put together a yoga practice that fit my current needs - mostly restorative and focused on stretching aching muscles. I glanced up at Adriene every now and then to see what she was doing, but I was perfectly happy doing my own thing. I was really surprised by this, because during previous day 30s I always tried to keep up with Adriene. And now I just...didn't. It was really empowering to realise I had all the tools to put together a 40 min sequence by myself, for myself.

That said, I still prefer being guided by Adriene :D

I started this journey as a way to force myself to get my body moving again after being idle in quarantine for so long. What I didn't expect was to grow mentally and emotionally as well. The thing that I am most proud after completing this journey is not my increase in strength and flexibility (although that's pretty awesome too) but the ability to quiet my mind. I have had many days that have been very, very difficult but having the ability to just lay down and focus on my breathing has done wonders for my overactive mind. I definitely think I have discovered both a love for yoga and a love for myself. Thank you to this community, and especially to Adriene, for such an amazing and uplifting experience. I'm definitely going to try to make yoga a part of my normal routine moving forward.
Thank You Adriene, for this journey.

This is the longest yoga session I’ve ever done and I enjoyed it so much! 40 minutes felt like 25! Thank you so much for this beautiful journey! I grew so much in my yoga with you as my YouTube teacher! I told my Mom about your channel and she loves it! I truly appreciate this experience and thank you for making it accessible for all!
Thank you Adrienne. It’s been a wonderful journey

Yay! We did it! I was a little nervous about "Silent Adriene" mostly because I've done most all of this whole practice by letting her voice guide me (especially the times when she says go ahead and close your eyes if you want to and I already had). But I was able to do it today -- maybe not perfectly or at the very same pace -- but I did it and enjoyed the journey and new experience! I was worried about missing all of he wisdom that she imparts along the way -- kind of in passing -- that I've learned from but I heard many of those messages repeated in my head as I went along today; both of how to do the yoga poses and move as well as how to take it into daily life. I must say that I loved the music!!! And it was like watching poetry in motion to see Adriene move so beautifully through the poses.
This was a great yoga experience and I recommend it to anyone and everyone! I'm going to do "Home" again after I try some of Adriene's other series.
Thank you, Namaste
finishing this 30 days yoga is one of the nicest accomplishment for me
Thank you (and Benji!) for this amazing experience, you've changed my life for the better and I'll always be grateful. One love.

i am having a wee cry because this is the first 30 days challenge i've managed to stick with and complete. often i've come in and done a few days in a row, but i could never get past 25... my routine would be changed for some reason and i would forget to recommit to the practice. but here i am! day 30! and honestly, i can't believe how emotional it's made me. i always read comments on the YWA videos like "ahhhh i'm crying i'm in touch with my inner being waaaaa" and i didn't really get it, but here i am, crying along with the rest of you. thank you Adriene for holding us through whatever each of us are going through, i have discovered so much tenderness and love for myself through these daily movements.
Thank you Adrienne x

That was the coolest experience ever! I started off so nervous wondering how I’d be able to see your cues. Then I just closed by eyes and let my body lead. Thank you Adrienne for teaching me to trust myself! You’re an amazing teacher!

I don't normally comment but this journey is the best thing I have done for myself in so long. When I showed up today and realized you had your mic off, I actually took that as an invitation to just move through my own practice alongside you today. I chose and guided my own movements and got very emotional when realizing that I am the leader of this journey, and no one else. I finished my own practice 36 minutes in--it was the perfect amount for what my body needed and wanted. This last lesson truly took me home. Thank you so much to my great teacher, Namaste.
Wow! That just feels like coming home! I feel like now I'm ready for my yoga trip next week. Thank you Adriene! I really appreciate this. Lots of love 💛
86 degrees fahrenheit in my room, soaking wet, feeling stupid but I'll continue :)

Initially I planned to follow along with you, I was a little anxious about getting lost without your voice and was going to try to remember some of the sequences from the first 29 days of this Home practice... but then I started to breathe, to check in with myself, to hear you say, "Find What Feels Good" in my mind's ear, and something clicked. I truly did my own practice. I have been doing a fitness challenge and I spent the whole 40 minutes stretching and breathing into all the sore, aching parts of my body. I stepped of the mat feeling so much better!
I can’t believe I stuck through with this for a whole month! It seems like a few days ago I just started!
I cant believe I was able to do yoga for 40 minutes by myself
I love you Adriene!! Thank you!!
this was my second 30 day yoga journey during quarantine, it has been wonderful, thank you. ♡
Thank you Adrienne, that was most wonderful....a blessing, as are you!

Thank you Adriene for the love and light that you bring into the world and have helped me bring into myself!

I love your emphasis on the synchronisation of the breath with movement and have noticed many benefits both on and off the mat from this practice, mentally and physically. I have found new strength in the more challenging poses which I draw upon in challenging situations in life. Looking forward to joining you on the next one.

Good luck to all, and
Namaste!
I just completed the 30 day Home series.   It was wonderful!   Different lengths, different themes, some easy and some hard, but all valuable.  Thank you!!

Adriene, today I completed my day 30 and I don't know how can I ever thank you enough for this. You have changed my life. Life's good Adriene. Life's good because of you ❤️. On day one I came with lot of anxiety, stress and negativity. You will be happy to know that I am finally home 💕. I cried my heart out towards the end of this video. I am so proud of myself and so thankful that I chose to do this. You always said the hardest part is to show up. On day one I couldn't do a basic plank or down dog and here I am today ❣️. I have never seen angels or god but than I found you, my guiding light. I will always be with you, show up and practice with you. Once again a heartfelt thanks to you and this wonderful community. I love you Adriene thanks for your unconditional support. Sending you love and light. I am grateful that I found you and will always keep you in my heart and thoughts💗🌻. Namaste 🙏.

Omg this is how I watch all your videos lol 😂 on mute!! Lol
And thank you for the quotation at the end! 🙏
I had a good cry at the end. I don't know why. Anyone else who why that was? I wasn't happy or sad just started crying.
This has been an absolute JOY! When I got into the foetus position at the end I was like - yep, I'm home sweet home!

Like many others I 100% panicked at the beginning and even thought about skipping the last day, but as soon as I started moving I realized I had learned so much and I just moved to the music and my breath. I can understand how this was too overwhelming for many; I think the key here is to not be hard on yourself and remember to keep breathing and moving to whatever feels right for you. I finished the practice without realizing that I had flown through 40 minutes of my own yoga-created practice. I’m so thankful for this journey and will definitely continue to do yoga.
Thank you, Adriene! I wish I could 'like' this video every time I watch it. Did all 30 days and feel more fit and balanced.

After four months, today was my first day back I work after furlough (uk). Today was my last day of the Home journey too. After a hectic day of prep coming home, forcing myself to the mat reminded me that this time is precious and brought back to my home mind frame. This was my third 30day yoga during lockdown and this has been the first one that has really changed my yoga as well as life habits. Diolch yn fawr (thanks) Adriene, one of the best yoga teachers I’ve had.

In just two words: THANK YOU

What a beautiful and emotional ride. I appreciate your kindness, your guidance and your smile. Thank you for this journey 🙏🏽

This was the best thing in this lockdown. Thank you so much Adriene :) It was an amazing journey with you, I kind of felt emotional in the end when you didn’t say anything thinking what will I do from tomorrow, but I will keep on practicing it. Thank you once again :)
