Dearest Adriene, u r such an inspiration! I completed this yoga journey with you at home during these difficult pandemic times and truly am I blessed. I look forward to continue my practice with u, c u soon on the mat. Namaste. Love and regards, Samhita

you are a goddess. thank you so much, Adriene. I actually look forward to yoga every day because of you. You've made it so hilarious, fun, approachable, doable and most of all with love and care and sweetness. Thank you so so so much!!!!!!!!!!! YOU ARE THE BEST!!!!! Lots of love back to you x

Did all 30 days without missing a bit....accountability: no one owes it to you, but yourself.  My  body & mental health thank me for being consistent, even on days when I was doooowwwn.  I knew getting on the mat would take all that shit away.  So, here I am, day 30 &  grateful for you Adriene <3 for this gift.  Starting the 2019 30-day on Tuesday (july 28)

Even though it took me about 5 months to finish this, i made it through the entire 30 days. I started this somewhere in April and due to all the craziness it took me a while. Lets see which 30 day challenge we will continue with and how long that will take me. 😊

I took a lot of breaks during these 30 days and in total it's lasted me almost three months. But each time I came back to home, I felt loved and calm and happy this practice was amazing and surprising and I couldn't believe how far I'd come. Thank you, adriene, for making this possible for free.

I had completed a "30 days" years ago, in bits and spurts over the course of a few months. Then, I was so focused on getting in a "good workout" and didn't pay any attention to my breath. I didn't even know how to begin to do that. Years have passed since then and, in the midst of this pandemic, I decided to do another 30 days of yoga journey and I'm so glad that I did. This time, it was all. about. the. breath. for me and that changed everything. This past week, I started to worry about this practice. I remembered the tradition of the 30th practice not being guided and I was flooded with self-doubt and fear. But, I showed up today and I had a genuine smile on my face the whole time. I turned the computer so I wouldn't be tempted to look at the screen if I didn't need to and instead I went inward and just followed my breath and flowed for the entirety of the practice! My smile was from so deep within me. Tears flowed multiple times, happy tears,  as I'm just overwhelmed with gratitude for you and what you give to this community, for this journey, and for myself. I feel strong and calm and proud and happy. Thank you thank you thank you.

We Both came to the Matt today with almost the same outfits on..The same time that Benji was walking around the room my cat was walking around the same time it was funny it was almost like a mirror image but a cat and a dog..That was actually really hard because I had to keep looking at my phone to see what you were doing without having any instruction. It’s not that I don’t know the moves. But when you say what it is I don’t have to look at the phone and I can just focus on the move more so this was actually really difficult for me, but I did it..I just finished the 30 day program and I am so proud of myself and now I’m just gonna start doing your other yoga videos every day..

I finished today and cried like a baby. I was moved that I made it all the way to return home. I was moved I know what to do on the mat and I was afraid I wouldn't. You're amazing person Adriene, thank you for all of this
Oh my gosh! This made me cry. I don’t know why but I was crying especially towards the end. Thank you for this @adrienne. This journey has been helping me to get through my own life’s journey.

If you had told me a month ago that I’d be guiding myself through a 40 min yoga flow, I’d think you were nuts. But this practice had me trusting myself, finding what I needed in my own time. It reminded me that life’s moments all come to us exactly when we need them, and just because someone else is doing them first doesn’t mean we won’t get there in our own time—even if their journey is just a reminder to steer our boat to that course and redirect.

I began this journey because I’m a new mom trying to figure out parenting while working at home during quarantine. This practice was every day during the first nap. It changed me.

Thank you for this practice Adriene. It’s been the first “fitness journey” I’ve ever completed.

Thank you for you, the community, who I checked in with often to see if they experienced what I did and to hear of your journeys.

My pups and I enjoyed this and can’t wait to see what’s next.

Love you all. (Especially Benji)

Thank you Adriene mam for creating these videos. You made these days beautiful. Thank you so much and ♥️.
Just did this 30 day course in under 90 days! New record fast
Getting me through the pandemic! Thank you Adriene!

This was definitely an interesting last session. I went ahead and did it, sometimes following Adriene, sometimes just doing what I felt like. I don’t think I can do 40 mins of yoga unguided, I’m glad I’m not the only one.

Still, I’m so grateful to you Adriene for this practice! I loved being able to experiment and make the poses my own. The comments section is always so kind and inspiring, you’ve created a wonderful community. You are a lovely human being, and I look forward to doing your other 30 day practices! 🙏
That felt wonderful, having you there as a reference but being free to move as my body wanted. Thanks Adrienne

What a wonderful treat!  I started this Home Journey a month ago and ended yesterday on my birthday, a present I gave to myself. Thank you, Adriene, for helping me get back into a routine since my local yoga studio closed. I appreciate the care and commitment you devote to your lessons.

Adriene, thank you so much for this! After almost a decade of practicing yoga in inconsistent spurts, I feel like I finally found my way home into my daily practice. I'm glad you told us to come to the mat today with an open mind, I felt a little unsure about how to do this without your voice guiding me... but your voice was there the whole time! "If you fall, we will catch you" "Trust that the earth will catch you" "Don't panic" "Find what feels good" "You got this!" Thank you.  I found myself very emotional during this one as well, anyone else?  Also - I loved so much that Benji moved with us this time. I think he was trying to catch a fly? Lol. But I loved watching him join you. My pups alllllwayyyssss join me on the mat, whether I want them to or not, so I have really enjoyed seeing Benji with us on this journey. Anyway - thank you.

This is my second time through-I absolutely love this series.  Not only does it enhance my yoga practice but it gives much more emotionally.  Practicing mindfulness has become a priority during this pandemic and Adriene has served as my role model in her ability to do that, her constant positivity and her sincerity in her videos and uplifting daily message.  I can not thank you enough!

You are such a great teacher. 🙏

Thank you, Adriene and Benji❤❤

I’m so SO GRATEFUL for this. You have no idea how you changed my life during this 30 day journey. I feel so lucky, I feel so light and free. Actually, I can’t even describe how I feel. I can’t thank you enough 💙

Just wow! Finishing this makes me feel this sort of weird sadness though I've come so far. Doing all the moves. Syncing my breath. I did this in a heat index of 105 today, sweating it all out. I had this feeling of sweating out all the negativity in my life and the things that just don't fit with this new found peace  and just an overwhelming feeling of renewed freshness and well being. I am looking forward to many more years of this peace. Thank you Adriene and thank you to all who came to the mat. Peace and love to you all.

Thank you. Wow I got to day 30. Om shanti all fellow yogi travellers and thank you Adriene for this gift you have so generously shared with us. Xxx Sue 🌈

THANK YOU SO MUCH, ADRIENE! This is the second 30 day yoga journey I’ve done with you during COVID. Your videos are a true gift to me during this time. I feel like I truly have returned home to myself, my intuition, to trust myself. Slow down when I need to, find my breath, and let the breath guide me. During these 60+ days now of yoga with you, as a long time off and on practitioner, I’ve been able to do what I haven’t done in years. Both literally and metaphorically. Release old hurt and pain stored in my body. Heal those areas within, even in the spiritual/ emotional body. I truly appreciate your approach as a teacher. Thank you so much for this gift, this treasure and light during the chaos. This practice is my medicine. Blessings to you and all the YWA community!

This was brilliantly beautiful. Thank you for this wonderful 30 day series Adriene.  Feeling a bit sad that its over. Looking forward to beginning another one and perhaps someday returning to this one.

I don’t even know how to start, but I’ll just say Thank You.
During quarantine, I knew I had to start embracing a healthier lifestyle. I started doing HIIT and (eventually) yoga every other day after being recommended your channel. I started with the Home series cuz I thought it was created by the need to quarantine, but it was just a fantastic coincidence! I’ve never done yoga before and decided to try it. Here I am, 2 months later and I just completed a self-led practice with the tools and grace you gave us during the Home journey. Like many others, I was intimidated by the 40 minute video length, and learned the hard way that day 30 wouldn’t be guided. I didn’t think I could do it, but I just started by sitting in a comfy position and leaning into the breath. Then everything just.. happened. 20 minutes went by of listening to my body and moving into whatever positions I could either remember or felt like doing. I feel so much happier with myself, with my progress, and my physical flexibility. I didn’t expect this to stir some emotions in me after completing the Home journey, but thank you. I can’t wait to try the other journeys you’ve posted on here! Very grateful for you.

My mother, sister and I spent the last few months doing both "Dedicate" and "Home" together via Skype! We really enjoyed both journeys and it has become a kind of ritual, meeting up every morning to do yoga together - so thank you Adriene!

However, we never really know how to handle Day 30 of any journey. While it's nice listening to the music, we all struggle with the actual yoga sequence, getting cricks in our necks trying to see the screen while in downward facing dog, lying on our backs, etc. We all feel like we can't enjoy (and relax into) the movements because we're constantly checking what's next and how long you hold the positions for. So sadly, we've ended each series with a little more disappointment and frustration than would be anticipated.
Of course we trust ourselves and the movements we've learnt, but we don't want to make something up when we're all doing it together - just because we can't see what's actually happening.
Dear Adriene, if you ever read this comment, we would be thrilled if you would consider adding just a bit of commentary at the end of your next journey, so that the transitions from and to positions not facing the screen become more manageable. That would allow us to truely enjoy even the very last part of the journey!!

So, I've been bedridden from November of past year until February of this year, crippled by full-body eczema and the depression that came with it. I'm usually fairly stable mentally (which I'm so thankful for) so the depression hit me like a freight train.

However, as I started slowly climbing out of the darkness, with the help of my incredible parents, therapist, and medication, I started to regain my sense of self.

This month, I finally decided that enough was enough - I was going to put my past behind me, whilst still holding on to the lessons and the grace that it taught me. That's when I stumbled across this 30 Day Yoga Journey.

I don't know what made me click on this particular one - after all, there were more recent Yoga Journeys - but I like to think it was serendipity, a higher power, maybe even my intuition, that brought me to you, Adrienne.

And I've done it. I've done 30 Days of Yoga, 30 days of taking care of myself for the first time in a long time 30 days of walking the path, not back to the old Ciara, but towards the new Ciara that I've always been. I've uncovered parts of my personality that I never knew were there. I'm resilient, I'm strong, and I have more optimism and hope inside me than a Disney princess (or prince, for that matter).

For the last 15mins of practice, I just lay on my side in the fetal position, with my clear skin and peaceful heart, and cried. I just cried and cried and cried. In that moment, I felt reborn.

I'm damn proud of myself for doing this, and I'm so, so thankful that you, wonderful Adrienne, have chosen to share your gift to the world.

I extend love to everyone. I extend love to myself. Most of all, I extend love to the home I've rebuilt inside of myself.

Thank you, Adrienne.
Love,
Ciara

I am 25 years old. I want to start off by saying that this is the first goal I have ever set for myself and have willfully achieved. I started this 30 day yoga practice during quarantine, when I began deeply examining my life and reconnecting with myself spiritually, once that finally had the space for me to address it due to not working my usual, very stressful job. It also naturally created a lot of chaos, me opening up doors to myself that I had long locked shut (I've tried to commit to yoga for so long but never made the time for it). I had very little yoga experience prior to this. I definitely had no core strength or balance. I turned to yoga for mental clarity, for emotional release, and for physical health. There were hard days, but the reward that I hold now was well worth it. I haven't felt this type of mental clarity, ever. I haven't felt this good, ever. I have more patience, more grace. I am overall more calm. What I once never made time for, I now can't go a day without. I find myself excited for this practice every day, ready and willing for the internal discipline it's taught me to have. It has helped teach me, that ultimately, I am in control here. I am worthy of giving myself the time to grow. These positive changes influenced me to apply to college (my last course was 7 years ago). I am taking more initiative and chasing after my dreams. I truly owe it to these videos, this practice, and you, Adrienne. I can't wait to begin the next 30 day yoga journey tomorrow.  My new goal is to do yoga every day for a year. If I can make it 30 days, I can make it every day. I surprised myself doing the last day of this challenge. I actually was able to keep up with you and move through each pose easily. I realized I have grown a lot stronger than I thought I would grow to originally. I could go on and on about how this practice has changed my life, but alas, I'll be with you in my next journey!
love this.  My thoughts exactly.  I look forward to being on the mat and am equally surprised by what I have gained.

Did anyone else hear your favorite Adriene phrases in your head while doing this?

"Take up space"
"Your version"
"Take your time"
"We'll meet in this position"

There were many, many others, but just hearing them on my own made me realize how much I say them to myself in daily life now. When I feel stressed and I just tell myself to take my time. Or when I'm feeling small, and I let myself know that it's okay to take up space.

I was reluctant to start this practice at first, my friend wanted me to do it with her and I was like, "well... okay". Today, I am so thankful for this practice and the effect it has had on me.

Finally reached the end of this journey, I just want to write about how grateful I am for adriene's yoga and how glad I am to give myself the time and space for yoga with adriene. This past month with adriene completely transformed how i do yoga, how I feel in my body and how I feel my mind. Anyone who is interested in yoga, PLEASE START WITH THIS JOURNEY :)
In the first week i started to pay attention to the various little sensations and moments in my body - from the soreness of my neck to the touch of the ground on my toes. I started to pay more and more attention to my fingers, the ways I use my muscles, my torso, my quads. I paid attention to threading my every movement with my breath - with more space in my mind.
While I discovered parts of my body that i had never paid attention to, i am feeling more calm, more stillness, more resilience, more strength, and more clarity in my mind. I realized that my mind is strong and my body can be stronger.
Thank you adriene!

A friend suggested HOME to me a couple of days before my birthday. I'm so thankful to him for allowing me to discover this amazing opportunity to breathe and this wonderful way of understanding our own movements. I was unnerved when I realised we had to do today kind of on our own, and my intuition wasn't so strong—but maybe it was the SICK entry of the opening theme in the middle of the video that got me so pumped up. I was kinda struggling in the middle but that filled me with so much joy, and I found myself in tears at the end. I cry easily but during yoga I am so focused on moving and RELAXING, I thought years of joking about had made me immune to cathartic crying. Maybe because it was so relieving, cathartic; maybe because of the glorious thumbnail or the music; or maybe I was stretching it so HOME wouldn't end, I found myself shedding a couple of tears in a quiet kind of joy. Thank you so much, Adriene. You made me believe in this. It was a beautiful journey.

Omg!  Why did I cry at the end of this??? Did anyone else have an emotional response?  I thought, wow, that was tough, but the whole time I had to follow my instincts and make decisions on my own.  I had to sit with my own voice, and in the end, I discovered home is deep within.  And then I just started bawling!  I don't know if it's because I felt so afraid of my own potential.  I don't know if it was because I was felt so in charge of my decision making.  I don't know if it was because it was the end of a journey that I'm sad to see end.  But overall, I'm hopefull for what comes next.  I'm very thankful for this experience, because throughout the whole thing, Adriene gave us permission to listen to our own bodies.  And as a former dancer, it felt nice toe reconnect with home.

I started this session with tears streaming down my face, and unfortunately I had to tap out midway because I spent too much time trying to watch (vs listen) and ended up getting entirely too dizzy/queasy (I've been struggling with that throughout the entire journey)  but I sat and watched in awe and she flowed through the poses so beautifully.  She is absolutely my inspiration and after we get moved and settled, I fully intend to take quite a few more journeys with this beautiful soul.
Thank you!!
That's was AMAZING thank you so much 💕🙏

Wow this is my first time doing yoga consistently for 30days. It really helped my flexibility, balance and controlled breathing when i do my workout.

You know, I panicked a little when I was watching the first bit while I did my scar care and hormone application and Adriene was like, "You're DIYing it today kids but I believe in you and I'm here if you need me!". I wondered what the hell I was going to do but then I though that this was cool because it took the pressure off me to keep up with the video and I knew I had poses that I liked despire being a total beginner. So I just went with whatever popped into my head and took the pressure off myself. I didn't always hugbmy lower ribs in, I didn't breathe right in places but that's ok because it was a journey and an experience. As soon as I started in mountain pose and then raised my arms up I felt this huge rush of emotion and I knew I'd be ok. Like Adriene said, I had the tools she'd given me. I can do it. I had to look a few times to get ideas for where my flow was going which was cool.

Maybe my journey home was realising that I can do stuff on my own amd I'm capable of guiding myself and I won't fuck it up.
thank you Adriene for such a beautiful 30 day yoga journey! Perfect ending!! <3

I found this channel by accident and because I was suffering back pain. After 2 days of back work out, I moved on to Adriene’s 1st 30-day challenge. I have bought yoga packages before, but I never had such determination to follow through, but with Adriene - I finished 30 days! I started with apprehension today, I was so surprised to know that I can actually complete it. Today was a tough workout but I loved it and was overwhelmed by the confidence she has unknowingly instilled in me. Thank you for the selfless sharing of your knowledge Adriene and Chris. Appreciative of your giving heart and your actions spur me to also want to pass it forward. Love from Singapore.
What a life saver during this time. I thoroughly enjoyed each session. You’re the best!
I just finished my Home 30 day challenge and I am so empowered to continue with you. The ending tune brought it home where I began with your opening music and I thank you.

Oh, Adrienne. I've been a silent lurker here since I've started doing yoga for the first time ever with this journey. But during the practise, a thousand thoughts were popping into my head, and I felt like I needed to write something afterwards.
It was magical. I truly cannot say how much yoga have changed me, physically and mentally. I've had a tumultuous period with my studies this year, and starting this practise about a month ago was a way to deal with the stress. Fitting is also how the 30th day came up with the day of my final exam, and I'm ending the whole year with a beautiful practise. :)
When I heard at the beginning that you won't speak a thing in Day 30, I was hesitant, almost as if I was a child who's getting sent to school by a mother for the first time. But it all disappeared in the first 5 minutes. The music and the flow connected me with you, and all the people practising, like never before. There's something in the silent, thoughtful, mirrored movement that serves as a wonderful communication tool, and it felt even more like coming home.
I teared up when I realized the music I've started associating with "victory dopamine boost" that's usually at the end of the videos is playing alongside some of the harder parts of the practise. It's so metaphorical, and so freeing, to see our hardships as something to take courage and strenght from, maybe even happiness!
I also noticed that thorough this practise I didn't complain in my head even once. Not with the boats, or the plank pushups - I simply acknowledged that they were part of the Journey, and calmly prepared myself, knowing that I can do my best, and it will be enough. And I can already feel how his tremendously helping this mindset will be in day-to-day life.
I could write a whole book of praising here, honestly. I kinda just did, haha. But I wanted to leave it here. I'm definitely carrying on doing yoga with you, and the 30 days were just the freshest of starts. Thank you. :)

I sweated, I smiled, I even cried a little at the end, but most of all I felt strong. I'm a little sad that I'e reached the 30th day; I don't want it to end! But I am proud of how far I've come. Your practices have brought my days in quarantine joy, balance and a sense of commitment. Thank you so much Adrienne!

And, of course, I am now crying. But in a cool way.

I have so many things to say. The first and most important, thank you. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking me through this journey. I have only realized through this practice that it has indeed been a journey.

I've never thought I would be able to freestyle a practice of my own. But I did it, and it felt amazing and fulfilling. I took a few peeks at you and at some times we were doing the same thing. One time you smile reassured me that I was on the right path.
Thank you again for everything! I have learned so much from you and yoga, and I look forward to exploring more of it.
Namaste!

Yesterday, I messed up in my life in a way that I really broke my own heart. It was hard for me to show up today. I was trying so hard to avoid being alone with my thoughts. Little did I know, Adriene would have today's practice be a silent unguided one. I cried so much. I felt so pain get felt, validated, and released. I forgave myself. I held space for myself.

I have been doing yoga and teaching it for years. This is the number one hands down best yoga experience I've ever had. Adriene thank you for what you do.

I've realized that in life, "mistakes" are inevitable. I am always doing the best I can. I can't beat myself up to success. I can't avoid pain and bypass to success. I get to stick with myself and love ALL OF ME no matter how messy I get.

I am ready for my next 30 day challenge starting tomorrow.

I'm another who started and finished this journey home during quarantine. This was absolutely what I needed. I am a Theater and Dance major, so I have a physical practice built into my days through Jazz, Ballet, Modern, movement classes and physical theater. I feel so lucky and grateful to have found this journey home. I was so desperately missing the connection with my body that I had known consistently for the past 3 years of my education. Having my routine and my physical practice suddenly taken away left me feeling confused and frustrated. I felt like a stranger in my body. Through this journey I have learned that being distracted by long days and rehearsals, dancing constantly and going to the gym to maintain my instrument is not the same thing as a loving connection with my body. Working myself to exhaustion is not the same as finding what feels good. I always struggle when Adriene asks me to surprise myself. What do I have to offer that's surprising or new? How can I do that when I'm a beginner and still learning? Well, today in this silent practice - I absolutely surprised myself. Thank you, Adriene. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

I cried literally when I finished this yoga home journey and heard your intro music on the last part.i just Cant believe it I finished this journey. thank you adrienne. I’ll start the revolution 30 day yoga tomorrow 😍

Wow. I was really nervous and scared when I found out that this was going to be all on our own and I didn't know how I was going to do it, but then I just started doing the yoga poses that feel good for me and what felt right in the moment and kept continuing to do them one after another, remembering previous sequences we have done. I worked to not look at the time or what she was doing for reference at all and just do my own thing. I decided to lay on my back to finally get in that meditative state and eventually it felt like it was time to get up. Little did I know when I opened my eyes Adriene too was sitting up from her last pose and bringing her hands to heart center. It felt like I had only been doing yoga for 15 minutes. It's crazy how things can work out just right sometimes if you just believe in yourself without question.
This was amazing! This is the second time through this series-still a newbie. I cried because I can just feel how strong I've become physically and emotionally. Thank you so much. ❤️

This series has turned me into a complete believer in the practice, and I never want to go another day without taking this time again. Thank you, Adriene.

What an exciting journey with incredible teacher, I really felt in a real class not with a stranger at all 😭❤️I never thought I would end all 30 days, I feel inspired, proud, emotional and excited to begin a new one with adriene ❤️❤️

I can't believe I cried in the end!! Wow, I don't even know where to begin but honestly, this yoga journey changed my life. I'm 23 and I feel like I never really accomplished anything, I never finished anything... I've started so many things that I was super excited in the very first days and then eventually ended up giving up. I thought this yoga journey was going to be another one of those things... even though I was promising myself I was going to make it till the end, there was this part of me that was sure I was not going to finish it. But well... I made it!!!! First I was starting the videos after midnight because I was waking up really late and watching tv shows all day so after midnight was when I had time, but after day 5 or something I decided I was going to do it in the mornings so I started to wake up early just to do the yoga and then during the day I also started to do more productive things. Slowly, in these 30 days, I went from somebody who would wake up at 2 p.m, stay all day in bed eating and watching Netflix and then go to bed after 4 a.m to somebody who wakes up 8 a.m, does yoga every morning, works out in the afternoon 4 times a week, studies every day for at least 4 hours, spends time with the family and goes to bed at 22 p.m. I feel like I woke up to actually living again and I honestly believe it was all because of yoga. Thank you, Adriene. Thank you. Now my goal is doing yoga every day until the end of the year and I look forward to writing again how that changed me :)

This is the first time I've done a day 30 and I was not expecting that. At first I didn't feel prepared and my brain went into blanking mode but having the video helped a bit. Not my favourite day but I think with some more practice it will get easier. Thank you for this awesome practice.

Throughout much of this class, I kept thinking to myself, “I don’t like this!" I felt uncomfortable, uncertain, even scared. But it was in that discomfort that I began to notice some pretty important things.

I have a huge fear of missing out that hinders me from being brave and doing things differently, or even asking myself what I want to do. I’m afraid of not belonging, or being on my own. I kept glancing at my screen to see what Adriene was doing so that I could follow along, losing focus of the integrity of the poses, of my breath, of staying present.

I don’t know how to follow or even feel my intuition, or maybe I just don’t trust myself enough to do so.

I’m a perfectionist, and get caught up with the minute intricacies of whether or not I am doing something right.

I’m afraid of doing things wrong, and resistant to try new things on my own.

I still don’t know how to do anything with ease and grace. Especially failure.

I struggle with truly being mindful and present.

I am very hard on myself.

My mind always feels like it’s running a hundred miles per hour, and when I am left alone with myself, the uncertainty I feel only brings in the chaotic thoughts even more persistently.

But in the silence of this class, I also found that it turns out I'm stronger than I realized I was. Doing just a little bit every day for the past thirty days has led to results that surprised me.

It was only in the last few minutes that I asked myself for the first time, “What do I want to do?” and began to diverge from what Adriene was doing. It felt terrifying, and also exhilarating, to be making my own choices and trusting myself.

I may not have liked this class at the beginning, but I sure as hell needed it. If anything, this last day taught me the ways in which I need to grow. I began to tear up when the quote from John O’Donohue showed up at the end.

Although I did not enjoy how I felt during much of it, today's class ended up feeling like magic when it was over. Looking back, this might be the best experience I’ve had in the past thirty days.

I am so grateful, Adriene. Thank you for helping me catch my own magic. <3

I loved having done the 30 day yoga with you Adriene.I joined during lockdown and looked forward everyday to do my yoga .

I love adriene with all my heart and I was so happy to see benji wandering around -- and so did my dog who always watches the screen intently. I want to preface by saying I really do love everything about ywa; I tell everyone about this amazing corner of youtube like a town crier and I'm buying myself my first ever ~subscription~ to the fwfg community for my birthday this monday. My boyfriend and friends are for sure tired of me dropping yoga into every conversation so they all began practicing to appease me. Surprise! They have now joined the cult of everyday practice and are now the town criers to their own circles :)
I do feel like I failed this one though. I knew the second I read no mic that this wasn't going to go well for me. I'm seeing themes of this in some comments too. I am a perfectionist in recovery so not 'nailing' every pose or landing on time really got to me. I was out of sync with my breath and body and really in my head. Which is beyond ironic as ywa -- specifically this home journey -- have pushed me along the path of self acceptance and confidence. This journey is nothing but remarkable and it came right on time for me but I was frustrated today. And I feel like a toddler crying from frustration simply because I didn't cry from joy or relief like the others. I'm not sure where to go from here; should I try this practice or the entire 30 days again? Did I miss the rules, should I be doing my own movements? Or should I be trying to keep up? Was I not ready? Or am I not zen or trusting enough to have finished correctly? Did I not find the right home? Because it feels as if I had my bags packed and ready to move in but I don't have the keys to the door.
Okay, I digress. This is not a bash on the ywa community or adriene herself. I have nothing but love and respect for everyone and their mats but it seems jealousy has wiggled its way in as well. I need my fellow perfectionists in the comments to know they aren't alone. Not sure I have any advice to comfort us but I definitely feel the same way. @khadija zaheer @ajmonkeyflash @Archie & Alfie @Steph anie @Kathy Moseley
Thank you Adriene

I started practicing yoga about 10 yrs ago but had not been consistent in the last few years, quarantine brought me back to it! TYSM Adriene for all the effort you put into this, it is greatly appreciated!!! Greetings from Guadalajara, México!

I simply want to say a big GRACIAS for introducing me to yoga. I’ve done everyday twice (I’m a slow learner 😀) and It has helped me to cope better with the lockdown. 2 months down the line I Know now that I have the foundations to continue practising. You are a star! See y’all soon! From Bugbrooke, England, cheers! Javier

I have been doing your yoga videos for the past two years, but on May 1st, I decided to do my first 30 day yoga challenge. I finished yesterday and I loved every moment of it. Doing Home helped me stay calm during the covid-19 madness. I want to thank you for helping me to stay calm even during uncertain times. I’m gonna do True during the month of June!

Thank you, Adriene! You have found something inside me that I didn't know I have. Like a hidden treasure that I didn't have a map for. Now, I'm slowly uncovering a need that seemed to be dormant for years. I'm not sure why or how but your practice often uncovered unexpected emotions that I didn't know existed within me. It has been my pleasure to join you and thank you once again for what turned out to be much more than an exercise program :)  I'm for sure going to continue on this journey.

Thank you for this amazing journey in a most difficult time. Your face (and Benji's) were something I looked forward to each day. I cried at the end, which caught me by complete surprise. You are a gifted teacher.  Thank you for sharing your gifts. Namaste Adriene. xoxox
I did it. Thank you for sharing a wonderful growth experience with us. One of my favourite journeys :)

I had no idea that this was the last day tradition. Maybe just add captions or something. You move so so fast. All I did was have a panic attack. I get that I am supposed to make the decisions within the move but some people can't make that leap straight into silence.

I found my way home and this was a beautiful practice & part way thru I found myself crying. Happy tears & sad tears and all the emotion just began pouring out. Happy tears just cause i was proud and amazed at me able to do all of this & sad because the journey home was at its end. I won’t stop practicing tho and as this journey ends i look forward to starting a new one. Thank you so so much Adriene & Yoga with Adriene community. I love you all & namaste!!! ❤️🥰❤️

Thank you very much, Adriene, for your 30 day-tours. I just finished the second one (30 days and 30 days of home yoga) and I am going to start my third tour (yoga camp) with you tomorrow. You help me more than words can say, especially in these corona-lockdown-days. Thanks so much!
It has been a wonderful journey,  thank you Adriene ♥️ especially during this situation it's truly a life changing experience throughout the 30 days!
Loved my 30 day journey! Thank you so much for making this series!

Just finished these 30 days and I can't thank you enough for the gift of you and all you allow and teach on the mat. As one of the many healthcare workers out there, thank you for a safe place to let it all go❤.

This was really hard for me. I felt like I couldn't really relax into any of the poses or close my eyes because I would miss what would come next. I even broke down and cried because I was so angry that this last practice didn't have any cues. I finished it, because I said I would, but I had so many bad thoughts coming up during it. I struggle a lot with my body image and perfectionism, so just being alone with my thoughts like "you didn't do this plank properly" "you're lagging behind again" was so difficult. I realised how much I rely on Adriene to tell me that it's okay if I can't do a chaturanga, it's okay if I don't do it perfectly.
But all in all, I really enjoyed Home, even though I didn't do it 30 days in a row. I just still have a really long way to go practicing being kind to myself.

Thank you for writing this; I felt so abandoned when I pressed play looking forward to it being the last one and then just anxiety and panic when she said it'll be on our own :( I didn't get it at all, I didn't even understand whether we were supposed to do what she did or just our own thing. I felt as if I was dropped in the deep end and expected to know how to swim when I absolutely did not feel ready for that yet.. Cried throughout. I just wanted it to end so that I could at least say to myself that I finished everything. Out of all 30 days this is the only one that I've wanted to go into child's pose and stay there for the whole 40 minutes, just because I was so not prepared and the panic took me by surprise. I'm a bit of a perfectionist too, and I really really don't deal well with feeling unprepared and not good enough... Such a low end for me, to what's otherwise been such an amazing journey 😞

I had such a hard time with this and bailed at minute 27. I have vertigo and craning my neck for any significant amount of time reactivates it and makes me dizzy and sick. I also never fully got into the postures bc I had to keep checking. I'm so disappointed that I couldn't finish this. I'll literally be sick if I do. 😥

I'm glad I'm not the only one, though. Virtual hugs to anyone else who had to stop.

Me too! I felt like I had made so much progress over the first 29 days but this session broke me after 10 minutes. I couldn't close my eyes and listen to my body because I had to keep turning to the screen to see what comes next. I broke down and cried for half an hour and now I feel so discouraged about the last month.I wanted to start another 30 day program straight away but I feel... betrayed in a way.
I just kept finishing it after reading your comment. At minute 19 I felt exactly as you describe. But I kept finishing it cause I see I wasn t struggeling alone. Thanks.
Go at your own pace. When you're ready to "catch up" just join where she is at that moment without worrying about the bits in between that you missed.
Thankyou for bringing this into my life. :)

This was so powerful. Thank you Adrienne💛.
(BTW: Every time I recommend your channel to one of my friends, I say, "You'll love her. She's one of us".)
Thank you. <3

Dear Adriene,

I cannot be thankful enough for this wonderful experience! I have been following you some years, but I never paid enough attention to all the gifts that you have shared with all of us.

I finished Home Journey during this exceptional and unique time that all humanity is facing, I can assure you that connecting with you during this time will always remains in my mind and heart.

Gracias, Gracias, Gracias! May God keep blessing you and the entire team behind the camera. Say Hi to Benji!

With Love , Karla from Honduras

What a disappointing way to end what has been an otherwise wonderful 29 days. Not sure why this is a tradition since it seems more aggravating than anything else. I spent more time looking at the video trying to see poses and transitions we were doing than actually, consciously doing them. I would have 100% preferred an audio-only video rather than tearing my focus and gaze away from what I was doing every five seconds - completely ruined the flow that I have been practicing for the last 29 days. Would give the Home series an A- only because this last was such a let down. Really hoping this tradition ends here.

I did these thirty days of yoga on Fri/Sat/Sun for 10 weeks during quarantine due to COVID 19.  This series kept me active and limber and gave me something to look forward to, something to commit to.  Thank you, Adriene.

Just finished my 30 day journey home after 80+ days in isolation... ive never done yoga before for 30 days straight but it feels so good!! Looking forward to my next journey with you Adriene... With love from Cairo
Started in March finished the last day of May but I kept saying yes and finally got through a 30 day yoga journey!
Delicious. Thank you!
Completed 30 days journey! It's such a beautiful and lovely experience. Thank you Adriene!
Thank you Adriene.

What a fulfilling 30 days! I will definitely be using this video for my daily practice just so I've got someone to do it with. Thank you so much for leading me to this point, you've changed my mindset and most of all my emotions and fitness, this was truly a beautiful experience for me❤️

What an amazing journey - I have practised Ashtanga yoga for 2 years and have just found you as I have a couple of injuries and wanted a ‘lower level’ yoga. When you said what today’s surprise was I panicked, I followed you to start with and then ‘found what feels good’
- it felt so liberating to to be able to my own thing instead of structured moves in sequence and when we happened to do the same move at the same time, I smiled! Thank you - can’t wait to start my next 30day journey x

Dear Adriene, can you tell us what's the music in the background and where can more of that beauty be found? :)
Thank you for everything, this was my favourite journey this year! <3

This is the second time I complete one of your 30 days series. I cried tears of joy and gratitude again. Thank you Adriene for transforming our lives through the teachings of yoga and compassion. I love you.

Wow, coincidentally was able to do a complete head stand myself for the very first time while doing this last day. Made the end of this whole journey that much more emotional! Loved it all, thank you so much Adriene!!
Sensational! Thank you so much, just completed all 30 days and has changed my life; this was truly amazing!

Thank you so much for this beautiful journey Home, Adriene.
You are amazing and we love you!

Is it just me or did anyone else get emotional when she bowed at the end? I started and didn’t believe I could finish it. I didn’t think I would stay committed but when I finished and bowed with her, I was in tears. This is my first 30 day yoga and I completed it. I’m proud of myself and I thank you Adriene for the support and encouragement. 🙏🏾. Love you very much!!

For the first time in my life, I managed to complete a 30-day challenge without skipping a day! I cried at the end. In a time like this when normal life has been interrupted and every day just sort of blends into the next, little wins mean so much. Thank you Adriene.

I cried a lot during this practice, mainly because without words and instructions, it felt like meditation. Pure, uninterrupted flow. I loved the whole experience, Adrienne! So thank you for that. I always use yoga as a first step to meditation. I am blessed and I hope you all are too. Peace and love! :)

I'm really not a person who is in any way consistent with anything. I'm surprised by myself that I did 30 days of yoga in a row. So like some others here I got a bit emotional towards the end of this video. Like the quote in the end suggests, I hope for all of us that this challenge will "open a path of plentitude". Thank you Adriene!
We did it! I've never felt so much body positivity and love for my body! Thank you Adrienne for softly guiding us to maximize our best potential :)

Thank you so much Adriene, I feel so good while doing yoga with you. Your energy brings me positivity and this journey was really awesome. You know how to make us smile.
I will gladly continue on my journey thanks to you, I can't wait to do your monthly calendars.

Lots of love.
Namasté 🙏
Gracias, gracias Adriene. Your classes had changed my life literally. We love you too!! 🧡🧘🏻‍♀️
Loved every day! ❤️ Yoga is changing my life ; I feel it helps me so much!Thank you so much for your guidance and gentleness. Much love for you and Benji!

I can't express enough how much your videos make me feel so alive and well and peaceful. I've followed all your 30 Days series and check in with your regular videos inbetween, and each one has helped me so much. Seeing the number of your subscribers grow fills me with such hope for the world too; that so many people are discovering yoga and enriching their lives.
I teach English to international students online and share your channel with every new student I meet! The response I get is always positive and they tell me how you're helping them with their communication skills as much as their physical and mental health (I'm sure the phrase "Hey yo!" has a universal meaning across many cultures! :-D )
I comment on a lot of your videos but still just wanted to say how grateful I am for what you share with the world.
Keep shining that amazing light, Adriene! Namaste :-)

I have to admit that I was postponing today's practice because I knew it would be like this and I thought I wouldn't be able to guide myself, but I decided to give it a try... I can't believe that I did 40min of yoga following my own lead... Thank you Adriene, I ended this journey learning to trust more in myself, and I want to keep practicing everyday

As I was feeling anxious and sad during quarantine, I knew I needed to do something for myself.  That something became yoga.  This is the first 30 day challenge I’ve completed, and I have grown in ways I never imagined.  I am turning 50 in one week, and my body has changed a lot in recent  years.  With your help, I discovered that my body is so much stronger and more capable than I thought.  I have come to accept and love my body more than ever before.  Thank you for that, and thank you for the gentle, sweet, calm start to my days as I’ve had to facilitate my kids’ learning these past weeks.  I know it made a huge impact on my mental and emotional state as well.  I missed your sweet voice today, but I get it.  I knew the poses, the flow, and how to breathe through the poses.  Thank you for helping me discover that. Looking forward to spending more time learning and improving. 💕

Started my journey Home in quarantine, I could not be more great full for it .Im 15 years old and had never done yoga, but after the 30 days I feel much better and full of awareness. Thanks Adriene, kisses from Argentina

Yep, I did not enjoy this practice. Maybe it's trust, maybe it's confidence or maybe it's something else. But with no audio or visual (I don't wear glasses when practicing because they keep sliding off my face) cues...I was completely lost. And I felt frustrated. Like @ajmonkeyflash said: this definitely felt like an exam I wasn't prepared for. Sigh. Quit at the 20 minute mark because I didn't have a clue as to what to do....so I went back to another day. Sorry Adrienne but I think this one will definitely require a lot more time and work.

Aww sad my glasses always fall off too but I just go with the flow, it’s like I already knew what to do! You were right to quit at the 20 minute mark though, yoga is supposed to build you up and make you feel great, but not frustrate you. Anyways, congrats to making it to the 30th day! ❤️
Had completed the 30 day yoga journey some days back.. I am still doing this particular session as it feels like a recollection of all that we were doing the 30 days..

So graceful, so gentle yet so empowering. Thank you all so much for the amazing videos and life long  lessons. Just so amazing,. May all of your lives be filled with good health and happiness. Sending all of you love from Mongolia.  Thank you so much. Namaste.

I loved all the music that was picked for this closing practice of this journey! It was very soothing and enjoying. Thank you for making this series accessible on this platform. My yoga practice has grown and evolved since day one of this journey with you and all the people around the world. This was my first completed yoga journey.  You helped me get though quarantine. It gave me something to look forward to in my day fo the past 30 days. Thank you again. Namaste!
I’ve been working up to this for a couple of weeks and did it today it was really nice! Great yoga instructor 🙌 thank you Adriene
I feel amazing after that. Thank you
Thank you so much for the past 30 days; I couldn’t have got through this stage of lockdown without it! I couldn’t control my tears at the end of the experience today. Thank you, namaste x

It was such a beautiful journey! :, )
Thank you for all the heart you put into this, Adriene.
Love back to you from Singapore!

Ngl when I realised that Adriene wasn't going to be talking us through it I panicked and figured I might get about 20 mins in then give up, but once I started I was amazed at how much I remembered. No, it wasn't perfect, sometimes I forgot to breathe and I had to keep glancing back at the video to see if what I was doing was vaguely right, but it felt good. There was a fair amount of freestyle and I spent more time on my back than doing flows, but that was what felt right for me today and I really enjoyed it. This is the first time I've ever completed a 30 day challenge and I feel so proud and motivated to continue. Thank you so much Adriene for giving me not only the tools but also confidence and trust in myself to keep going with these practices. I look forward to the next one!

Just finished HOME during 30 days of lockdown. A definite curve ball at the end but one I felt content with. I haven't read any comments on this journey, but after being full of emotion, joy, fulfillment and tears at the end I felt the urge to see if others found the same. It is comforting to know that despite being in your own bubble, others are sharing the same feelings at the same time! Thank you.
Reading the comments and I feel relieved that I’m not the only one who cried at the end. In the silence of this practice, I resolved to continue practicing everyday as much as I can. Namaste

Thank you for this 30-days journey. Thanks to the quarantine I was able to do whole this practice day by day within 30-days. The time on the mat is very precious to me. It's the time when I leave all my thoughts behind the mat and for this few minutes I feel calm and relax.

Just finished the 30 days,with pauses in between but always picking up where I left of. Did not expect all the feels and tearing up with this silent session, it felt like my own little graduation.
I can confidently say I went from belly flops to actual decent cobras in 30 days.Thank you Adrienne, from my Chilean heart to yours, may the journey continue!

"My journey started today"..this is the only feeling after completing 30 day yoga journey without any gap at home (India). Thank you Adriene for taking us on the track with mindful innovative routine. As I felt to start up my own journey to the path of Yoga, will always remember you as a great motivator who ignited the passion for yoga in me. Namaste.🙏

Just finished this 30 Days Yoga Journey on Home during Quarantine, on my 75th day of lockdown. Never Did Yoga before and I simply loved it. 30 days in wich I dedicated a moment for me, learned to care for myself and to appreciate all that my body is capable of, all during dificult times, I found serenity, love, health and of course strenght. Thank you so much Adriene! I'll keep on the Yoga practice, now with the "Dedicate" session!!

When I saw those 40 minutes I panicked. "Not gonna make it, I dont know what to do!!" It went so fast! I didn't notice that it was ending till I saw you bowing! Thank you for everything. This was amazing!!

This journey has been amazing to say the least. Today I feel I've finally broken in and found my center. No studio has been able to help me practice on my own like you have, Adrien. 🙏🏼
Namaste ✌🏼

Today I felt I was done after circa 25 minutes but that’s ok, it felt really good and I enjoyed my time in savasana ❤️ now onto Yoga Camp, even though the lenght of the videos really scares me :/ but it’s been 60 days of yoga every day so far, let’s hope to keep this going!
Thanks Adriene for this wonderful yoga series! I really enjoyed it!

Just finished this 30 days of yoga on 30th May!! I can't believe I did this through Ramadhan fasting.

Thank you so much, Adriene. Love from Indonesia ♥️

Namaste 🙏
Thank you so much, emotional, enlightening and the passage at the end gave me goose bumps.

Wow, Day 30 of this journey was beautifully empowering; you do what all great teachers should strive to do - teach steadily, build mutual trust, and thoughtfully encourage those who are following that we have had been given the tools to do exactly what we've practiced. So, so lovely, Adriene. Thank you for all you do!

Thank you for this 30 day Yoga Journey. Day 30 has been such a magic closure,  very empowering: listening to myself, trusting myself, and at the same time feeling guided and accompanied by Adriene. Thank you for the gifts, for the chances and opportunities that you give to so many people around the world by providing this space for connecting.
Ah I loved this 30 day journey. I had tears in my eyes at the end of this video from gratitude. xo

This practice was so powerful for me. I've never finished a 30 day before, so I wasn't expecting the last day and leading my own practice. Initially I found myself watching a lot, but then I remembered the practices to explore movements that feel good, and found myself going back to favorite poses I'd forgotten. I didn't think I could fill a whole 40 minutes, but I did. It was my strongest practice yet and I ended with tears streaming down my face. Thank you Adrienne, for making the journey home not seem so scary. 💕💕💕

Adriene... You have totally changed my home practice!! I started watching you at the beginning of the year sporadically, and quarantine coupled with your videos has helped me journey back into everyday practice. Thank you, thank you for helping me gain my strength back, boost my confidence and light my creative fire again. You are a great teacher!
Just finished Day 29 on 29th May, cant wait to do this tomorrow!!  Hello from Dubai, UAE!
That was great yoga!  Thanks Adriene.

From Petaluma, CA: Just finished Day 30 and it was one of the few times I didn't read the description first. What a surprise - first anxiety, then opening, then magic. In the end I surprised myself. Like others, I discovered you during quarantine, and like others I started out shaky, out of shape, breathless when during every inhale and exhale. My resting heartrate was in the 80's. Now I just get breathless toward the end. And my resting heartrate is in the high 60's/low 70's. I can almost put my heels down in downward dog and I don't fall over (as much) during the warrior positions. I can do the planks without having to stop. I feel incredibly emotional and empowered as I, in my 50's, am looking toward my first bachelors degree and research graduate schools. I know we are coming home, but I do feel transformed - my eyes are clearer and my heart is wide open. Thank you Adriene and thank you to this community. I will see you tomorrow! Sending so much love and light.

30 incredible days. It was an emotional experience for me, Adriene. Realizing I was able to follow through and do this 5 days every week for the past 6 weeks. Thank you for this gift! I will forever treasure this moment. You are a God-send.

Yo! Adriene! Words can’t do justice in expressing my gratitude for you and all those involved in making this series. Thank you thank you thank you. You changed my life! I felt like crying at the end. Maybe I will now. And then maybe I’ll keep practicing my new freestyle yoga moves I didn’t know I knew until today. 🙏🏼🥰
Thank you Adrienne ! Thank you for showing me my way back home. ♡

What an amazing journey. The change has been great from where I started to now. I wasn't in the best place mentally when I started and I feel these videos have helped in so many ways. Such a beautiful end to the 30 days. Thank you Adriene for helping me <3

I guess I wasn't open enough for this - it's really hard to follow a sequence in my laptop without the audio guidance, I kept peeking all the time. I imagine if I had done it on my own, it'd have been much more relaxing and fun. It was a great series with not such a satisfactory finale.

I kinda agree. I come here for a guide because it keeps me motivated to follow the steps and do these poses that I wouldn't know how to do normally. I'm a beginner and I was frustrated getting to the end to find this. This journey has helped with my anxiety but this last session only triggered it. Like I understand that the message is supposed to be "you have it within you" but imagine you went to an in person yoga class and the instructor said nothing and just did yoga in front of you for 40 minutes. Absolutely not lol

Have to agree.  29 awesome sessions and one dud, we have no comfort with our personal yoga vocabularies.  So instead, using the video as a huge crutch, we: hurt one neck constantly looking at the screen, we both completely lost track of our breathing, and both of us generally had a miserable experience.  If Adriene had built us toward a 'make it up yourself' session instead of springing it on us at the end, our results might have been different.
I definitely agree, I enjoyed this series but to end with a 40 minute unguided session where I couldn’t close my eyes because I had to keep looking at what comes next was not satisfactory at all.

You're exactly right! The sequence was not meant for you to follow to the letter, and you are encouraged to "find what feels good" vs "geting it right". You would definitely enjoy it if you went off on your own even if only loosely resembling Adriene's sequence (or not at all). I loved it.

I'm so happy, this is the first Day 30 that I've been able to do alone!!! I remember Day 30 of 30 days of yoga, (it was about 5 years ago!?), I felt so lost not having a video to follow and it was impossible to think up things to do which was disappointing and upsetting. Now I finally relish having freedom to do what I want, this was the perfect end to Home for me.
To anyone who panicked at this - it comes eventually! You can learn the poses but I found it's a totally different ball game being able to read what your body needs that day. I hope this marks the beginning of me doing many practices alone. I think at first I'll still need this video on in the background to help me get ideas when the mind goes blank, but maybe someday I'll be able to just do it me and my mat...
Even though I was able to think of a lovely sequence today I found it hard to be alone with my thoughts without having Adriene to listen to, which I wasn't expecting. I guess it shows I really need to work on the mindfulness and meditative side of yoga now. Excited to continue on my journey until I am a fully independent yogi!
Thank-you so much Adriene! We love you so much too.

I had a moment where i was stood at the top of my mat in mountain pose, I felt lost and totally unsure of what to do next. My mind started to race and worry and it paralysed me even more. It took a little time but using my breath i quieted the mind and slowly embraced the stillness. At that point it all simply became a nourishing and natural part of my flow.
I hope reading this can help someone.
Cosmic love and shiny vibes to you all. x

Thank you for this journey. Very emotional ending.
Love these songs ❤️

Thanks a lot for the great practice and guidance!! What would you recommend as a following step into the world of yoga? The silent practice was helpful, but I want to continue practicing new techniques.

I completed today during lockdown in the UK.I've managed to keep up consistent practice every day and feel great. I promise to myself that I will keep this up when I get back to going out to work. Thank you.

This 30 day challenge took me way longer as I  did it between Latvia and the Netherlands, but it still left the same effect on me, as all 30 day yoga challenges with Adriene do - am I the only one tearing up here and there and always during the last day of practice? I am sososo greatful for this channel and for what you do Adriene  - thank you x 123456789.

Can't believe 30 days have passed.Time flies in no time. Doing yoga in the morning saves me from being alone in a different country. Thank you Adriene and lovely-as-always Benji. Hope you all stay safe n energetic Xxx
Hi everyone! I am a beginner, and just finished this 30 day journey during the lockdown... it really helped me <3 Can someone recommend what videos should I do next?
At the beginning of this video I was scared, but your voice and breathing was all the time with me, guiding me. You have given me so much ❤️Thank you Adriene

I was not expecting to be my own guide for this one, but was pleasantly surprised to find that this was exactly what I needed! My practice looked nothing like Adriene’s except for one point where we were both in the exact same lunge at the same time. But I found what felt good, and good for me was rolling around on the floor in happy baby and even finding myself moving into pigeon. I always thought I needed a teacher or at least a guide for my yoga practice. Today I learned that it all is inside of me, I just needed some help in recognizing that is was there all along. Thank you Adriene!

I don't even know what words to say. I kept telling myself I wished I could do yoga without guidance (as much as I love being guided) and here I am doing yoga without guidance. I just read in the description that it is Day 30 tradition but as this is my first 30 days I was not expecting it. I feel so emotional and compelled to comment and engage with my fellow yogis. I hope you all have a beautiful morning, afternoon or evening. That includes you Adrienne - and thank you. Namaste ♡
We did it!!!! 🙏🏽😊

At the start, when I saw you taking off the mic, I was definitely panicking. "I need a guide!" but then, after a few breaths, I realized, I am my OWN guide!! You were there with me, but I was guiding me. About halfway through I started saying out loud the guiding instructions just to help myself and it was like I became the yoga teacher!! Thank you quarantine and YWA for helping me find what I want to do in life, I think I may have just figured it out!!
I just ended YWA Home 30 day challenge and i have tears in my eyes :') sending love and prayers your way Adriene❤ you're  my teacher and i have utmost regard for you, thanks for this❤

I started back with yoga on this 30 day Home journey in mid-April. My husband of thirty years died unexpectedly on April 24th. He was only 48; our 3 children lost their dad. I was determined to stay on this journey. I wanted to tell you that the last session was cathartic and really made me dig deep within. My first thought was “Noooo I need your voice”. Then you said “you already have the tools”...your encouragement and support lifted me as I cried my way through the yoga session. And I did it. Thank you because I needed to be pushed, I needed to allow myself to let the emotions flow and I needed to be reminded that what I need to survive this is within me. I already have the tools & I will live the best life I can for both of us.
Thank you so much I am  about to cryyyy you re the best xx

I just paired this 30 day journey with my 30 day IVF journey. It made the meds and injections feel like a part of this amazing series. It was wonderful to wake up everyday looking fwd to the journey rather than having fear or resistance to it. I highly recommend this series for those women going through IVF. I modified toward the end, eliminated any twists and tummy time, but was able to complete all the way up to day 29 before the surgical procedure of egg retrieval. I did a modified version of day 29 and 3 hrs later I was ready for egg retrieval. I had to wait 48hrs after procedure to do any yoga so today I am happy to say I just finished day 30!
The IVF process from beginning to end was a welcomed breeze and I owe it to this series. Very grounding and perfect for this time!! Thank you Adriene. I hope we get some viable embryos but even if we don’t, I will forever remember this time fondly with an empowered and grounded feeling of home. 🙏🙏 Namaste everyone. (If anyone would like to chat about IVF I’m here for you. Feel free to DM me anytime!)
~Sara @yosemitesara Instagram and One Straw Farm Life Youtube.
Thank you so much for this Journey Adriene! It's been really good connecting with myself through yoga on these challenging quarentine times. I'll continue practising yoga because i love it. Namasté.

Hi Adriene! I just wanted to thank you for this beautiful journey. I had done yoga many times before but I never did it daily. This truly was a game-changer as I felt all the benefits yoga can offer. I gained physical strength, more flexibility, peace in my mind, and a true connection with my body. I will for sure continue doing yoga daily (or at least many times a week).

as a 19 year old male i always used to read the comments, there was always this comment saying how beautiful that day's session was and how it made them cry, i had never undesrstood that, i used to feel tired or energized but not emotional, i'm actually not an emotional person. But today, oh boy, when i read those last words i cried in a way i've never done before, i felt weird, i cried for like 5 minutes before regaining composture and then i noticed something... i felt... i felt proud of myself, i still do, i feel so proud of what i've just done, 30 days of yoga, i did this for myself, i didn't told anyone and wasn't expecting no one to congratulate me because i didn't did this for nobody else, i did this for myself, when i noticed that, i started crying again, i've never felt this way before, everything i have ever done has been done waiting for someone else's appreciation, this is the first time i have done this completly motivated by self love and self care, and the fact that didn't abandoned it halfway throw, i still cannot believe i have done it and only thinking about it makes me feel weird and i start crying a little bit again.
Adriene, i cannot thank you enough for this, i have never loved myself, i have been through some hard stuff, everyone has, but this gift you gave me is something i'll treasure forever, you showed me a part of myself that i never thought waspossible, i feel complete for the first time in my life, i'm crying while writting this, thank you so much and thank you to everyone that accompanied me during this 30 days, you all are winners, you deserve so much love in your life, this is just the beggining, you'll see.

I rarely post more than a few words on Youtube. But this young lady is certainly worthy of incredible praise. As a middle-aged guy I never considered yoga, as I am more of a rowing guy at the gym, but in lockdown for a few months I found Adriene on Youtube and off I started on my 30 day yoga journey.

Now I must admit, I probably looked ridiculous in my living room on my exercise mat trying to crane my neck to see my tv and wondering how does this lady get into them positions with such ease. But, unperturbed, I ventured on. As I progressed I was amazed at how much I enjoyed it and by day ten I was quoting positions to myself and doing a bit of 'free-styling'. Obviously being middle-aged, I forgot to breathe correctly and was 'out' when Adriene was 'in' and so it went on.

But all that did not matter; this quite beautiful lady, who will never know me, gracefully led me on a 30 day journey that has quite frankly been amazing. I am now a fully fledged and committed yoga starter. Now, I must add that all this was on Youtube and quite free and Adriene should be given some high praise for doing this. So much so that I will be purchasing further sessions, as the 'girl's' got to make a living right.

So before I sign off, regardless of who you are and or where you are from, if you are just passing through, I urge you to give this a go and it might just change your life.

Chris.

Wow, what a curve ball. Finding out this was kind of on our own I didn’t really know how to feel but then the opening played and I was like, “Okay ill just start on my back and sync my breathing”. Then i was like, “Alright, I’ll just do spinal flexions cat/cow into downward facing dog, thats easy to remember”. Then I just went off, on my own, breathing through my movements and really using the vocab we all learnt through the 30 days of our journey, not even really noticing. I just so happen to turn to check what Adriene was doing and it hit me all at once, this feeling that like wow I’m doing this alongside Adriene, I knew I could do it all along, I just had to believe in myself and I just started to cry and cry. Maybe it was the serendipity of the music, or the 30 day journey coming to an end, or everything all at once, I honestly must have cried through my whole practice; tears of happiness and courage, writing this im still tearing up. Thank you so much for bringing a ray of sunshine into our homes for the past month, especially in such crazy times. Please do a 30 day part 2! Lots of ❤️ and take care everyone, we made it🎉🎉🤗
“Lots of love in, lots of love out...” Amazing journey!!
I know exactly how you feel - I've done 30 days of yoga in years past but this one still made me cry buckets through a sense of achievement. Adriene is so bloody awesome!

I’ll def take a look, thanks very much 😊😊👍

When I first heard the intro I was scared.  I've only been doing this thirty days how on earth was I supposed to do it with no guidence?  But once I started I somehow immediatly knew what to do, what I needed. Downward dog was easier than it has ever been and I could breathe deep for the first time in it.  I was able to warrior without needing to hold onto something for balance.  I knew what I needed.  I'm so sad it's over.  It's hard to even think there was a time without yoga. And I'm only 16!!!
Thank you for helping me find myself again <3

day 30 was by far the hardest day yet :D i definitely felt overwhelmed by how long it was and didn't trust myself to do the flow "properly." i missed your voice cracking jokes and giving encouragement during the hard bits, and i wanted to give up. but i finished it. i definitely don't feel an iota stronger than i was on day 1, but i think i walk through life with more full body awareness and forgiveness towards myself, and i cherish that.

Today i’ve finished this 30 day yoga. It gave me confidence and found a new kind of love for myself. Just yesterday I was frustrated because I’ve been trying to lose some weight and my progress was going well until i checked yesterday that I did not have any kind of progress this week. I thought if i continued working hard, i eventually have results. And that thinking made me proud but as i did the last day for this yoga program, i realized that, i may have forgotten my roots and it clouded my perception of what progress it. My last day doing this yoga grounded my feet when I was feeling invincible and I realized my faults and I was happy I did. I am proud to say that I garnered more patience and my understanding of things had been broad. This totally humbled me. Thank you!

Hi Adrienne, this was my first try at yoga and I made it to day 30. I feel defeated and frustrated by this last episode. An extended 40 minute routine of everything we've learned in 15-25 minute routines without any verbal guidance is very difficult. It was very uncomfortable having to look up every 30 seconds to see where you were going. Really disappointing.

My whole family (and our pups) have been doing your 30 day challenge during quarantine and we’ve just loved it. Thank you for your generosity, your playfulness and all around gorgeousness. Lots of love from your Australian fan club xx
Oh my gosh!!!! We did it!
That was a great thirty day session. Loved the longer one on day 30. Will probably repeat day thirty again and again. Yoga session was very doable even for this 64 year old. Well done Adrienne.
Thank you. This cemented my resolve to embrace yoga :)

5 minutes in, I hear my hip crack during a freestyle cat cow which sets off the waterworks, reminded of how much I've learned to listen to my body and connect with the breath all thanks to Adriene's kind and gentle daily home practices. I rose in the dark this morning, it's almost winter. Stoked the ashes in the fire and as rain fell on our tin roof, I loved this morning's flowing 40 minute culmination of the past 30 day journey. I've been practicing yoga on and off for over 20 years but this 'journey home' has me finally REALLY getting it, getting ME! Thank you Adriene, can't wait to explore the rest of the videos you have on offer in the coming weeks and months.

Fist time actually completing a 30 day challange!!!! Dear Adriene, just finished my second round of 30 days of Yoga journey and like first time i got totally emotional, with tears in my eyes, feeling grateful. Thank you for everything you do. I rarely comment on YouTube videos. Adriene. I cried from start to finish of this one. I started this journey in a particular moment of my life and ended it on the day where I needed this THE MOST. It really didn’t end tho. Feels more of a new beginning ❤️ I’m so so so thankful a soul like you shared this with the world. A message that a lot of people are waiting for and you manage to communicate in the most handsome, sweet, mindful manner. Through this journey you make us realize that message is already within us. I love you and again I’m so thankful. You changed my life. Also, when I started crying both my dogs jumped on me to cheer me up and it was so wholesome 😭😭
Thank you Adriene for sharing this journey. It has been a very enjoyable experience. God bless you.

I cannot thank you enough, Adriene. Out of all the challenges that I got constantly bombarded with all over social media during quarantine, this is the only one that I was able to show up to, every single day, without hesitation and without a minute of doubt - and this is something huge coming from someone who was never into yoga, but was mildly interested in it. Thank you for making this practice accessible to everyone. This has become the only part of my day that I genuinely look forward to, and I cannot wait to start your other "journeys" on youtube. Your voice guided me throughout the entire practice today. You were in my mind through it all saying gently that "I am strong" and that I need to "breathe lots of love in and lots of live out" while also reminding me that "I shouldn't take more than what I need". Thank you so much, lots of love to you and Benji.

Thank you so much Adrienne! I’ve been following you for years. Last year was my first 30 day challenge and this year I didn’t think I was gonna do it. But quarantine sure changed that for me. I broke down crying during this practice and for the first time it was a cry full of joy and love. You have no idea how much this means to me. Thank you 💖

Dear Adriene,
Thank you for creating such wonderful yoga sessions! I've been practicing for several years and have not made so much progress in such a relatively short amount of time from the guidance of your videos. I initially was attending in class yoga sessions but due to the coronavirus outbreak I turned to online sessions. I'm grateful I came across your page. After the first session I was hooked! As an intermediate yogi, I enjoyed the pace of the videos, the various modifications offered to intensify or ease the postures, and the manageable sessions for creating a daily practice. I appreciate you for emphasizing the importance of bringing the breath into the practice. I was able to go deeper in my postures which ultimately increased my endurance, strength and flexibility. What I'm most grateful for is the sense of calm I felt as soon as I pushed play and watched your videos. Thank you for sharing your cute puppy Benji in all your videos. He adds the perfect touch, is therapeutic, and promotes connection. From the bottom of my heart thank you for your dedication, efforts and sharing your gift with me and the world. With love,
Dorothy
Thank you Adriene, for giving me a sense of purpose every day for the last month during isolation. What an emotional end to just the beginning! ❤❤

Every day on this COVID19 quarentine, I' ve been awaken with 30 day journey Yoga Home with Adriane. Today was my 30 day!
Is the best that happened to me, she's full of light, inspirational, ...Thanks for being so sweet and gentle.
I must said that I loved the music!! Very emotional. Blessings to you my beautiful.
I follow you from Bolivia, in the heart of South America.

Was excited to start day 30. I couldn't help but smile at the thought of the 30th day. When i heard you say mic will be off, i was thrown off and panicked for a bit. But your gentle reminder to trust that I had the tools to guide me in the practice helped me to rally on.

At some point, though, I think I stopped looking at the screen and just flowed to the way it felt right. And before i knew it, you were done, the music went silent, and i was just about to lie down. 😅 dunno if that was supposed to happen, but i kept going anyway, giggling all the way to the end.

By the time i finished my flow, i sat up to a seat, and lo and behold, my tears decided to chime in and started to flow on its own too. 😅

No words can ever express how much i appreciate your gentleness, and patience all through out. I deeply thank you for allowing me to journey back home and trust myself (unconsciously).

I hope this finds you Adriene, anyways this is my first 30 day journey, I did a triangle and almost cried. Funny feeling when going back into yourself, it’s such a wonderful feeling.
