Vividly imagining it was like walking in the middle of nowhere, you said “here, let me show you” you held my hand, we walked and talked without words, smiles across our faces. Then at a point in time everything in that vast space starting feeling familiar, a kind embrace that I could only have with myself. This was my world within and seeing my realization, you smiled at me ever so gently, let my hand go, and me, now understanding the comfort in my own setting, smiled back at a distance, then turned around, continuing the path within myself as you waved me goodbye.

THANK YOU! This is the first 30 days of yoga I have done and quite possibly the first bit of exercise I have stuck with for 30 days. We always say life is to busy but now in the UK we have been in lockdown for far longer than I can remember (more than 30 days for sure) and its hard to know how to fill the days! But when I do my yoga as I have for 30+ days I feel as though I have achieved something with my day even on and especially on days when I haven't wanted to get out of bed. Living alone and going through a break up while living in lockdown has had its ups and downs. But knowing I have this time 'on the mat' with a friendly, familiar face and Benji has really got my through. There's days where I have a cry on the mat but I always come away smiling, more centred and better able to get on with my day.
You really are giving the world a gift with your talents. Thank you for taking the time to make this series and the many other videos I have watched over the years. Stay well and safe x

And as for Benji, well what a sweetie and reminder of the calming presence dogs bring to everything. Now trying out some of your other videos. Best wishes from London.

This was beautiful. Thank you for this opportunity Adriene! I must admit, when you first said that we were doing our own thing today I was a little skeptical. I nervously giggled for the first three minutes (whilst acknowledging the silliness of that response). I started off with the breathing from the beginning of the Synchronize class, and then fell into the groove and just listened to my body and gave it what it needed today. It became a hip-opening restorative class as I did a 1h15m intermediate vinyasa class yesterday in addition to Day 29 andi was a hurting unit today). I never before would have allowed myself to do a practice on my own, but your gentle push into it helped me to trust myself enough to try it.

I feel like I grew in my yoga journey today. Thank you. ❤
So grateful that you are doing it!!! Lots of love ❤💚🙏

Whoa. I started this journey really hoping but not really believing that I could do it. I was never good at regular exercises. But this became so much more than "exercising". I really tried to get into this headspace, that it's more than poses and how accurately I can do them. Adriene's patient and calm instructions made it all possible even though I'm quite overweight. I learned that my body IS my home. I learned how much I'm really capable of, some of these poses never seemed possible. I came with the single intention: show yourself that you can do this, that you are persistent, reliable. And I am. If I can do this, what else can I do?
Of course it woulnd't be possible without Adriene, to whom I send my most sincere and heartfelt thanks. Your gentle instructions, unwavering faith, your soothing voice coaxing me to just TRY, your belief in me, your thanks at the end of each video - it made me a better person. And I am very grateful for that. Great, now I'm crying :)
I love you 💛
Thank you <3
I'm in lockdown alone in London and just finished day 30. Thank you so much Adriene, you and Benji got me through this sane! It has been like spending time with friends <3

I started doing random morning yoga with Adriene videos the day before we got the news that schools would be closing here in NYC due to Covid. After about 20 days of various videos that got me going and feeling good, I chose this 30 dayHome journey to keep me motivated and connected to yoga. I truly believe that yoga with Adriene has kept me centered and balanced and breathing in a way that I would not be without it during this time. I am a single mom of three young kids- 6 and almost 3 year year old twins. Their other mom is an essential worker so they don't see her as much as they used to and I don't get much of a break from being the sole caregiver, teacher, cook, housekeeper, etc. It's a lot. But I have kept yoga as a daily constant even if it meant in the beginning having crying two year olds hanging off of me because they're not used to not having my full attention. Now they sometimes join me for some parts of the practice, and my 6 yr old will randomly come to me and say, "Hi, I'm Adriene." :-) This has been a wonderful, sometimes emotional, journey. I'm looking forward to choosing my next 30 day journey here. Thank you for you, Adriene. You are a gem. You have become part of my household, and part of what is keeping me sane during this pandemic.

I was so nervous to do this, mostly because I've never been particularly self driven in any kind of physical activity. Even though you kept saying "you've got the tools" I just understood that as "yeah, i understand what she means when she tells me what to do, I don't have to look at the screen." BUT as soon as we started I almost started crying- I was doing it by myself and without really thinking too much about it! I knew when to breath in and out, I knew where to take time to sit in a shape for a while, I knew the pacing I could handle. Thank you so much Adriene <3 I've never felt this sure of my body in my life.
Loved the journey till the last day, sadly felt I couldn’t enjoy and give into the practice bc of constantly having to watch you. Feels a little incomplete.

Thank you SO much Adriene, my roommate and I practiced a "Home" video each day during quarantine, and it helped us establish a routine and structure. We are much more mindful (and flexible!) since we started on Day 1. You are a fantastic teacher, and we can't wait to choose the next playlist in your channel!!
I've just finished this during quarantine, it's been so nice to have something constant in my day to help me relax and have a moment for myself, forgetting about the world outside. Thank you!

Dear Adrienne,
This is the first time I've actually completed one of your 30 days yoga journey and I'm so proud of it, I didn't miss a day and I never realized how much taking care of oneself could be such a bliss. When you said your microphone will be off, I was kind of anxious at first, but once I started grounding through my breath, it all just came along, I barely needed to follow your flow perfectly because I knew somehow where you were heading, but most importantly, I knew where I was heading for the very first time.
Thank you so much for everything, and thank you for being such an incredible teacher and human being ♥️
Wrapping you in love and warmth.
Got to know a lot of yoga postures I didn't know about.

This was quite an emotional ride for me. I really didn't expect this class to be without your vocal guidance, so I definitely panicked at the beginning. I saw the 41 minute length and felt overcome with anxiety and thought maybe I shouldn't do this one. And I found myself looking up to the screen many times just to see where you were... Anyway, about 20 minutes in, I started relaxing. I was still having to glance at the screen which wasn't ideal, but I was more calm about it, and I came into the flow :) When the theme played entirely for the first time during the plank swings we were doing, I cried! I was struggling a bit but I kept going. And when it was finished and I realized you weren't going to talk at the end, and your kind comforting smile appeared, I cried again. So many emotions. Thank you Adriene for this incredibly journey! I want to continue this yoga journey with you! So much love xoxox

I cried at all the same moments you did! The beginning when I found out we wouldn't have Adriene's guidance, again when the HOME theme song came on, and again when Adriene didn't address us at the very end. What an emotional practice. Wow! I have just finished my first ever 30 days of yoga with Adriene (or with anyone for that matter) and what a journey home it’s been! I'm absolutely gutted to say this, but I hated this last day ; as a beginner to yoga I enjoyed this whole journey, and felt like it was doing me so much good during those 29 days, but having no guidance for this one made me feel so inadequate and frustrated with myself that I almost cried, I felt like I messed it all up and couldn't keep up, or make sure to breathe deeply while staying synchronized to the movements, and took zero joy or relaxation in it... I'm really sad that this beautiful journey ends this way, it doesn't really feel like home getting so disappointed with myself after hyping myself up for days and thinking that I could do it... it must have also been a bad day for me, and I was already emotional without adding this stress ! I'll keep on practising with you but I guess I'll always make sure that I'm mentally in a good enough place, and check that it seems doable at my level ! Thank you for everything ❤

My friend and I just completed the 30 Day Journey HOME during lockdown, he’s in New Zealand and I’m in the UK. Neither of us can believe we did it and are now looking forward to continuing our daily yoga practice together, albeit it from afar. Thank you so much for sharing Adriene ♥️

Thank you Dear Adriene! I did it! This 30 day challenge was motivating to my lagging spirits especially during the lockdown in 🇮🇳. I’ve been into yoga the last 20 years, love its calming effect🧘‍♀️💕, but one loses rhythm when you have a lapse. Always done Iyengar in 🇮🇳, then some Ashtanga, Hatha and a fusion in Japan(my hometown). Then, my own self style  when going to the studio became difficult. But my son encouraged me to go onto YouTube and do ‘Yoga with Adriene’. It kept me from slipping...You are an amazing teacher, I admire your flow and soothing messages of loving yourself, and I aim to continue. I seem to get aches here and there (mid 50’s 🤫) and just two days ago, when I raised my legs against the wall to ease my lower back pain and irritating edema that flares up now and then , wow, the results were so good that I look forward to doing this every evening. BTW,  I happen to be drinking a similar yogi tea concoction every evening, and it just affirmed my heart that I was on the right path😊 It has to be Chai every morning and I love to put turmeric and ginger in almost everything! Keep going Adriene, lots of love and stay well🌹
I love you. Thank you so much for your generous
heart. This journey was a big gift for me.

Adriene, I have been homeless for two years. One could say I'd been homeless for much longer on some level but two years ago, I made a conscious decision to forego maintaining a physical "home" to move into a sense of home that did not depend on external conditions. With just a backpack of supplies, I thust myself into a vulnerability that challenged me, moment-by-moment to show up honestly — speaking honestly, listening honestly and living honestly, authentically embodying my core values, principles and wisdom. I leaned into the uncertainty present in every momentary set of circumstances to fully dedicate myself to unearthing the Truth in the heart's center while hitchhiking up and down the West Coast, taking only temporary housing offers and volunteering.

I started Home late, in April, after a short-term housing arrangement turned indetermimable with the pandemic locking down the state. It seemed that I might stay put for a while despite how my heart felt, well, compromised and unheard.

Eventually, I did manage to leave despite the climate and stepped out into an unfamiliar uncertainty.

Just like everyone else, I feel much more vulnerable in the pandemic climate. Moving about has been central to my life as a homeless person for the last 2 years. Unlike most, I don't have a base in which to take shelter for an indeterminate length of time.

And this has been true for these last couple years but now I can't rely on the support of open doors when I have to move on for whatever reason. I feel vulnerable to making unfortunate and possibly unhealthy compromises to remain sheltered - a condition we know is ultimately unstable anyhow.

So my experience and appreciation of instability is deepening. Surely, none of this will last but neither is relief guaranteed. Life may very well continue to present conditions wherein its inherent instability must be faced on increasingly deeper levels, no choice and no escape. That's a frightening prospect but, of course, that way lies surrender and liberation.

I wept throughout this day's practice. It's humbling to see how much work I still have to do to land "home", how my practice has led me here and still I feel frightened, vulnerable and uncertain.

But I know that I see you and I see what you offer; it's not just a way to move that builds physical strength, agility and flexibility — these are just by-products — but rather a way of seeing and allowing ourselves to be seen, by ourselves and each other.

Adriene, I see you and I know you see me. Because it is not my heart and your heart but THE heart which sees vulnerability with tenderness, compassion and unconditional love. This is always a precious, precious blessing; thank you.

I can't know where this next step will land but I remain open and inviting the path to rise up to meet the four corners of this foot. And wherever I have the chance to lie back and sink into the earth, she'll be there to hold me, she'll have my back and together we'll carry me Home.

Blessings, Adriene. May you always have support for your journey Home. May you always return to your heart in gentleness, beathing deep into love. Thank you.

In kindness and care,
Natasha

I think the point of today's practice was to try and improvise a routine of your own. Start with some basic poses sitting down, maybe some standing poses like the lunges and downward dog we did almost every practice, and finish off with your favorite poses to settle down and stretch your back! I think Adriene wasn't meant to be followed all the way through, just served as an inspiration guide where you could look up and work your way to a pose you forgot! I think you should try again with your eyes closed perhaps, and try to do a 10 min yoga of your own! I'm sure you can do that and you shouldn't feel like a failure if you can't do a full 40 min yoga routine! I did 30 mins on my own with just poses I remembered and held some of them for a long time cause it felt right!! Good luck Harriet, I believe in you :)

Was just looking for a longer practice to do and this was perfect. I wasn’t expecting the “no mic” but it was perfect. Thanks for sharing your practice with us so we can grow.

To start another challenge. For me, this series isn't about yoga only.

My dear "humble guide" Adriene, I am so very grateful to have found you!This has been such an amazing experience,and you made such a positive impact on me through the videos, not only physically,but also emotionally and psychologically. I couldn't do it all in 30 days(something flared in my body after day 4,so I had to do it every other day until it healed),but I finished strong (consecutively) on this past week!I remembered your words on making it ours and respecting our body limits,so I wasn't so hard on myself !Here is Day 30,I was anticipating and dreading it at the same time...You opened the video,talking so gently and I started crying! Really?! Lol...You are at fault for being so incredibly down to earth and make us feel like we are bffs,when in reality we have never met.I am calmer,less reactive,breathing better and more centered.Now I want more!Where do I go from here?I do not want to stop! These moments became such a highlight of my day!I am a humble and grateful sister,forever,for getting me to this point!Namaste!
Thank you Adriene 🧘🏼‍♀️
Who else hasn't worked out 30 days in a row before and is feeling amazing after finishing this series? We love you, Adriene! <3

I live in Italy, and I started this at the beginning of quarantine, when I found myself blocked totally alone in my student flat, unable to go back to my home town and my family. More than two months later I've finished it, and this same week, according to the last government regulations, I am finally allowed to get a train to get back to my home safely. So the timing is perfect, and this "journey home" has so many meanings for me now! Thank you so much for this <3

i found myself crying at the 24 minute mark. out of gratitude, out of bliss, out of pure connection with my own mind, body, and breath. when i started this journey, i knew little to nothing about the yoga practice, but day by day, i found myself listening to my body, i found myself putting my breath first, i found myself putting intention behind my movements. seriously, these past 30 days have been one of the best things i've ever done for myself, and it culminated perfectly today with this practice.
throughout the video, i could hear many of the teachings from the previous days cycling through my head, whether it was "observe", "spread your hand across your ribcage as if it were dipped in honey", "halfway lift, your version" or my favorite "belly to cobra or chaturanga to upward facing dog", hahahah. i even said "i am strong" aloud. this was such a beneficial journey for me, and i can see myself coming back to this video in particular and creating my own flow mixed with notes of what is going on on screen to further enrich the practice. i am so so grateful for this, and i found your channel at the perfect time for me. thank you so much, adriene (and benji!!!) <3333

I am 28 years old and was living abroad for the last three years volunteering in the Peace Corps when, seven weeks ago, we got the news that we were all being evacuated to our home residences due to COVID-19. I was distraught mostly because I knew I would be going to my childhood home, not to mention, with no prospects for the future for the first time in my life! A couple weeks after my return to South Carolina a friend sent me "Home" sensing I could use the pick me up. I had never done yoga but I literally had nothing else to do. Here I am 30 days later in the middle of Journey when it hits me that I started and completed "Home" in my childhood bedroom. I'm feeling much better than I was seven weeks ago! I sure did miss your voice today, Adrienne, but I'll get to hear it tomorrow with a new month's practice.
This was truly amazing. Thank you, Adriene for guiding me through this journey.

I feel so accomplished! I stuck with this every day, with and exception here or there. This journey has inspired me to continue to do yoga daily and find the best version of myself. Adrien you inspire me to be better! Thank you for all of your guidance and humor 😊

One of the reasons I love hot yoga so much (and I miss it dearly right now) is that it is the same all the time. Mindful and mindless - can concentrate on my practice. Without watching this video several times before doing it - won't be able to complete it. Kudos to everyone who can.

Wow Adriene. I was emotional from the very beginning but when I heard the Yoga Revolution music, I lost it! Many emotions came up: courage and excitement but also uncertainty and doubt. I tried to notice them all and keep breathing through. I have found Day 30 much more difficult in the past, so I can already see how much I've grown over the past few years. Thank you so much this journey: your channel is a gift and means so very much to me x
Thank you so much Adriene for your Home 30 journey.  I enjoyed day 30, felt like I did well, yes sometimes I had to look up for you but it was a great experience without the guidance......Namaste ❤️🌈
Just want to say thank you 💖

The music was so powerful to me in this flow (I actually used to find the intro a bit too cheesy but how it has changed!) - triggering the daily notion of clicking on YWA, all the different feelings that I've had at the start of a practice - the ups and the downs. But each day being greeted with the intro music and again at the end of my practice, feeling restored, healed and ready for the day. It served as a reminder of the journey we have all been on together. This at home practice, on my matt with Adrienne. Like the millions of others united in their destination but with different paths or meanings. I started practising YWA in 2016. I wasn't sure this feeling could come from a virtual class, but I carry your voice in your head throughout my day beyond my practice; "Set your intention", "Let go of what's not serving you", "where the mind goes, energy flows", "we call this the Texas T"
Thank you Adrienne for bringing in the light. Namaste. 🙏
Does this help loss weight?
Thank you so much Adrienne, when you said, take your microphone off and over to us I just cried. Not sure where that came from. This journey has been amazing, I don't want it to end.

I'm speechless about this 30-day challenge. I've done your videos here & there for the last 8-9 years, but I never did a 30-day challenge. Doing yoga would make all this anger come up for me, as I wasn't able to be still and present with myself. I would hate doing yoga. A year ago I realized that perhaps yoga could be a way for me to cleanse all this anger out, but I wasn't ready yet. I just finished this 30 day challenge and I've never felt so peaceful. It has moved me, challenged me, and cleansed me. Thank you, Adriene. You are such an incredible guide for so many of us. I'm not stopping after 30 days -- bring on 60 days of yoga every day! Namaste❤

I did the Home journey back in January, but for some reason, I forgot about the last video and stopped on day 29.  Nice to be back here to complete this and look forward to new challenges. Thank you and much love

This was an amazing journey! I loved every minute of it. It was wonderful to finish with all of what we learned into one class and brought on quite a few emotions so much love, strength, happiness. Thank you so much Adriene xx

Just finished 30 days and surprised at how emotional I am. Maybe it’s sheltering in place during this pandemic. Maybe it’s just the fact that I birthed a tiny human six months ago and this is the first time I feel stronger. Or...maybe it’s just gratitude for this daily practice, and time taken for myself (which doesn’t happen much these days). With sincerest gratitude - thank you, Adriene ❤️.

Thankyou so much for the 30 day yoga journey. I loved it, it was the first time I have had a daily yoga practise, (admittedly it took me about 35 days), you made it accessible, relaxed, easy and I feel you gave us a perfect grounding and starting place  for continuing yoga. Thankyou for your generosity;, some of us do not have the means to pay for regular classes, esp at this time of lockdown and no paid work. I feel the benefits in my body, in the way I move and in the way I feel connected to my body after just this 30 day course, which is very motivating. Thankyou Adrienne, thankyou to your community, and to Benji for a bit of a laugh, warmth and lightness.

Having done 'Revolution' and 'True', I knew Day 30 was going to be a freestyle practice and I wasn't looking forward to it. Not one bit. But this time was different. I decided to keep my eyes closed and to just go with the flow. And it worked ! I peaked at my screen a few times and was amazed to find myself in (almost) the same posture as Adriene.
This practice was wonderful. I was able to fully commit to the journey for the first time, even if it took me 34 days. I will be back to the mat tomorrow with 'True' which I didn't manage to finish the first time around. Maybe I will complete the practice in 30 days this time. Maybe I won't. And that's OK because Adriene has taught me to keep an open mind and to "find what feels good" :)
Namaste y'all ! Hugs from France 🙏
Thank you, Adriene! I loved how all the 30 days got together in this last practice.
just finished ^^ thank you adriene♡ I'm excited for what to come.
30th consecutive day! Wooo! I'm going to go straight into another 30 day one :)

Adrienne, your channel has shown me the beautiful connection made between earth and body when taking on a yoga practice. Before quarantine, I always thought I would hate yoga because I hate mindfulness. But I came to your channel to find new ways to address my loneliness and anxieties during this time. I found myself bawling like a baby at the end of Day 30 because I found myself in ways I never thought I could. Thank you.

I have to say here out load: I did it! My heart is full  When I remeber my first day saying  to myself, let s give it a try and thinking at the same time no way I shall do this every day for 30 days. I am so not flexible, I get tired just watching. And I did it each day without skipping.. It increased my strength, my balance,  and most of all my piece of mind. The most important thing is that I learned  how to listen to my body... and  the rest will come. And here I am, staying proud. And you know what, my journey have just started<3 Thank you Adrienne

Wow, it's been emotional! It turned into way longer than 30 days but I've loved every second & found myself teary at the end. Thank you for being so lovely & guiding the whole world to inner peace, you & Benji are fabulous x
Thank you Adriene!!!
Who else is crying at the end?
Thank you Adriene! For the dedication and love you've put into this and shared to all of us. Bless you and stay safe <3

Just finished this journey due this global quarantine. This was such an amazing part of my daily life. Thank you Adriene!
Looking forward to start another 30 days with you and yours calendars. Sending so much love!
Thank you Adriene. I did it in the quarantine. It helps me a lot with stress and body strength. You are the best ❤️😊

Whoah like whats with my tears. Amazing experience !
I think the whole point was not to actually copy her, do what you have learnt and do your own routine. Well thats what i did any way and at some points when i looked up I was near enough in the same position.
🙏🏼
Few things are as empowering as being fearless and performing planks with the 'Home' track playing in the background.

Anyone else coupled this with 30Days of Yoga? So so powerful yet gentle and yummy... Thank you Adriene for giving us the chance to practice, learn, discover, evolve... I released so many emotions and negativity during this journey, things that were stuck for so long - still work to do but hey, baby step after baby step right? :) Lots of cries on this last session, I hold your hand during these past month practicing with you, really . You are the only teacher in 3 years that succeeded in having me back on the mat, and for that I am eternally gratefull. From my heart to yours... Lots of love <3

Thank you Adriene for providing this 30-day practice 🙏🏻 . Thank you to me, for committing to this practice 🙏🏻 . Thank you for our community in this time of uncertainty and change. May we all use this time in isolation to journey inward so that when we finally are able to journey outward, we bring real and lasting change for a more peaceful, loving, equitable world. Love to you all ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤎🤍

Dear Adriene and Benjin, you guys, can’t imagine how I feel great after this beautiful and amazing yoga journey, for sure, both of you changed my way to really realize the power of yoga and home. You changed my quarantine. at the beginning of this video, I started to cry, cuz I feel like: “omg, I did it”, I could do it and I’m so happy that you got my back and make me believe that I can also got my own back, thank you so much for this, Adriene, you rock! 💞  sending love from São Paulo, Brazil. 💫 obrigada 💋 🐶  (I’ve just downloaded your app, I’m loooking forward to continue this journey)
This was the most wonderful journey home 💛 namaste 🤎
literally balling my eyes out
Thank you so much for the love and light you have send me with this journey.

I just want to say thank you Adrienne, this series came at the most perfect time.

30 days ago I was 2 weeks into my recovery from a possible covid-19 case, just getting back to work and revising for University exams. My breathing was horrible, I was anxious and quite frankly scared and feeling horrible overall.

30 days later, my breathing has healed up beautifully!! I feel much more calmer and in tune with my body. I have gone from okay let's make an effort to get to the mat, to counting down the minutes to my lunch break just to have this moment of calmness for myself.

And physically, wowza my arms are toned!! I feel like I've just walked out of a spa at the end of each session. Honestly thank you, you'll never know how much you've helped me during these crazy times!!

As possibly many of us, I started my journey home in quarantine. I feel so blessed, grateful and honored to have shared this journey with you, Adriene, and the YWA community - It is truly amazing how much connection I was able to feel during a home alone yoga practice. Adriene, I lack the words to describe how grateful I am to you for sharing your spirit with us. Needless to say, I will continue my journey home with YWA. Thank you so, so much.

On another note: My dog, who is living with my Mum, is called Benji, too. I am not able to see them during these difficult times, but seeing you and your lovely Benji was a daily reminder of the two of them. Although the thought of them being so far away stung each and everyday, it also filled me with love. I saw this as an invitation to send my daily love to Mum and Benji... Breathing lots of love in, and then breathing lots of love out.

Now, dear Adriene, I take a deep breath, and send my love all the way from Germany to your home!
Namaste.

Adriene, I have been doing your videos on and off for about 3 years and this was my first time completing the 30-day journey. I just wanted to let you know that it felt great and I do feel like I've learned a lot and am trying to put some of the elements into practice "off the mat" as you always.  This last video was incredible as well. I could hear your voice in my head giving instructions for every pose that we did dozens of times before and I really enjoyed the music too. Thanks!

Thank you so much for this yoga journey... I couldn't do it in time, so I joined late to this journey, now I've just finished it and I felt sad... Because of the music probabaly, that it won't continue tomorrow... Thank you for all your effort, energy and teaching... Tons of love and hugs...
Could anyone let me know what's the playlist used here?

You told us on day 29 to come with an open mind today and I did, but this sure isn’t what I expected! At first I couldn’t help but laugh nervously and feel a bit lost, but I sat in "a comfortable seat of my choice", and just breathed for a couple minutes until I was calm and confident enough that I could do this on my own.
From then on it went amazingly smooth! I followed my breath, improvised, all the while hearing your voice inside – "lift your left leg up high", "aaand slowly release to center", "belly to cobra, your version", "and straight to downward facing dog", and so on. I peeked at the screen from time to time, for inspiration, but also just to see how you were doing, and it felt like I was practicing together with a friend.


Thanks for this journey, this 30-day program (well, 32, I took a couple days off) was my first time ever doing yoga, but it won’t be the last :)
I am happy and so proud of my self that i did the 30 days of Home!, gracias Adriene!! keep the nice yoga!. btw excellent for quarantine.

It makes me so happy to know I am not the only one balling at the end. Actually started crying when doing the superhero and star pose too. I felt capable. The love I felt from Adriene in this was extraordinary! Thank you for being so real and empowering us.
Thank you. You got my husband doing yoga and you got us through 30 days of lockdown in New Zealand.  You have started us on a yoga journey that we have been putting off for a long time. Loving it.

Just finished the last day of home yoga, it has been a fun experience during this quarantine time especially since this is my first time taking yoga this seriously. Definitely appreciate everyone that recommended this to me! 🥰
Thank you for this series I loved it! I grew in immense ways with this practice since day 1 <3

Hey Adriene, I just finished home and I'm very grateful for you and myself for showing up. Thank you for all te love you put into it. It brought me calmness and power and kindness to myself. With love, Esther

Hello everybody!

However for this one I struggled quite a bit I don't why :/ but it was still soooo fruitfull and I 'm gonna continue!💚

I just wanted to say thank you for this journey. I got really emotional at the end, I didn't expect it. I started one month ago thanks to a friend, after a couple of days I felt weird but I decided to go on - in this period I feel lost and I needed a daily commitment. And... after a week this was "my appointment", it became my thing. I discovered so much about myself, what I am capable of, what I can commit to... this has been really important. And you are super sweet and helpful. I'll keep practicing with you. Kisses from Italy!
Today I finished my 30 Day Home Yoga Practice during Quarantine.. I'm very proud of myself and thankful for your lessons, Adriane.

I don't even know how to express how precious this 'Home' journey was for me - I started 30 days ago, bored with isolation, tired of the lockdown situation, feeling pretty down about sitting home alone for weeks. It took me 2 or 3 days to notice the small changes first, then the bigger ones. After a week I have somehow switched into the 'positive mode' and I have stayed there. I've noticed big changes in the body and huge changes in the mind. And I'm sure that all the credits for that go to 'Home | 30 days of Yoga'. And the end of 'Home | 30 days of Yoga' is not an 'end' at all - I believe it's just a beginning. Thank you, Adriene 💗

Thank you so much Adriene! Like many here, I did this during lockdown, and this yoga journey has infused this time with mindfulness, compassion and 'yumminess'! Like a delicious cup of herbal tea. The lessons have spread way beyond the mat (which I guess in this analogy is the teabag?!) I seem to be a bit behind most people who've done this but if anyone's finishing home at a later date, hey! Lovely to practice with you (across space and time! Whooooa.) PS Adriene I enjoyed your theatre references! Fun fact: in the UK we call zip zap zop 'zip zap boing'.
Started in January and now I’m here!
Can't wait for the next 30 day journey. Btw Adriene, your glutes are poppin' in this one.

Day 30 in the books and I feel AMAZING!!  "Home" could not have been more perfect.   ~ Such a peaceful, forgiving, effective series.   THANK YOU, Adriene!   I don't want to stop!!   Just these 30 days have made me feel SO much better and had me doing things I didn't think I could do!  Is there another series that progresses from here?
Thank you so much for all who is with we all over the world and taking your time to finish this 30 days yoga Journey. Especially thanks to Adriene for this wonderful 30 days

I'm doing this along with the 30 day yoga moment from yoga with Kassandra and i feel like I'm re-descovering myself in a way if that makes sense....I'm feeling more mindful more happy more energetic  all bcz of your yoga practices thanks alot ❤️

At the begining i thought how i dont like it, because i have to look at you all the time, I cannot go into the flow.. but then it was beautiful, and at the end- so emotional. Thank you for everything that you do 🙏🏼❤️
It took me three times of going through the whole 30day journey before I felt ready for this one. Thanks, Adriene!

I finished this 30 day yoga journey today! I promised myself that I shall finish what I start this year, and I am very proud of myself for showing up everyday, and like you said, showing up is the hardest part :))) Namaste

Thank you Adriene!
his journey made me fall in love with yoga. It became part of my daily routine and my favourite me time-moment of each day. I was so surprised and proud of myself during this last session that, after this 30-day journey, I'm perfectly able to create my own flow, just letting my body decide how to move and what to do, just letting it happen and enjoying all the movements, really feeling it. The tears rolled over my face for 40 minutes. I'm so gratefull for you for being my guide, and gratefull and proud on my own ability to just flow and let my body go.
Warm regards from Belgium!
I made it! 30 days of yoga and it was incredible! Thank you Adriene <3

I began my journey during quarantine as well. I live alone in my condo and just before the quarantine, my ex and I broke up. I have spent so many days crying on my mat as I force myself to go day by day. This last day was even more emotional as it was the end. I trust you but can I really begin to trust myself now? Thank you for all that emotinal release and for giving me the strength to find home in myself.

Took me a few extra days to finish but I would like to say thank you for teaching me to show up. I now understand what it means. Like many other people, I felt a bit insecure at the end and I thought I needed more coaching but a few minutes in I just did the best I could remember. At some point, I have noticed how some moves are now so much easier to perform, how I can hold a pose longer and how I do not rely only on Adriene's voice. I also remember to breathe, to relax my shoulders and acknowledging my thoughts and letting them go. To all of you on this journey - congrats, you have done great! To myself: pat pat. And to Adriene - thank you from the bottom of my broken heart.

a big thank you from Berlin, Adriene. Going on a journey with a stranger for 30 days could have been exhausting, but with you I really enjoyed it. Not esoteric, but empathetic. Not loud, not too quiet. Not lame, not too fast. Not a pretentious animal lady, but a woman who I, for my part, find great. A person with whom one can imagine sitting in a café and having fun all day. Thank you for the journey together, which for me has definitely only just begun! Tati

🔮This last session was like a present for me.
l even felt so emotional something in me that l couldn't describe.
lt was the best decision ever l took this course during my quarantine.
With your kind words, guidance l found my inner peace and could spend productive days.
lt was my pleasure to follow the journey with you and thank you for giving me the energy, brave, and positivity.
l realized, what a brilliant life l am living right now. 

Thanks to you and Benji. l wish you the blessing days!💝🐾

Can hardly believe our journey has ended (or just begun)! I was feeling deeply critical of myself leading up to today because I didn't manage to finish the journey without skipping some days, confirming my struggles with following through. I am so glad that I took up your invitation to trust our inner guides today, as I closed my eyes almost the entire time and finally found that my body was learning from our practice all along. Even though I kept tumbling while attempting crow, your voice emerged to say, "I got you", and I felt safe even though fragile. As I slowly pulled my thumbs up to my third eye with my back turned to the screen, the closing music started getting louder and I realized we were finishing synchronously. I looked back and saw you bowing and started weeping. Thank you Adriene, for helping me be with my body after a lifetime of running away from it, for guiding me to my own inner guide, for trusting that we already have what we need to heal.

Thank you so much Adriene. I just finished your 30 day challenge. The symbolism behind all this, with your words and how it made me feel, I am simply speechless. This last day made me so incredibly emotional! I felt such gratitude, reaching my hands towards the sky, it actually made me cry. Reading all these comments makes me realise I wasn't the only one. Quarantine ends over the entire world, starting slowly from tomorrow it seems, which made this last practice even more beautiful. A new beginning. Ending with a beautiful quote. This challenge was also my first dip in yoga! And I got so surprised along the way how much I enjoyed it. I have been in bodybuilding for 17 years, I slowly introduced Pilates a few years back, but there is something so absolutely wonderful and intimate about Yoga. Also, these last 30 days made both an old wrist and elbow injury completely dissapear! So again, from the bottom of my heart, thank you so much.
these were the best 30 days in a long time, thank you 💚

This journey started 30 days ago, and I want to go on with it!! I felt I had been through ebery movement, and I felt the flow and the sound of my breath. Thank you so much for this journey! Greetings from Argentina :)
finished the journey home on my birthday, during self-quarantine. this was such a meaningful journey. thank you, Adriene!

Thank you so much for accompanying me during this month. Some days were harder than others but I always left the mat with this sense of accomplishment and fulfillment I can’t explain. I panicked during the first 2 minutes of this practice but by the end it felt so liberating. I got very emotional, letting my emotions flow and tears fall as I felt your guide from afar but right there with me. So thank you so much for everything you give. This journey has been an absolute pleasure (and a surprise of a beginning!).
I am so proud and happy for all us who have made it to Day 30! 🥰🤩

I loved this so much! I am an active recreational tennis player but due to the pandemic haven’t been able to play.  I began this series 30 days ago and can’t believe how good my body feels.  Gone are my usual aches and pains that I’ve always had.  I also feel more “balanced” physically, mentally and spiritually.   Even when I start to play again I will definitely keep up yoga as a daily practice.  You are an inspirational teacher.

To everyone here during quarantine, it is my honor to share this experience with all of you. Thanks to Adrienne's practice, I feel we are not "stuck" at home, we are safe at home, and this past 30 days has been journey inside towards that which is most important, most sacred, and most essential. And even though we are physically apart, we are all still connected. I love you all, and we love you, Adrienne!

Today was my day 30! I cannot tell you how much you have helped me! A month ago I was posting on Instagram saying "I'm losing my mind in this lockdown" and I truly was worried for my mental health. Then I found you! Every day there was a routine I was looking forward to, after the session I'd take a shower and feel like my day had been worthwhile! The fact that I know yoga terms now is beyond belief to me. I talk about downward facing dog or baby cobra and my friends go like wth are you talking about! I am truly grateful for giving me something to do every day during these uncertain times- thank you, from the bottom of my heart 💜

I never thought I would be able to complete a practice without spoken guidance, let alone find it so rewarding. Thank you for a beautiful and truly emotional end to this journey and for bringing us all home.
Thank you for that ❤
Just finished the challenge too! And made my bf and roommate do it too! Thanks Adriene ♥️

WOW. Thank you Adriene. Reading through some of the comments and feel honoured to have been a part of this journey Home, I was so emotional. I feel so grateful that I am able to do class with you. Thank you and, I Love you too x x
Yay!!!!!!! We did it!!!!!!!! <3

Thank you for getting me through April in lockdown!  it took me 32 days as there were a few days didn't manage. But even with the odd break its been a great journey at 'home' with you.  Mind and body feeling good, much need in this strange time with a 13month year old with endless energy! Thanks again to you and Benji too! Going to check out meditation May tomorrow. Namaste xx

I met yoga and I met your beautiful soul during my quarantine with the 30 day home yoga series. And because of you, because of the way you teach, the way you talk and the way you set the things up, i'm hooked to yoga with adriene. My journey to home took a new route, a happy, blessed route. Thank you so much...

Am I the only one who started tearing up at savasana?


This has been the start of what I feel will be a life changing health practice. I've struggled with work stress/anxiety for years, and for the first time in my life I have felt the benefits of yoga for my mind and body. This was such a motivational journey over the last 30 days during this quarantine time. Thank you so much, Adriene. With love from Berlin <3.

I just "finished" the journey Home, stepped on the mat every morning for 30 days.
I never imagined discovering so many things about myself. 
What a way to find out there's never really a finish line. It's like yoga broadens its shoulders for you to lean upon. :)
I documented this last session as a timelapse video, also to have a reminder of taking on this adventure and making it my own.
Thank you so much, Adriene, for always being here!

This has been such an emotional journey "Home". I have cried far too many times than I would like to admit on the way, but all on a journey to self discovery. On day 30, I was finally able to find stillness. It has brought so much physical and emotional strength into my life. I never would have thought 30 days of yoga could have done that. Thank you so, so, very much Adriene, Benji & team, for providing this 30 days and also guiding me to find freedom within myself. Also, my Mum and I live almost 8 hours from each other and we have completed this journey home together. It has brought us the feeling of being closer together. Each time I get on the mat, it is like I am receiving a hug from her even though she is not here. It is such a beautiful and comforting feeling. Thank you again <3 I cannot wait for the next one xo

Thank you Adriene for such an amazing journey Home. I feel so proud of myself because I successfully committed to practising for 30 days in a row. It may seem such a small achievement but isn't. I was an absolute beginner, never practised yoga before and I now feel that the practice has to fit into my daily routine because it makes me feel good. I confess I got a bit emotional at start because I was scared I couldn't do anything without your guiding voice. But then it simply came from within and I follow the guidance of my breath, because it was not a competition, not a race, just return to yourself, to something you are already, regardless of small "mistakes". and I was even more emotional when I realized that I was able to do 3/4 pushups after the plank position, never happened before. Thank you also because this program helped a lot facing the quarantine at home.  I now look forward to continuing the journey !

Thank you Adriene. This 30 day series should have been call "rebirth" for me. Some things very hard came into my life while I was doing this 30 days, but the message this practise have taught me is to never give up. No matter what happen(ed), never give up on myself. Try and try to be my best version. To spread happiness, and be happy. I choose to be happy. No words to express my gratitude towards you and your work. Namaste <3 (from France)

I started "HOME" in Canada and finished it in France where is my true Home. I could'nt imagine how much this journey be true during this incertenty time we are all living. Thank you Adrienne for bringing me Home, I am now ready to be the best part of me.

Wow! I never thought I'd cry in the may. Seening you with Benji made me cry buckets over my darling Collie Max I lost some years ago. Beautiful dogs are more than a blessing, they are a direct gift from God.  Thank you for this I felt strong and vulnerable and happy and sad but that's ok. Love to all and stay safe with you and all those you love. Thank you Adrienne, thank you all.🙏🤗

Thanks so much Adriene for this beautiful journey! That"s the first time I've ever finished a full month of yoga and it not only felt like a really natural thing to do, but also was extra calming and energising at the same time! You're the best!

Wow! Thank you for such a beautiful yoga journey! I just finished home and I got very emotional and teary at the end with the music fading to your theme and that beautiful quote by John O'Donohue. Thank you so much Adriene, this has been incredible. I look forward to starting another journey, or beginning one of your monthly calendars! Namaste ❤️🙏

I cried 3 times durig this video.
I got into college 4 years ago, and was working out twice a day. With all things from college and my personal life, I ended up not doing anything for my body for the last 4 years. I tried going back to the gym several times, home workouts, etc, because I hated my body.
Today, completing this practice I cried because I was giving myself so much love, deep inside I was telling myself "You see? You can do whatever you want. You are amazing. "
I guess I finally found the movement that makes sense for my body, something that besides being challenging, I love to do. During yoga I know there is no right and wrong.


Thank you so much, Adriene, for showing me the way back home.


I will keep up with the next calendars! I love you guys <3


Namaste <3
My friend and I finished the 30 day challenge! Ready for the next challenge!  Love You!  Great Journey ❣️🙏❣️

thank you so much Adriene! Never before have I felt more in touch with my body, uplifted by my mind and in tune with my heart! Also, big congratulations to all out there- we did it !

done...during quarantine.....I made these be the first thing I did each day before I did anything else....found what felt good..... namaste everyone. Be well.

Today is my day 30! I started this and did not miss a day, even though sometimes I did it really late in the evening, I was able to keep this one committment to myself throughout. I have never done any yoga before so I was unsure what to get out of this but I am so thankful for the opportunity to go through this. I was mildly panicking when you said no mic, but I was actually able to follow along and I do feel stronger at a lot of the poses than when I started. Thank you so much!

I just finished and what else can I say other than thank you! Over the past 30 days I feel like I've really reconnected with myself and how I'm feeling, it's been an amazing journey and it's really helped me both physically and mentally. There were days when I felt like I didn't want to do it or I couldn't do it but I managed to click on the videos and just do it and I'm so happy I carried on through cause I feel great for it. Thank you so much, for not only making these great yoga videos but also for helping me and so many others in so many different ways. I can't wait to carry on doing yoga and continue practising,
all the best wishes, lucy x
id: lucy in the sky with music

comment: I have loved this 30 day journey, thank you so much!   Unfortunately, couldn't finish this last one, I felt off balance having to see what you were doing next (without your lovely voice to guide us) but perhaps the idea was to do our own thing?  Can't wait to check out your other videos!

Just finished and I feel so relaxed and accomplished. This journey has made me healthier in mind and body. It has given me a reason to stop what I am doing and connect with myself every single day. My family knows when I say, "I am going to do my yoga" to allow me time to be alone. As a young adult trying to figure out my life during these tough times, I am beyond grateful to have this escape. I'm still learning to give myself permission to let go. Tomorrow, I start "Dedicate" <3
PS. Loved those little moments with Benji. So cute <3
Thank you Adriene for the last 30 days, it has been a wonderful journey with you that left me very tearful throughout the last practice yesterday. Today I feel stronger and calmer within thank you 😊
It was so beautiful month at home. I feel like I'm a wonder woman now :) Thank you Adriene, you're like my flatmate after this 30 days
Today I got super emotional. Even cried a little at the end. Thank you Adriene for this amazing journey!

Thank you so much I've loved my 30 days whoop! I felt fantastic during lockdown because of yoga! I cant believe it! 30 days and I'm done. Its strange how emotional i got at the end. i cried and i cried and i cried. What a beautiful journey to home. Thank you Adriene.

Thank you for this beautiful journey back home Adriene, I cannot say this enough thank you.
Thank you so much! Truly eye opening.

So I started this with only exercise in mind but at the end of the last day I cried. Never thought that those 30 days would be so emotional but they were. Gosh I'm feeling so many things I don't even know what to say, so I'll just say thank you.
Thank you for the journey ❤

That was incredible!
I've never done an unguided practice (without a voice telling me the moves) and the first 10 minutes I was constantly trying to look at my screen to see if I was keeping up with the moves. About 20 minutes in I swear I started hearing your voice saying when to breathe in and out haha and wow by 30 minutes in something must have happened during these 30 days because I swear we got in sync. I would look away from the screen, breathe into the movements and by the time I looked back you were doing the exact same thing! It's like our minds just were connected (as crazy as that sounds).

Thank you for this amazing journey Adriene!!! Looking forward to so much more and this has given me so much more confidence to create my own fulfilling practices when I don't have access to internet or devices to play these videos. Much love and gratitude xx

I finished the journey home yesterday and it was the best zen of my life. I’m going to retake this journey this month!

Also, is there a playlist of songs used in this video? so good, so relaxing, so inspiring!

I am almost finished the Home series.  I am seeing that my balance is getting better.  I want to improve on this and lose weight what would you recommend next.  I want something that is maximum 40 mins long.
WOW! I was expecting to peak at you the whole time, but I ended up doing my own yoga flow. Thank you for giving me the tools to feel confident and capable in my own practice. <3
I started this journey 30 days ago, during Quarantine. The last lesson is absoluting the best. I loved the choice not to talk and the music was so powerful! Thank you Adriene..you gave us a gift <3

Thank you Adriene for leading me through the month of April for 30 days of yoga with you.  In these crazy covid quarantine days, you really helped me deal with life and find my center.  I am now finding other of your videos to continue my yoga journey with you and all your practitioners.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Namaste

Adrien, thank you for this amazing journey together. I learned a lot about myself and I love myself more now. This was unforgettable experience and it will stay with me forever. This incredible feeling of unity made me very emotional - that's what we all need during this challenging time.

Finally finished Home today!!
Thank you 🙏🏻

Thank you, Adriene, for a beautiful 30 day journey. I don’t want it to end.  I’ve done TV yoga for years and although it was wonderful and I learned a lot,  it was always led. I love how you’ve taught me to listen to myself and lead myself. It has been a gift. Thank you.
Thank you Adriane!

for the first time ever I have completed the 30 day challenge with Adriene so feeling absolutely elated. Was feeling a bit emotional before I started Day 30 because I knew this was the last session and was wondering what I'd do next, then when Adriene said she was turning off the mic I felt overwhelmed with emotion. I felt like a baby bird being thrown out of the nest for the first time and not knowing whether I could fly. It was a bit of a nervous first flight but the last 29 days have taken me to this place and I realised I had everything I needed to go solo. I'll be sticking with Day 30 for a while to help me remember all the moves to create my own unique flow. I could have done with a Day 31...Day 30 with the mic on and Day 31 without, just to save me looking up to see what the next move was going to be but I can't thank you enough or recommend this challenge enough. It has got me through lockdown so far. I wish you had a 60 challenge!

I was so overcome with emotion during the entire thing. It was so wonderful to realise I could trust my body to know what to do and to know the prompts and pointers and to flow. Endless gratitude Adriene❤️

Wow, I thought I’d hate this practice without your guidance but I loved it! I expected myself to be trying to follow your every move but I ended up just doing what felt good. It felt wonderful and it was quite fun when I looked up and saw we’d met in the same pose sometimes. I ended up with a really nice flow that was just what I needed, I actually was more in tune with my breath and my body than ever before and I realised I have everything I need already, I don’t necessarily need someone telling me how to move (though sometimes that is wonderful and I wouldn’t be here on my mat without that.) Thank you so much Adrienne for this 30-day journey, I’ve learned and grown so much, my yoga practice will never be the same again - I’m so much more in tune with my body and my breath, I’ve learned so many new flows and poses as well as improved on how I move in familiar ones. This has really helped me through a difficult month in coronavirus lockdown and helped me give structure to my days. Can’t wait to explore more of your channel, though I can see myself coming back and starting this journey all over again from the beginning sometime as I’ve enjoyed it that much and got so much out of it. Lots of love, namaste 💛

Finish yesterday the 30 day Home practice, conscidence or not   the 30 of April in self quarentine, what an amazing moment to do this practice ❤️! I end it with tears of joy❣️ the playlist was really well choose it was a great flow 🤸😍Thank you so much Adriene 🙏 it  great to know you have our back❤️ much love to you...looking forward to start the May meditate calendar...you are amazing  😘
Thanks . Made me cry ❤️

Thank you so much Adriene and Benji <3

Wish you had walked us through this one. I finally got day 30 without any breaks! What should i do now? I want to continue....🤷🏻‍♀️

Thank you Adriene, although I truly don’t know if words can express how I feel. I started this journey on the first of April, thinking it would be a nice way to stretch, breathe, and move. I end feeling stronger, more in control, and more content. I have felt extremely anxious and stressed in quarantine, and your yoga practices have helped me realize that when I am spiraling, a few deep breathes will help me become a little more calm, which can make all the difference. Today, on day 30, I was overwhelmed with feelings of anxiety and helplessness. This practice was exactly what I needed. I was worried about a non-guided practice, but I knew that I had the memory and all of the tools I needed. I now know how much I enjoy yoga, and how it helps me in many ways. I have more confidence in my ability to use how I feel to guide my yoga practice, and I am ever so grateful. I’m very excited to be doing the May yoga calendar, and I cannot wait to see where this journey takes me.
Julia
That was SO beautiful!! 💗😢✨💜 Thank you for these past 30 days of HOME...you are such a delightful human...I appreciate you so much! 😘

I was a little afraid going into this last video of the 30 day journey but I surprised myself so much throughout this session. Everything you taught me flowed out of me with no effort. Thank you for bringing in this confidence in me that I wasn’t aware I even had. 💛

I DID IT!!! oh wow, adriene. gosh. im sure you get told this all the time, but this has changed me in so many ways and i will be forever grateful for you. i have been dealing with a panic disorder since i was a little kid. i was agoraphobic for about two years. at the end of last year, i finally managed to get myself to a therapist. a couple months ago, my therapist actually recommended your channel to me. my self esteem is so low and i had no doubt in my mind that i would give up on this. i put it off for the past couple months because i couldnt deal with the disappointment in failing myself yet again. but look where i am now!! day 30!!!! i had those same doubts and fears when you said you were going to be taking off your microphone. i thought that was crazy and i couldnt do it with no guidance. but i reminded myself that i had those same fears going in to day one and i thought to myself "if you can start, you can finish." and let me just say, that was the fastest 40 minutes of my life. i feel so strong. i cant remember the last time i felt physically AND emotionally strong. these past 30 days have sparked a hope that i thought i had lost forever. i am more than grateful for you and your words and your teaching. thank you, adriene. you have a very special place in my heart.
I did it! What a great experience. I'm sad its over... so Day 1 starts tomorrow again. Thank you Adriene!

Just finished the journey home today and wow. I really never thought that I would stick to all 30 days, but this has honestly been the highlight of every single day since I began this in quarantine. Thank you for being so kind and accepting in every single video and encouraging me to be kinder to myself. And thank you for making it so easy to fall in love with yoga as I have always been the person who felt like they were too busy or would make some other excuse. Your messages throughout this journey has resonated with me a lot, and I have definitely grown mentally, physically, and spiritually (although not every day was a walk in the park!). I am excited to continue my yoga journey, thank you Adriene!

Gracias eternas, dear Adriene! Your kindness, profesionality and profundidad (i don't know how is it in english) help me a lot to get home when I was lost or just reminds me that i am not alone... more than enough. Love breath to you, Paula.

Thx for the 29 days of guidance. I was extremely frustrated during today's practice because I needed cues. I craned my neck a lot looking at you and was unable to focus on matching my breathing with movement. Not sure what the purpose of the 30th day was...

I’m not crying, you’re crying!😭

I finished this in a month and a half. I’m glad I did it. Thank you Adriene for helping me find my way home.

Due to a running injury, I turned to yoga.This 30 day journey healed me in more ways than one. Thank you

JUST FINISHED A SECOND GO AROUND! !I never thought I would be "A Yoga Guy"... In December of 2019 I did my first couple YWA sessions (and first ever real yoga sessions for me). I found YWA looking for videos geared towards back and neck pain as I am a graphic designer/single dad and spend most of the day at my desk or chasing around a toddler. I continued these sessions through January and decided to take on the Journey Home for the month of February. In conjunction with a few lifestyle changes, I lost 12 pounds!! I was so happy! What was better yet, my neck and back pain were going away. March was more of an every-other-day yoga practice kind of month and my weight stayed about the same. So in April, especially with the quarantine going on, I decided to take on the challenge for a second time. I'm thrilled to say I lost another 8 pounds, making it an even 20!!!! Not only that, but to see the improvement in my flexibility and strength in that time frame was awesome! So I've decided to do another challenge for next month but will take on one of your other sessions (any recommendations?). I honestly haven't felt so good in years (both physically and mentally).Thank you so much Adrienne, for helping me make this life changing journey. Yoga With Adriene gets 5 Stars All the Way!!!
Adriene I love you, but this was really frustrating
Thank you so much 🙏🏾

Dropped out after 17 minutes. Too hard to follow without audio cues. I prefer audio so I didn't  need to look up. Felt more frustrated than nourished. Finished on April 30 during safer-at-home period of COVID-19.

It was so great! At first, I thought that I could hardly work out for 40 minutes, and most likely I would skip the part. But I got so much pleasure doing it. It was so easy, harmonious and natural, I did everything without difficulty, enjoying every movement and sigh. Thank you so much Adriene! And thanks to everyone who was here with me in quarantine, and to those who were here at any other time. I read the comments after under each video and I am glad that there are so many people here doing and feeling it together at the same time being in all parts of the world! With love, from Moscow!

This was such a perfect culmination of 30 day journey! I’m proud of myself for stepping on to the mat everyday even if it was at 9pm. What a wonderful journey of self-care! Thank you, Adrienne, for being my beautiful guide!

I don't know if I was meant to follow with what you did in the video. I didn't at all - totally freestyled. At one point I looked up from extended child's pose to see you in star pose and thought, "Well, I hope we're meant to do our own thing, cause I sure am!"

Also, having a cat weave about your legs is really motivation to come down from one leg balances gently

Loved the journey. Did am st every day consecutively. This last one was a struggle though. I am visually impaired so I had trouble without Adrian's narration. Luckily my roommates have been doing the yga with me so they narrated. But this video should be more accessible for everyone

Today was a thought day, even if I'm not able to understand, explain exactly why. I empetied a whole box of candies thought. Eating anxionsly without stopping. Thank you Adriene <3 It was magical. I cried at the end and I thought it was impossible. Once again: I did it. We just have to remember ourself to be brave, more often. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

I am so very thankful for your yoga channel, the mood you set, the instruction you give, and the structure you provide.  To strengthen my core and improve lower back pain, I have tried weights and physical therapy with no noticeable difference; however, practicing your 30 day yoga program has made my core significantly stronger.   Through this program, I have learned how to use correct posture and feel those abdominal muscles the protect my lower back.  I am just completing HOME - 30 Day Journey for the second time, and now I have improved strength in my upper chest and arms.  Thank you again.  I look forward to continuing Yoga With Adrienne.

Just completed the 30 day Journey Home, absolutely loved it! It challenged me and pushed me beyond what I thought I could achieve after having a baby! Thank you Adrienne 🙏 looking forward to continuing your home videos 😀

Absolutely amazing! Thank you for this incredible journey you are so inspiring ! The best yoga experience ever

Wow, I'm so emotional right now sniff, sniff This 30-day journey Home has taught me so much about myself and about yoga. I enjoyed every practice and never wanted to miss a day! This last one was particularly challenging. I did my own thing and then looked to Adriene for guidance, and found I was often in sync with her. I will take what I've learned and work on trusting myself more. And I'll continue meeting Adriene on the mat every day!
Thank you for this beautiful and delightful journey! Lots of love from Italy  <3
Thanks for the beautiful 30 day flow! I enjoyed it very much! Lots of Love <3

I found this really hard and I’m just a little deflated right now. I could do it by myself for around 18 minutes but I had to skip to the end and feel like a failure. I find it too difficult to do this unguided. Feel like I’ve let down the whole journey 😔
I struggled to follow aswell without the mic but just keep repeating the video until you feel confortable. Don't give up. Youve come this far...you are not a failure x
Simple, take a break and finish the other half, which is actually a lot of cool down.  Stay positive - you made it through the hard part.
I have tried for years to complete a whole 30 days. It took quarantine to make it a success for me. Thank you for making my home a little less scary for me. Namaste. 💕

Just finished my 30th day, body feels stronger and more limber. Daily meditation practice that comes with it has been really useful for staying grounded during these times. Something that would have made this final practice feel like a better 'sendoff' would have been if it were verbal only (very basic, minimal instruction) and no video.


Craning my neck out of line with my spine to see the video for the visual queue made me feel frustrated, because I was constantly reacting and playing catch up rather than anticipating how I'm going to transition into the next position. Wasn't able to sink in and enjoy the juicy parts either because I had to keep an eye on the screen. Hard to turn inward with this format of video.


That said, this series is awesome and I've recommended it to many friends.Adriene is a wonderful teacher, I love her philosophy of self-compassion and grace, "finding what feels good" makes this practice easier to stick with. Her pacing is perfect and her sense of humor makes me feel at ease. I look forward to doing another series and using her other videos for my home practice!

Thank you, Adriene. 30 days of Home during the past 30 days of lockdown. Tomorrow morning I can walk for exercise outside my property for the first time since 26 March when the lockdown eases slightly. The daily yoga practice has kept me sane and healthy.

Today's practice has been like a catharsis for me. I was getting more and more emotional as the practice was coming to an end. The whole 40 minutes have been a realization that this 30-day journey has taught me a lot. I never thought I could do a whole practice without a voice guiding me... and I did. And I followed my breath all the time. And it has been amazing. And just when I opened my eyes at the end of the practice, I found you smiling, staring right at me and I started crying like a child. Thank you Adriene. I love you.
I made it, but I do need the sound on so skipping this one and moving on to the next series. Thank you for the journey! 🙏
Day 30 done.  30/30 complete.
"Home" was my anchor during Quarantine... Thanks so much for your light!

Today is April 30th 2020. I just finished Day 30. When you said that you were turning off your microphone I almost had a sense of panic. How will I know what to do? Then a tiny voice inside me told me that I would know the way. As I sat at the beginning and started deepening my breath I realized how much I look outside myself for the answers, how much I still wasn't trusting myself. And as I focused on my breath and began my flow with the music of the class today it's like I knew what I needed to do. I cried at the beginning of this class and the end. AMAZING!!! Thank you Adriene!
Completed this journey under lockdown and really appreciated it Adriene. Feeling emotional too! thank you so much for taking us home xx

Thank you Adriene...stared this journey on April 1 and finished today on April 30.. couldn't believe I worked out continuously for  30 days ,that too sitting at home during this Lockdown...this was only possible because of you...your 30 days of yoga  is awesome..it has been the best part of my day,over the past one month.

Amazing, thank you so much Adriene. It / You made me cry at the end. xD The journey.. the connection.. You're an amazing, generous human being, we are so blessed to have you and your wonderful yoga classes. Thank you, thank you, thank you :) much love and gratitude!

Thank you, Adriene. <3

Just wanted to say THANK YOU.  I never thought I would be saying “I did yoga today” . I came in trying to do something for me, my health, my mind, and my soul. I came out happy, fulfilling, and at the break of tears during this episode. No microphone at the end really wrapped in the journey. ♥️
we did it. yay.
I did it! Took me 34 days to finish, but never thought it would feel so emotional to end this with the bow😌. Thank you Adrienne and Benji 💖
Thank you very much for being here with me, for bringing me home! Thank you from the bottom of my heart, Adriene! Namaste❤️🙏
Where to go from here now? I'm guessing Quarantine will take 30 days more at least

Thank you for such a beautiful month of yoga. I like many in the comments started yoga because I was in self quarantine and couldn’t go to my regular exercise classes. This challenge brought me so much awareness and love for my own body and provided me with a bubble of peace every day to escape the fear and worries I’ve been dragging around. This practice brought me to loving tears once I realized all that I’d learned from you and how much strength I’d gained. Thank you Adriene. Not stopping here, now I think I’m a certified daily yoga addict!

Dearest, darling Adriene, and all of you wonderful humans practicing alongside me, thank you. During this quarantine and uncertain point in my life, where I have completed college but am so unsure of the next steps and am anxious about the pandemic, this practice and reading your comments have been a rock. Before quarantine, I never thought yoga was for me. But I have found so much dang peace moving my body with my breath. How unexpected today's practice was! I had no idea today would be a time for us to try on our own, with Adriene practicing with us. Without Adriene's voice, oh my goodness, my thoughts came rushing in big time! Memories of my childhood washed over me, ideas and goals of setting out to do this practice, a deep longing to feel something meaningful or spiritual, reminders to clear my mind and try and focus on my breath. And, for some reason, I sensed a lot of fear/anxiety within my body, within my mind. I think I just have so many gosh darn hopes and dreams, as all of us humans do :) And I really, really, DEEPLY want to strive to be a certain kind of person--someone who just lights up with kindness for herself and others. Hahahaha anyway, as all of this was rushing through my head, instead of grounding myself to Adriene's voice, I realized I could do the same thing with the music. So I kept my deep breathing, and did the best I could. Had to toss in some yummy hip-openers! And the 40 minutes did fly by--definitely felt more like twenty.


I hope everyone is staying safe and well during this crazy time. Thank you all so much for being here. Thank you Adriene, for making a beautiful way of being/feeling accessible to all.


Thank you, Benji, for being Benji. :)


I am so scared for what is to come, and sad for certain things that have past. But I also know that there is a beauty in the unknown, and so many people are here along this path with me. I wish you all the very very best. Sending love, sending happy vibes, sending well wishes!!! <3
when Benji joined us for some downward facing dog...!!! <3

Thank you for sharing your time and energy with us ❤️ You're such a blessing ✨

I'm grateful that I have you as my guide when I'm returning to everything that I already am 🙏 Namaste 💫

Thanks, Adriene! Thirty days locked down x 30 yoga sessions = no time wasted!
The 30th day was emotional. In the beginning, I wasn't confident that I could follow without your guiding voice on the background, but you were right. Thank you so much for doing this—Lots of lovin'.

It took so much longer than I anticipated to finish this journey, and I think that's telling of a lot of my mentalities and neuroses. Even during this practice, I kept finding myself thinking, how much time is left, what pose do I do, should I be doing what she was doing. But a quiet little Adriene voice in the back of my head said something along the lines of "you're probably thinking, okay I have to do warrior next and *phwoosh * jam into the next pose, but can you find a way to relish in this posture, this moment, right now?" and that was so important to me. I discovered that in yoga, as well as in life, I'm always thinking of what I have to do next, how it needs to be done etc etc, and as such I miss out on so much happening RIGHT NOW. I think that's what my "Home" is. Right now, in this moment. And it's surprisingly harder than I thought to live in the moment..
I thought that by the end of the 30 days (or 4 months in my case) I'd have figured it all out. That I'd be "Home". And as such, I felt a bit of... disappointment at the end of this practice? Because there wasn't any eureka moment, I didn't feel like "ah, I'm home now." But I'm proud, because I know that this 30 day challenge was more like a gateway, and a guide, leading me to the road that would take me home. Tomorrow I'll be attempting to commit to a daily practice, and hopefully as I go, I'll truly be able to find my way back home.
Namaste to everyone who practiced along, wherever you are. And namaste Adriene, thank you for being my guide back home.

The 30th day of yoga with Adriane and she takes the mic off after reminding that all the tools are there, just flow. So many emotions with this. First scared/nervous- I'm not ready. Then moving through it- I got this, I'm awesome at this, I could do this everyday. Then I went through all I thought about but she was still going- I didn't do enough, I should have kept going, I could have got more, I should have breathed more, I should have held it longer. So I did a few more, I watched as she finished and stayed in savasana so I could be reminded of what I could add, and let myself listen to my thoughts as they passed. Then it comes to a close. I realized that if I'm not doing as much as someone else, it makes me feel bad, but I did what I felt and that's good enough. I realized that I did some things imperfect and it made me feel bad, but I did them and I'll improve, so I can let that go and move forward. I realized that meeting myself where I'm at and with empathy will allow me to continue forward.
Merci Adrienne for accompanying me through this quarantine, at least i could follow a program for thirty days, not like the French government.
