Hi Adrienne,
I just finished your Home 30 days journey and I can't tell you how much this meant to me. Two years ago I herniated a disk in my spine and it gave me crippling sciatica- I couldn't run, bend over, or lift things. I went through physical therapy, started doing weight training to strengthen my back. During quarantine I finally have had the time and been feeling healed enough to try out yoga again for the first time in years. This sessions meant the world to me, to come to the end of the 30 days and feel flexible, strong, and anchored in my body in a way I haven't in years. Thank you! At one point during the flow I did a forward fold and grabbed my toes, not to prove anything, but just because it felt good, and it made me tear up because two years ago my doctor told me it was possible I'd never be able to touch my toes again, even with exercise. So, two years post injury I'm getting my Personal Training certification and transitioning into a career in fitness because fitness changed my life and gave me my body back, and this 30 days working through the Home series has felt like another integral and powerful step in my recovery. Blessings, thank you, mwah!
Thank you for this journey

This was the first time for me that I became so one with my own imagination. Everytime I looked up to my ceiling, I saw treetops with their green leaves and a blue sky, everytime we where in mountain pose, I became a mountain and I saw that I was joined with many snowy mountain tops all around, everytime we bend forward to the ground, I saw my own eyes in the reflection of a pool of water. In the end I was laying in a beautiful maddow surrounded by flowers and trees. I could hear my own voice loud and clear telling me 'everything I thought I couldn't not do, I can learn. Everything. I am so much stronger than I think. I actually DO love myself. Thank you to myself, for gifting me this care and movement, and thank you Adrienne'. It was wonderful. I brought nature in my home. Thank you so much Adrienne!!

It made me smile until I saw my own reflection on the screen, it's like I was smiling to myself. And what a wonderful smile it was. I was (and still am) so happy. I burst into tears, tears of joy, pride and love. I couldn't have hoped for a better ending.

It's crazy how much of an impact you've made on my life and the life of others. Dear Adrienne,
I started and ended this practise with tears rolling down my cheeks. I started practising with you in 2017, but could never make it through a whole 30 days of yoga. I've been on and off since then, never feeling like I had the time or mental energy to fully commit to an everyday practise.
I began this yoga journey Home 30 days ago, on the day that New Zealand entered its first day of lockdown. I figured that I would have the time and need the routine, and I was right on both accounts. Although most of my practises ended up being in the wee hours of the morning, I began to treasure the twenty minutes we spent together. You became a beacon of certainty in this time of huge emotional and mental turmoil. You allowed me to take back ownership of my body, kept me moving even on my most difficult of days, and most importantly allowed me to feel truly proud of accomplishing 30 continuous days of yoga.
We are exiting the strictest stage of lockdown at the start of next week, and I can't wait to take your wisdom and daily practise back into the world with me.
Thank you so much for what you do. You are so good at it!!! XXXXXX
Thank you so much Adrienne.   30 days of wonderful mornings.

Dear Adriene,

Honestly, I admit my 30th day practice was not my best practice through out this Home journey. For the first half of the video, somehow I was irked by the abscence of your voice guidance and I couldn't keep my breathing steady. I was frustrated.

I found it really surprising, since I always love your sessions, this was the first! I even paused and tried to assess my feelings. Like, what is going on??

After calming down, I tried to continue the video. Then, throughout the last half, I could feel my 'inner' was stopped. My feeling is not flowing, stagnant. And while doing the movements and listening to the music, I wept. My tears just melted and melted.

I think everybody is trying to adapt during this pandemic, so does myself. And i thought i am doing okay, but clearly I am not. I had a feeling I had numbed myself so I could have my quarantine days at home undisturbed.

But through this 30th day practice, my stagnant feeling started to flow again. I communicated with myself, accepting that I am not okay and so does everyone in this world.

Then, I remembered. Journey home is not always smooth one, and I am gladly accept this with an open heart.

Thank you for this experience, Adriene. May we all accept our feelings, good and bad. Namaste.

I just finished this practice down here in SW Austin, typing from my yoga mat, quarantined at home like the rest of us. Pretty emotional right now -- been a tough 24 hours. My old dog, Henry, hurt his shoulder on a long walk in Slaughter Creek and had to go to the vet yesterday where I couldn't even get out of the car to be with him while they examined him. He's okay, just getting old, they said. But I was reminded kind of crushingly of his mortality, and then of everyone's mortality, this thing we're all thinking about but not really saying or implicating ourselves in. And so, when Benji entered the show today -- his down dog turned into your down dog turned into my down dog -- I just kinda felt it all again. I'm so glad to be home with Henry, so glad that I completed this journey -- I'd never done much yoga before this. A few classes at the gym this winter, but that's about it. I feel more now, I think. This has helped me so much, allowed me access to things I didn't know were there, made me stronger and more vulnerable at the same time. I can't thank you enough. I really mean that. What you do here is such a generosity. You're helping the world so much, and I'm so grateful.

I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for launching this program and for making it free and accesible to everyone! It was a huge help for me and I couldn’t tought of a better way to start introducing yoga into my daily practice! I will do my best to practice yoga everyday since the results that I’ve got during this month we’re truly amazing!! Thank you so much!! I loveee youu!

I started this the day before lockdown and you have become part of my daily morning routine which I have loved!  You and Benji bring calmness and a smile to my face each day.  I am now thinking about what to do next (slightly worried I may lose my focus) .....can you, or others, give me any recommendations about how to continue from here as I really want to continue to develop my practice with you.  Thank you again for bringing so much joy in challenging times.  I recommend you to everyone! Namaste.
I, too, took this journey through the Stay at Home, from the lockdown in Spain, to self-quarantine from my family, then brought it HOME to be with my family ❤️. Thank you for everything! 😊
It took time but home I arrived.Thank you Adriene for taking me on this journey. Lots of love from my heart to yours xx

I have done two of these 30-day challenges (although they take me more than 30 days) and I burst into tears at the end of day 30 both times. Don't know why. I practice on my own all the time, but this feels so special. Thank you, Adriene .
Love you and thank you! Namaste

Hello adriene.  Namaste...I am from india.. our country is in full lockdown.. I came across your 30 days yoga journey.  At home. Just while scrolling through YouTube..  its amazing I just finished 30 days of yoga at home. I am inspired by your words . And a very slow and steady practice which is actually suitable for my body..thanks you.. and do keep posting more and more videos so that the mankind is getting things to trust. Which yoga joins the mankind to trust and be in the present moment. Always. Namaste

I discovered  YWA at the end of the first week of quarantine when I felt completely despondent. It has been my energy and my focus each day, so grateful for your teaching and the opportunity Adriene. Thank you for bringing me Home.
looking forward to join new JOURNEY !

Thank you, Adriene.  Like others, I have charted my Lockdown journey with this yoga practice, and like others, I unexpectedly shed a few tears at the end.  It has given structure to my day, and a sense of achievement.
It was perfect.I enjoy every moment.thank u Adriene
Woo hoo, completed the 30 days of 'Home' while on Quarantine and loved it.  Can anyone recommend which 30 day journey I should do next?

God bless you Adriene, beautiful soul. You are the light of hope, you are support for so many people. For the first time through many years with your lessons I've done it all  - 30 days of yoga in 30 days! I'm so grateful. Mу body and mind are stronger. My soul is more kind and more giving. I stopped eating meat and it came so naturally without any pressure on day 14 return. And your question was definitely a sign - 'What do you want to return to? Healthy eating? ' Thank you for your energy! LOVE!

Thank you thank you thank you. That's all I can say! That John O'Donahue quote at the end was just perfect, and he's one of my favourite poets. I feel like a new journey is about to begin... I've never done 30 days of yoga straight before! Maybe thats a new normal while the rest of the world feels a bit upside down. Thank you Adriene. Nickie (New Zealand)

I will be honest, every time day 30 swings around I find myself lacking the courage (and the perseverance!)  to be alone with myself for whatever amount of time I need. However, this session was different in many ways. I did not have time to practice in the morning, so it was moved to the night. That said, I have not had the pleasure to brave the final day of 30 Days of Yoga, I found the silence to be intimidating. I struggled to be utterly alone with myself, and whenever the final session would swing by, I would just begin a new 30 days of Yoga journey. Yet, I found myself willingly, albeit a bit nervously, participating this time around. I followed you, but I did deviate and included multiple push-ups and intense moments where I found myself pushing myself not under your guidance, but my own. I wept at the end of it, for I truly felt I had found my way home. This quarantine has put my mind in places I did not think it could go, and yet you managed to gently pull me away from the edge and guide me home. Thank you, Adriene. I have been following your practices for nearly a year now, and I found incredible joy and pride when I whispered the names of the poses out of recognition. I cannot thank you enough, you are the universal yogi and have brought immense amounts of peace into my life, Thank you so much. Namaste. 🌱✨
never knew yoga would make me so emotional!!!!!! <3 thank you adriene!!!!

I just completed my 30day yoga journey and all I can say is WOW. I thoroughly enjoyed every single day, every practice on this journey ❤❤ Day 30 was my absolute favorite! I was so emotional at the end. I am truly grateful for this journey. Grateful for you Adriene ❤

Sending you lots of love and gratitude
Xoxo
I completed today :) Feels so amazing!! Thank you so much for the experience Adriene. We did it!

I originally started the 30 days of "the journey home" in January when it first started with my husband, but life got busy and we only made it to day 15. Then everything shut down in March and life's craziness was put on "pause". This pandemic and my yoga practice has reminded me to slow down and appreciate every breathe. I just finished my 30 days (thanks to my husband watching the kiddos while I steal away) with tears in my eyes. It felt so good to reclaim my body and finish something I started. I feel strong and capable. I've come "home" in more ways then one. I've started creating more art again and I feel motivated to keep this energy going! From the bottom of my heart, thank you Adriene for leading this Journey!

I felt really unsupported In this practice and didn’t like the fact that no voice was used, makes it a bit difficult when you are using small devices and having to consistently strain my neck in positions to see what you are doing next, and not being able to follow along correctly is extremely frustrating. I couldn’t relax into it or close my eyes and follow along, which is really disappointing as I had to stop and give up the last day
Thank you is all I can say.

Wow! I’m crying. Full of so much love and joy this was such a journey. I could feel and hear Adriene through the practice. So many emotions. Thank you for all your light and love this was an incredible journey and I’m grateful❤️

Loved doing this! Thank you so much for posting these videos.
Day 30 without spoken guidance was pretty difficult though😅 kept having to twist and lift our heads to see what we were supposed to be doing. Would love a version with some dubbed over spoken guidance!
Gosh that was emotional!
First time in my life I managed to “accomplish” some target fitness-related, and I thank you, Adrienne, for everything! You’re really the best (and yes, quarantine helped)

Just wanted to say a humongous thank you.. I’ve officially been doing YWA for a whole year! I started during the beginning of an internship at an organic farm, seeking some remedy for all the back pain I was developing. Back at the farm again this year and this practice has again become such a healing time for me. I wanted to let you know that during my day of tending to the earth I take comfort in knowing my practice is waiting for me at the end of the day. Thanks for being you Adriene! Xxx
thanks for your journeys :) I started and finished during quarantine and yo gave me many energy!!

Never tried yoga before and I started this journey to give it a try and to see if I'd like it. Today I finished the 30 day practice and I enjoyed and looked with anticipation every single day of it. Thank you for you warm energy Adriene, for your time, for your guidance, for your support! ✨and Benji too haha for being such a cutie. Will continue with your other practices.Sending lots of love to all of you! 🌞
This was such an emotional journey. Thank you Adriene. You changed me.

I did it! This is my second 30-days journey with Adriene. The feeling was overwhelmed in the last sitting position until Adriene ends it. I feel like I listened to my body after so long. Thank you Adriene, lockdown might bring all emotions to us all but I am glad I returned to this again.
xoxo

It took me 2 months to complete this journey. I am so proud of myself. I did panic a bit today though, but then I let the video run and took some breaths in childs pose and met up again in downward facing dog. Thank you Adrienne, from my corner in tiny Denmark.

Dear Adriene, thank you so much for making this Journey possible. Although it took me four months to finish, the journey was incredible. Because of your soothing method of teaching, the classes really felt like I was at home while practicing. Due to this journey, I started to love myself en be true to myself more than ever. Thank you for this incredible gift!
Finished 30 day yoga challenge today... started 30 days ago during quarantine March-April 2020

Wow, amazing to genuinely have felt your warmth and love (and Benji's of course!!) through these 30 days of quarantine so far... and I'm amazed how quickly it's gone, as well as how much I can feel I've progressed! What a wonderful human being (and dog familiar) you are, thank you for all these gifts and sending love, peace, and prosperity to you, Benji, and all my other YWA friends. Totally love you, and am in pure awe and gratitude for this practice, and most important the sense of community, belonging, hope and love that have come along with it... 'thank you' doesn't begin to scratch the surface, but it's all I've got right now. So much love <3 x x x

The last session was so powerful and it made me travel through all this journey. Everyday had something different and new. I am so grateful I could follow you all this 30 days, and GRACIAS for this gift to all of us, staying in our homes but having the chance to enjoy and delight yoga with you. From Argentina with love!
We love the last song!

Finally!!! \o/ Namaste!


(in first 5 min I was closing my eyes and waiting for Adriene voice :P)

I can not thank you enough for what you have done for me Adrienne! Never in my life have I been able to touch my toes and after 30 days of yoga I can touch the floor. You have changed my perspective on things like I could never imagine. I started this during quarantine and it was something I knew I could always come to and always rely on. Thank you for bringing me and my body home. Namaste ❤️

My wife and I just finished this 30 day journey during our self-isolation (our first proper experience with yoga). The last day was pretty tricky as we got used to being guided by your voice and had to keep looking at the screen but overall we learnt alot during these past 30 days and are stronger and enjoyed it. Any suggestions from you or the community on where to go next? Any recommended series to follow now we have finished this?
Thank you for this Adriene. It was such a gift. If I can't leave my home...might as well remember where it is, haha! Love, love love.
Completed my first 30 days yoga with Adriene....feels great. Thank you Adriene for your time and guidance.
Thank you Adriene, we did it

Hi, thank you for these 30 day, defiantly helped during quarantine.  I struggled with the silence and fast forwarded through parts.  I will try again with another 30 days tomorrow. I saw you have TRUE  a few others. I will get better with silence :) Thank you

I decided to just do what felt right for as long as I could without looking up for guidance. I went more than 20 minutes with my 'own flow.' I surprised myself with what I was willing to bring, and how much I've grown in these 34 days. (Yes, that's how long it took me. Congratulations to all of us who have made it this far!

Started and finished my "Home" journey during this quarantine period and it is my first time to consistently practice yoga. Thank you so much for being there, Adriene! Sending lots of love and light to everyone practicing in the YWA community. Hopefully we will all get through this crisis together and continue this wonderful journey. Namaste!
Thank you Adriene over a month now in lock down and through your guidance more flexible 🙏🏽
Thank you so much Adriene for this journey!! It really helped me to start my day calmed even though I am in quarantine.

Finished my journey Home today, it was quite interesting without following the voice but giving "sneak peek" and also only guessing! The happiness when guessing the next move Adriene would do was real haha! Thank you, I want to explore more Yoga now! Not sure what would be the next step, I was thinking to focus on Chakras...

i finished this Journey to Home yoga today, and i gotta say that this has surely had a massive impact on me. i started this Journey along with journaling together to practice self-love and balance in my life. had never done yoga before so never would i ever have thought that these two combined would change me this much! i feel like i have finally found that inner spark that i have in myself and learned how to listen to my heart. as someone struggling with mental illness atm, this yoga Journey really has had a positive impact on me (and reading all of the supportive community messages after every practice in the comments!) Thank you so much Adriene for bringing us back to ourselves aka Home <3 Looking forward to see you all on the mat again <3

Because of coronavirus I had to rent out my new apartment and return temporarily to my old one. I returned  this week and finished the journey, and couldn't ask for a more fitting return Home. Thank you Adriene

Thank you, Adriene. There were so many days that I didn't feel like coming to the mat, but I did. Some days I felt enlightened and had all the warm fuzzy yoga feelings, some days I was frustrated and couldn't wait to be done, some days I cried at the end. But your encouragement and soft voice got me through 30 days (in quarantine, no less). I truly thank you for sharing the gifts that God has given you and that you have clearly worked so hard to cultivate and connect to. You've got a new subscriber out of me! We love you!

This channel has truly changed me. At the end of each practice I feel lighter and my heart gets full of positivity. I can't wait for my next 30 days of Yoga with Adriane. Thank you Adriane for making possible for so many people to feel the power of love through yoga.

To be honest, i got a little emotional at the end. With everything so horrible happening in the world right now, this made me feel more grounded and "at home" more than ever. you are so amazing. i will definitely be starting another 30 day challenge with you. Thank you thank you thank you.
Not a coincidence that I stumbled upon Home at the beginning of our province’s covid lockdown.  What a peaceful and calming nourishment to each day.  Thank you Adriene for this amazing gift.
I loved the music that went with this routine.

Wow what a powerful ending to this series, which might have been the best thing since the quarantine started. Like many others, this 30 day home practice has kept me sane in the confined space located right in the center of an epicenter. Thank you for sharing the positive energy and bringing some peace and love to all of us!
This is my favorite YWA video by FAR! I felt emotional from start to finish & I loved every minute. Adriene thank you so much for all that you do for us! I just love your energy!

I've Just finished the 30 days Home program over 35 days of lock down in France. It has been a very good  experience, i'm very happy that i have been doing it until the end. The 30th days video is amazing, i feel stronger, more aware of my body's capacities and full of positive energy. thanks so much Adriene for making this happen !

Halfway through, I realized it was too difficult for me to watch the screen and copy Adriene's move. I began flowing with the music, really listening to my body and breath, and just going with whatever sequence came up. Two minutes later I was crying. You got me, Adriene. I am home.
I just finished "Home" today. It (and you, Adriene) has been the perfect quarantine companion. Many days, this series was my only constant.

Today I finished this journey and what a journey it has been! I started doing yoga because I was bored for being home all day due to COVID-19 and I thought this would be a nice challenge. I didn't count on yoga being something I looked forward to at the end of each day or something I would continue doing after this challenge was done. But here I am; day 30 of the challenge and so not ready to leave yoga behind.
When I saw that this last video was 41 minutes I almost didn't do it because God I'm tired today, but I sat down on my mat and pressed play. When I heard that you wouldn't guide us like you normally do, I almost stopped this video, cause there was no way I could do yoga alone and just make it all up. But now I was already on the mat, so I didn't feel like giving up already. So I tried. Just doing what felt good. And then all of a sudden the music stopped and I was about to complain that you turned off the music mid video. Until i realized, that the video was done and I had made my own yoga rutine for the last 40 minutes.
Thank you for showing me that I can do this and the hardest part really is showing up <3

Thank you Adriene..I so greatly appreciate your guidance through this journey back home. 💗 It was such a lovely and empowering, enlightening experience.
I have seen such a significant change within myself from the beginning to now. I have continued my practice of consistency, mindfulness, stillness and nurture throughout every day. Thank you.
I am so grateful to have been able to be apart of this with you and so many others by my side.
Namaste x
I got through it, thank you!!! A million likes!

thank you so much!!!:) I finished today, and I your guidance is amazing, I didn't felt the time passing.. that means for me, that I was truly enjoying all process.. thank you for all, you're a great teacher and a beautiful soul. much love

I just finished the 30 day yoga journey while being in quarantine. Thank you for this amazing journey, I learnt a lot and I can't wait to start a new session. It was definitely the perfect time to focus on all those things. Thank you Adriene :) Cheers from France

I"ve been awakened for many years now, recently I started to lose my discipline. During this time of quarantine, I was introduced to your yoga. My words are not enough to say thank you for your gift. Every day I have been breath taken to the wonders of what I have learnt spiritually, reconnecting again with energy and of course feeling like my body has strength again. Thank you again for this gift

Started this during quarantine. It was a great journey. But, unfortunately you didn't say when are you moving or what position to move to in the last video, so I spent all my focus on you, and when are you moving. Today my neck is very sore from trying to see you all the time. I couldn't focus on the movement and my breathing.

Yeah I don’t really get the purpose of this video! Looks like a lot of people enjoyed it but... if I wanted to do an unchoreographed yoga session on my own... I wouldn’t have a video of someone else doing yoga I’m not supposed to follow along with on.
same thing happened with me.  My back strained to look at the screen and catch up.  UGH  but I did her low back video yesterday and I'm feeling a little better.
Thanks so much for this, Adriene. I really appreciate everything that you do ❤
We did it indeed !

For all these years, i’ve lived for someone else. I tried to fit into someone else’s standards, I acted like a liquid that took the shape of others' molds. I tried to be ‘perfect’ for everyone, while forgetting myself. This journey has brought me home. To myself. I finally love and adore myself. And live only for myself while being kind to others. Thank you Adriene, for this incredible journey.
I've completed day 30... now where do I go next?
hell yes quarantine yoga home team! Finished today, beautiful journey have seen so many positive changes in my body <3 thank you adriene <3 <3
id: l u c y h i g h e t

comment: Thank you, Adriene! Thank you, for making me understand what kind of person I want to be. Or, in better words, what kind of person I have to reconnect with within myself because it was already in me. I am moved beyond words and I cannot express the gratitude I feel to have trust myself enough to be part of this journey. Thank you, and thanks to all the people who practised with me, even while being in different parts of the worlds. We are all living and experiencing a crazy moment right now. But, for sure, we are having a good ride! Namaste.
Thank you so much <3 (from France :) )

Thank you Adriene! I started and finished this series during lock-down, it's also the first time I have been consistent with daily yoga. I was initially sceptical about you turning off the mic, but I found my groove and totally enjoyed it. My favourite thing to do post practise was scroll down and read the comments :-)

I loved this course. Thank you so much. I went to your shop to try and buy some merchandise as a way of saying thank you and supporting the work that you do but it was unfortunately closed. Really appreciate your videos. You are a wonderful teacher.

Wow, what a payoff!  Very unexpected yet a perfect practice set to beautiful music.  I quickly veered off on my own journey and finally managed to do crow using all the things we learned along the way.  Like many, I started this during stay-at-home quarantine and finished in about 33 days due to the birth of my son last week!  Thank you, Adrienne, for all that you do.

Wow when I started this journey 30 days ago I was thinking, "Cool, a way to motivate myself to do yoga every day." Now, just having finished this 30th practice, I realize how much I've learned about myself physically, mentally and emotionally over the past month. I always come away from the mat feeling centered and comfortable in my skin. This journey has really kept me calm and true to myself during the quarabtine too! Thank you so much Adriene! Your warmth and genuine love for this community shine through each of your videos!
Thanks a million for these wonderful classes! They helped me a lot during this quarantine. Namaste! <3
Thirty days during lockdown, with no plans to stop. My aim is 365 days plus. Thanks Adriene.

I finished this today during quarantine and I never expected the tears of joy that came in the end. Thank you Adrienne for this magnificent journey. I have learned so much and I am so grateful. I send much love and gratitude from Puerto Rico. Stay safe
This was such a beautiful experience. Thank you!

This journey is already coming to its end. Or it's beginning... It was amazing. Thank you so much Adriene, you made me love yoga even more. Gonna keep practicing with you for sure...❤ Sending you love from France.

did this during quarantine, didn't miss a day as much as i wanted to because it gave me a much needed routine... here i am crying after finishing it. I can't thank you enough, this journey was something that got me through so much anxiety and feeling lost and i genuinely feel like i'm home.

I cannot believe I've made it this far
for real I'm so shocked I really want to cry

And that's it : end of the 30 days yoga journey. I cannot believe i have done it ! I was scared at first to start this journey, today i am felling so well, i am proud of myself and I am stronger everyday. At the start of february i have broken up with my boyfriend it was a really hard but yoga has helped me with all my emotions and with my self-confidence. Today at the end of that practice I almost cried : i was so emotional and so proud of myself. I will for sure continue to practice at least several days in the week. I am so much better in my soul, my head and my body. Thank you so so much Adriene. Lots of love from Switzerland.

Never thought I would make it through 30 days. With the quarantine and all that’s going on, this daily centering and focus on the journey has been a foundation for my days.  Had to say thank you!  I’m looking forward to tomorrow and many more milestones.

Wow - what a wonderful Journey to Home it has been.  The timing was perfect with having to practice social distancing and remaining HOME.  The journey was amazing!!!  I looked forward EVERY morning to seeing you Adriene (and Benji too - he is adorable and added to the calmness with his presence - soo sweet).   Thank you for the gift you have given me - the breathing skills and flexibility I have gained feels so good.  Day 30 was emotional at the end - what a wonderful journey and that theme song gets me every time - especially today.  Take care and thank you.  Namaste  :)

I was a little daunted to begin with and began by trying to follow you, then I decide to listen to my body and find my own journey through this practice. It was the most incredible experience, I felt one with my body and all parts of myself. I lay there at the end beaming from ear to ear with so much pride and joy. Thank you Adrienne. The words at the end summed up this practice for me so completely. Namaste.

I have just finished my 30 day with Adriene. I have been involved in yoga more and more for the last half a year and I feel so much calmer, lighter and peaceful. It is bringing me closer to the state of ananda. Thank you so much dear guide. Love from Uzbekistan.

Just finished the 30 days of Home, and I feel so happy and grateful!
It's a beautiful sunday in Rome and the silent practice felt wonderful.
This was the first commitment I took when the lockdown started, needing to reconnect to body and breath, and also because i began the 30 days many times in the past and never got to the end.
I am so so thrilled that i did it, and it only makes me more excited to continue!
It's so inspiring the love and care you put in the practice.
All the food for thoughts, the kindess in every movement and the quality of presence did open so many doors, like "so this is how i actually feel", "wow, i can do this thing", "oh my god i love how this feels, i want to go this way".
Thank you so so much!

Here is another thank you Adriene for all your channel and this 30 day journey I just completed! I practiced yoga sometimes in the past but I didn’t think this journey would have such an impact on me. The last week was really quite something, and I can’t wait for tomorrow. Much love 💕

Merci beaucoup Adriene (and Benji)!  I have enjoyed this SO much - been doing it with my 20 year old son (who has never done yoga before) during confinement here in France.  Might run through the whole thing again since we have another month to go before restrictions are lifted.  It's really helped to keep a lid on my anxiety during this challenging time.  Thank you so very much.   Sending lots of love your way. <3
Thank you so much ❤🌞

Today I finished this 30 day Yoga Journey. We did this one during lockdown with two of my best friends. In the beginning I did not realize how much this would be rewarding. Thank you so much for everything Adriene. ♥️ I will keep on practicing and improving as you taught us, as well as trying new things (including with your other videos).

Adriene is amazing... She has a way of doing yoga like no other yoga instructor can do online. She helps me avoid depression which is something I can say for sure so thank you Adriene... Also what's that song at around 31:00-31:10

I feel so good. I completed your HOME journey today. You helped me a lot to stay positive and calm during the virus era. Thank you so much Adriene, and I will follow your other 30 day yoga challenges 🙏💕 Namaste
Loved this session, thanks a lot :)
Amazing!! We had a wonderful journey from Argentina. Thank you!!

Oh, I definitely created a beautiful practice of my own. I began with you and suddenly started going with the flow. And a long yummy shawasana... Thank you thank you thank you! These were my first 30 days of unceasing yoga and I want more!
Yes Adriene, I did it! I had to come back to day 30 for a second time, but I finally trusted myself enough to do one yoga class ‘without you’. I feel so proud. Thank you 🙏🏻

It took me until today to do the last session - I did every session in January and then was away for the last day and had some resistance to doing it until now. And wow. It was so gorgeous and just what I needed right now. Adriene you're a gorgeous soul and a gift to all of us. Thank you for all that you do. I'll be following along from now with the monthly calendar and see where I go from there. Thank you so much, xx
I can't believe I finished this. I'm so proud.
Thank you for getting me through the first month of this quarantine. I felt so happy/lucky to get to spend some time with you every day, not to mention the yoga.

This practice could not have been more meaningful and perfect to start just before our home quarantine. Thank you Adriene for carefully guiding us all thru a beautiful, well crafted yoga practice. Feels like this sequence of inspirational sessions were meant to be.

30 days of being quarantined at home and following these videos, I think I have found my "Home". I have always carried it within me and this journey made me realize and appreciate it. Thank you, Adriene, from the bottom of my heart. Day 30 has left me quite emotional, yet calm and blissful.
I hope you could make more videos like this!! This was awesome experience and you inspired me so much. Thank you so so much!

Thank you so much Adriene!! This is my 4th year doing the challenge. Some years I get further than others but this year I finished today!! Took me months longer but I stuck with it and didn't give up. I appreciate your encouragement and wise words! Namaste 🙏🏼

First I want to say Thank You Adriene! At the start of this Shelter in place I said to myself that I want something positive to come out of being stuck in my home. And I feel strong and will definitely continue with yoga and you.
But that being said.... am I the only one who prefers you with mic on? This was the worse day. I actually hurt my back because I had to keep straining to look at the screen. UGH I didn't realize how much I just went off your instruction. I have done yoga for years, so I know the moves, but not knowing what was coming next gave me a lot of frustration. I guess I'm not ready to be HOME alone ;(

This practice has helped me genuinely see the good in what's happening currently. I gained flexibility, I'm breathing deeply and I hear you in my head during my other exercise moments saying "head over heart, heart over pelvis". Thank you I will definitely be continuing with yoga!
When you can't go outside, go inside.

started and just finished in quarantine .. alot of thanks and appreciation to your beautiful effort .. and lots of love from Egypt
the best yoga instructor ever

wow that was a long one haha. Not gonna lie, it took me 3 months to finish this and before I did this one I was achy and in pain due to not being physically active the past few weeks....it was hard not having your voice to guide me. I hope I can do this again with no days off though. I want to experience it the best way possible...and I want to feel strong again. Btw you foresaw the future Adrienne xD everyone’s at HOME. :P
Thank you for this series. phew
~Namaste

Hello Adriene. We feel like we know you now. Our midday guide every day for 30 days to a welcome moment of wellness. You said it - the hardest part is showing up! We (Beth and my daughter Hana) showed up everyday for 30 days.  I welled up emotianolly at the end of the last session. It has been a journey- we both thank you. we will continue.  just one note for me, i would love the music at the end of the segments to last just a little longer so i don't have to move to stop the video - it feels so good to be in shavasana.  Thanks again. - lots of love in, lots of love out.

I would like to thank you, now I feel amazing thanks to you after finishing this 30-day routine during quarantine at home. I got a bit emotional at the end of this 30th day, I wanted it never to end!! See you very soon for a new practice ❤️
Ps: I told my friends to watch your videos and they were definitely convinced too!!
Wow I can't believe I've made it! this one of the best things I've ever committed to! Thank you so much!!!
What a journey! I've started and finished during quarantine and I have to say it was the highlight of my day each day. Thanks Adriene, much love from Morocco <3
I did it. Thak you Adriene. ❤🙏
Thank you for this journey Adriene!
amazing and surprisingly emotional. Adriene , thank you.

Thank you Adrienne for this. You’ve got me through my first 30 days of lockdown and feel blessed in doing this. It’s let me see just how much I can do (always felt slightly worried I’d make a fool of myself in yoga class) and inspired me to continue practicing to make it to the ones that are more challenging! Look forward to seeing you tomorrow (on the screen) to discover all your other practices. Xx
Finished my first consecutive month of yoga of my life! Thank you adriene, thanks to this my quarantine has turned for the better, and like so it will continue

Well, I'm writing a comment for the first time to thank you for this journey. I started it a week before the UK first when into lockdown for C-19 (already had a regular practice and dipped in and out of yours every so often) as I wanted something to help me stay healthy in both body and mind as I dealt with a huge amount of uncertainty, for both myself and my loved ones, of whom I miss dearly. It... truly truly has. I'm finishing this practice stronger, and happier than when I started - despite everything that has happened in that 30 days outside of the mat. I am finishing with tears - mostly of joy and gratitude. And a promise that I will keep coming back, every day, until the end of lockdown and beyond. Thank you for bringing me home, when home wasn't always necessarily where I wanted to be. You have helped, in so many ways Adriene. Thank you.
I look forward to the next journey.
Yours in friendship, RB x

I would like to say a huge thank you, Adrian. This was my first ever 30 day yoga challenge of yours and I thoroughly enjoyed it on every level. My downward dogs are better aligned, my balances last longer and I am stronger!! I thought I'd be the only person still doing this in March/April, but the comments here have proven me wrong. It just goes to show that even when we think we're behind, we're actually right where we should be.

After 29 days in lockdown and 29 days of yoga, I was so excited to do this final practice, but I had to stop a few minutes in. I was experiencing for the last few days terrible chest pain and difficulty breathing due to stress, and I wasn't able to enjoy this last sequence. I was in pain every time I inhaled. I burst into tears on the mat, letting go of all the stress I accumulated since this pandemic crisis began, and had to wait a few days for the pain to leave. I came back to the mat today, did this final practice with a giant smile on my face and a few tears of happiness at the end. I feel so strong and confident. Thank you Adriene and the community for these amazing 30 days of yoga, and thank you for keeping me sane during those difficult times <3 Namaste everyone

I just wanted to say thank you for this excellent 30 day practice.  I have never been able to figure out a practice when doing yoga at home.  I would find myself questioning everything I did.  After this 30 day journey, I just completed my first at home practice where I just did what I knew my body needed.  Nothing more, and nothing less.  I got really scared at first when you said you were taking off the mic and not cuing us into the poses but I just followed my instincts and what I had learned from your previous videos and also stuff that I had learned from previous instructors.  I was crying by the end of the video because I was so thankful that I was able to do a full 35/40 minute practice basically on my own.  Thank you so much for sharing your gift!  You are truly inspirational!!

I can't believe what these 30 days of yoga did for my body and mind, especially my body. I was so stiff and sore on the neck, shoulders, back, you name it. My posture was terrible, I was tired all the time, headaches, etc. My sister lifts weights and she always told me that I should do it too to strengthen my back. She has been doing it for years and she still has occasional back pain. After 30 days of yoga, it's all gone for me... I'm not a spiritual person at all, but you don't have to be to enjoy yoga. I never liked exercising because it always felt like a chore. When I was on the gym for a year I obviously noticed my body changed, fat was gone, muscles were in, but I almost never really felt a big difference. Now I know why. Today I am so aware of my body that I almost FEEL it changing, like on the inside and not just when I look at the mirror. It's honestly amazing and kinda... spiritual?? What is this sorcery, Adriene?? I am not a spiritual person! Am I? One thing I know for sure though: I am never looking back. I finally found a physical activity that makes me feel good and doesn't feel like a chore and I think it has done more for me mentality than I realize. I feel confident enough to make my own yoga flow from now on, but I'll come back to your channel always and do your other videos too (and new ones!). I just did this video but I'm already missing your company, haha.  You have a subscriber for life. Continue being the beautiful human being that you are. Kisses from Portugal.
Thank you for this series! Making it till the end made me tear up. I feel like I learned so much!

So it has taken me 3 months to complete this, but after finally finishing I am proud of myself! I was a bit apprehensive about day 30, but pleased to say that I really got into the "zone" and was able to "find what feels good", using you as a guide but also doing my own thing - I even managed to do crow practice and hold it for at least 5 seconds!! :D Thank you so much Adriene for sharing your practices with us, I am very grateful to have you and Benji in my life! Namaste :) <3
I finished!! :)
Beautiful day 30. Thank you Adriene.

This may be an unpopular opinion but I highly dislike that you took off the sound, I couldn't finish the video because it wasn't even relaxing for me.

My neck and back were hurting more because I was constantly having to look forward during every pose to see what you were doing. My muscles in my abdomen and leg were twisted the wrong way because I was unsure of which way to turn without guidance and how to do certain moves without looking up. The constant looking up and doing the move wrong without guidance ruined my whole calm and made me anxious.

I thought maybe the point is to make up our own flow rather than follow yours then why include the video at all then? Why not just tell us to practice on our own or put a calming scene? Because I tried doing my own thing but then would get anxiety see you in a completely different motion. I'm here to be taught yoga, if I wanted to create my own flow I wouldn't even be here.

I couldn't finish it because I decided finally to just not try to follow you at all but then I run out of moves to do...I am a beginner so I can do a couple basic things but expecting me to do 40 whole minutes of freestyle is a bit much in my opinion :/

I think for my 30th day I will just go follow one of your videos on yoga for neck or back pain and do that instead now that those areas are screwed up from this. That's what feels good for me. To each their own.

fuhbloom i feel the same way as the original commenter. I can maybe freestyle for 5-10 minutes but then I get frustrated. That’s just where/how I am. I typically skip the last video in each journey because I don’t like them.

If you followed Adriene for 29 videos then you have the basic moves to make your own flow or at least enough that a slight glimpse to the video would instantly remind you what move that is and what comes next. The point of the video is that you didn't have to follow it to the letter. Even if you did a different version of this or that, it's all good! But well, yes, each to their own. Each person is different, maybe you can't do these things without looking for guidance, but considering you went through all 30 days, this video wasn't that hard to follow if you wanted to follow it. And you should know what type of teacher Adriene is by now. She highly encourages people to do their own thing, freestyle and "find what feels good" for them. She likes to play around and have fun and yoga isn't a strict physical activity for her that has to be done this or that way. There are plenty of other Yoga videos out there where it's all business, straight to the point, maybe those would suit you better.
I got emotional towards the end knowing that this was the last of the 30 days home yoga 'journey'. so much love to you Adriene x
so much gratitude for you, adriene! 🤍

Adriene, love you and this series! Love everything you do , but just some feedback to let you know I found this more distracting than peaceful.

Well, here I am...stuck at home, but also finally at home. I started on January 1st and didn't know how or if I would finish, but today I proved to myself that I could do it. Today's practice, itself, was a journey--I didn't know if I would be good enough to lead myself, remember enough to come up with things to do, and then somewhere along the way I just felt it. I ended up doing a crow pose because that was what my body wanted. And just as I got ready to dip my first boat pose because I was feeling it, Adriene did the same thing, and I smiled! Thank you, Adriene, and YWA community, for the unconditional support and good vibes. Namaste.

It's April 6th, quarantine in Moscow and the first day of a new cycle. I am achey, irritated, low, generally upset and have a mild cold.
I was so angry at myself for feeling this way, as I've been looking forward to this practice immensely. I felt like I failed, ruined everything, succumbed to despair and disappointed the very essence of Yoga with Adriene. Breath lots of love in sounded like a cruel joke today (especially considering the blocked nose). I wanted to postpone until I felt better.
But I showed up. And decided to allow myself to just BE. With who I am today. And move in a way that feels good today.
I cried through most of the practice and did the silliest moves, but my Half Moon was the best it's ever been. And then I look up - and Adriene is doing it, too. And I remember that we all have days like this, every single one of us. It's universal.
So why not embrace it? Sometimes this is where my head is, and it’s a part of my Home. And it’s also good, because in it’s own twisted, neurotic, touchy way it want the best for me, tries to protect me.
I am my Home.
And I am ready to face the day with tenderness and love - for myself.
Adriene, from the bottom of my heart, thank you. You have changed my life for the better.

Thank you so much for a beautiful journey, your generosity is incredible. Just some gentle feedback (and I can see that I am in the minority in not having enjoyed this class), I wear glasses to read and see screens. If Adriene is speaking, I can make out what is going on without my glasses but if not I have to wear them, which meant that they were in the way and kept falling off. So I didn't finish. I will use another session to end my 30 day journey. With love and deep gratitude.

I'm not going to lie- I thought about stopping this video about 4 times during practice today and just ending it there.
I thought 40 min, all this flow, choreographed, this is too much, too hard.
I got into a real wave of depression all day and honestly didn't even expect to be doing this last video. I looked through some pictures that made me laugh, got a glass of water, and turned it on.


When these thoughts came up I had to remind myself what I've learned these past thirty days - that I don't have to compare myself to anyone, that I can find what feels good. For me that meant some extra childs poses for breaks and chaturagas because I really enjoyed how my arms muscles felt in them.


This past thirty days has not been easy. And I'll admit that I'm not like OH MY GOD THIS JOURNEY WAS AWESOME AND WONDERFUL AND IM HOOKED ON YOGA. A lot of times, it was super hard. My mind would wander, I would get mad at myself for not wanting to work hard enough, yadda yadda. But it's not how easy it is that gives it value. It's how strong I've become in the process, how fluid my movements are, are clear my mind can be. It's about regaining control over who I am and who I want to be, while cherishing what is. This journey has given me confidence, strength, and power. And that's why it has meant so much to me.

I came into Day 30 very emotionally heightened and feeling like all I needed was to be told what to do so I was pretty upset and ready to look for another video when I learned this final practice was the exact opposite of that. Dear Adrienne. Thank you. Thank you with all my heart. I did this yoga journey in January-February, and then life overtook me and there was three sessions I didn't finish. Until a few days ago, after two weeks of confinement, I came back and wanted to finish. I find magical that the days aligned so beautifully. This morning, I decided to give myself silence and no outside noise in the morning in no form at all (whether it be a book, a podcast, a text message or anything) and I was delighted to find out that the practice was in silence as well. It was my favourite. And then at the end, deep sobs came out. Because, today was supposed to be the day where I moved to a new city and finally start building a new life. I obviously cannot due to the circumstances. This session allowed me to live this emotion, to be disappointed, but to also know that it will be ok and that home is within. So thank you, I appreciate you and what you do. It is truly magical. Best of luck in these times.

Hi Adriene,


I really hope you get to read this. I am a person who struggled severely with an eating disorder. I entered residential treatment in October of 2019 and am currently in an IOP program. Your videos were recommended to me by one of the therapists, and I am so glad she told me about you. I have a history of over exercise to the point of destroying my body. You are helping me to cultivate a better relationship with my body, and to find a way to move that empowers rather than tears down. Each day along my journey with you, I'm learning how to move mindfully for health, rather than to burn calories or judge/critic my body. You are truly making an impact on my recovery journey, and I couldn't be more grateful for that.

thank you Adrienne. i found you in a very tough part of my life. and you thought me i can find the solution inside. i really felt home this time. it was hard, maybe not in the middle of it but i was inside. sometimes i was just lazy, not strong enough or whatever and missed a video but i always recover it. i completed all the journey. i made it! you thought me its Okay. if i miss some,if i struggle, its okay. if you didn't make me feel like its okay not to be okay sometimes i would never be able to complete the journey. thank you for everything. lots of love in, lots of love out.

Thanks so much Adriene this really helped me destress and open my mind.

I started last year's 30 day journey but didn't stick with it, so this year I committed myself to finishing this one no matter how long it took, no matter how many days I missed. I stuck with it daily until I got sick about halfway through. For a few weeks I couldn't do yoga, and it took me a bit to get back into the daily practice, but I remembered what I had told myself in the beginning and I kept at it. Getting back into it was difficult, because I had lost a lot of the progress I had made, and I was very discouraged. Slowly, I started to see it come back and I realized that I could do this. When you said today that you were taking the microphone off, it terrified me. But I decided to trust in you and myself and it resulted in one of the best practices I've ever had- something I didn't think I was capable of doing for myself. I heard your voice in my head the whole time, reminding me to breathe, to take up space, and to do what feels good. I was surprised at how many times I glanced at the screen and found you in the same position as myself, as well as the amount of times we were doing different things and that I was okay with that. I teared up at the end of this practice today, filled with so many emotions. Thank you, Adriene, for this wonderful gift. I've made yoga a daily part of my life now, and I intend to stick with it as long as I am able. Namaste <3
starkidgranger3eva the same happened to me, I finished today. I hope you are doing well :)
Day 30 was so POWERFUL!!!! Your silence gave me confidence, strength and will power!!  Definitely worth the journey!!!! Looking forward to meeting on the. at tomorrow.   Namaste🙏❤

Oh man, I was so intimidated when you said 'I'll be turning off the microphone now'. I genuinely thought I'd be completely at a loss of what to do and about ten minutes in would already be in corpse pose, thinking I had reached the 40 minutes already. But once I got going, it was actually surprisingly easy to go from one pose to the next, following the kind of flow you have taught us. I peeked at the screen now and again, I'll admit it, but got over not being in the same pose as you like nothing. It was okay. This was my own 40 minutes to fill in as I please with all the great tools and poses you've taught me over these 30 days. And aside from some minor mishaps in half moon and crow, it went really well and the 40 minutes were over much faster than I anticipated.
Thank you so much Adriene! For doing this, for being you and for getting me into a better physical and mental state. And I think I can speak for all of us when I say: We love you too.
Wow! I love you!
Absolutely life changing! Thank you so much Adriene ❤️

Wow. This was really powerful for me. I cried at the end and wasn’t expecting that kind of release. Thank you for this. I was partly following along with you, partly making it my own based on what felt right to me. I’m glad that I finally made it through this journey. All I could think of at the end were the words, “I’m free. I’m free. I’m free.” Free to be who I want to be at any time. I don’t have to wait for someone’s permission to do what I know is right for me. I need continued healing but this definitely brought some light into my life, so thank you so much, Adriene!! ❤️❤️

I just want to thank you so much for all that you do Adriene. I have been struggling with my own mental health lately and your yoga videos have really been my saving grace. Over a month ago I found out my partner was suffering from his own demons. We both decided to do this 30 day yoga journey and finished 2 days ago. Between the pandemic concerns and all of the bizarre developments this year has brought it has allowed us to find peace and strengthen ourselves and our own relationship. I have been following you for 4 years now and this is the second 30 days I have completed. We just started dedicate and the mental, physical, and emotional benefits of yoga are so evident. We have two children together and both work as nurses so find it difficult and unaffordable to go to a studio. These videos, your words, and careful guidance are a perfect balance in our busy lives. As natural caregivers we both find it difficult to care for ourselves. Thank you for helping us guide us into a space where we can learn and grow. I have been sharing with others and have had people message me "Adriene has really change my life." I hope you are able to read this and understand how much you do for people just by sharing your love and gentle spirit with others. You are a true teacher and leader and wonderful human being. Thank you for being you. Much love to you and Benji <3

thank you adrienne for this amazing yoga journey that you took us on. As i lied there in shavasana trying to clear my mind and have a moment of stillness, i realized that (of course) not all my problems are suddenly solved. i still can't concentrate that well, i fall over in half moon and i am impatient and on edge pretty much all the time. But i also felt an immense, stubborn love for myself, something i never really felt before this deeply. I realized that no matter what, I will continue to love myself whether i love me back or not. I will continue to do yoga even though it takes me great convincing to get on the mat because i know how good i'll feel afterwards, i will eat healthy food instead of a diet of chips and ice cream because i know that i feel way better and i will be kind to myself and all those around me even tho i want to snap at people and tear myself down. Because I love myself and i love living! From the bottom of my heart, thank you adrienne for being a role model, a wonderful yoga instructor and an inspiration in kindness, patience and love. ♥

Wow, it was like I lived, breathed, and saw this montage of my YWA journey to get to this day. I took it at my own pace, and somehow I found myself syncing up with Adrienne at times.
What I've rekindled is the playful essence of my spirit and my hands and feet's spirit too! I was playing in boat pose and started flicking my feet in point and flex. Imagining little splashes of water. I've held a grudge again my feet for so long because they pronante in the wrong way and have large bunions. I've seen them as this stand still obstacle in my movement practices. I never truly feel grounded my feet. The part of me the literally supports my whole body to connect with the earth, I've shunned as a part of me.

With these magical splashes, I forgive you my feet. You deserve much more love and support from me.

Thank you for guiding to awaken the imaginative playful essence again. ❤ ^U^

Finally finished the 30-day journey! The end of the journey is always my favorite and I've been doing yoga with you for almost 5 years! Last time I cried while doing my day 30 video where I took control of everything because I was in a darker place back then. BUt now that everything is much, muc hbetter, I find myself choreographing a sweaty 40-minute routine that feels light but at the end of it I sweated as if I was doing cardio!


The magic mantra is "find whaat feels good". Who knew that today, my body is moving on their own accord because what feels good is sweating! I also find myself doing hard poses that I thought I couldn't do like crown and half moon, and it felt like flying! Magic!


Thank you so much Adriene for this practice and this journey and for those who are also practicing with the same frequency. I hope everything in the world will be better soon. Love.
My first 30 day finale!  Thank you Adriene for your teaching, grace & perseverance through this journey.  I feel unity through this practice even through this unpredictable time.

I discovered YWA in 2017 while going through a divorce and recovering from addiction and Adriene's gentle, empowering presence helped me find my light again. I did yoga almost every day until getting pregnant last year (with my current wonderful partner), and doing this 30 day challenge has been my reintroduction to my self and my body since our son was born in December. I didn't start until February, had to skip a day or two in between, and had to pause many of these practices multiple times to get up and soothe a newborn, but I always got back to it and feel SO good seeing the positive changes to my body/mind/spirit. Jon O'Donohue is one of my favorite authors and the ending quote hit me directly in the feels! First time commenting but I have spent hundreds of hours enjoying these practices and my life is better for it. Sending so much gratitude and love for you and this community!

wow.... so proud of myself and you and benji for strengthening me body mind and soul... this is my second 30 days of yoga sequence and this time .. i didn't have to look up and use you adriene as a reference ....not once and I powered through every pose ...remembering always to check in with my breath and sync with it .... listen to my body and my spirit when I felt like I was lost or losing my momentum but .....that didn't happen ....thank you both so very much ..... It took me until March, and a pandemic, to finally finish coming Home, BUT I DID IT!  Thank you for creating such a safe place, a place without judgement. I feel like weeping for joy!

So today I have a volunteer interview with the red cross, wrote the city council to help support the houseless while EVERYTHING is closed with bathroom and water access. Then I did this practice and I am crying. Who would have thought we would be here on Jan 31? It's taken me this long to get through the 30 days but I finished even sooner than I thought because everything I was working on is cancelled. Thank you Adriene, for giving me permission to take care of myself during these times. Hope you're doing all right out there.

Thank you Adriene!  I saw your interview on the today show a couple of months ago.  I said to my family, I'm going to try this.  Well, 30 + days later, I am more flexible, stronger and have better balance.  At 59 with back issues, I would have never thought that doing 15-30 minutes of yoga most days of the week would have this affect on me.  You are a blessing!

challenging but amazing <3
it took me a while to finish the whole journey, but it it's incredible the diferences in my mind and body
thank you adriene!

Dear Adriene, thank you for everything. This is my second year in a row that I do the whole 30 days of yoga. Here I am, 17th of March, grateful, energized and hopeful. Well first of all let me say I really enjoyed the first 29 days but that (the 30th day) was just annoying, a guided yoga routine without an audio guide.yeah I know the positions and moves but it’s still a routine and without audio guidance you continually have to check the video which is not at all good for some of the poses or your neck and you can’t even relaxingly close your eyes during parts of the practice because you have no idea if we’ve moved on to the next pose. In some ways seemed like more of a personal performance piece. Thanks for the first 29 days, really started each day off nicely :)

Many Peaceful Blessings to you and Benji ✌💚☘🌶

Thank you Adriene for making yoga fun and doable for me. I have truly come to enjoy yoga and see it as part of my daily routine!! I enjoyed learning to listen to my body and what makes it feel good. I overcame my first depression episode with going through a yoga teacher training (in Austin actually!) and was practicing yoga every day but my work got busy and a year later I had another depression episode much worse than the first one. There was such synchronicity in my meditation practice and what you have taught us during this journey, it was unbelievable. Every morning I started with the gratitude for you and it's such a great feeling. You are light. Thank you for sharing your light with this world. Love you!

Today is March 12, 2020... and my Day 30. I was nervous when you took off your mic but so so proud of what I achieved on my own. Knowing you and Benji were here to guide me helped a lot, but I was also astounded by how much my soul and body were in sync. ho god, I started crying 30 seconds in. took me 2 and a half month to get through this, recpecting my limitations and my injury, and god Im proud <3 Thank you Adriene <3

This is a waste of time for me. I get the point & in theory it sounds beautiful & freeing & all that stuff to “trust yourself” & go without cues. But in practice it’s just me being annoyed & not able to predict what she’s going to do next so I have to watch the screen in a way I didn’t with any other day. I don’t have time to waste 40 minutes without feeling like I got a workout. I also just feel stupid the entire time. Maybe I’m not as enlightened as everyone else here. But I did 30 days of this only to feel stupid for 40 minutes.

I was proud that I made it 30 days straight through, but the pinnacle was a let down. I say this because I was straining to look at the screen to know when to go to the next pose. I had to quit because my neck is hurting. Some sort of sound cue is really important as you shouldn’t turn your neck in some of those poses. I’ve been really appreciative of this practice, and would like to do more. Adriene, I’m just wondering if this is the standard for ending each series? It’s going to be hard for me if so. Maybe there’s a balance between the music, the opportunity to create a personal practice and use the language and sound guidance? Maybe if you named the next pose and let folks move into it on their own? I’m asking because it would be more healthful for me, and I’d like to complete each series. Thanks for listening to those of us that need some sound cues, and thank you for taking the time to offer this great resource. It is much appreciated. Love and light!

THANKYOU ADRIENE!! This is my first time completing the entire 30 day challenge and it was an AMAZING journey. I really appreciate what you give and I hope you are receiving so much love from us in spirit! I'll continue my practice since stopping seems like such a foreign idea now lol I will see you next time on the mat! :)

for some reason i started doing the 30 day challenge from 2015. I guess it started out as another way to get strong and relieve back pain. Turned out to be doing even more for mental health! I carry a nugget of calm with me all the time, and its lovely. After my first 30 (from 2015) i immedtiately started this one.
Today marks my 60th consecutive day.
I feel happy!

I just finished Day 30 today! I think it might be my favorite day of the journey Home. Choreographing my own practice made me connect with my body and find the joy that made me fall in love with this practice to begin with. It also made me realise how much I've learned these past couple of months. Thank you for this journey, Adriene!

I gotta be honest- I've done Adriene's yoga journeys for a few years now, and I came to fear/hate/avoid day 30- I even skipped it last year. It made me feel lost not to have a voice guiding me. I went into this practice feeling the same kind of emotions and almost delayed it to get on with my busy day, but I managed to press play (the hardest part, right?). I followed Adriene for the most part, got in to my own groove a bit, and was shocked when I realized that 40min had flew by! I felt calm for most of the practice, but when I saw Adriene closing the practice, I got so emotional. Tears came to my eyes. This year's journey went so well for me- I'm proud to say that I only missed one day in the whole 30 days! (I was traveling in Jan, so I started on my own in Feb.) After so many years, a daily practice is starting to seem really within reach. So many people say it, but it's true- this yoga has changed my life. Thank you, Adriene, for all that you do. I am deeply and eternally grateful for your gift!

Thank you Adriene. I have been following your videos for more than 2 years now. Every time I have followed your flow, I have felt good. Finally after completing this 30 day flow, I feel like I have grown emotionally and physically, I have a long way to go but, these 30 days have taught me to appreciate the journey and to live mindfully. I can never Thank you enough for teaching me how to Live with meaning. Lots and lots of love and positivity to you❤

This is the third year that I’ve followed Adriene’s 30-day yoga journey, and THE FIRST TIME I’ve managed to complete the 40 minutes without hesitation, knowing what to do next. The first year, I just sort of hobbled around wondering what to do, taking cues from Adriene but feeling as though I was cheating. Last year (Year 2), I managed about half the time before following along because I’d run out of ideas. This year, at last, I felt quite a natural flow from one sequence of movements to the next. I have never tried practicing yoga on my own, so this was a really significant step for me. I really enjoyed the time to feel my way into each posture, making it work for me. And I finally realized what I’m doing wrong when moving from chaturanga to upward dog! Thank you so much, Adriene, for (a) rekindling my interest in yoga later in life and (b) giving me, as you say, the vocabulary to express myself freely. 🥰 It's amazing, like the first time my dad let go of the bike and I found myself cycling upright without support.
Thank you so much Adriene! Just finished that 30th day of Journey which I started on the 2d January (and almost completed it in a month then!) — feels so fine and happy <3
I literally cried when this session ended. Thank you!
thank you for this beautiful journey, it was peaceful, loving and I feel like I am home now <3

Day 30! It's March 9th. It took me twice as long to get here as I expected to arrive here. The journey has been one of many lessons. Adriene, you are such a supreme guide and light. I appreciate you and myself for getting here. Late is better than never. Thank you. Thank us. <3

I remember when I went to  classes in London. I saw the rest of the class moving nicely while myself... not so much.  I thought it is only a dream to be like them. Today I became that dream. Thank you :-)

I am happy to have gone this far, but unfortunately, I  feel defeated this 30th day, unable to flow without instruction or looking at the screen. I plan on continuing though , (Fat lip and all! )with your videos, I really enjoyed this journey overall, particularly the time for myself .

This brought up so much emotion from me that I totally didn't expect.  I have done my own yoga flows in the past but I realized through this freedom and trust you invited us to participate in how much I have been relying on the guidance of others as of late.  I teach and preach inner authority, alignment, personal power and yet, I've been abandoning my own while I shift into new and uncharted waters.  I felt so much fear come up as the practice began and sat with it all.  I used the opportunity throughout class to remember that I have the wisdom, I don't need to go fast or do it right or perform for anyone.  That the way I move is perfect and right for me and that's all I need to remember and come back to.  This was so profound and so perfectly timed.  Thank you <3

Adrienne, thank you for always being there.
From the core of my being, I love you.

today i finished my 30 day journey, arrived home safely with some stops on the way. 100% gratitude - to you Adriene and to all of you who share comments here, thank you. it's my second 30-day journey with you - just like with the last time, i cried towards the end of the last video. something about synchronizing without words, something about when i open my eyes and see a similar pose on the screen, or read tiny clues, or nearly hear your kind jokes. pure joy. thank you. namaste.

Wow... That was amazing.  I have finally started & finished my 1st 30 days of Yoga. I enjoyed it so much.  Thank you.  This is huge for me as I have that "can't get off the sofa till bedtime attitude after about 7pm, but this practice has seen me unroll my mat at midnight because I didn't want to miss out on the journey. But I arrived on my mat this evening grumpy, tired but I had an open mind & trusted it would make me feel so much better.  And I did it. I trusted my breathe & knew I had the knowledge and loved it. Dear Adriene,

I've been going through a rough patch and this yoga journey has been the only thing I've been able to stick to daily for the last 30 days. Actually, most days, it's been the only thing I was genuinely looking forward to. It kept me going, time and again. In your own words, my yoga mat literally and figuratively got my back. Today, I sat down on my mat at the golden hour. At first the prospect of going through this session without your vocal guidance distressed me; I thought I'd only get stuck in my head, afraid of missing a "cue", of not knowing when or how to move. But only a few minutes into it, it dawned on me that that's not the point; yoga is not a choreography, it's a language. A therapeutic language. I never trusted my body as much as I did during this final practise, however clumsy the outcome. I actually, genuinely listened—to my breath, to my body, to my needs. I'm not talking about a hyperfocus kind of mode; it rather felt like I was letting go of something, in the subtlest ways. I melted into the moment, into the environnement and sounds and light around me, into my body. At the end, I lied down with my left hand on my heart, the right one on my stomach—the two areas that I probably tend to mistreat the most. It took me a minute to notice the tears after I felt the steady, loyal beating of my heart and the warmth of my abdomen. After this 30-day journey, life is still what it is, sure. I wasn't expecting a miracle. But something has changed withing me. I finally want to take care of myself. And from here on out, yoga is going to be a central point in this process. It's only the beginning. So much love x

When I started Yoga, I'm slowly learning to appreciate myself more and also to value, love myself (which I haven't done in ages) & just appreciate life in general.  Thank you Adriene! Finished today with about 8 days of breaks (showing up sometimes is difficult). I'm not going to lie. I was a little scared and worried about doing yoga without you telling me what to do (I think it may be somewhat easier to do it that way), but once I started doing it, I couldn't believe that I did yoga by myself for 35 minutes!!! You've taught me the vocabulary as well as the moves and allowed me to create my own freestyle yoga practice! I think the main thing that I learned was just to take time for yourself and to love yourself (whatever that may be). It was great! Using you as a guide to remind myself of the moves, I was able to do my favourite poses and hit spots that were "yummy" and helped me feel better. Thank you for this journey! I'm going to continue with the next calendar. Namaste!

Although I absolutely love all of Adriene's workouts (she's my official "yoga instructor"; this video didn't work out very well for me (or the other 131 people who gave it a thumbs down).  Adriene, in my opinion, is a pioneer.  She gently guides and instructors her students as she takes us through the various poses.  I can't take a fast passed yoga class and her videos are perfect for me.  It's impossible to watch an instructor AND get into these poses at the same time.  Especially figuring out what the next pose will be while in downward dog with my head upside down at that time.  Having to keep my eyes peeled on my laptop screen without simply following the guided instructions of her voice, made it impossible for me to benefit from this video in an easy "flow" manner.  I'm not alone in that opinion so, hopefully, none of Adriene's other classes are silent as this one was (I've taken over 50 of her videos and a few are my favorites which I do all the time!).  Hands down, she's the best in the biz!

I started this journey January 10. I was sick with the flu from January 1 to 6 (a great start to 2020). Having more PTSD symptoms than usual, and recovering from the holidays that had their own triggers, made January a very difficult month for me. Body memories from January 2019 were being triggered and I wasn't used to having recent things to process (most of my trauma is from 5-7 years ago).
I still made it onto the mat, even if I had to skip 5 days during a bad week or ended up crying halfway through a video. I still made it through this whole video able to do each sequence, even if I misstepped or had to look at the video a lot.
I'm so proud of myself and thankful for this exercise keeping me grounded during a significant and challenging point in my life. Thank you Adriene.

So... here we are I got on my mat for (almost) 30 days straight and I couldn't have done anything better for myself. I too cried tears of happiness - quite unexpectedly in forward fold (the feeling of tears streaming up your forehead towards your hairline is quite something :)) In the beginning I thought that I will run out of poses before the video is over, but I even ended up rewinding it a few minutes because the time just flew by so quickly. Thank you for being you and always having my back! <3 Namaste

Wow. I’ve done a few other 30 day journeys with you but for some reason this one was super emotional, especially this last one. All the feels. I’ll admit any time it came to day 30 I never had the balls to fully commit to a session by myself. It felt way different than just yoga stretches and I guess I wasn’t mentally ready.
