Thank you so much, I am so greatful. I struggled with eating disorders, and body dysmorphia my whole life and also survived sexual assults. I was married for 14 years, and I wouldnt let my partner touch me or see me naked, the entire time. I was so ashamed of my body. However, Ive already fully recovered from my eating disorders, after 25 years, at worst I almost died after starving myself to 93 lbs, another time I weighed 260 lbs. Now IDK, or care I am healthy; that's what matters. I also have 13 broken bones and metal rods, plates and screws holding them together. I never thought I could do yoga. Hello, Adriene!
I started this journey a little late and with a lot of unhappiness in my heart. While I can't say that yoga helped against that, I certainly feel like even the motivation to wake up early every day and do it was a clear boost for my spirit and morale. I was so very surprised when I saw some signs of muscles on my arms, as well as when I realized that I gained some more length in my very inflexible legs! Today was my biggest surprise by far during this journey and it happened when the usual outro music softly started playing. With my hands in front of my heart, I just started crying and even as I write this I have tears falling down my cheek. They're not tears of sadness, nor happiness, but something else. It feels as if I've been watching a piece of art or something highly inspirational.

But I am babbling now! I want to thank you for being you, Adriene and for everything you do for us. I hope you'll remain this bright being which you are or grow into an even brighter and warmer one. You are wonderful and I wish the best to Benji and you! I will try to go through the other 30 days challenges and see where I'll end up. :)

Just finished it! On more time, a thank you for the love and kindness you put through this work and mindful progression of the journey!

A month ago, I began a new chapter of my life, I moved from Sweden to Australia, to be an au pair for 6 months.
This is what I wrote in my journal after today’s practise:
“I was just at the end of the practice, thumbs at my third eye and crying from being humbled and so, so grateful for all my yoga pals around the world and Adriene, when C and A walked in. D had another bad evening and L needed me to watch them. Sometimes, things just don’t go according to plan, or the plan changes abruptly, and that’s a beautiful part of the journey too. Today, I’ve had to try to let go of the need to know and plan what comes next. In this, during practice when my mind wanted to continuously plan the next pose, and when I looked into the travels I want to do after I’ve finished au pairing. /../ Can I bring back my intention with this trip, to go with the flow and not plan too much ahead? I want to take one thing at a time and see where it leads me. I’m on a journey. ‘Don’t decide where it ends’...”

I’m so grateful for this journey, this practice, for lovingly having my back through this first month of a new adventure. When the change and newness has been too much, it has been my comfort. It has helped me reflect and grow, feel my feelings, and has grounded me. It has helped me slow down and take notice, when things have moved too quickly. It supported the transition of moving across the world, and Adriene, I cannot thank you enough for that. HOME created a home within myself when I left everything and everyone that has ever been home to me far away, and now that safety will forever be there. I am so loved, by other people but also by myself on a new level. It’s intrinsic, unconditional, and will follow wherever I go next. That inner support makes me brave. It makes me believe that what I do, and how I do it matters. That is true, for all of us. I love you all.

YAY!!! I did it!! Proud of myself and everyone on the journey!!! I have been doing yoga every day except 2 day since January 11th. Other than that, f I didn't do a video i had gone to a class. You are a wonderful teacher Adriene, and have taken me from the sofa to (almost) daily practice in the space of about 8 weeks (I started my journey just before Christmas). In that time I've learnt how to breath properly again, rediscovered stretches and moves I don't think my body has known since I was a toddler, gained some new strength and balance, and feel a new sense of purpose and well-being. I even find myself having a secret little stretch when I'm doing something mundane like washing the dishes or brushing my teeth!


I only wish I'd discovered this magic 30 or 40 years ago, but I've discovered that you are never too old to start learning yoga.

Once I realized I wasn’t going to be able to end on 1/31, I almost stopped. I have a tendency to let go of things if I can’t do them “the right way.” Workout programs go unfinished, I stop using apps because I’ve lost my “streak,” I let my diet collapse on itself because I went way over my calorie goal a few nights in a row and feel ashamed.

But when I started HOME, I said that I would not judge the process. That I wouldn’t say or think anything negative about my body for not being able to hold a pose or for having random pains on occasion. And I wouldn’t beat myself up for anything that came up during the 30 days. So I figured out how to keep going.

And I finally finished Day 30 on Valentines Day, of all days! To me, that feels perfect. This practice felt like what I needed; I wasn’t expecting to get very far without you telling me where to go next, but I stayed “self-guided” for most of the practice. So glad I didn’t give up on this. I finished when I was supposed to finish.

I'm so glad I'm not the only one! I missed days here and there but the more I did the more I could do. I hope we both keep up some kind of practice despite inevitable lapses. Diets too for that matter.

Well, I made it to day 30 (albeit a little late). And I am surprised how I enjoyed today's practice. Last time I did a 30-day challenge I skipped the last day because I can't manage without structure. Today, I used Adriene as a cue for when to move from seated to tabletop, then to standing, seated and finally lying down. But apart from that I mostly did my own thing and the 40 minutes shockingly flew by! I am amazed by my gains in strength, flexibility and posture. I sit and stand up straighter, I feel stronger and I even made it into a few postures I could barely do before. Thank you Adriene for this journey.

comment: Loved this class, thank you !
Absolutely loved the moment when Benji came up to you for a kiss! So beautiful! 💋

Thank you Adriene for this, I do these journeys with you every year and love them and am so grateful for them and all your hard work!
However I must honestly admit that I really dislike this tradition on day 30 to take off your microphone. Like someone else also mentioned in the comments, it’s frustrating and very difficult to follow along without audio cues because I’m forced to look at the screen and crunch my neck all the time making me feel rather uncomfortable. I’m a yoga teacher myself (which you have inspired me to become!) so there’s really not a problem with me not being able to listen to my own voice, I can easily do my own flow and listen to my body etc but the reason that I do yoga with someone else is because I’d like to follow along with their flow, and that’s incredibly difficult to do without audio cues. If I’m in childs pose for example, how do I know when to come out? If I come out whenever it feels right to me, I might miss out on a whole sequence and see that you’re suddenly in a completely different pose that might need another pose to come into it, and so delaying me even further, in which case I’ll get so much more out of it by practicing on my own. For this reason I enjoy just watching your day 30’s each year to avoid myself frustration. I love the sequences every year and at least it serves me as a kind of meditation. I just wanted to share my personal experience with you and I hope you’ll appreciate my honesty! I love your channel and have been following since your early days. Keep up the great work! You’re a huge inspiration!

Finally finished the 30 day practice and at the end of the session I became very emotional. The music building up to the end send tears down my face - just knowing how strong I’ve become and far I’ve come with treating my body and my mind with kindness. Thank you Adriene, you’re amazing!

I have not done any Yoga for the past few days as Cyclone Damien had a direct hit at Karratha in Western Australia at approx 3.30pm on Saturday, 8th February 2020. We had to evaculate our caravan park, our caravan in a warehouse and us staying at friends place. 4 days later I am back home in my caravan. I am sitting outside on the last day of this 30 day journey about to complete this Home journey. Always do my Yoga outside, but this time its different all around is destruction of our trees, buildings, etc and the two trees nearby has broken branches. But I am about to witness a beautiful sunset amd listening to the birds as I do this 40 min practice. So there is hope again. Thank you for letting me share this. I have enjoyed this Home Yoga series very much.
Just completed my 40min Yoga under the sunset and watching the darkness and stars to appear. It was emotional, but I feel renew and hope for me... as well for this town to come together as one and rebuild. I am glad to be Home again. Thank you

Thank you so much Adriene and all of you for sharing your journeys and making me feel safe enough to share mine with you. Ok, I'm 10 days late but THANK YOU SOOOO MUCH. I enjoyed (almost) every day and got used to do some sports in the morning. It affects my mood during the hole day. It's awesome.

I can't even describe what Adriene has given me throughout the years I've been following her videos. I feel like a new person. I'm so grateful for this community, and grateful that this practice has given me my body back. I love you all.

I know I'm just a small little fish in a vast sea ...however I just wanted to tell you that I came here for the inner peace more than to be healthy and you gave me both. I started crying towards the end because you were able to give me a form of peace finally through all the noise of the day. Thank you for sharing your gift of inner healing.

I have finished my 30days with you and they were absolutely beautiful, in the last 30 days i have transformed and healed my soul day by day practicing on my yoga mat with adriene and continuing to heal you've helped me a lot and i would like to thank you and honer your hard work that you share with us.. nothing but love and respect for you and benji ❤🐾🕊🌻🙏

we did it 💖

I made it! I don't quite know how it's been 30 days already but apparently it has! Thank you so much Adriene. I know a lot of people have left comments here before me saying very similar sentiments, but honestly from the bottom of my heart thank you! Even after these 30 days I have noticed so many changes happening in my life from incorporating this daily practise. I don't know why but when you brought us down on to the floor and I hugged my knees into my chest I just started crying. I don't know where the tears came from or why, but I just felt something give way. You've given me so much through this series and honestly I'm ready for the next one! My biggest heartfelt gratitude to you and Benji for sharing your time, love, and beautiful energy with us. Namaste <3 xxxx

I love your channel, and have enjoyed every video (I usually spend 2+ hours a day doing yoga from your channel) up to this point, but I found it frustrating to be left to my own devices on the last day. While I know most of the moves already, it's hard to know when you're switching, so I end up looking up at the screen almost constantly to make sure I'm not missing poses (which I did, and the other ones were compromised by my looking up at the screen.) This made it impossible for me to continue keeping focus on my breath/core. The fact this happened to be the longest video of the series just made it more frustrating. I stuck through til the end in the hopes I'd still feel good after, but I didn't. The way I see it is- if I wanted to do yoga without any instructions, I wouldn't be on Youtube watching beginner videos in the first place. That said, thanks for all you do, and I'm glad that not everyone agrees with me, and that many could get something out of this day. <3

Finishing my journey home on Feb 11th and I am beyond proud of myself. Although I missed coming to the mat for 11 days in January, I stuck with it and finished in my own perfect time. As a beginner, I have learned so much from day 1. Thank you Adriene for sharing your love and compassion. I hope to take the skills learned here into the rest of the month, year, life, etc. The mantra that came to me on this journey is "this is me". and I am ready to own being a strong, independent, joyous, and caring being! Sending love to you all.
Feb 11 and I finally made it! The biggest thank you to Adrienne and the team for giving your time to help all these strangers start the year the best way.
Feeling so proud of myself that I stuck with it for all 30 days. Practicing in Ecuador with my cat as the always-curious observer. Thank you Adrienne

This one was a little hard to keep up because I had to keep looking up at screen from my mat. But all in all one of the best practices I have experienced. I cracked some stuff, opened up, then burst into tears with gratitude tha tI can do this!  Thanks a million Adiene. Namaste.
Many thanks.Really magical end to our thirty day journey.It gets better every year....

Want to start off by thanking You and the YWA team for such wonderful and loving content. We all appreciate this so much!

A small population of this community requests that there be two versions of this final 30th day. One version with some verbal/audio cues and the other without. Sorry to sound ungrateful 😬. My wife and I practice every morning and rarely if ever look at the screen but do actively listen for movement and breathing cues. We don’t “watch” your videos, we practice them.

Muchas Gracias desde San Antonio TX!!!!

Adriene and YWA team, thank you so incredibly much. I had been doing the HOME series daily until day 20, where I took a bit of a break here and there, until I finished day 30 today. I was so moved at the very end, when the HOME theme song hit. The emotions and tears came out of nowhere. I was legit crying! And that hadn't yet happened to me in this series, even though reading comments, I see it has happened with others. Reflecting on it though, the release of emotions may be because I am so busy in my life off of the mat, that when I come to the mat to practice with you and this beautiful community we have created, I feel such gratitude and profound peace inside myself. And knowing that this HOME series has wrapped up is like... an acknowledgement that we have done it yet again. I had done Dedicate and True before this, and...the music incorporated in today's practice was so meaningful- like a nod to series past. I love this channel, this community, and the way yoga (and your presentation of it) has shone a light on the inner teacher and the higher self within me. To the readers of this comment contributing to the light and love on this channel and in your own communities: thank you, thank you, thank you.
The title music is so beautiful it speaks to me... It's like it is saying go go go... What's the music name? I'd like to listen it
I agree, it’s beautiful!!

I love your videos and this 30 journey! Sadly I couldn't connect with this video. Kept having to break the posture to look up at the screen and then find myself anxiously catching up. I have been practising for a while and really tried to trust my instincts but it wasn't connecting. So I had to stop 20 minutes in , I understood that this practise wasn't right for me today (and that's ok) so I'm going to do another instead. I am sad to not "complete" the Home series but just being kind to myself (as it was making me anxious) and changing gears. That's just my experience. Much love and light to you Adriene and everyone practising today! I am so grateful for your videos amd this community.
My mom and I just finished today, woops. But we are super proud, thank you for the good time!!! I loved this last silent class, it was the perfect cherry on top. Much love!

I might have cried a little out of gratitude of completing this 30 day journey...I've been practicing yoga for years, but it felt amazing to follow through on these 30 days and rediscover so many things about my body and postures I hadn't been using in a while, like Pyramid pose, so thank you so much for taking the time and dedication to put together this series and for making me cry out of appreciation, you're a fantastic human being <3

I finally reached day 30! But oh-me-of-little-faith, I just led my own 35-minute practice, feeling incredibly connected with my breath, the present space, etc. I haven't felt this empowered in such a long time, that tears of joy streamed down my face in my final resting pose. Thank you thank you thank you.
Well. Cried on that one. Speechless. Thank you is all I can say Adriene. I love you

I have to admit that I felt a little reluctant  on whether  I should do this practise or not. The thought of not having  the voice of Adriene to guide me through this, made me feel kind of scared and insecure  about me, like: "what if I don't know what to do on the mat?" Or "what if I do it wrong?". In the end I've decide to give it a try and the result was marvellous: My body surprised me by knowing  exactly what it wants! I was just concentrating  on my breath and left myself guided by my soul and my body. It was the first  time after a long period where I've trusted myself again and proved  that I am capable of doing something. I finish the home yoga journey still imperfect, full of flaws and insecure about many things in life but with a tremendous  important  lesson that I've learned: to accept myself the way I am. To welcome all the imperfections  and to befriend my insecurities. Thank you Adriene for showing me that it's ok to be broken, and that life is an endless  journey  wjere we search our lost smithereens and try to achieve  our best version. Thank you so much ❤ Namaste

I just finished all 30 days by today, Feb 10. I may have fallen behind a few days, but I proved to myself that I can stick with it  and not give up bc of a setback. I'm proud that I did this. Thank you to everyone who joined in on this. I felt like we all connected through taking this journey together. I got a bit emotional at the end, knowing it marked the finish line to these 30 days(not that it has to end, but you know what I mean)! You've helped kickstart my 2020 in a big way, welcoming self care, reflection, discipline and consistency. Thank you again, beautiful ❤ Namaste to all🙂✨

Just finished the whole month today! I love you Adriene! Namaste💐 💗🕯💗💐

When I saw that the video is 40 minutes long I thought oh no, I’m not ready for such a long practice. But then I took my own sweet time and it was almost too short for me! 10 days late but I did it 💪🏻

Adriene that was the most amazing practice. This journey has been exactly what I needed to affirm my love for myself and my commitment to caring for myself both mind and body.
At first I had a hard time getting to the mat each day, but as time passed I began to realize how essential my yoga practice is to my self care. At first when I missed a day I would be very self critical, but as I progressed I realized that I can allow myself to choose when I practice and forgive myself for the days when I may choose an alternative.
I am going to continue my journey and do my best to make it to the mat each day while following the calendar that you sent out. Thank you so much for taking the time to create such a wonderful journey and sharing it with the world.

This was amazing!!! I have completed your 30s days. I tried the last two new year starts but never completed and this time I did it. I feel such overwhelming pride that I achieved this. I've had anorexia when I was 13 and although my weight stabilised after therapy I was still carrying a lot of negative assumptions about me and my body for the last 12 years. Those assumptions became  more and more conscious during the last year and I had a hard time continuing to eat and staying in a loving relationship with my body. This journey helped me to understand that I live in my body, that I own every cell of it and that every day I can make the decision to nurture my body with tasty, healthy food, kind and loving thoughts and movement that feels good and is in line with my energy level. Thank you for this, Adriene - you're a really inspiring woman!

I'm writing from Canberra, Australia. We have had a really hard and stressful start to the year in Aus and this challenge really helped me feel more optimistic about 2020. Day 30 was beautiful. I fell into a rhythm on my own, I was a little scared and thoughts of "am I doing it right?" popped up but then I just knew what came next and flowed through. I'm proud of myself. Thank you so much. I'll continue my daily practice into 2020.
Thank you so much for this moving practice. For this whole journey. It's been an honor to have practiced with you, to be guided by you. 🙏🙏

I finally finished HOME, yey! I’m so proud of myself and everyone who has come this far or will in the future! I finished this today, on February the 9th, in my little corner of Spain. The 30th day is so important to me. I felt quite sad today, that's why I knew I really needed to get home. I was ready. I just started crying from the very beginning with her words and hold my tears during the practice at several moments. I was very excited and nervous as if it was a test. I wasn't always synchronized with her but I didn't feel bad about it. Her instructions resonated in my head and I said a lot of them out loud to give me confidence, the name of the postures, the mantras... One that really stuck for me on this Home journey was " Find your footing". A great metaphor I can use off the mat.
Everything was really dynamic, I felt my heart racing , I enjoyed the effort with a smile. The music was fascinating too because it was the "Home" theme. I finally arrived to the end of this journey really happy with my accomplishments. I needed to let go some heavy burden that I've been carrying around for more time than necessary. This journey gave me hope and made me trust myself a bit more. It's tough but I'm getting stronger.
Thanks so much Adriene, beautiful angel 💙💙💙💙

I used to do your yoga every single day

This was such an emotional practice for me. My mantras throughout the journey were "I am strong" and "I am capable". I hoped that I would gain strength through this 30 day journey and, as always, I gained so much more. Near the end of my practice today, I was in a supine twist and I repeated to myself "I am strong, I am capable, I am worthy" and found myself answering back in tears "you have been all along'. I found release from some of the tension I have been holding on to for so long and was able to finally connect it to anger about my past. I now know what my soul has been searching for and truly have started to find my way home. Thank you so much for this journey, Adriene. Namaste 🙏🏻

Here we are! Two friends, Renata and Aya practicing at home and gym in Hanoi, Vietnam! Today we finished 30 days. Biggest benefit we feel is the achievement to finish it 30 days in low. Even we do not see changes much our body changes and we can not do all the postures, our flexibility got better. And what is the most important, we look forward to exercise. We liked the fact that we could exercise together. That was important for us, and we liked that it was kind of surprise what is waiting for us for the next class. During our last class without the guidance, just music, we realized that we still have to work on remembering the patterns so we decided to continue with another 30 days challenges. Which one you would recommend, the one from last year? Some of the postures are really hard for us. Like changing the positions to get the leg from plank to the front. Same to return the leg bag to the standing position. Our feeling is our arm is too short but may be there are some advice or trick that we did not figure out yet. So thank you very much and now we enjoy your tea and we like! Greeting goes as well to Benji💓💓
finally finishing day 30! 💗💗💗 practicing from the philippines. i will forever be grateful for this 30 day challenge that we have been doing together for years adriene. love you to bits! Namaste.

Finished on February 8th! Thank you Adriene for such a fantastic journey home. I have never stuck to a yoga “program” before but I really enjoyed my almost daily practice with you. I also really surprised myself that I completed 40 minutes of self led yoga with this final practice. It’s apparent to me that I’ve gained both physical and mental flexibility and am capable of more than I sometimes give myself credit for. I am proud of myself (and everyone else) for completing these 30 days but am sad to see it end. Looking forward to following the February “kiss” calendar. Thank you again, Adriene, for sharing your knowledge and light with all of us around the world.

I did it! Felt so emotional as I bowed and whispered "namaste." I had bumps along the way and I had days where I did not show up for myself but here I am, nourishing the benefits of this practice. I trusted myself and I trusted you. This has been a wonderful journey for me and I slowly learned to have that courage and strength to show up and to tell myself, "you got this!" I have some things going on and work can be stressful but at the end of the day I always have that feeling of joy when I show up and come home to myself. There's always that excitement even when I am not emotionally or physically okay, I am able to say "I CAN'T WAIT TO COME HOME AND DO YOGA" I am truly grateful that I found you. It was on January 2 when I typed, "yoga" and your channel was the first to pop up! I am looking forward to continuing my journey home as I make yoga a part of my daily ritual. We love you, Adriene!!
Adriene i love u and ur yoga classes i did it and it helped me physical and mentally thank you so much u r awesome

Since the first of this year I have completed an internship, moved to a different city, and began my bachelor's thesis, and in mid January my grandfather died. I have followed this practice in multiple apartments, multiple countries, in my grandmother's attic, in hostel bedrooms. In a season of very rapid changes in my own life, but also in the west, through brexit and impeachment trials and all of the rest, this series of practices has been a constant. A daily reminder that I am well, that my body is beautiful, a daily reminder to allow myself time to do absolutely nothing, and over that time, I have watched myself and the other 5,500 people who have followed this practice grow stronger, calmer, more aware, more mindful. I'm just so overwhelmed with gratitude for the gift of this practice.
What I'm tying to say is, thanks for leading us home <3
Thank you❤️ so grateful
I. HAVE. MADE. IT. THROUGH. Thanks Adriene!!

We could all hear the beautiful heart felt cues..no matter how "silent". They were there. "A lot of love in, a lot of love out. If you fall, I am here to catch you. Take up space. Move like you love yourself. Dont decide where it ends. I love you." By the end. Sitting with hands to forehead, all I could hear was "come home, come home, come home". Finding strength in self, I've never been more at home, and more excited with who I am now, and who I've yet to be. THANK YOU, for a potent practice. So grateful for this practice, and you.

just complete day 30. it was great . getting stronger :))

Dear Adriene, thank you from the bottom of my heart for this journey home. There were days when I struggled with the title of this journey, I lost my physical home, a place that I loved, through divorce, and have felt displaced every since. And toward the end of this yoga journey I began travelling, back to sea, back to my other home, to a place that has been a huge part of my life, a place that I am uncertain whether to continue to live in or whether to let go of. Thank you for reminding me that home is not a geographical location, but a place within me to be carried wherever I go. It is an honour to be guided by you and to be a part of this global community. I am grateful and thankful for you Adriene and for the tools you have given me that I know will see me through anything that comes my way. Namaste 🙏🏻
Very inspiring.

Loved this yoga session. My 11yr old son and I do an ‘Adriene Yoga’ every morning. He is Autistic and this really sets him up for a good start to the day.
One thing that disappointed him is that the heart was not there at the end of day 30. He also remembered it wasn’t there last year as well. Sounds like a small thing I know but he watches all the way to the end to see it. So he asked me to ask you to-‘Bring back the heart please’.
Love always ❤️🙏

I like that quote is quite true. I feel like that after this last day was perfect and full. Well it was a beautiful new beginning 😉. We did it! I got a boost of energy during the practice and I felt guided by you as well as by my intuition. Yes. I took care of myself in my little corner of the world for this great program. Determination, motivation and strength of the Spirit. It was a concentrate of this today to me. The music relaxed my mind for this session (excellent choice) and later I was like; Oh! The theme of Home. It was a honor for all too I think to follow it. Thank you very much Adriene. It was a fantastic job! Namaste.
Loved hearing previous years' theme songs throughout this practice! Having flashbacks to FWFG Januarys past...

I began this 30 day journey in one state, then traveled to another (which was my home of origin), and finished in Australia, my new home. I was 5 days behind because of days on planes, trains, and automobiles, then have been putting off day 30 for another couple because this is my third 30 day January with Adriene so I knew what was coming and, I'll be honest, I was scared. But I put on my big girl pants (as they say here in Aus) and dove in and found that I have truly been transformed over the last month and in a larger sense over the last three years with you. There were a few times I looked at the screen and we were doing the same thing so I would flow with you for a few minutes, then we would go our separate ways. I feel uplifted, strong, and grounded. I am so grateful for you, for me, for this community. At the end I cried with gratitude and joy. Thank you thank you thank you!
I just completed the 30days 😭 I still can’t believe I finished something like that thank you so much 💕
Thank you for another amazing journey Adriene! Thank you for everything you brought to this journey, and for guiding the way. Namaste!
Doing yoga has helped me tolerate many things that are out of my control.  My anxiety has certainly gotten better.  Thank you Adriene, for all your work and the passion you put into it.
That moment with Benji around 6 or so minutes in. If that is not what feels good, I don't know what is!! 🥰

I was under the weather for the first week of the new year, so I couldn't start the course until I felt better, so I only completed the 30-day course today...but what a wonderful daily ritual to have! I went through a myriad of emotions - Sometimes I was so up for it I'd be full of beans on the mat, other times I really couldn't be arsed - but I still made it to the mat and always left so glad I did! There were times I was joyously happy and sometimes where I was totally frustrated. all this culminated today, where out of nowhere, when we put the 29 days altogether, I slowly became deeply connected to a sadness that I was able to release in a heavy wave of emotion at the end of the practice and I have felt so light since! I was pretty amazed at how much I remembered and was able to do without you telling me to as well! I'm now going to head on over to one of your other 30 days and keep this daily ritual rolling...This is the good shizzle! Thank you so much, you legend!
Thank you I loved every moment❤️I was crying at the end with tears of joy💗🙏🏻
Thank you everyone and especially Adriene for this 30 day journey.  Nameste 🦋❤️

Finished day 30 only today yay! I have to say, hearing the old 30 days challenges's themes got me hard. While I was flowing I was reflecting on all those days and challenges I shared with you. All those sweating days, cozy days, hot days, heart to heart days. The journey home. This is something. Thanks to my therapies and yoga with you, I healed so many things in my soul and body. I hope you do feel my love, our love! and gratitude for you because 'girl! That's something! I will forever thank you for helping building better foundations for my life. Those past years have been challenging but you helped me build strength and faith. I always say that I was born out of darkness, but I was carved by the light I allowed in. Now it can shine. Now I can shine. So Ms Mishler, from my wide open heart chakra to yours, Namaste! 🙏🏼💚
Dang it. Every year, every day 30, bawling like a baby by the end. Thank you for inviting us on another journey. We love you and your light.

Thank you, Adriene. I've been practicing with you for years and have started many of your 30-day challenges, but this is the first one that I've ever finished. Part of doing this, for me, was to get back into the habit of being on the mat each day, so even though some days I didn't have time for a video, your constant encouragement got me there, on the mat, anyway, doing whatever I could for however long I had. I'll continue to turn to videos for certain needs and strength-building, but now I'll also turn more often to me. Thank you. <3

What an amazing experience. I not only committed to something I needed very badly, but it came at exactly the time I needed it most. I sobbed with happiness and pride when the screen went black — and then the quote that says it all about what this year is about for me. From my inner teacher to you, Teacher -- namaste.

During this silent yoga I felt inspired just to do my own thing. Moving in and out of poses like they came to my mind. Just looked at the screen once in a while to see how much time was left. What a lovely 30 day journey! I felt more powerful with each video, more sure of myself just to close my eyes and follow your voice during the practice. Please reconsider talking us through the video, maybe you can leave out the visuals or encourage us to close our eyes and find what feels good ourselves. And not make me feel so lost.
Thank you!!!!!!!! <3 Also, the ending music reminds of me Jurassic Park, which makes me happy.

I finished the thirty days challenge today. Wow! This was the BEST way to finish the thirty days! I felt relaxed, empowered, restored. I'm so glad I discovered your channel this January. There were many times when I was going 'freestyle' only to look over and see we were in sync. 😁
I haven't exercised (other than gardening) in years, and after losing some weight, it's time to get back in shape. Flexibility and balance has been mostly restored. (I'm close to 60 years old). Thank you! ❤️🌷

Thank you, Adriene. Finished up a few days behind, as is my unintentional tradition, but so very grateful for this annual series. The start of today's lesson was surprisingly emotional to me. Thank you for this annual start to the year. I shall go forward with that most advanced of yoga postures: turning up the corners of the mouth.

Just beautiful, awesome, amazing! Finally got round to day 30 in Vietnam! With my son behind me whilst out of school, asking why she's not talking today HAha..feeling great about how much I learnt, progressed and took since day 0! ❤❤❤⚡🙏

Thank you so much Adrienne!!! January 2020 was filled with so much stress, but doing yoga with you helped me manage it in ways I couldn't imagine before. As someone with severe anxiety disorders, I should've been a blubbering, anxiety-filled person this past month, but instead I was able to take the lessons you shared and apply them throughout my days. If I started to feel overwhelmed, I would try to take a second to breathe lots of love in and lots of love out. My husband even said the other day that he loves that I love doing yoga with you because he can tell it helps my anxiety! He said I seem so much calmer after.

So thank you, Adrienne, for changing lives (especially mine) and for changing the world. I hope I can thank you in person some day! ❤️

I procrastinated this last one because I was afraid I couldn't manage a 40-minute practice without your instruction. I'm finally here, and I'm proud to say that I made it. To everyone who's made it this far, you're my heroes. To those of you who, like me, are finishing this on February 5th, you're amazing. To those of you who will come to finish this at any point in the future, you're all awesome. Home is not a place where you come to hang your hat at the end of each day, but it's the version of you who is ready to receive all that which is good in life, and the bad. Adrienne has hit it on the spot by showing us that home is a journey, and I know that I speak for all of us when I say thank you, Adrienne, for inspiring and challenging us to become better versions of ourselves. To continue to journey home. Don't let the journey stop here, for every new breath is a new beginning, and it's up to you to decide what it'll bring. So to all of you, welcome home. Namaste 🤙

An hour ago I completed my 30 day yoga journey. I became very emotional the moment Benji kissed you because during this journey I lost a companion. My beloved dog Tano, my friend for 15 years went missing for four agonizing  days until one morning I found him. I brought him home to be buried amongst the trees in our garden. That day was the only day I didn’t practice. I often think about how I would have handled the grief if I wasn’t on this journey. But I do know I am thankful. Thank you  Adriene. ❤️

Huge THANK YOU! It was great pleasure to go on this journey with you and all amazing people around the globe. True inspiration. Creating a daily habit it is a big deal for me, waking up every morning a bit earlier and starting the day with yoga turned out to be not that hard as expected! I feel I made a progress in my yoga practice, I am more alert now and also I am not frustrated of being still and silent. Namaste 🙏🏻❤️

Dear Adriene, at the start of your very first 30 days of yoga a couple of years ago, I cried because after a 3 year cancer battle I could not move my body, had not the strength I used to have and was shattered. Today, after following you since then, at the end of this years 30 days I cry happy tears to see how far I've come thanks to you! Healthy and doing my very first yoga teacher training. I can't express what a vital role you played and still play in my recovery, physically and mentally. From the bottom of my heart - thank you so so much!
Love and strength to you!

Thank you Adriene! Wow what a Life changing and such enriching, beautiful journey. Have loved everyday and will continue daily at home yoga practice. Really do feel like I have come HOME. I am so grateful to have found your channel. namaste everyone.Love Victoria xxx :-)
This whole series was amazing. Thank you for the confidence I gained to do this whole flow in silence. Beautiful.

Thank you Adriene for this series! This is the first 30 day challenge I’ve done with you and I’ve never felt so connected to my body and my breath. I can feel it throughout my everyday activities and I feel so much calmer in general. I have to admit I shed a few tears during the shavasana as it refers to death, reminding me of how we lost Kobe this last weekend. Knowing that he isn’t alive anymore, that he won’t be able to see his beautiful daughters grow and the kids he mentored blossom into their full potential deeply saddens me whenever it crosses my mind, but it also makes me grateful to be alive. Grateful that I still have breath. Grateful that I can nurture and strengthen my body. Thank you for being the guide into stronger mental and physical health this month, and I’ll be sure to join you in the future months! Namaste!
I did it! It took me 34 days lol but I’m super proud to complete this. Thank you Adriene, I feel stronger, calmer and I look forward to using what you’ve taught me moving forward.

Can someone make a playlist with all / some of these songs?

ps. I almost cried

Thank you so much for this wonderful series and practice today! I, admittedly, started to compare my no instructions practice with what you were doing on screen. Suddenly, I was comparing myself and thinking oh no I haven’t done this pose or this pose and it’s not going to be a fulfilling practice. Then I reeled myself in and remembered that yoga isn’t about comparing or meeting a certain number of poses per practice. All the things you said throughout the series came flooding back and I finished the rest of the practice with a smile of gratitude. Gratitude that I accomplished something, gratitude for all the support in the comments, and gratitude for the body I am in (which has been a tumultuous relationship at times). I look forward to continuing to grow in my practice and in myself!

Thank you Adriene this journey has been life changing and I feel like a infinite being of light after completing this series :)

Hi Adrienne!!
I just finished the challenge because I came down with the flu around Day 15. I must admit, I was heartbroken to finish behind everyone else... but I finished, and I am so happy! Throughout this challenge I have gained SO MUCH flexibility!!! I can now do the splits, touch my forehead to my knees in forward fold (with straight legs) and touch my heels to the mat in downward dog! I have to admit, these are things I never thought I would be able to do. Yoga has been the one constant throughout this crazy, crazy month... some days, between work and school, it was the only time I had for myself... and most of my days have been 16 hours long! Basically, what I’m trying to say is... thank you, for everything. You are truly amazing... we all are!
Blessings everyone😘

I just finished my 30 day yoga "journey", and I'm at a loss for words... This was by far the most demanding session, but also the most rewarding. For me, this was honestly the worst practice of the journey and I feel like its ended on a down note. I'd wanted to really get stuck into this one and compare it to how I felt on day 1. Meaning I wasn't giving my all to each pose and it didn't flow like usual. The whole point of this for me is having a guide, if I'd wanted to make up my own routine I wouldn't be here. I’m a little behind in these 30 days (a couple days of early morning travel earlier in the month set me back), but... wow. Finally did this one today, and it was SO meaningful. With the beautiful music and your graceful movements, I watched and thought, “There’s a woman who loves her body.” And then I stopped, and realized: I am doing the same movements to the same beautiful music. Do I... also love my body? Wait. I’m doing this because I love my body. Idk if that’s not a profound revelation to anyone else, but for me, that was a BIG DEAL to realize. I’m doing this because I love myself, you guys! I proceeded to cry healing tears all through the rest of the practice. Thank you, Adriene. I think... I think I might actually be Home.
I love u all! Namaste

Thank you for the most beautiful gift. 5 years of rebuilding a relationship with myself after decades of ignoring and yours has been one of the more present voices along that journey.

of all the 30 day journeys we have been on together, this one was really real to me. i have always been afraid to do things on my own, unconsciously not trusting my inner teacher/wisdom/intuition. but today- oh today was different. this is the first day 30 that i was able to get through on my own, AND even had more to do after you were finished and the video stopped. it was so comforting to know i was able to sit with myself, my breath, and just flow for 40 minutes!? truly something i never thought would happen. i feel so connected and in tune with inner teacher now, and am amazed at how strong and graceful i can be.
this past 30 days have been a magical journey, a real shift in perspective. the synchronicities all around me are mind blowing. so many things about the “journey home.” how fitting. “how’d they know?” it’s almost comical to me looking back now. that the answers i was seeking were within me all along. i can’t thank you enough, adriene (and benji)! i am grateful for this platform, and your willingness to serve not only yourself but others all over the world. something even close to yoga with adriene is something i haven’t found yet in my local yoga community. i love the intention, the way adriene lets you know “i got you,” “you’ve got this,” you’re strong,” “find what feels good,” “from your center,” is such a reminder that yoga is so much more than asanas. you have somehow found a way to put the foundations into each and every video, and i believe that is why your videos are so helpful and hit home (😉) for so many people.

thank you again. adriene, benji, and all of those who joined me on this journey home. 🙏🏽🙌🏽💕

Adriene, thank you for walking me home.  Your videos have changed my life.  I started practicing with you in 2016 while I was struggling with seasonal depression and now I have been doing your videos every single day for the last year.  Here's to another 365 days of yoga! <3 <3 <3

Thanks so much Adiene for helping me find that bit of time for me.  I am a stay at home mom to two kids and a work from home husband, I never seem to find time for just me. The last day of the journey practice, I ended up with back pain. Therefore, I had to finish the journey today. I pushed myself through the pain. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU for the time you put in to inspire so many people across the world. Just coming out of  an emotional depression, your HOME reminded me who I was, who I am now, and who I want to be in the future. You truly are a blessing.

Thank you for reminding all of us to nourish the only home we have during this journey, our body! It took a  catastrophic injury and two years of chronic pain to realize that all the external stuff is unnecessary clutter when the internal is in a state of unbalance. Love your body because it's yours and no one elses. If you take care of this vessel it will take care of you. I was watching Beyonce's homecoming performance on Netflix and I enjoyed the achievement more because she worked so hard to get her strength and stamina back after having twins. It's nice to let go of obsessing over physical appearance to focus on internal strength. It's kind of magical to just love and appreciate your body for what it's capable of instead of what it looks like.
"Lots of love in, lots of love out...." THANK YOU ADRIENE, FOR BE THERE AND HELP A LOT OF PEOPLE LIKE ME. NAMASTE

Wow, I did it! Thank you Adriene and the Home
Community. I will miss you in the comments every day! On Day 30 I truly came Home-what a wonderful journey! Have a great 2020 everyone and see you in February, xos

When the music used for True came on during the practice, I was overwhelmed with emotions. In that moment, I realized just how much I've learned about myself on and off the mat in the last two years. You have helped me grow so much through this channel. I finally feel at home within myself. I finally feel a sense of validation and grounded ness I always sought in other things. I already am whatever I want to be. Namaste, Adrienne.

Dear Adriene, thank you so very much. This whole journey has been wonderful, and it's not over yet! I was surprised today by all the strength I have built, inside and out. I'm very proud of myself and everyone who participated.

One's of the best yoga sessions I've ever had. My heart is so full of love right now! Home is wherever I practice Yoga with Adriene ❤️ thank you for another amazing journey!

Thank you Adriene for a beautiful journey. 😘🥰

Thank you. First and foremost. I have been meaning to join in with the monthly practises for a while now and this is the one I actually stuck to, hard at first but easier as I went on thanks to your unending enthusiasm for teaching and sharing. It's baffling how wonderful these practises are and how they have changed my mind and body! I was wary of this practise when you first said that you wouldn't so much as be leading it, a scary thought and I have to say that I panicked. But I got in the flow and got lost and struggled but it was nice to be able to play and also have you there just in case.
Thank you again, so, so much.

Thank you Adriene for this incredible journey home ! 🌸
I don’t know about you guys, but I made a bunch of new year resolutions and this 30 days is the only commitment I kept! I am so thankful for the everyday yoga practice keeping me aligned and feeling like no matter what happens, its got my back 💪🏻

Wow what a journey. I started this journey crying at the end of the first video (for the first time after a  yoga video) I ended this journey crying at the beginning and the end of this video. Today I read your mail and I already started tearing up. Then I started this practice and I just started crying. So in tradition I just showed up with what I had going on and started to find what feels good. So for the first few minutes just sat there crying. And the tension that I've been having in my shoulders the last few days just disappeared. Usually I get this pain in my throat, this lump in my throat so big that I almost can't breath. This time I felt my throat a little for just a second and then it was already gone. So eventually I started the slowly move and begin my practice. During this practice I begin too feel so light. This last few weeks feel like I have been digging deep in some old pains and have been processing them. It has been tough but also needed. At the end I thought, I did it and just felt so grateful. So the tears came again. And while laying there I heard you voice Adriene so strong saying, you are loved and you are worthy. And I truly felt it in my heart and soul. So you guessed it I started crying even more. So thank you so much Adriene for this Home journey and helping me process this old pains. I'm forever grateful, Namaste
Thank you, Adriene <3

I was feeling rather agitated and distracted when I came to my mat for Day 30 of Home and then realised that there would be no instructions from Adriene and almost didn’t do the practice because I didn’t think I’d be able to concentrate without being told what to do!  I’m so glad that I stuck with it, though! The 40 minutes flew by and there was something so serene and mindful about just doing the practice to music and focusing more on the movements and how they felt.  I feel like a different person and really proud to have completed the full 30 days.  I feel stronger, calmer and more flexible after finishing the Home series.  Thank you so much, Adriene! You are a yoga superstar!

Breathes. I'm still emotional typing this out right now. This practise opened & embraced my heart, and it's a real comfort. Adriene, you've been in my daily life for 2 years now, & I'm always grateful. The start of the year has been a challenging one, as I'm now away from home & in a new country alone. Thankfully for this practise, I had the space to appreciate myself in how far I've come, how much I've endured, how well I've done that I don't give myself credit for. Once again, I was reminded how to love myself. & that it's okay. It will be okay. I'm home.

WOW!  Scary and amazing.  Thank you Adriene, I can't believe how much I have learned over the last 30 days.  Thank you, thank you, thank you to you and your team for the videos.  You have encouraged and motivated with love and kindness. This is only the beginning.

HOME was my first journey into yoga, the first time I pushed away all the limiting beliefs that yoga was boring and not my cup of tea, and just pressed play. And it was one of the most amazing experiences. I came to the mat every single day, despite the challenges life throws at us. I came to the mat at 3 am and at 11:00 pm. I had days where it seemed too hard, and days where it felt effortless. It thought me to trust myself, to listen to what my body needs and wants, to feel that elusive self-love, to let go of negativity and toxic anxiety, to relax my shoulders, and to breath. Thank you, Adriene, for bringing this light into my life!

I did it!  Thank you so much!  I am a day late - in the UK.  Thank you so much.  I started off last year just doing the short 10 minutes ones - always in a rush to get the day going, but this time I followed through. It is now becoming a habit every morning and if I miss it, my day is never the same.  Adriene, you are an inspiration and a beautiful gentle teacher. Namaste!
I want to thank you sincerely, in my own mother tongues: Tack. Kiitos. <3
Who else wanted to make Adriene so proud? We did it! And you know what? I'm proud of myself :) Namaste.

I feel so emotional finishing Home! I've never ever been able to commit to something in this way, and my GOODNESS has it changed me in ways I never imagined. I think the main thing I have learnt, which is something I hope to carry with me for the rest of my life, is to accept myself exactly as I am in this moment. No judgement, no guilt, no shame. Just seeing where I am and knowing that I already possess everything I need to both succeed and just 'be'. I feel so much more content and strong and centred within myself and I hope I can keep this going for as long as I can. And how amazing to have learnt so much that I could do an entire practice with no audio cues! Thank you endlessly, Adriene. You are an incredible soul.

Thank you so much for this 30 day journey! ❤ It has meant a lot to me. ❤ Today I coreographed my own flow - did what my body and mind needed. Thank you for couraging for that. ❤ You are beautiful in and out Adriene. ❤

Thank you for this Adriene. This has changed me in so many levels. I decided to start this year healthy, mentally and physically and this has helped me so much. It's been a wonderful month for me, 0 anxiety and learning so much about myself, all thanks to this, to you. The universe showed me your videos in the moment I needed it. This took me home, and now I know that even if I feel lost, I can always come back home, always. Namaste, from the heart.
In the end with tears in my eyes I remember all this journey - my first conscious day-to-day journey with my inner voice, that guided me to join you. Tears of gratitude ❤️ Namaste!

Thank you for sharing your spirit and your gift with this beautiful community. You've inspired me and countless others. Because of your channel, I've found the courage and the commitment to maintain a daily yoga practice. Today was Day 762 in a row for me. My body feels stronger and slimmer and more capable of handling life's challenges. Sometimes I watch your videos, sometimes I do my own self-guided home practice, sometimes I go to a class... but I'm always incorporating the skills and the concepts and the flow that I've gained through practicing with you as my guide. I'm planning to move from my home in St. Louis this year to a new city, and it's brought up some triggers for me about what HOME means. This 30-day practice was right on time. I AM HOME. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

All 30 days done 🎉, congratulations everyone we made it home 😊 , thank you so much for guiding us and making it possible for all of us to love and care for ourselves together regardless of the distance , we love you so much 💜 I wish you all the happiness in the world, and honestly I did miss your voice a lot 💔

I am so proud of myself for getting to the end of this journey! I was afraid at first I wouldn't know what to do but I felt so guided through the whole practice by all the lessons you've taught me during this journey! Today was like doing yoga next to a friend rather than a teacher and I loved the opportunity to take my own path home. Thank you for this journey!
Also, the fact that the practise was unedited allowed for more Benjie time, he really put a smile on my face.

Welcome home everyone. We have arrived. By the end of the video, I didn't want the music to end. This will be the tune I hum when I need peace from now on. It felt a little odd not to have your voice guide me and actually having to look at the screen (I do most of the practices with my eyes shut if I can help it). But I found myself imagining what you would say, root to rise, downward dog paddle it out, close your eyes, bat your eyes open, bow down, Namaste.
Namaste to you, Adriene. So much love!

So happy to have taken the journey and to have arrived home,,,even if I never really left...but it is a different home here on day 30. A home where I feel more grounded and supported than I did at the end of 2019. Having Benji there was pivotal for me since I lost my Joey pup in September,  so for sharing him with me I am ever grateful. Thank you Adriene for your exceptional human touch and openness. Much Love.
Thank you !
Thank you so very much for guiding me through this beautiful journey home!
THANK YOU.

ADRIENE! I'm graduating TEACHER TRAINING tomorrow!!! I'm in the Rocky mountains in Colorado. An hour away from Denver (Shoshoni) and you were my first ever yoga video. You inspired me to do this. It's been so hard. But such a beautiful thing. I just want to say thank you. You mean so much to me. I LOVE YOU. NAMASTE

P.S. Red Rocks was amazing!

Thank you, Adriene. I am so happy to have completed this especially with so many life changes I went through in just 30 days. I stayed centered and came home to myself. I am so grateful for this practice. I can't wait to see all the beautiful things this practice will open my eyes to.

This whole series was just so beautiful and it's so bittersweet that it's over. Your videos, Adriene, and your lovely personality are what keeps me coming back to this channel everyday for the past few years. Through this series, I've found my love for yoga again and tried to really feel everything, rather than just going through the motions like I'd been accustomed to recently. For today's practice I had some incense burning and put rain sounds on in the bg, it was so relaxing. Through the whole journey my cat has been right next to me. I lay out a yoga mat next to mine and he sits on it as soon as it's time for our practice. Thank you so much Adriene! (and Benji) love you both. <3 namaste.

I just did the first session of 10,000 Tapping, after completing the 30 day Home practice. I think it was a good flow from one to the other and I really let out some emotions just like I do on the mat with Adriene. The organizer is trying to reach 10000 for the Maharishi effect, so we were encouraged to share. There are six tapping sessions left. This isn't normally my thing but I thought it was worth a shot and I'm glad I attended the first session. Maybe you could be too. https://www.unify.org/10000tapping
Aaand I'm crying (for the 4th year in a row....)

I truly feel that I have found my way home throughout this yoga journey. I feel I’ve built strength, resiliency, and a feeling of calm - both mentally and physically. I am ready for the remainder of 2020 and to continue to find my inner strength through the discipline of yoga. I am calm. I am strong. Thank you Adriene for being such a wonderful, passionate, caring, and guiding light to this community.

This is my third year doing the challenge. This year was so special because my husband joined me for the first time. Thank you so much Adriene! Your a treasure on this earth and my family and I owe you! <3
Who else loved hearing the music from her previous 30 Day yoga series? Reminds me how long I have been loyal to Adriene and how loyal she has been to me. <3
Thankyou Adriene. Thankyou for bringing me home.

We did it!  It is clear that you are the most inspiring person I've ever knwon.Thank you  for the opportunity to practice yoga with you.

I was a day behind so today was my day 30. I've really noticed a change in my strength and flexibility over the last 30 days, even my toes seem more flexible, lol! I've done these 30 day YWA challenges for, I think, the past 6 years, so I knew what to expect on this day. I decided, just as a challenge, to do my own thing and not focus too much on what was on the screen. It made me slow down, relax and take my time. I have to admit, I did lose my focus a little trying to figure out how much time went by. I got it back and carried on until the final namaste. Can I just say, I got a little emotional at the end. I know you'll have more for us throughout the year, and I can't wait to see you all again soon! Until then, keep rocking the tree poses and one-legged pigeons 😀 Namaste everyone 🙏🤗
Thank you. This was a lovely end to the 30 day. Adriene, I'm not the first person and certainly not the last you've inspired into a yoga practice. I'm immensely grateful to you.
Such an emotional experience. Thanks for helping me find my way back home ❤ Cant wait to continue my yoga journey with you! Namaste
Absolutely beautiful from beginning to end.  Loved the practice and the music and you and Benji.  Thank you so much.  Brought me to tears...💕

Finding that grace that comes with moving with intention and integrity again feels like coming home and makes these day 30 self-lead yoga practices so special.


This is my 5th year of doing the 30 day yoga journey with you. Thank you for reminding me to come home again.

I cannot believe that I made it, however one day late, but I am so proud of myself and everyone who decided to take this journey! I’m usually not a weeper but at the end of this video I couldn’t hold my tears of joy, it was absolutely beautiful and I want to say Thank You, Adriene, for being such an important inspiration and for encouraging me and the whole FWFG community!❤️
Tears of joy rolling down my smiling face...thank you! ♥️(Montreal, Canada 🇨🇦)

Adriene, thank you, I’m full of gratitude for you! Injuries have kept me off the mat for about 8 months and you really did bring me back #home. I am back and I am strong and my heart is full. I feel blessed to have found your channel in 2015. 🙏✌️❤️

Well that's it, I'm addicted now!! I usually make excuses for not having enough time for myself or exercise, but  the difference in my strength,  balance and flexibility after just 20 - 30mins a day is so rewarding - I am truly hooked and will continue with another 30 day journey tmw!! And guess what, the world doesnt fall apart when you take time out for yourself - thank you for reminding us of this!!
Miss hearing your voice for the final part of the journey. I would love to be able to practice these last day of your 30 day challenges with a reposted narrated version.

This was a beautiful practice and just what I needed. I've been in the process of moving and I started the practice feeling the weight of stress finally release, and spent the first five or so minutes crying. But I gave myself the space to do so and by the end I was crying tears of joy. While I didn't feel yet at home in my new place, this journey made me realize I am home no matter where I am, simply because I'm there. And this is only the beginning, not the end. Thank you Adriene. Can't wait to continue home with more yoga! All my love to you Adriene and to everyoneon this journey with me. ❤️We aren't alone.

I saved day 30 for today, when I returned home after a 3 week road trip.  What better way to celebrate!!!  As usual on day 30, there were tears, but also a great feeling of togetherness with Adriene and Benji and all my fellow Home-ees!  Thank you Adriene!!!!!! ❤️  ...and now on to KISS !
Benji was/is so sweet
Thank you so much, Adriene. Much love to all of you! 😍
we made it ! thank you it was a very teaching and grounding journey to 'Home'

That was very hard for me. I just couldn’t keep a good flow going. Nonetheless, I have loved the 30-day journey and want to keep doing yoga everyday. It’s done wonders for my mental health. I feel a bit lost on how to keep going! What are others doing?
I had a really hard time with this one too, but moving into the 2020 February calendar KISS, starting with "Fill your cup" , was encouraging and refreshing. Keep going! You got this!

Such a beautiful soul you are, Adriene. Your love and compassion touches me every time. Deep gratitude for your loving spirit and gifts.   Your smile at the end of this practice had me in tears. Thank you also for your beautiful letters, I always look forward to reading your thoughts and wonderful insights. ❤️

As always (!!!), thank you so very much, Adriene! For your kind, caring, beautiful heart. Thank you for giving us these 30 day yoga journeys, for your all-year round videos, and for giving us the tools. You truly are a gem! (YES, I'M EMOTIONAL! lol)

Edit: Could you please provide us the tracklist for this video?! There were some beautiful songs on that one!

This was perfect. Thank you so much! I am so glad I made it through the 30 days, so proud of me and of all the beautiful people around the world.
Thank you Adriene, for helping all of us every day! ♡

Thank you so much Adriene. This was so beautiful. After many years of practising with you I finally got how to Find what Feels Good and not do what I assume I should be doing. I even did some poses I traditionally always groan at ....because it felt good !! Thank you , thank you , thank you ...Namaste <3
I can't believe I managed to do that after only thirty days. Thank you, Adriene. You give me a chance to believe in myself <3

Ahhh... I will always that smile in the intro - the one where you hold a mug in your hands. This video went so fast. This "Home" journey went so fast. I legit spent 10 - or so - minutes more at the end. I definitely didn't have the time to do everything that I wanted, though. I loved how we went into the boat pose combo at the same time. How you went into poses when I was just thinking about going into them. I loved the flow. This must be one of the very best practices I've ever done. Plus, the tracks were perfectly chosen!!! I read the poem (?) at the end and it teared me up! I don't want this to end, ugh! Still, I feel like I'm getting where I want to be. A bit slow but I'm enjoying the process. Maybe, it's just that: a journey. Might as well breathe deeply and go with the flow while enjoying (and learning from!) the bumps <3

Last year was my first 30 day challenge, and then I continued all year (I cried on that last New Year's eve practice as I finished up my goal). This year's challenge I was joined by my husband, our daughter and her boyfriend (and millions of other wonderful souls across the planet). I can't thank you enough, Adriene! You have changed my life and you are shifting the planet one asana at a time, teaching us how to love ourselves and each other. Bless your contagious energy, kindness and grace. Namaste, Laya
Is it normal to cry at the end? Thank you, Adriene. 😭🧘🏻‍♀️🙏🏻
Didnt think I could do a whole silent yoga class....but I did, and even freestyled some! It felt empowering and strong.

This has been an amazing journey. At the end of the practice, I couldn't help but give my self the biggest, warmest hug. I felt so happy and loved. this has been such a wonderful 30 day journey of reconnecting with my self, dedicating time for my self, getting to know myself and eventually getting back home to me! Thank you so much, Adriene <3
There were quite a few times where I thought, "hmmm doing this move would feel good" and then I would look at the video and you were doing it too!

Absolutely loved this 💜 30 days of yoga - it teaches us so much. Thank you Adriene for this gift - where did January go?! Such an uplifting start to 2020 and very special to experience yoga alongside whatever I brought to the mat each day. A really wonderful experience.

One month ago doing a full 40 minutes yoga non stop would have made me run of breath and sweat profusely but this time it just feels like it's the right intensity. Thank you for making me and everyone else here stronger, physically and mentally. We heart you Adriene and Benji!
30 days went by so fast and I loved each and every one of them! Thank you so much for this glorious experience!! Namaste🙏❤

Thank you so much Adriene! It's been six years now that i've been practising with you and every year at the end of the 30-day yoga Challenge I cry like a baby....because i still find it hard to believe how far i've come in my practice and what amazing things yoga has brought into my life. I practised every day of this challenge even if I had to stay up till midnight to do it, even when i felt super tired and then yesterday, on the last day, the most important day, i had a stomach bug and was simply bed-ridden. Absolutely gutted that for the first time i could't finish on time but it was all worth it when i finished it today, every second of it. I'll definitely repeat the program and happy to say I've convinced others to do it too. So again Namaste for all the magic and joy you bring into our lives. We love you :) xxx

Hi Adriene...and most of all, thank you.  Piggybacking on what Dianne Graham said earlier, I hear your voice also saying, "find your center", "I show up because you show up", "you got this", and many more encouraging messages.  You are an excellent teacher.  Day 30 taught me that my practice is still good if I make it my own....it's okay to pet my dog during practice (loved when Benji got onto your mat), I can pick lint off my mat during a pose, I can find what feels right and hold some poses longer than others ("my version"), etc.  I am grateful for you popping up in my IG feed in late December--what a blessing this has been.  I look forward to following your monthly calendar prompts as well as the 30-Day Challenge in 2021.
This is a piece of art...thank you for all that you give

I enjoy the Day 30 practice so much, even though it’s so challenging! I always start off knowing what I want to work on, and then somewhere in the middle I start to feel lost so always look to you, Adriene, until I find my flow again. I built a sweat, stretched my tired muscles, and enjoyed the process. But when the “Home” music started, right before the end, I just lost it - overcome with emotion! 😭💕

I usually dislike the final day of the 30-day yoga challenges - not bc I don't like the practice, but the silence is a challenge.  I've found after years of doing at-home yoga with Adriene, I tend to do it nearly all with my eyes shut and just follow the cues, so the silent practice totally throws me off (and makes it much less relaxing than usual).  This year, I found a happy medium of looking up when I needed to, being okay with finding my own flow, and if I wasn't synched up when I popped my eyes back open, I just realized I was okay with that and found what felt good.  Great 30-days to start 2020 :o)

Unpopular opinion: This was my first time participating in 30 days of yoga and day 30 was so disappointing for me, I cried. I like the structure of someone talking me through the breathing and the poses. That’s why I play videos instead of referring to the pictures of poses you can find on Pinterest. I don’t want to stare at someone or a picture... I want the guidance of someone talking me through it. To each their own I guess... 🤷‍♀️

While I completely understand the purpose of this practice and the feeling of empowerment a lot of people received through doing whatever felt right, I completely agree with you, Alyssa, and felt like a lost puppy and a little let down.  I really missed that guidance and am happy it was just one day out of thirty.

I wanted to really enjoy this practice so I delayed doing it a day as it was unbelievably hot in Melbourne yesterday. Best decision, as I could really give this practice my full attention and felt so content and proud of myself at the end. First time commenter but have been following along every day :)) thank you so much for everything you do Adriene, but specifically for creating such a needed 30 day practice to start this year off with. Much luv to you and Benji x
Thank you for this 30 day yoga practice, it has helped me a lot and I am very thankful for it.

Today was so so amazing! First of all, it was the day of me completing my goal to do this challenge and I'm so so grateful for your loving guidance along the way. There have been a huge amount of times over last year and this year that I've felt really useless and like I couldn't do things but you've helped me to do it! I feel such a massive sense of achievement and self love! As the challenge has gone on, I've been able to love myself so much more and look after myself better and I'm so so grateful to you Adriene. Secondly, the idea of Day 30 has always really daunted me! I always thought there was no way I'd be able to practice on my own! I was really worried I'd get bored, run out of ideas of what to do next, or I wouldn't make use of the time properly. And for 40 minutes? No way! But wow! Today was I think my favourite day of the whole challenge! Thank you so much Adriene for helping me to enjoy this challenge so much!!! I can't wait to continue the year with this new mindset and I can't wait to carry on practicing yoga this year! Namaste everyone!!!! xxxxx
Love to you and yours!  Namaste
Heck yeah, we did it! ❤️
It was a lovely practice ❤️. I did miss your voice.... and watching the tv to see where we were was a bit of a pain but nonetheless, thank you for this wonderful month of yoga, love and discovery ❤️

I am here with you today. The journey hasn't been easy, but anything worth doing takes time. As this practice closes, I'm so grateful to be a part of the journey with you all. Hello Adriene!
A huge Thank You for all the Yoga journey! It makes me feel better in many ways :)
There is also two small things I would consider to change in the future.
One thing is: when you turn to the camera when doing the first side, then I have to turn away from the screen to do the same move. Sometimes I tried to do opposite side first, but that's confusing for me. So for me it would be easier to follow, if you did the other side first, so I could watch it while I'm doing it.
The other thing is really not that important and personal preference. I kept wondering why you chose to show us your pretty butt in close up every single day in the intro. For me it seems to private and a little inapropriate for the seriously good yoga you are doing.
The best thing about this series: all the precious thoughts beyond the shapes!
We did it 🧡i did it 🧡i m so happy even if it was to fast ! I was crying a lot today 🙏thank you so  much Adrienne 🧡with you i found my way back on my yoga practice 🧡🧡🧡🧡

Hey Miss, I've been watching your videos for 5 years now, and I have started the 30-day challenge for the past 4 years. This was the first year that not only I made it past day 4 but actually made it all the way to the end. I am so proud of myself, I am so grateful for you.


Day 30 was a surprise, with no guidance for over 30 minutes of practice. I started out fearful that I couldn't make it, but I did. I stuck with it. Tears of joy at the end of the practice today. And now I intend to continue the practice.

Thank you Adrienne! Thank you for everything you and all the compassion, patience and humility you share and teach with. You’re an actual angel on this 🌍 It’s been so beautiful experiencing these 30 days with everyone 🙏🏿💗

Beautiful, Adriene. Many tears have I shed this day. I cannot express how Life has truly woven for me a beautifully meaningful path, of which this Home yoga journey has played a special part. All of life is the journey but I wrote a story which has evolved and evolved over the years. There’s a small seed, stuck alone under the earth. Finally… finally she begins / I begin my long journey out into the light of day. Your quote for today fits perfectly. The metaphors of my story-tale-life… Thank you for all of it. Wonderful practice without the talking, and yet very difficult as there was so much to flow through and, without the voice, it was very difficult to authentically remain centred. Thank you thank you thank you Adriene ! For this role you are playing in my life and the lives of so many. May I continue the yoga with you and may my body, mind and heart grow so strong 💪 !!! I hope I hope I hope 🤞 ! Much Love… 💕

I feel like i'm missing out on something because I simply cannot do it without any audio cues. Yes, I have the "vocabulary", yes I generally know what order we're going to do certain poses. But without something (or something - a bell?) telling me when to goto the next thing, I'm constantly forced to look at my screen and it takes me out of the practice and makes me very frustrated. I don't want to sound ungrateful for this wonderful work. I've tried every year to do the 30 days and this is the first year I made it. THANK YOU for everything you do. I'm probably just being too literal-minded and not trusting myself enough to do it on my own without guidance. Maybe someday.

Like many one here I totally agree. I suggested in a separate comment that maybe they could do Day 30 with the mic on then Day 31 without the mic. I loved that Day 30 linked all the work we've done throughout the practice and wouldn't change anything but needed the guidance  to help me remember all the moves we've learnt. I love the idea of going it alone but it was too big a jump from Day 29

I felt the same way the first time I did a 30 day yoga with adriene and it ended up being a frustrated ending rather than a beautiful one haha, but I guess it's all about how we deal with it
Don't feel the pressure to do so many poses or the pressure to Know what to do, we simply don't know, we're not adriene at this stage of our journey 😅 so "find what feels good" even if that meant spinding the practice in child's pose and cat cow 😁 focus on breathing and Enjoying what you know, it's still frustrating I know but the more you do yoga the more you feel at ease in flowing between poses ( and you still wouldn't know what to do and it would still be different than when adriene guides you)
But I guess we're doing our best and that's what matters :)
Have a lovely day
