I've been having one of the hardest weeks of my life. Yesterday someone I care very much about decided that he needs some space for the time being. My heart aches because of how much love I have for him. I couldn't get out of bed once I got home. I could barely get myself to eat and drink water. I felt like a failure because I hadn't missed a single day of this journey, but the last one was finally where I missed it. But this morning my mom has been encouraging me to move, and I decided that I'm going to finish this journey. Today will be far from easy, but I'm grateful for being strong enough to do something for me, just me, even if this is the only thing I can muster on my own all day. I'm so thankful for this community for keeping me motivated the last 30 days, but especially today. The best parts of my days have been coming to the mat and doing something that I knew I was doing just because I wanted to do something kind for myself.
Thank you, Adriene. Thank you, John O'Donohue, Mary Oliver and everybody!

I can't believe it 30 days already! What a 30 days has this been! This whole journey to arrive at the end back HOME was filled with gratitude, joy and a special feeling that this is really a journey with myself to I. I turned 40 on day 29 (your lucky number, Adriene!!), and I admit I had intentionally started this journey to somehow "complete" these four decades of life. I think this was one of the best choices ever! I didn't have too much problem with showing up because after about three days these little sessions became actually addictive! I tried to use our special vocabulary all day long, not just for the practice - and somehow this made me more balanced and calm. Thank you so much Adriene that you were part of this special journey to my special birthday and thank you for teaching me that sometimes it's just better to do what feels good rather than do what you think you should do... Namaste!
Dear Adriene, this was a real prayer. So happy and thankful for the great gift you made to us with this journey. I found my home which I felt I had lost :-). Love and kisses from Germany.

wow...beatuiful... cried the whole way through..in every pose as I am still dealing with my dad's passing..but I did it we did it and it really did bring me Home.  Thank you to our teacher Adriene..Namaste to you and lots of love back.

Home has been my absolute favourite year yet. Thank you so much Adriene for creating and sharing this journey. I am not overly emotional, but I really did well up at the end there. Namaste to you, and to everyone I shared this journey with. What a privilege it has been. Thank you.

Man, this was a really new experience for me. In dancer's terms: it felt like leading and following at the same time, where I'm only used to following. At 30 minutes I felt a bit lost as to what to do, but lucky you were there, Adriene, to guide and inspire. Thank you thank you thank you so much.

What a perfect end practice to incorporate everything we’ve learnt on this yoga journey together. I can’t tell you how my body has transformed. I feel confident, empowered, strong! And this is a lot coming from a person who at one time felt completely out of control of my own body. It’s true the saying, ‘the best things in life are free’ because yoga is the one of the few things in life that nourishes mind body and soul, it’s magical. You can come back to it any time or anywhere and it’s there, waiting. I can’t thank you enough Adriene for the amount of hours and sheer hard work you put it in each and every day to give us free yoga and your touching emails reminded us to appreciate the little things and beauty that’s everywhere in life. Your support and guidance is what pushes us all to complete each practice. When we feel things are maybe out of our comfort zone, you come in with ‘feel that fire in the belly’ with a smile on your face and we know there’s nothing to be afraid of because ‘we got this.’ You’re an incredible teacher, and someone we love and trust, who wants the best for us. There’s not a materialistic bone in your body and you encourage us all to find happiness in ourselves and practice self love. Thank you once again for this outstanding 30 day yoga. I will continue with the monthly practices with new strength, wisdom and flow. Love to all my fellow yogis, and congratulations for completion! I’m so proud of myself and everyone else. 💪🏼💛❤️🧡💚💙🎈☀️🌤🌈🌟🌝🌸🌺🌻

31 days ago I decided to follow the HOME journey (now fondly known to me as Yoga with Adriene with Adrienne). I've never done one of these month long journeys, and never really committed to something like this before, not fully anyway. But I figured, why not? Some mornings I didn't want to get up, but I did. Other mornings, I was up before my alarm. Some days, I had company next to me on the mat and others it was just me. Some days (especially this week), I came home and turned to another video just to help me decompress from a tough day. But, every day, I did it. I don't normally post comments, but these 30 days have meant something more to me - they have shown me what I can do and what I want to do - and I couldn't miss the opportunity to thank you for this video, for this series, and for this opportunity to challenge myself and truly commit to something. Thank you, Adriene, and thank you to all the others practicing along with me - it has truly been an inspiration.

There's this Radiohead song called Lift and as I was listening to it today it reminded me of the theme of this year's practice. Somehow both the meaning of the song and the concepts of the practice merged and let me understand the philosophy of yoga. It was one of those moments that made me go "Ohhhhhh I get it now".

Great song btw, I recommend it.
Wow good job thank you

Before I started doing Yoga with Adriene, my balance was so distraught that I couldn't even think of standing with my feet together. I have bi-lateral acoustic neuromas(brain tumours) which are responsible for loss of balance. A year later, I can stand with my feet together for however long I want, can do high lunges. I couldn't believe when I actually did the half Moon pose the other day.
Adriene, you are healing the world, one person at a time. So much is wrong with the age we live in, yet here you are, guiding us through the impossible. You walked us home, and like a true Guru, today you leave our hands, smiling as we walk the rest of way. So many of us owe our lives to you. May you never have doubt how loved and valued you are. Guru Maa, Jai Namaste 🙏

About 2 weeks before I started this journey HOME I had recently finished your 30 days of Yoga with Adriene programme. That programme was the reason I started and stuck to doing Yoga every day and seeing that another 30 day programme was right around the corner made me so happy. I thank you, Adriene. I thank you for taking your time and putting heart and soul into these yoga practices. Every day I relearned to love myself a little more and be less harsh towards myself. At the beginning of this 30th day practice I sat down on the mat and cried. I couldn't believe it. In that moment I couldn't quite believe how quickly those 30 days actually passed by and how I did the daily practice EVERY DAY. But it really scares me how quickly time flies by. It feels like just yesterday I was 12 and this month I'm turning 17. I hope to keep the joys of yoga at my side for years to come. Namaste and thanks Adriene.

I dn't even know what to say and write that hasn't been said or written before to you.

We made it. And I’m so grateful. I’m stronger, more dedicated to my journey, and feel more at home. I’m so excited to continue this yoga journey. It’s the longest thing I’ve ever stuck at, day after day. Thank you, Adriene.

Wow, what a journey this has been 💞 thank you Adriene for guiding us HOME, for inspiring us to be our best versions every day, for making sure we take care of ourselves. I’m proud of myself for sticking with this, for completing it, for showing up even when I didn’t want to and I’m proud of each and every one of you who joined me on this journey! May we transfer everything we learned on the mat, off the mat. Namaste 🙏

Today felt like graduation, and I felt a similar sadness that this beautiful group practice is over, but also just so much gratefulness for this wonderful community and for you Adriene. While I was in the moves I could hear your voice saying "just let it all go", "move from center, from a place of connection", "relax your shoulders", "you got this", all of your helpful words have become a part of the movement for me and it's wonderful :) This is my 3rd 30-days with you, and this is the first one that I made it to the mat every single day no matter what, and I really learned this time that it is better to show up even if I'm tired and just breathe if I need to take a break between moves, because taking the time and space to just connect with myself, to let go of all other thoughts and worries and just be completely in the present moment, that that is truly the most important part of all of this for me, and it doesn't matter if I hit every pose "perfectly". The peace that I have found on the mat this last month has carried into my life in so many ways, this practice continually brought me back to myself, and nurtured joy and strength within me. I love yoga, and for years have wanted it to become a part of my daily life, but somehow I just never managed to create that space for myself, and your guidance has been immensely helpful in me finally creating that space. Thank you so very much for all that you do, for all of the time and energy that you and your team (and the ever-cute Benji) put into these videos and into your lovely emails, it has all truly made a positive impact on my life <3
Thank you Adriene for everything, this was an amazing journey home, glad I took it with you, Benji and everyone  ❤️ ❤️ ❤️
The music from the previous 30 day journeys made me realize how far I came with her❤️❤️❤️ WE DID IT AGAIN 😍😍 thank you Adriene ❤️❤️

After practicing yoga for almost 4 years, this is the first time I did it every day. Today I finished day 30 and I feel so grateful for this experience. It changed both my body and mindset. I even teared up during the end of this video! Also, as a Muslim, yoga makes me more God-conscious and it has a great affect on my soul. I am soon to be married to a Muslim man originally from India and we all know things are not going well there at the moment with their Indian version of Trump. I pray we can all be united by our differences. Thank you again, Adrien. Namaste. Or like the Muslims say; as salamu alaykum (may the peace be with you). Sending my love to everyone from my little corner in the Netherlands.

What a blessing and a gift the HOME journey has been for me! I know I’m always writing about my spiritual self, but when I looked in the mirror, after practice, I noticed my body was, awake - nice posture, toned stomach, and my face was bright. I definitely want to continue!

I feel refreshed.

Thank you Adriene, for guiding us home. Covering and blessings upon you, and everything and everyone in your heart.


Love.

Thank you dear Adriene. Thank you for yet another amazing 30 day challange. It's been five years since I first started doing yoga with you. I started with your 30 day challange. During this video I found myself doing the same poses as you witgout even looking at the video. I have learnt your flow and your steps. It was amazing. Thank you from the botoom of my heart ❤️

I can't even begin to describe how healing this session was for me. I remained with my breath, in my FULL body throughout the entirety of this video. I got giddy with how many things I knew how to do, and how naturally it came to me as long as I was breathing. In this session I melted away years of self doubt and limiting beliefs that I can't do anything on my own, or I'm not good enough. In the middle of this session I started rocking some crow pose because I got so excited that my toes left the ground last time. I go in for my second round of toes off the ground, and POP I had a split second of panic before I realized I wasn't in pain. I had popped a significant portion of a calcium deposit on my left wrist. I mean, this thing was at least an inch round and I thought for sure I would need surgery to come close to fixing this problem. It's been on my wrist for 7 years now, and has caused me tension all the way up into my shoulders. Seven years. And it popped during my journey home. That's no coincidence. I'm so humbled, grateful, and in awe right now. The perfect ending to our journey home. Thank you for this practice and thank you for marching alongside all of us. Namaste, Adriene and so much love and gratitude your way 🙏❤🥰
So much love and gratitude for this practice. THANK YOU dear Adriene, your work is amazing and you give so much to the world! Namaste from sunny Zürich :sun:

Thank you, Adriene. When I started practicing yoga with Adriene there were two 30 day challenges. At the end of each year I look forward to the new one. The last couple of years I have done yoga almost every morning - you basically bring the ease into yoga 🌿

This was especially powerful for me, this day...I just got off a plane after traveling for almost two weeks, and am now back in my dorm room, exhausted but happy. I had forgotten what the whole journey was about these past couple weeks, just lost in making sure I did each day. But now I feel so fulfilled and renewed. THANK YOU Adriene, and THANK YOU yoga community! You all are beautiful and more powerful than you know, and whether you have just finished this round of the journey, have a few more days to go, or have just started, congratulations. May you rediscover the strength within yourself every day! Namaste.

Deepest gratitude to you, Adriene. These past 30 days have been transformative. This last class ended on my birthday and what a beautiful class it was. Downward dog doesn’t hurt so much, I finally did a few push ups again without my right shoulder collapsing. I couldn’t believe it.

I forgot about the last day’s tradition, and while I felt sad that our Home journey has come to an end, it felt like a badge of honour in a way that I could practice quietly with you. Almost like I’d earned the spot after these 30 days.

Once again even though it’s never enough, thank you so so much for this yoga series. I never let a day go by without joining in because I knew that this community was a place to come to when I needed to relax at home.

My gratitude is immense and I’m ending today’s practice truly full of love. May 2020 be a brilliant year for all of us! Namaste ❤️

Love you and thank you Adriene for creating something so special...but also making it seem like we're all creating something special together. 💖

Thank you so much, Adriene. ❤️ This journey has helped me connect to my body in ways I don’t think I ever have. My body & my mind are my home, no matter I go in life, and it’s been so amazing realizing what that means to me.

I am strong, capable, & worthy, even when it doesn’t seem like it. I showed up even when I thought I wouldn’t. I found myself deeply appreciating my body when I’ve spent half my life resenting & hiding it. I found an inner strength and balance I didn’t know I still had. I came to the mat with anxiety, happiness, exhaustion, irritation, sadness, and always left it feeling stronger. Like for a moment, with my body & breath connected, I was in control. I could go on, but the gist is — THANK YOU. ❤️ Looking forward to continuing this journey in Feb!

Thanks. It is my second year  doing the 30 day challenge. I am 80 pounds lighter and much healthier. Not bad for a 65 yr old. I appreciate all you do and the great community that is yoga with adrien. I find all of you just incredible.  Thank you all!

I live in a motorhome (bus). We travel from Ontario, where we live in the summer to Nanaimo, BC, where we stay in the winter. I joined the gym last year when we were here, to stay in shape and weight train to keep myself strong for our handicapped 66 pound dog who we have to lift in and out of our motorhome. Last summer, we spent so much money on having some of her bad teeth removed and so many other things that in our budget, (we are retired) I couldn't justify spending the money to rejoin the gym. It rains here, a lot. I saw a pop up shed on sale here recently, made of tarp material and steel poles that I asked my husband to buy me as an early birthday gift. My birthday is in July. I popped it up beside the bus, lined the floor with a tarp, put some jigsaw mats in it and voila.... Yoga hut! Every day I've been going out to the little She Shed and doing 2 sets of 10 pound dumbell lifts, 2 sets of 50 squats, a plank that I increase every day by one second (I'm up to 2:17) with your January daily yoga session in the middle. It's me time, it's glorious and I'm proud to have done it every day except for two snow days. Thank you so much for all you do here. You and Benji and that lovely calming voice, with the twinge of humour and the creak in the floor. I've loved every second. Namaste! 🧘

This is the first time I've actually completed a 30 day challenge and I feel so incredibly amazing! In the beginning it was also hard to find stillness and I had such a hard time slowing down, truly feeling the sensations of each movement..I had definitely been just going through the positions. THANK YOU for teaching me to slow down, to find what feels good, and to always make that journey back home! 💜💜

I left my beautiful home country of Brazil when I was 18. Since then I travelled very much but it was not until I had my children that felt homeless.
The need of providing then grounding took me on a journey where my heart become my Home. It’s no need to wave a flag anymore. I live on planet Earth and wherever I am with my family it’s exactly where I belong. I am HOME and so are they.
Beutifull start of the year!
I am so gratfull for what you do and all that people around the globe that took this journey with me.
Much Love! Namaste
Sooooo goooood... Thank you Adriene for another 30 days of yoga journey! It has been a comfort, magic, & a true pleasure to be with you each day. I love you back ❤❤❤ Namaste
A journey to feel I have all I need because you dare to share that journey with me. Thank you and you are all that we needed.

This was the best way of ending this ride Home. I struggle with inconstancy so much, that this 30 day experience was in the beginning a way of proving myself that I could finish something. But little did I know that this would not become into another to-do list, but into a new way of living, a new way of exploring myself and my body. Every day I noticed an improvement and discovered new things (at the beginning I couldn't even do downward facing dog properly, or reach the ground without bending my knees a lot in forward fold). Today I let myself explore and do quite a lot of "freestyle", and it felt so amazing and liberating. As you say "trust me, trust yourself, trust the practice". So much internal grow for me in only 30 days.
I cannot thank you enough for this. Thank you Adriene, namaste. 🌸

Dearest Adriene,
Even after four years of your challenge, I still get tearful on the last day. It’s like saying goodbye to a friend . A friend who has your back.😇🥰
I am in awe at what amazing souls you and Benji are. Giving the gift of yoga for free to millions. It’s refreshing to know people like you are here. You are changing the world. Exposing people to this wonderful and nurturing self practice. I think your my modern day hero.🦸‍♀️

In thirty days I’ve seen my body morph into a well oiled machine. The improvements in postures, poses and mental health are impressive.

I hope to catch you this year when you come to Red Rocks. You and Benji have gotten me through deaths, break ups, loss of dogs, births, changes good and bad. Namaste 🙏

Redemptive. It’s the only word I can think of right now, what this practice has meant to me. Day 30/31. I’ve made it. I’ve done it! Gone are the days where I call myself a quitter and believe it. I’m not a quitter. I did it. By myself. I finally attempted, trusted, crow pose. I’ve never given it my all before- because I told myself I’d fail before I even tried. How often do I do that in life? Probably too often.
I showed up. I journeyed. I ~trusted~. I slow danced with myself and cried; knowing I have my back now, just like I did then. Through it all, I’ve been here for me. Home.

Thank you so much, Adriene for sharing this journey. During today's practice, I accidentally exhaled and spooked my cat by blowing air into her but hole.  On a more serious note, I wasn't sure if I wanted to go all in and commit to 30 days but I just went for it and tried not to overthink it. I am so glad I did, I felt great starting off the spring semester of college having this accomplishment to be proud of.
I did it!! Regardless of all obstacles and challenges, I showed up every single day. Thank you, thank you SO much for your gentle guidance 🙏🏼💕🥰🙏🏼
I did it!! Regardless of all obstacles and challenges, I showed up every single day. Thank you, thank you SO much for your gentle guidance 🙏🏼💕🥰🙏🏼
thank you Adriene, Namaste 🤍

This feels like a parent teaching a child to walk or to ride a bike, taking the child through every step of the way and when the parent knows the child can do it now on his own, they let go but not completely as they are always going to be right behind the child to catch him if he ever falls. This felt just like that Adriene. You fill my heart.
Is there a way to get a list of what these music pieces are? Thank you!

I was literally sobbing before this practice. Like, one of those loud I'm so tired cry sessions that even your animals look at you like 'woah'. I didn't want to do it. I didn't care that it was the last day(not anyones fault, just not sleeping enough recently). I also didn't feel creative. I've done these 30 day series with her before, so I know what it means. Still sobbing, I pressed play and... I had one of the most meaningful sessions I've ever experienced. Thank you for this.
Thank you Adriene and Benji! Thank you my worldwide YWA family! What a joy to share this journey with all  of you. Namaste. <3
I trust you - thank you for helping me find the way home...Love from my corner of the world...Namaste..

I have to say today was tough.  I came to rely heavily at the end of my work day to come Home and feel like someone is guiding me and bringing me back to find my center. I couldn’t find my own voice and couldn’t hear yours.  I held my breath throughout the whole practice and constantly reminded myself to breathe. I was not expecting to fee l on my own. Woof this was hard to get past.  There were definitely tears, but I think of frustration.

For the first time I am going to have to put this last day on hold and do a shorter video. As part of my exploration of self I completed a calf tattoo that requires a few more days of healing. This series has helped me with my internal dialogue as well as my external body. I look forward to returning to this when my physical healing allows. Thank you for an amazing journey yet again.

I did not feel my best during this practice - but it didn't matter. It didn't matter that I was bloated and tired and stressed. It didn't matter that I often followed along with you Adriene instead of doing my own thing. All that mattered was I showed up for the journey. I am so proud that I have shown up every day for the last 30 days and I cannot thank you enough for bringing me this practice in journey in and incredibly tough emotional time in my life. Thank you for bringing me home ❤

It has been an honor to go on this journey with you all. When I started this journey, my intention was to follow through with what I started. I wanted to commit to showing up for myself every day to heal and grow and practice. This is the first time I have seen a 30 day challenge all the way through. The days flew by and stepping onto the mat today was such a magical moment. I wish you all the best with your practices moving forward. Thank you, Adriene for being a light for others to follow! Namaste!

Adriene Thank you so so much for this magical 30 days of journey with you ....it's truly been a blessing to witness small but many many changes in how this journey has effected me and my interactions with others .....will miss everyone doing this together:)
Thank you for this amazing experience, my body feels fantastic. I actually look forward to doing this every night before bed. Will there be more new challenges coming up?
We can continue our practice together with our free monthly calendars - https://yogawithadriene.com/calendar/ Follow along every day or drop in when you can. x

As soon as I said "Namaste" with you at the end, I bursted out crying and couldn't stoo for a good minute. I didn't expect this kind of reaction from me at all. It must have meany a lot more to me than I thought. Thank you so much Adriene. I feel so proud of myself and I can now believe that I love myself.

I thought I was going to have no clue what to do during this practice, which is obviously a normal thing, but my body took control and knew what it needed. And it was the most emotional and amazing thing to just sit back and realize...wow. I am HOME❤️

Dear Adriene, Benji, and the entire YWA team,


Words cannot describe the amount of gratitude in my heart right now. Thank you for all that you do. I could not have gotten through January without HOME.


I was reminded throughout the practice how much of an impact YWA has been in my life. I joined the YWA family in 2016, and had the honor of completing REVOLUTION as my first 30 days of yoga. Then TRUE. DEDICATE. and now, HOME. Thank you for being such a light in my life, constantly reminding us all to return back HOME.


I wish you, Benji and the entire YWA peace, good health, happiness, and love, always.


Namaste ♡

I just finished and I'm crying tears of peace and gratefulness. I am so happy to be able to share this with ya'll.  I actually cried at the beginning too when I realized I had to do this alone, but I was so encouraged by Adriene's words of "we have built the vocabulary, we got this." I allowed myself to let go and go for it. It was sooo beautiful... I'm going to go and enjoy crying some more now. THANK YOU to this wonderful community! (oh and I am also glad I'm not the only one who also kept hearing Adriene's voice in their head!)

Amazing way to finish this beautiful journey 📿🧘🏻‍♀️
Thank you so much Adrienne blessings for you 🙏🏼🪐🕉
NAMASTE ✨🌟💫
From my mat to yours with so much love. Thank you for the journey HOME.

Given the hour, it seems I will be part of the last group of people to do this last practice, on Day 30, January 31, 2020. I actually considered putting it off til tomorrow, even though I've done every day up to now. It's late, I'm tired and I've had some wine with dinner, but I feel like I must (I want to!) finish this journey I started with all of you, in all our varied abilities and circumstances. The comment section is so moving and I feel so emotional even before I start. I have thanked Adriene and her team in other comments, but here I want to thank all of you who have shared your struggles and found your way to the mat with me every day this month. I will definitely be breathing lots of love in, and lots of love out 💖🙏.
wooow... I'm just overall grateful for you Adriene and everyone else who stuck with this journey. I felt so alive and felt good to know I can trust myself. Thank you so much for everything. Namaste 🙏
I’m so happy I made it all the way and I’m happy to keep going. Truly thank you for this! ❤️😊
Namaste Adrien, I am strong. Thank you.
Thank you. bows gratefully to you and Benji ☆ You're incredible, we're incredible, I'm incredible!

Thank you so much for this beautiful journey, Adriene! I am so thankful for you and your hard work in putting together this wonderful journey for us. At the end of the 30 days, I am finding it easier to forgive myself for a multitude of things. That is huge for me because I'm a perfectionist to the point of it being unhealthy. Really, these practices have taught me so much about myself and I've been able to work on areas that desperately needed attention (perseverance and my abs mainly hahaha)! But anyway, from the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU!
Tears of gratitude came flowing out. Thank you so much for gathering this wonderful kula. ♥️🙏🏻♥️  Today is my 905th consecutive day of yoga because I found you back in 2017 and kept going.
Thank you so much for creating this amazing kula.
AMAZING! You are such an inspiration, Candice! xx
Thank you:) the time spent doing this practice with you has been previous.

A beautiful practice. I was unsure at first without the cues but as I moved my body seemed to know what came next. I love how you have been teaching these movements all along and they culminated in this freeing flow. Mentally and physically challenging. Sad the 30 day challenge is over but my goal for this year is to do yoga every day so I will be back for more. Thank you for your heartfelt teaching.
Day 30, being Home, check. It's been years since I've said something like that. To my Yoga Instructor A.Mish; those that have found their way Home and those still journeying... Namaste🙏.
Loved the journey home! Powerful elegant music to bring us through the 30th day! Thank You Adriene.🙏😊

it feels so good to accomplish such a positive and uplifting feat. So happy to do this with all of you around the world. Thank you, Adriene, for all that you do. You have such a powerful essence of unconditional love, and it is very contagious

This has been such a wonderful journey. I don't know if I've ever practiced anything 30 consecutive days before, but here we are. I don't know where to begin to explain how impactful this has been or how it has shifted my mindset, but maybe I can summarize it by saying that during this practice I did my own thing and when I was stuck I didn't stop, but instead asked myself "Where can I go from here?" and then I listened to what my intuition told me. I found myself in a pose I had never tried or even thought of before! In tree pose I opened my arms to my sides and tried a spinal twist. I fell on one side, but held it on the other. Thank you for this program, Adriene! I know the 30 days are over, but I'm sure I will see you again tomorrow. Much love from snowy Minnesota.
Thank you, beautiful. so much.
Thank you Adriene.  As always, I send you appreciation and love.  My fur baby does too :)
Thank you for this beautiful month, Adriene. I am so proud to be here at Day 30 with all of you. It was everything I needed and more.
"It ends in Gratitude"  Thank you Adriene and friends!
This month's journey Home is one of the only things that helped me make progress through the grieving of my dog's passing. Thank you from all four sides of my heart Adriene. <3

I finished it! I completed it! And I did not miss a day. Looking at my growth is amazing as always. To see my growth is a priceless treasure. I am beyond grateful for you and all you have done for my little world. If you see this please know that you have changed the world of a small town girl in Michigan. I hope that one day I can take a class in Texas with you! Namaste Adriene. Thank you for the journey!
i had to take a break part way through because I was so hot. BUT. I did it! I've attempted this 30 day thing for the last 3 or 4 years, but this was the first time I made it all the way through!

Long comment alert!!
This was really emotional for me. Particularly hearing the music that served as the themes for the previous years of the 30 Days of Yoga. It really struck me - more than usual - how long I've been practicing with you as a guide, Adriene. It may sound silly, but you are someone I "see" every day, and I appreciate that time so much. And it must be an exhausting endeavor to be the person that literally millions of people see every day. This series especially was a reminder of that, and I can't express my gratitude enough for the work that you have done and continue to do. Your guidance has strengthened my practice in ways I couldn't have imagined when I started practicing almost twelve years ago. May all the energy and love that you've given return back to you a thousand-fold!
Namaste, everyone - we did it!💙

Beautiful sentiment and I agree! There's something about that Yoga Revolution music especially that feels very emotional to me. I so appreciate this channel as a safe, supportive place to come to anytime. As Adriene says, she, and yoga, have our backs <3
I share the same feelings! It was beautiful
I felt the heart strings tug a little at the end, too!

My cat, Marmalade, was fixated on  Benji today. First time he's ever noticed him and while he was rather uneasy for some of the practice I loved day 30 the most. And from the comments I see I was not the only emotional person 😘. I committed myself mentally to this sometime early December. And even though I experienced an autoimmune flare up just after Christmas I started up Day 1 as planned. When I flare my feet, legs and back have strange sensory issues and the last thing I want to do if feel my body. BUT I stuck it out, breathed through it and had the quickest recovery yet with almost no anxiety about it. Ahhhh. Felt like sharing that. Thank you.🧘‍♀️

From Wilmington, NC thank you Adriene. This journey Home was great and has been a wonderful intro for my husband who joined me this year. We thank your for your guidance through this beautiful experience.💓

I didn't ever have time to check in the comments section, but I followed the journey and I am stronger and wiser for it. Thank you Adriene! My daily practice is a nonnegotiable part of my routine now and my life is better for it. <3

Adriene thank you so much for this wonderful journey Home! I truly enjoyed it and felt sense of accomplishment having completed the entire series for the first time. God Bless you and your team (including Benji :)

My goodness...I cannot believe I made it through these 30 days.  And because you made this feel like such precious and important time for ourselves, I only looked forward to each day.  I have to be honest, I did not feel very open minded when I read what we were going to do for this last day, but I happily surprised myself with how much I could move through the asanas with ease and confidence.  Definitely some room for improvement, it wasn't always graceful, but you accept what "is" and keep moving.  Thank you for opening my mind and my heart to what yoga is.  I'm a bit emotional on this last day as it's been what I looked forward to each day.  I hope to keep joining you on more of this journey and better my practice as time goes.  Thank you, thank you!  Bless you for being such an inspiration and really showing you care about all of us that watch you from our home studios. Peace from Illinois ✌🏻

This was the most cleansing practice I've done all month! It's amazing how we can tap into what feels good and learn to trust ourselves. This journey has been amazing and is something I will take with me; I feel so free. Thank you, Adriene, for helping me help myself. This 30-day journey has inspired me to continue to practice daily yoga here on out! My body and mind thank you. <3

I don’t know about this one. I loved it and at the same time I kind of missed your voice. During my usual practices I have grown accustomed to closing my eyes and to being in the moment, listening to your voice. Today, silence had me looking at the screen... was not totally able to settle. I missed you Adriene and totally sad that this was the last of the 30 days. Went by so fast. Tomorrow I shall start another... with your voice so
i can yet again close my eyes. 😘

wow I was not prepared for how emotional I would get at this last day of home. I really felt like I was moving with love and moving with control like you've taught us. Thank you for this amazing yoga series, you are awesome!!
Sorry.  This didn't work for me.  It's hard to relax into a pose and find proper body alignment when I have to keep looking at the screen.
That felt like sweet sweet gooey melted namaste caramel with a dollop of downward dog on the side.

Thank you, Adriene, for a beautiful beginning to 2020. We will be leaving Austin, TX (home for 26 years!) later this year for my hometown in IL to help my sister with our aging parents. It is truly a year to journey home. I have started your 30 day journey twice, and twice, life got in my way and I didn't finish. How fitting that the year I committed to going to my childhood home to find your 30 day yoga journey HOME. I don't believe in coincidence, but I DO believe in serendipity. This was serendipitous. I will continue along with you as often as I am able, and as I travel from one home to the other. Namaste.

I got discouraged at first because usually with the last day and the mic off I have a hard time following and panic too much to keep up. I didn't do anything too out of the ordinary this time, my joints are all over the place in stability anyway. But I did the flow for once, and managed to cry out some excess energy built up. I haven't cried for a long time, so.....guess that was needed. Thank you for this practice, like always.
From the bottom of my soul, thank you!

After 1.5 years of practising yoga by following and learning from other teachers (you are one of my favourites :D ), finally today I listened to you and did my own practice and finally I understood what finding my centre means. I am so happy. Thank you so much Adriene. God bless you!! Lots of Love from India. <3
It was an awesome, awesome 30 day journey and today I literally found my home (my centre). Thank You soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much :)
Completed 30days journey!!

Patience the Pup and I have been on this Journey for all 30 days (well, me for 30 days, she for most of those, when she wasn't off eating a snack in the kitchen). We didn't record them all, but we did a few -- here's <4 minutes of our final HOME practice, with breaks for tummy scratches, pup leans, tail wags, and some epic canine side-eye. https://youtu.be/FI6Cu_8mIZw
Whoa Nellie!  I needed that, emotionally and physically.  Thank you, Adriene (and Benji)!  ❤️WE DID IT!!! 🧘🏻‍♀️

I am so thankful for this journey. I’m not going to lie when Adriene said she was turning her mic off I panicked inside. Then I started following what my body was telling me felt good. Thank you Adriene, I am motivated for more!
Started two days ago.. looking forward to this journey 🙏🏽❤️
Thank you for hosting this journey, Adrian. We did it. I am proud and sad and so thankful.

Never have I done a ywa video without Adriene singing or talking about the carter family but here we are. How is this over already????! Definitely gettin that calendar for tomorrow so yk it's never over

I’ve been through three of these thirty day journeys so far and I nearly cried because I truly appreciated that I did in fact have all the tools I needed! I was able to fill all forty minutes, I was able to stay calm - let my mind stay calm, and not doubt myself. Thank you so much Adriene, for awaking this power inside all of us, it was an honor to practice with you these thirty days 💕🌙🙏🏻
Homeostasis - a (relatively) stable equilibrium between all bodily processes. Where a body naturally wants to be. I have found my way home.
What a beautiful experience this has been. Thank you. That it ended on this sacred day, Amartithi, was especially powerful. Jai Meher Baba!

This was one of the best yoga videos I've done. I smiled the biggest goofball when the Home theme song came on during the practice. I will def revisit this practice whenever I don't know what I want to do. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for helping us to our journey home.
My favorite day 30 in 6 years! 🌷

This is my third 30 day challenge, but this is the first time I’ve done day 30. I used to feel like I didn’t know what to do/ felt impatient because there was no guidance. This time I felt so excited to get to day 30!  This was a wonderful way to start this year, thank you for giving us this gift!

In all the past 30 days of yoga, I dreaded the final day. I felt lost in the silent practice. Home was the first day 30 that I was able to let go and find what feels good. Thank you, Adriene! Looking forward to February and another month of yoga. Congratulations to everyone on your Journey Home.

This was the most magical thing I've ever experienced. I almost cried alot, so much of this is pride at being able to see how far I've come and appreciate coming home. You are truly an inspiration and your yoga has changed everything for me is such a wonderful way. I feel so light hearted and slightly weepy (😂) but cant thank you enough for this beautiful experience 💕💕 I will be adding this to a weekly rotation because its perfect 💕

Finally completed day 30 .. a whole new experience of life .. a sense of calm , focus,peace and a sense of achievement .. this is not going to achieve by me if you were not there to guide ... Wonderful sessions and a commendable mentor #adriene . Thank you #adriene to be there for all of us ... #adriene namaste 🙏
Thank you, Adriene, you are a truly awesome being. 💕  Namaste
That was amazing! Namaste deep from my heart. Thank you Adriene. 🙏

This was my first “live” 30 overall really really enjoyable. Getting on the mat really is half the battle some nights. Once I do, I always appreciate it. Day 30 is fun to watch, I try to keep up.......not really but
I was able to do my own thing because of our wonderful teach 🍎

Going to head over to the fwfg site tomorrow for a day or 2 of rest and to try meditation and then back at it.

To all that are involved in making this happen, a sincere heartfelt thank you 🙏🧘🏻‍♂️
My journey is complete!  What a beautiful month, thank you Adriene!

Thank you once again for this. Todays journey brought me through places of goosebumps and incredible joy as I found.ndmy inner strength and wisdom.  I finished the class with a broad smile on my face, a warmth in my heart and tears my eyes. Thank you for guiding us back to our own home. Namaste x

Thank you Adriene, for starting my decade with a rekindled love for myself and my body. This year, I promised to trust myself again--to make a commitment to my heath, and stick with it. You made that so easy with this Home Journey, and I am truly so very grateful for the guidance and community you foster.
Thank You Adriene blessings to you and all those who accomplished this 30 day practice Namaste from a friend in Florida

Oh Adriene, you're such an amazing teacher that I could hear your voice guiding throughout the whole video. I want to thank you for being here for me, for us and  for sharing this lovely journey as you do every year. You can't imagine how much good you do. I hope you never leave us, I trust you have our backs. Now I feel healthier, stronger and loving my body just as it is. I did this last class late cause I didn't want Home to end, I think this 30 day yoga journey has been one of your best. Gracias por esta experiencia tan hermosa, gracias de todo corazón desde el cálido hemisferio Sur. I love you Adriene, see you tomorrow of course for the new  February calendar. We did it, we are home. Namaste 🙏🏻.
Meeting you, Adriene, was one of the best things that happened to me. Thank you so much.
The first time in 6 years that I started a 30 day journey and actually made it to the end!  And on time with everyone else!!!🎉🎉🎉

Wow - I can't believe how powerful that was! I was a little scared at first at the thought of being unguided but I quickly felt my body and my instinct take over. I've heard you say so many times that the know how is within us - but today i really felt it for the first time - that all the wisdom and strength I need is already in me. Thank you for showing me this. What an incredible 30 days. Feeling so strong!

Great gratitude and abundant thanks to Adrienne and crew and Benji for all the time and effort to bring this Home program to us. I'm really going to miss the daily sessions w/ Adrienne here, and all together.  I've done the January 30 day challenges for 3 years now and it's a wonderful way to start the year.  But I'm not crying or emotional- I have to say the silent thing doesn't work for me as well- it's not because I don't trust myself or my body it's because I can't remember what is next, or when to inhale or exhale, or what to pay attention to in each pose, and you'd think I would remember, but I don't, so I like to be reminded- my brain was working harder w/ the silent thing- and then the "go slow" but I'm slower at times than Adrienne was or faster, or distracted by trying to look at the screen to see what's next, and I totally miss the verbal cues and Adrienne's silliness too. Well anyway- just my outlier opinion here...  The main thing is that I'm really grateful and appreciate this series and Adrienne and thank you thank you.

oh my
This is the first time I've made it to the end and have made time for me everyday. What a beautiful final day, well final day for the home series, but I now know I want to make the time for me each day. Thank you, this has been a very special start to the new year and new decade xx

Thank you Adriene for the most wonderful 30 days!
I will be repeating the Home series two more times during my time on Saint Helena, before it’s time to return to Scotland and I can do your YouTube videos on proper internet again! Haha! Xx
If you look at day 1…there are 1.4 million views. Here there are only 60k! Congrats to all who have made it so far! Thats only 4% of  people from day 1!

30 consecutive days of Yoga completed. I'm proud of everyone who stuck with this.
I missed Adriene's comforting voice, but it was interesting to see what I was able to do on my own. It was not perfect. I may just be having an off day; or maybe the independence of the practice scared me; or maybe the marinara sauce from dinner is making me feel sick. I struggled more than I wish I had.
This made me doubt myself, but then I remember how difficult the first day was. The way my forearms shook and the sweat that coated my body. I also remember how proud I was that I did a whole 40 mins of yoga, and how excited I was to start this journey.


And I now realize that the journey Home has only just begun. I've gotten my feet wet; I'm slowly making my way into the water. This journey has been so eye opening. I've learned how much strength I actually hold. I've been more loving and accepting to myself. I've found a new nightly tradition to that helps me got to sleep; sometimes the yoga makes me feel better than I do all day long. I've grown a better understanding and appreciation for yoga.
Thank you a thousand times over, Adriene, for your guidance and acceptance throughout this process. I am eternally grateful and excited to further my yoga experience with you. <3

Congratulations everyone! We did it! We came HOME! Now that you are HOME, what will you choose to do with the foundation you built? I have a pretty good idea what I'll be doing. Thank you Adriene. Thank you YWA community. Namaste

The ultimate test, can you fill this time with what serves you, listen to what your body is telling you and flow.
Congratulations! Ty #ywaHOME
Thank you so much for the 30 day journey. Much more fun to come! Namaste 🙏🏼
Tears at the end of this, but the good kind. Thank you for the journey!
<3
It is wonderful to practice with you and Benji. Thank you very much!

This was so freeing to see the progress I've made. I was a little nervous to start but I felt more comfortable after a couple of minutes. Thank you so much for this series, I really feel so much more confident with what I can do on and off the mat. <3
I teared up at the end from pure joy of this journey. From the bottom of my heart, thank you!

Wow this practice was amazing. I thought that I wouldn’t be able to do today’s practice without you to guide me but boy was I wrong! I surprised myself in how much I learned and remembered from the last thirty days and with he fact that I went the whole forty minutes without feeling like I need to take a break for mental or physical reasons. This whole month has been one beautiful practice after the next. I hope in the months to come I can continue on my journey on and off the mat. This month I was able to do my first (and second and third) crow pose which felt amazing! I thought I would never be able to do it because I have so little upper body strength but I proved myself wrong and now I feel like I can (and will) do more and more balance poses in the future. Thank you so much for all you have done Adriene I love you! 💕

Today I was in such a hurry that I couldn't do the practice right after I woke up. I saw the length of the practice so I waited, 'cause I wanted to be invested in.

It was the right choice. I'm writing this with tears in my eyes, I'm feeling so loved and so thankful. When Benji walked in your direction and you kissed him, I felt so happy and after this I couldn't stop crying. Happy tears.

The first 20 min I was in my zone, I did what I felt was right and it felt right. I found home. Then I was lost hahaha but you were here with me and I found my way again. It was a beautiful experience and I hope to be in this journey with you for a long time.

Always grateful for everything you taught me, Adriene. Namaste.

when i started today's practice: oh no, 40 minutes of silent, unguided (verbally, at least) yoga... this will be challenging
partway through: wow, i am truly capable of doing this on my own and trusting my own guidance. this feels exquisite.


thank you for your hard work, adriene. you have changed my life. i did a full year of daily yoga in 2019 and am going strong so far this year. i will miss and cherish our special january challenge, where i feel so connected to strangers around the world who share the same commitment.

I’m full of so much love and gratitude for this journey and you all! I hope that we all may continue to listen to the guiding force within  and remain gentle and patient and kind with ourselves no matter what life brings our way. We’re learning & blooming through it all and that is beautiful. Peace and love, always. Namaste. 🙏✨
thank you adriene for guiding us through these 30 days of yoga. this journey has given me hope and for that i will forever be grateful, all the love

My New Years goal was to complete one of your challenges. I printed out my calendar and started working on my goal. Every day after practice I would color a box depending on how I felt that day or how the yoga made me feel. I completed the challenge today and completed my goal. Not only does my colorful calendar look vibrant and beautiful but I feel the same. I even got my boyfriend to join in on the journey with me. We both feel as if we have grown physically, but also mentally, emotionally, and spiritually as well. Thank you for sharing this with us and giving us the opportunity to go on this journey with you. 💖✨💖
I did it... all 30 days! Thanks a lot Adreinne for being my guru and thanks a lot Benji for being with us. Lots of love. Namaste!!
Namaste, y'all. Thank you.
We did it! ✨All I could feel today was pride and gratitude. Thank you, thank you, thank you 🙏🏼💜

I cried too!

And there were times I swear I could hear her voice in my head "hop or step it to the top of your mat, your choice"

Man o man what a rewarding journey it's been. Love you guys!
first time completing 30 days! and first time I "rock and rolled" up to sitting since I was a kid lol I found what felt good!! thanks Adriene :)

Today instead of “trust my voice” it was “trust yourself”. I committed myself to this journey and I made it, I learned so much on the way and I am in a better place than when I started a month ago. I definitely think that yoga has contributed to this positive shift. Thank you Adrienne for helping me find my home :)

I can’t believe I did it! I’ve never continued any type of resolutions more than 3 days in the past. It was such a beautiful journey. I could feel your love for Yoga, your passion to share your love with us, and love between you and Benji. Today I felt like as if my dog was beside me while I was doing yoga, just like he used to.                                                                             I will definitely continue my yoga journey and see where it leads me.

I've never done 30 days of anything. I just finished the journey Home. Crying. Such a release and beautiful practice. Thank you, Adriene! I feel like I have a new friend and something to look forward to every day!! Thank you thank you thank you!!!
Victory! Thank you Adriene and Benji!

I'll be honest, I started out good and trusted my intuition for the first half of the pratice but got in my head for the second half and barely had any synchronised movement but towards the end, I stopped and just stayed in extended child's pose for a while. It's really hard to trust my instincts but we'll get there eventually. I definitely shed some tears towards the end there because I can't believe I made it through all 30 days. Absolutely grateful to you Adriene for all you put into this and everyone else for showing up for ourselves ❤️
I can't believe I finished this - but also I can't imagine waking up and not doing yoga tomorrow. I'm going to have to download the next calendar!
Thank you for the strength I needed! THANK YOU!!

This has been an awesome journey, so thank you!!! I've learned so much about myself, and what I'm capable of... and I laughed a lot, so thank you for being a fun and devoted teacher.  My dog Angel is always chilling on the couch while I stretch it out... and occasionally jumps down to join me in a downward dog, so I loved your subtle interactions with Benji. Cheers to 2020!  It's off to a good start ; )
Namaste.

Very nice.  Yoga without a net.  I found myself focusing on the insides of me - a radical feeling.  I worried about "what's next" but at a certain point, that felt OK too.  I feel like this when I sing without a score - trusting myself to riff through the parts that may not be exactly picky-picky right, and coming out the other side with a sense of self and calm and knowing that this is so right and good.  Thank you.

This month was so incredibly impactful... Thank you Adriene! So many comments have already expressed how I feel, so I'll leave it at that.... But just know you are changing lives. And helping us to feel empowered enough to change them ourselves. Thank you, and Namaste :)

Writing that comment on the surge of sudden inspiration during the last 10 minutes of Day 30, Journey, as I realized, this is my yoga. Home changed my life. When I started 30 days ago, I was depressed and battling the existential crisis. Nothing helped me, you name it - movement, books, spiritual tools, meditation, even sun, and healthy food. Through this process, I realized why it was like that. "I" was not there, I was not committed to healing at all, cause I had no idea who this "I" was. I loved the dark as it was comfortable, paradoxically warm, safe. And then I committed and fully surrendered to my own healing. And MAGIC happened. 30 days later and here I am, suddenly enjoying life and light again. All of a sudden I decluttered my whole apartment, bought a lot of houseplants and started creating my own urban jungle. And please mind this, I was not interested in plants al all my life. I do not know what exactly happened and I have no words. Dear Adriene and every each and one of you, I love you for being my humble guides home. Thank you, I am forever grateful. Namaste.

Thank you ,thank you ,thank you Adriene I did it, 30 days straight of yoga with you and everyone around the world.  I am so proud of myself that I did it, I accomplished my goal(New Years resolution).  I will continue my journey with you, I can’t’ stop now I’m on a roll.💕
It's been a long time since I did 30 days of yoga on a row. I'm so happy to be back. I loved this calendar, even more than Dedicate! Tomorrow, I'm starting Kiss :*
This has been an absolutely beautiful experience this month with you, Adriene. This final class was perfect. The calmness, the music, the practice. 💗 thank you for this.
This was the first time I didn't follow Adrienne and I feel awesome for doing on my own. I'm so grateful for finding this channel and to make the effort to show up even when was hard. Thanks so much

I'm so proud that I was able to fill a 40 minute practice with only a few moments of "uuuh...now what?" As an extra bonus, my shirt got here yesterday -- felt great to wear it on the last day. Thank you, Adriene, for a wonderful 30 day journey Home. Good work everybody! See you in February. ;)

Thank you Adriene and company for once again giving us this wonderful gift. This is the first year I was able to do the 30 days in real time. As a mom to a 9 month old at home yoga is my only realistic option these days. I’m so incredibly grateful for you!

This one was definitely difficult without the words to keep me guided but I found that I was able to guide myself just as much. Thank you for all the support and the amazing journey you brought to all of us. This month helped me grow as a person emotionally mentally and physically. What a way to start the year!

Thank you, Adriene and Benji. This was such a wonderful place to turn to every day. I appreciate all the effort this was, and on a more logistical side, I really enjoyed the length of all these videos. Every day seemed manageable :). Can't wait to keep going with you all!
Thank you

I'm so happy, this is the first time I've ever finished any kind of exercise challenge. What kept me motivated was my desire to show up for myself and to show myself that I can do it and I did it! Thanks so much for this <3 I'm hoping to show up for myself in more this year and just on a regular basis in general.

This is maybe my third attempt at the 30 days of yoga journey with Adriene. Last year I got sick halfway through and had to stop, though I did pick it back up later, just not consecutively. This year I was sick at the beginning, but I was still able to start. I am so happy that I can say I DID IT. I showed up for myself all 30 days. No matter what time it was, no matter what else I had left to do, no matter what roadblocks stood in my way, I made time for me day after day.

Thank you Adriene for this wonderful guided journey you created. I am planning on going for my YTT in March, and I feel like this journey was the perfect way to start a new year with such an exciting venture up ahead. I plan on continuing with a daily practice and even trusting myself to be my own guide on the mat. I'm happy to say I am home. I hope everyone here is home too. ❤️

THANK YOU, Adriene - this was such a beautiful awakening to what yoga can be and how it can be impactful on day-to-day life. I appreciate the time, energy, authenticity, and dedication of you and your team and cannot thank you enough for bringing me back to a love of yoga and of myself.

Once again, thanks Adriene for this wonderful start to the New Year. I find when I do yoga with you, it stops being a "push" to see how far I can go, and instead, I learn to relax into it. I thank you so so so much. Namaste.

I didn’t realize today was day 30 but I’m so happy I made it here with you all! I’m currently sick but I had to finish the last day before I rest. Thank you Adrienne for a wonderful 1st month of 2020. I can’t wait for more ❤️
What a lovely way to end this part of our journey.  Thank you Adriene.  Without you I never would have stuck to it.  Now for the next 30 days.  and then 30 days after that.  and then...

Oh Adriene, we as a couple (my husband and I) have done this HOME journey together, and just finished this morning (Phuket, Thailand). We have attempted two other 30 day journeys, but didn't miss a day and have held on to the 30 days in sequence from the start, amongst so many possible (and valid excuses), we made it work. This video had us both in tears; a release and also tears of immense gratitude for such a truly special experience. We started yoga via your YouTube videos one year ago, as complete beginners. We are so proud we could stick to this journey, and can't thank you enough. We are so grateful for this experience. You truly are a guide, a light and very special to us. We could go on and on ad nauseam. So, thank you from the fullness of our heart! Namaste, and love to you and your team.  - Justine & Justin

This is my fourth year doing the 30 day challenge. What a blessing to have this every year. I cannot tell you how much it means to me. Thank you Adriene and team for making this possible. I will be forever grateful. Namaste

I did it! I didn't go into this journey confident that I would stick it out for 30 days, but I did... I may have doubled up a day or 3 to get here when I wanted to though. Today's practice was terrifying but empowering. Thank you for bringing me home. Much love from Nova Scotia, Canada 🍁 ♥
So beautiful. Magical and emotional. What a journey. My fourth one with you now Adrienne. Here’s to many more. Your work truly heals and energises. Plus your so gosh darn it loveable and real x
We did it! Namaste, everyone

I too, heard you in my head, "Half way lift, your version...." This was a true experience. I completed all thirty days, albeit day 20 and 21 I combined because I let one day slip by, but I came back!!! And here I am just finishing up day 30. I missed you talking at the end of the video, and I missed your inspiration at the end, but then came the quote from John O’Donohue. Perfect!! Thank you Adriene. Namaste. :)

I wonder if the theme song for 'Home' will now always give me that surge of power and light that it did in this practice. Thank you Adriene for this amazing journey, I feel as if I have received something back that had been lost! 🙏

Adriene,

Thank you for teaching me the tools to come home! I feel like I’ve come home in so many ways ❤️
30 days! Interestingly I didn’t follow along with you today. I just let the music play and found what felt good. BUT, we ended at the exact same time. Mind blown 🤯

Third-year completing the 30 day challenge and the first time I closed my eyes and let the spirit move me. Thanks, Adriene for sharing yoga with us all. I begin my 200-hour teacher training in April. As I retire after 38 years of teaching students in schools I look forward to teaching in a studio. You have definitely motivated me to spread the word of the physical, emotional and spiritual benefits of yoga.
It is on my bucket list to come to Texas and take a class with you in person! I hope to see you soon! Love to you and Benji!
Namaste,
Cathy

There was a moment where I was in a seated position with hands to heart and I peeked at the screen and you were doing the exact same thing. What a warm, fuzzy feeling 🥰 Thank you for this journey home. Namaste 🙏
30 days complete! I was emotional at the end hearing that theme, what a gift this was in a month I’m sure we all needed it. Namaste Adriene. ❤️ This has been a beautiful journey home.

Thanks my friend! It’s been absolutely amazing journey home!
See you tomorrow in the new February set! Namaste!🙏🏻

Adriene - Peace be upon you and this community. This is the 5th year my daughter and I have completed this challenge. I was able to do a plow and wheel pose. I don't think I've done these since I was a teenager. I feel like I've returned HOME. Lots of love!
I am so proud of each of us that have journeyed together. What a beautiful way to wrap up this 30 day practice. We're home! I cried happy tears. <3
I have done three of these journeys before but this is the first time I did it in the 30 days! Feels amazing and magical.
It's been a beautiful 30 days! Thank you for walking us HOME and for igniting my self-practice again. I appreciate you! BIG LOVES
Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

I've done all of your 30 day yoga practices but this is the first time I've done them as they come out in January and without missing any days or taking some time off -- I feel so amazing and so happy that I accomplished this.  I tend to have trouble with longer practices but today I was surprised when it was over -- I continued on after the video ended!  Thank you!

After not making it through the past two years, I am so proud to have completed my first 30 days of yoga! This was the best way to start the year, and the best birthday gift I could have given myself (my birthday is today!) I am feeling very thankful.
I love u)))
Adriane, U helped me to deal with my knee injury
Sorry , I end my journey at day 20 or something, but I do handstand and other thing everyday

This was possibly the most transformative session of the past year I've been doing yoga with you. Couldn't stop the tears of joy. 2019 was quite a year for me, and 2020 is bringing complete changes to my life. I truly feel like I've come home. Thank you

Dear Adriene, thank you so much for this fantastic journey home. I have enjoyed each and every moment spent on mat with you and other people around the globe. You are so inspirational, so positive, so kind!. We would love to see you here in Ottawa!
THANK YOU!

SOOOO Wonderful, tysm...love so much Benji coming in for his TLC time!! Precious!!
See you all at the Feb 2020 playlist tomorrow!!! Fill Your Cup video! xxx
I loved hearing the music from true and dedicate playing!!

And I could here your voice saying ...
"Your version..."
"Ground through all corners of your feet...."
"Lots of love in, lots of love out...."
"Namaste"
There's a tinge of sadness and finality in not hearing your voice and at the same time a deep honouring in that silence. So much love for you Adriene, so much gratitude for your generosity creating this. I get how much you love and care for us all. This has been my 4th 30 day yoga challenge and my favourite. I found you after breaking my wrist 4 years ago, googled 'yoga for broken wrists' and there you were.
Deep bow to you gorgeous soul.
Namaste <3
Yoga for broken wrists How might I find it?  My wrists were injured.  I find it difficult to take weight on them
Dianne Graham i always hear head over heart heart over pelvis even when i go walking
Me too, "Long beautiful neck"
