I could hear her voice too! amazing. beautiful journey.
We love and appreciate you, Adriene! Thank you for all of your hard work and for teaching us how to be kinder to ourselves.
Thank you, Adriene.

This is my 4th year of the January daily yoga but the first of keeping up for the whole month. It was also the first where I could flow through the whole session following my own practice and even surprising myself at how quickly the time flew by. Others have written about when tears came: mine where when I thought to myself 'I can do a twist (ie look in another direction) at any time'. Thank you Adriene for what you have made, and thank you to all who join in. Namaste.

I've safely arrived Home ❤️ What a beautiful 30 days that I have spent with the most incredible people around the world! I have definitely got tears in my eyes after this one. Thank you, Adriene. For everything. Namaste my wonderful friends. xxx

My 4th year of Yoga with Adriene and I want to share with any of you that are coming to this for the first time..it's worth continuing your journey.  It's worth showing up everyday, or whenever you can.  The magic and transformation that comes with daily practice is real.  What Adriene shares about it is true...the gifts of the practice flow off the mat now in to my daily life.  A true game changer for me and for anyone brave enough to lean in to yourself, care for yourself.  I promise, you won't regret the effort.  Adriene, you are a guide from the gods/goddesses!! Love you all.
So magical, so powerful, so connected. I love you and all who commit to this beautiful community!
Thank you!

I have done 30 days of yoga every year since 2016 and let me tell you, day 30 gets me in all the feels every time. Happy tears, grateful tears. Thanks for sharing your gift with the world, Adriene and team. Namaste. P.S. I love hearing all the former themes. They take me back!

It's been tough at times but we dd it! It is my 90th day of yoga and there have been days where I couldn't do it but I got back at it. Throughout these months I have transformed into a different person a much calmer and loving one. I am not saying I am no longer sad or at times angry or frustrated but at least I am aware of these feelings and I also know that it will get better. Thank you, Adriene!(and everyone else who have worked for these series)  It's so weird to say this because I am only watching your videos online but I  feel like I know you so well, you have been like a sister to me. Thanks for listening and being there! NAMASTE!

Oh my goodness, I GET it. It’s been a hard week and many days on the mat left me feeling better and glad I did it, but still a bit of a struggle to get through. Today, I was nervous for sure. Wondering how I was going to conjure up the mental tenacity and physical energy. Not a few minutes in, I felt a spark. A few more minutes, brighter spark. Then full on, blossoming JOY. Actual joy in movement. In enjoying the sensations, feeling grateful for what I’ve learned. Reveling in things that were once “hard” that now are an “edge.” I actually think I did more than when cued because I was just truly enjoying the experience of being in my body. And then the quote at the end did me in. ❤️

Thank you, Adriene. There are no words for the impact you've had on my life and well-being. On last year's Day 30, I followed you the whole time. This year, I went off completely by myself, checking in when I needed to. Thank you for teaching me to trust myself (and the process, and the video). You are a saint.
Definitely yes. Saint Adriene.
I made it!! I did it! Thanks to you, Adriene 💜💗💚 and all your encouragement. Thirty days of FIERCE SELF LOVE  🥂👏🏻💖 Love to you xoxo ❤️ Many more adventures Adriene Chérie ❤️

Also want to add that it felt really emotional, since without your instruction ( though being without your voice was hard for me,) I actually felt like I was at your house and we were just practicing together, as comrades. 💕
Awww we did it!!! Thank you & Namaste to Adriene and to all. May our journeys continue to bring us into all we truly are and may the path become more beautiful each day <3
thank you ☺️
My teacher, my guide, my friend. I cried at the end of this video. Thank you for the journey :)

I never leave comments on videos but I felt that this deserved one. I started this journey home frustrated at how slow it was and how chatty Adriene was. But throughout these last 30 days I've developed a new appreciation for silence and this guided meditation she brings to the table. I've opened my brain to the possibilities and the joy that yoga can bring someone. Needless to say, within the first 30 seconds of starting todays practice I was in tears. This truly was a journey home and I know that I've grown more than I thought possible this past month. I cannot wait to take all that I've gained from this experience into the future with me.

Day 30 the journey being our real destination but boy finally arriving to our destination really makes all the bumps in the road worth it, let's be honest the journey never really ends it just changes in time so here is to showing up for 30 days or just showing period and being open when it's a struggle and finding ease and family with our community everyday. To our Amazing, wonderful, kind and loving friend, teacher and guide, we love you for your efforts and sacrifices that u made to bring us this 30 Days of home yoga and for all he other practices, thank you words will not do it justice to say how much u have helped me change my life and for that I will be eternally grateful and we love benji too such a good boy 😍, to all my fellow yogis your post on the fwfg community has really help me in ways I can't explain, I love you all and hope you had an amazing journey much love to everyone and who's ready for February 😉, Namaste Everyone and goodnight 💞💗💓💖❤🙏
this was a masterpiece!! v proud of myself for doing it all :)
a lot of emotions right now
Yes I did it! WE did it! awesome job everyone :)

I cried all the way through this one just as I always do on the last day. Something about the music from all of the different 30 day series and feeling almost like it's a goodbye, even though I know you are always there and these series are always available. Coming to the end is always so bittersweet because it is a huge sense of accomplishment and I am so much stronger and more capable than I was on day 1 but at the same time not wanting it to end. Thank you from the bottom of my heart, Adriene!!! You have inspired me and changed my life in so many positive ways. Namaste ❤

Omg. Wow. This was absolutely magical! I have never ever done a yoga practice without verbal guidance, so I was a little nervous at the start. But then I got going and I found my flow, I peeked at Adriene every now and then when I struggled to think of what to do next, and then I found my inspiration to carry on. I was hit at the end with emotion that made my eyes well up because I'd just done a shoulder stand, rolled down to sit up cross legged and I was faced with Adriene sitting cross legged too, bringing her hands up to her forehead and bowing her head just as I was coming to do the same, like the timing was perfect and the 40 mins were over without me even realising... This was the most amazing experience. Thank you so much! ♥️

Adriene, you move so beautifully. At one point I stopped practicing because I was in such awe of your movement. Thank you again for such a magical practice. Sad that these 30 days are over. I’m so proud of myself and everyone that has made it to day 30. I hope to see you tomorrow. Namaste 🙏🏽🧘🏽‍♀️

Tell me why I burst into tears at the end of this?

Just kidding, I know why. I’m proud of myself for returning home and all the self love I have now, thanks to you and this journey. This community is amazing and so are you Adriene. Thank you for all you do... you’re life changing.

I can’t believe I actually did it this year! 30 days of yoga without missing a practice! I don’t think I’ve done anything consistently for 30 days. Thank you for helping me prioritize myself a little bit every day. I want to make yoga part of my everyday routine. I’ll be going through your old 30-day sessions as a guide :)
Also, though this journey, I’ve discovered I can do a shoulder stand, which is something I would have never thought possible! I love building strength, balance, and flexibility all while focusing on breathing and being present in the moment. I feel like I have grown stronger both physically and mentally thanks to your guidance.
Thank you Adriene for your outpouring of love to all of us in the Yoga with Adriene community.  It was such a journey and a blessing. Namaste.

Tears of gratitude and appreciation. Thank you Adriene! The past 30 days of HOME has changed my life in so many ways. This wasn’t like me to commit to something like this but I felt in my gut it was for me. I am full of happiness and pride for having completed this challenge with all of you without missing even one day.

I've been saving my comment until I completed all thirty days. I have started and failed to finish three of your past 30 day challenges Adriene and this year I decided, and worked hard to make sure that did not happen. I've gotten up earlier; I've been late for work; I've done yoga with my nephew crawling into my lap and between my legs in down dog 😅; I've done it in the evening if I woke up too late. I printed the calendar and everyday I did a little celebration dance as I filled in the day with a pattern to mark it as complete.

Over the past month, yoga has been a calming space, a catalyst for change, a push to get started and a challenge. I've had so many emotions over the course of this journey from clearing my head of anything that is bothering me to allowing myself to think through things I've have been putting off. I appreciate your channel so much and today after thirty days of doing yoga consistently, it was so reassuring to peek up and see that I was in Warrior 2 with you. I crafted the first thirty minutes on my own but followed along for the last ten. I made sure to work in a power pose and a goddess pose because honestly, that's how I feel after completing this challenge 👸🏾🦸🏾‍♀️#superpowerfulgoddessyogi.

To a daily practice on the mat, cheers everyone! Looking forward to the February calendar.

We did it!!! Thank you Adriene for an amazing journey home. In this practice I could hear your voice guiding us. I know I have to keep this journey and find my <del>Find what feels good</del> Still a lot to learn about the breathing but I’ll get there. Namaste from Guatemala 🇬🇹 🙏🏻 💜
Well, that's one done. On to the next. Next goal: dial bail out of any of her reps on last year's series.
Thanks everyone.... It's been emotional 💜
Thank you for this journey. This conclusion did not work its magic on me -- it was just painful to crane me neck to look at you constantly because I had no idea what was going on.

Thank you for this experience Adriene, Benji, the crew, & the viewers here on YT. This was the first time I had ever done a yoga challenge & the first time I had been consistent with my yoga practice. These 30 days have really helped me to learn and trust myself. I felt so out of tune with my body and my mind last year, but now I feel myself healing.
Today's practice kind of scared me when I looked at it this morning, but once I stepped on the mat everything flowed. I've learned so much and I look forward to continuing this journey Home. Thank you again Adriene for bringing so much light to the start of this new decade. Namasté!
First time I do yoga 30 days in a row and feels GREAT!! Now I'm sure I can continue doing it for the rest of the year. Thank you Adriene!!! 🙏💕 (Btw, we share birthday!! Huhuu!)
Okay, hands up who cried more than once? 🙋
I was able to complete the flow and felt and heard your encouraging words along the way. Sunset gazing in Regina Saskatchewan, Canada,  as I completed day 30. Thank you so much. NAMASTE
Thank you Thank you! 🙏🏻❤️❤️❤️ I learned that it’s all about the journey!

I'm so happy I chose to do this and proud of myself for following through completely with my commitment. The feeling I hold now and that kept crescendoing through the final video could not be more perfect. It's exactly what I needed. Thank you, Adriene. This was awesome and you're amazing. - Chris P.

Wow day 30 and I did it!  Every one!  I feel stronger, more flexible and have better balance.  I have definitely improved from day 1.  Forever grateful for this 30 day journey Home! Thank you Adriene.  Namaste!
Words cannot describe the emotions I felt listening to all those songs that represent the many journeys I've been on thanks to you, Adriene. Thank you.

After this practice, I was telling my husband about it and said, "At the end, she looked right at the camera, and it was like she was looking right at me!" And then I realized it wasn't "like" that. Adriene really was looking right at me, and at all of you, and at all of the people practicing around the world. That's just part of what makes me love her so much.

Dear Adriene, Thank you for all the love and kindness you put out into the world. I knew not what I would find in these last 30 days, but I feel as though I found what I was looking for.
Multiple times through this last practice, I found myself offering kindness to myself, something that I have been witholding from for awhile, and I wanted to thank you, truly, for helping open that path once again.

As I said to myself after, I say to you here: May you be well, May you be happy, and may you be loved.
With love and kindness, Nathan Gilles From Missouri. <3
Namaste, Adriene.

I am gonna sound like such a cheesy hippie tree hugging human when I say this but... wow. That was so fucking magical. Music is so emotive! Adriene, I can't thank you (and your team!) enough for how much time, effort, energy and love you've put into this. I am so grateful. You've already single-handedly changed my 2020. Hi Adriene! Hi everybody!

I've been struggling with anorexia for quite some time now. Last year, I embarked on this 30 days yoga journey and managed to keep up with yoga for half a year before I had to focus on intense recovery from my mental illness. I spend the last six months of 2019 eating well and not moving any muscle, for fear that exercise will trigger weight loss thoughts. I ended that year with a body that was stronger and healthier, but with mind that was torn between further recovery and self hatred.

This year I embarked on this journey once more. Excercise is still scary, especially the community associated with it, but yoga with you is like a warm, safe space. As you say we don't do yoga, we practice it. There are no goals, only intentions. Every time I step on my mat, my intention is to be happy and hopeful again. Today at the end of the practice I thought, maybe for the first time in years, that I'm grateful for my body that is capable and strong and can move and do such amazing things. It was a revolutionary thought to say the least!

I hope yoga with you will remain a big part of a happy, hopeful life ahead of me. I'm truly thankful for you, more thankful than I can say. The feeling of self acceptance I felt today was one of the most beautiful moments in my life.

Happy 30! I will say that I missed your voice Adriene. I rely so much on your verbal cues. Namaste!

P.S. Benji stole the show!

Thank you Adriene, for bringing us on this journey with you. I'm so grateful, and some days my yoga mat feels like a solid rock in the midst of a churning sea. This isn't the end, just another beginning :)

I found out half way through this challenge that I would be having surgery on day 29. At first I was bummed because I was determined to complete all 30 days, but my wonderful friend reminded me that its all about intention. My surgery was yesterday and I completed day 29 right before leaving for the procedure. Now, on day 30, I am back home and resting. I watched this video from my recliner, and although I can't move much, I practiced breathing where I normally would breathe throughout this practice. It has been such a lesson in letting go, and returning to the breath. Thank you Adriene for all that you do for the community. I'm finishing off the HOME series with peace in my heart, and tears in my eyes.

Hi, first time in the comment section :) I first came across this when someone shared it in a discord server I am in. At first I was sceptical to it, like "me, do yoga? naaah" but I decided to give it a chance. was still a bit sceptical in the beginning but stuck through it, even if I looked completely ridicilous :D And this 30 day journey has been the most special thing to me so far in 2020. Every day after finishing, I have always felt at peace and genuinely happy, which is a rare thing. It's as if every bad depressive thoughts, any worries, everything just dissappeared for a good while. Also knowing that everyday that you, Benji and everyone else out there was here doing the same thing, it was reassuring in a way. I teared up a few time while writing this, there where both sad and happy tears. This has been the most amazing journey I have ever had, it showed me that change is possible, and what we all have within is very special and stronger than we think, and that it is just as or more important than what is on the outside. I am for sure gonna continue with yoga after this :D So, thank you Adriene, Benji, behind the scene people, everyone else here for this very special experience, for showing me that all needed to change is within oneself. And I hope you all continue to have a blessed and beautiful 2020, I'm sending all the love from Norway <3 Namaste

Thank you thank you thank you. I feel so lucky and so happy to have made it here (with happy tears) alongside you and thousands of other people. The awesome in this girl recognizes the awesome in you... and this is just the beggining!

I feel like an absolutely failure and don't deserve to even finish. I had a decent migraine yesterday and didn't do yoga yesterday. Now I am two days behind, and I feel like it's too late for me now to catch up :( Thank you for your awesome work, Adriene.
Thank you so much, Adriene . I have enjoyed every minute. And after two years with yoga, today I finally put my heels to the floor in downward dog.

I don't know if it's your soothing voice, the soothing music or my movements but my 'grandcat' comes in the room with me everyday when I do yoga.  Hasn't missed yet.  Thank you for 30 days of discovering something new that I can practice forever.

Woo hoo, what a joyous end. I had never done a self guided session before, tears in my eyes as we started and I realised you all had my back and I really am strong enough to do this. Wowow I went into this journey with the intention of cultivating more joy in my life.  At the end of the month, I'm finding more joy in each day, even though my circumstances haven't changed much.  Thank you Adriene!! and good fuck when the intro music played during today's practice damn did it hit different.
Thank you Adriene, really!
Yesss, I did it! Didn't skip a single day. Woo! Thank you so much Adriene, you add so much value to my life. My plan is to keep practicing everyday with your videos.

During these 30 days my journey physically took me from Brazil to South Wales and then to Yorkshire. I was nursing a hangover today, it got to 10 pm and I still hadn't rolled out the mat. I prepared for bed and then a little voice nudged me to roll it out anyway. So I had my own restorative low to the ground practice, completely different from what I saw you, dear Adriene, do next to me. It felt nice and also a bit confusing and new. A special experience, which I will definitely come back to do in the AM with more energy and a more focused mind. Thank you for the journey home, it's been a pleasure!

A bit of frustration part way through this self-guided tour - where to next; almost stopped the video, but I didn't.  I just refocused and kept moving.  A lump in my throat, and some burning eyes? What is this?  Gratitude I think.  Deep gratitude.

Thank you, Adriene and the team. I cried at the beginning but towards the end was bawling my eyes out. It felt like a release. And the fetal position... and the moments between You and Benji... So much gratitude. Thank you. So much love.


And to the 2792 people who practised with me - heyoooo!




<3

Today I completed 30 days straight of Yoga.  Thank you Adrian for your gentle push everyday and making coming back into the matt everyday with ease and curiosity.  I went to the Chiropractor this morning and he was impressed with my improvement!!  Thank you ❤️🤗🧘
Well, the month is over but the journey home isn't. Thank you adriene and this wonderful community for walking home with me. I wish y'all a great year.

I think this is the third or fourth challenge that I do with you. In every one I leanrned more about yoga, but I learned about myself too, and what i can do in and out the mat. This journey was amazing. Thank you so much Adriene. AND BENJI! The energy I have had tripled over what it was at the beginning. I have started to overcome my anxiety and depression. When I started this on day 1 I couldn't articulate why I wanted to do this and what I wanted to get out of it. I think my intuition from the start told me that I needed this kind of trust and acceptness of my body. I still can't put exactly into words how I feel right now. I'm very grateful and thank you all for the experience. I will definitely continue doing yoga regularly to get even more benefits from the practices.

Thank you Adriene, thank you! This was an amazing journey! You have been accompanying me in my journey Home for about three years in a row now. I am extremely grateful for your existence Adriene!

Without fail I always end up doing two unexpected things on day 30: Sync up with Adriene at various times and cry at the end lol 💕 I LOVED Home. At the end I was bowing to the past 30 days we had together while I felt gratitude rushing through my body. I can' believe it is the last practice. I am ready for the KISS tomorrow. Thank you for everything Adriene <3

I have to admit in all honesty, I really struggle without your voice as guidance. I don't really trust myself. I find myself forgetting to breathe correctly or at all! I need to learn to trust myself but following a guide is what works best for me. to do my own thing I need to not be feeling like I need to keep up with a video. All with love. Finding what works for me and what doesn't.

A beautiful practice. Thank you for guiding us on our journey Home. Namaste, Adriene.

Gracias Adriene, for another journey home. Thank you for giving us the tools to take care of our bodies and minds with precious time we shared with you. Namaste for your time and energy into creating this with you team. Really truly grateful. See you on the mat!

It was an absolute delight walking on this journey home besides you Adriene.
It wasn't always easy, I first had to convince myself to do this, it was sometimes hard to roll out the mat.

When I saw that today was a 40-minute freestyle practice, I was worried that I didn't have the proper tools. Yet I did it! That is because I had the tools thanks to you.
This was a life-changing 30 days. It was the perfect boost to continue my practice daily from now on. From day 1 to day 30, and now forever. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

I finish this 30 day programme with years in my eyes. When everything around me seems to be crashing, I'm Home! Thank you Adriene and everybody in your team, your mom, your dad, Benji and everybody practicing and sharing this experience. Namaste.

Thanks so much Adrienne! These 30 days have made such a great start to the year.... third year running I’ve done this. It’s the best! I was a little daunted by silent yoga without Adriene’s voice to guide me but absolutely loved it. So proud of myself for completing the 30 days and can’t believe how much my strength and flexibility has improved in such a short time! Thank you so much for creating home! I love the soundtrack. This was simultaneously my easiest and hardest practice! I was absolutely terrified when you said you were turning off the mic for this one - the thought of guiding myself through a 40 minute practice was daunting! But as others have mentioned, I could hear you in my head the whole time, a quiet voice of encouragement, "you've got this". And you were right, I do have the vocabulary, I do have the tools and it ended up being a magical and powerful powerful experience. Thank you for this incredible gift that has brought me so much these past 30 days, I am eternally grateful, namaste ❤️
Thank you!
I think everyone cried during this, I know I did. Thank you so much Adriene... You are truly a kindred spirit. Much love and gratitude. Thanks for helping us along this journey.
Yahooo.. We made it people.Thank you so much Adriene. It was the perfect journey to start this year. All the love to you and other yogis in this ride home. #ywaHome
It's been a wonderful journey and I am thrilled to continue this journey  on my own - and with the rest of the community! May 2020 be a blessed year for all of you. 🤗

Thank you Adriene. Last year I tried to do the 30 day journey in the begining of January. 3 times. And always when I arrived at day 8, everything in my life started going crazy, and eventually I had to stop. So, last year I gave up. This time around everything Was going perfectly fine... Until sunday!!! I caught up a respiratory infection, and had 40•C of fever for 3 days. Had to go to the hospital and everything. My first impulse was giving up again. And it made me sad. So... on wednesday, thursday and today, I did two days in each ( one in the morning, and another in the evening) and I FEEL GREAT, because that way I could come HOME with all of you. And most important of all: I chose NOT to quit.
Sometimes life throws curve balls at us... And we either quit... Or get creative😉
Thank you very much to all of you who came on this journey.
Kisses from Portugal 🇵🇹
See you soon

I'm just so emotional right now. Woah. I can't believe it actually : what a precious journey ! Ariene, thank you so much for everything, you're so kind and a perfect teacher, I love you. Thank you, thank you. Namaste and I'm freaking proud of everybody !

Took me time today to process my feelings. I was very hesitant about doing the practice without verbal cues and for 40 minutes, but did find that the time flew by and at times I pretty much was able to keep up with the flow. I'm not yet practiced enough to make up my own moves so I did sometimes have to hurry to catch up or stopped short at others. So overall, not very smooth. Somehow, I feel I'm not Home, but just Starting Out as I understood whilst doing the 30 days that this is to be a life-long, daily, practice. I've barely stepped outside the front door! Thank you, Adriene and team, for putting the 30 days and all the other practices together for us.
Thank you with all my heart for this beautiful journey,I am home,we all are❤️love to all of you!Namaste!

OMG I just can’t! Literally bawling by the end. I have never cried through forearm planks and yet...there I was. This has been an emotional journey for sure, but this practice in particular has brought it all home for me (pardon the pun). The courage, the camaraderie of everyone here, and how far we’ve all come on our journey home. By the end credits I felt like my spirit had valiantly battled the deepest darkest demons and was striding through the field, returning home to confidence, comfort in my own skin, and a more optimal version of myself. Thank you so much for this. What a blessing. I’m so moved.

Also, I NEED the music from this session. Especially the Home theme song, it’s so SO powerful.
Taylor Parris yes the music is so powerful! I noticed the music from the True practice was in the middle part...I always go back to True episodes, sometimes just to hear the music!!
Thank you Adriene ❤️ from the bottom of my heart! I wish you all the love and peace ❤️❤️❤️❤️

Me talking to the screen; You bring those hip-dips, girlie! I got this. I am strong!! 💪🏼 I held it together just fine, right up until the fetal position and then the water works started. Tissues were at the ready! I loved that you managed to sneak in a "knocking on heavens door" too. Brilliant!!  Sweet Benji was really feeling the lovely vibes, wasn't he? My cat was equally drawn to the positive, emotional energy. It's absolutely magical how you touch so many lives with movement and breath, all without needing to say a word. That's powerful. Thank you as always, sweet friend for seeing more in me than I see in myself and for always leading me back to the light. I am so very grateful to you, Adriene and everyone involved with YWA - especially all the faces we don't see. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!! See you on the mat tomorrow! 🙏🏻💚

Thank you so much for this journey
Namaste

Floods. I was left in floods. I thought that TRUE was my fav, I saw my little baby girl self looking back at me in my humble warrior for the first time and she smiled and waved at me and she looked SOOOO happy. Happy to make her way back home.  Adriene, from the very depths of my self, Thank you for this and all that you do for the community. I am so overwhelmed at how strongly I connected, I was ready to go home. Thank you, bless you. Love you.

Wow. What an incredible 30 days it has been, I've had some intense experiences throughout this series and I'm not exageratting when i say that i have experienced tremendous therapeutic and spiritual growth.

My body, my mind and my soul have all benefited from this prwctice. I came here searching for something, and throughout this journey I realised what I was looking for was myself.

However towards the end I discovered that I wouldn't find what i seek here, today I was proven wrong. I found it, I found Home. I found myself. I dug deep, so very deep in this silent practice that I finally found the childhood trauma that was blocking me from becoming who I truly am. The source that started this cycle of fear and desire to be accepted by others, and to conform. Now I feel free, and I have you Adrienne, mg dear teacher, to thank for it. And of course i should thank myself, for doing all of this, I love everyone here.

I was left at the end with this message from within. "now offer your gift(love) throughout the universe without shame."

I was all well and smiling way up until whispering namaste at the end, that just suddenly got tears flowing and it doesn't seem to stop.
I can't believe I stuck here all 30 days, I rarely stick with anything. And I want more :D I'm already waiting for tomorrows practice and I'm ready to fill my cup.
Thank you Adriene! Thank you for sharing your time, energy, wisdom, humour and love with us. Love you <3

I was woken early so I did this in the morning before getting ready for work. I’m all stretched out and ready for the day. Thank you so much Adriane and everyone else for your practices. We are home together. Have a great day.

Adrienne,

One month ago I started this journey not knowing if I would show up everyday. But I did for all of it. Each day I would surprise myself because for such a long time I didn't want to move. Was afraid to move because of depression and anxiety. Five years of it. So to be able to complete HOME is huge for me. Today I have a sense of pride and accplishment that I haven't felt in years. I DID IT! Yes, I will continue my daily yoga practice. Going to start DEDICATE tomorrow for mornings. And the monthly theme for evenings. Thank you, thank you for this journey HOME. It brought me back to yoga which brought me back to me. May you and sweet Benji always be surrounded in peace, light, and love.💜

Here I entered with my eyes closed to the practice, surprised myself twice looking at you, Adriene, and starting or finishing the same movement.

Thanks <3

Thank you. Thank you Adriene, the whole crew and all of you guys who were with me on this journey home. I can't really explain every aspect of me that experienced benefits from this practice but I can keep thanking you again and again. There is so much going on. So much has changed. And not "just" my flexibility. 😉
And its the first finale where I really trusted myself and went with the flow, not stressing about keeping up with you like I did one, two yrs back. I even did some extra moves and there was this one time when I decided to do this one variation I remembered from one of the past episodes, then looked at the screen and you just started to do the same thing 😂
Btw that moment at the beginning when Benji makes down dog and you doing the same right after was priceless 😍
If anyone made it that far I have a question - are you going to keep that promise we made few days ago about keeping the every day practice? See you tomorrow on the first video on febuary playlist!
Namaste everyone! We did it!! 🙏
Thank you once again for creating this journey and inspiring this community. 🙏🏻🕉

l loved this practice, I started with you but then I went into my own flow and let my body lead ... I watched you as I was in tree pose enjoying sharing in this time and space, But free to be different. These 30 days have been magical thank you 💕🌼
Home was so beautifully and mindfully put together. Thank you for such a wonderful 30 days, namaste.
This is it!

Before I start...
THANK YOU so much for such an amazing journey. Thank you for taking your time to prepare it all for us. It's been such an honour to be a part of it.
I couldn't stop crying while reading the very last email. And then, when I started the practice, I needed a few minutes to calm down. I found the stillness, it's a big achievement for me since I struggled for three weeks. I kept telling myself "you did so well".
I'll be honest. My body was very well prepared this time, I've exercised enough for the past few months. It was my mind that struggled the most. I knew it would be tough and challenging. Many thing happened last year and I was running away from thinking. I thought I was doing well distracting myself but all of these sessions made me realise that I can't avoid it. That's why it's been such an emotional journey. I though I wouldn't write it down but I think I can. It was my first time doing yoga since I stopped taking antidepressants. My emotions were all there, no help, just me and them. It's such a relief I was able to do it. I'm so grateful for the guidance.
I thought I would need a few days off but I might be back tomorrow, I feel like doing it. Let's see what happens.
I read many comments and people are so brave for showing up when it hurts the most, it's so inspiring. It made this journey even better. It's incredible.
I don't know what else to say. Once again, thank you so, so much Adriene, it changed the game for me.
I'm sending you all the love, you are incredible♥

Just wrapped up day 30! I truly loved the Journey! Thank you Adriene for bringing me home. My upper body is a bit stronger, my core is getting better, my postured has improved and it's all thanks to you. I love how open and honest this practice was and I'm excited for more videos to come from you.
Dear Adriene, I just wanna thank you, Benji, the team who made the videos and our community. It is just fantastic. I love you all. Love from Vancouver. Namaste. :)

Thank you Adriene to guide us during these 30 days on our journey. I am very fortunate to be part of this community. Also a word of thanks for everyone around you (including Benji :) , who made this happen. I am looking forward to the February calendar ;)
True, Dedicate and now Home - this is my third January full of joy. Thank you very, very, very much, Adriene.

Dear Adriene, I just want to thank you for the amazing journey you created for us. I often feel alone in my little corner of the world, but not today. Today I felt the community, the power of union and the universal love all of us have in the core of our hearts. Today in this silent practice I saw that I am much stronger than I think I am, and though I am by myself in my room and I am the one who has to take this journey, I am not alone. I am truly thankful! Namaste!
Thank you Adriene, I can't believe a month has already gone by! Loved this journey so much. I am really grateful to you.
This was another great journey.  30 in 30 completed.  So thankful for this community.  Oh, and... Today is my 37th birthday.  Namaste.
Day 30 🌱 yes we did it. Day 92 of daily practice

Thank you so much for this journey Adrienne. The past 30 days has changed my life - I feel stronger physically, mentally, spiritually, and emotionally. This was such a lovely practice to reflect on what we did as a community together to get this far, as well as the challenges I faced on the mat. I feel so proud of myself. I cannot thank you enough for helping me take my first step. <3
I love blue healers.  I had the chance of getting close to two Zen and Rainy.  Sooo loving!!!

I am so proud of everyone who made it through the 30 days, including myself! This practice was the best I've gone through and I was inspired to subscribe to Find What Feels Good to continue practicing Yoga with Adrienne! Sound like a commercial, don't I?😜 Anyway, I loved every minute. So inspiring in so many ways!

Loving all the positive comments and the many wonderful people who proudly completed this journey. Amazing work! As for myself... well I made it to the end. But after today's practice I don't feel proud or elated. I couldn't trust myself and cricked my neck trying to figure out what I was supposed to do. Without narration all the evil little voices kept chiding me for doing it all wrong and for still not being able to do things (ahem, boat pose...). Feeling empty and sad after this and like I failed despite actually showing up for myself every day.
January 30 Day Challenge complete AND my 5 year sobriety date on the same day! A great day it is! Way to go everyone, you CRUSHED IT! 🖤

Today's been the most difficult practice of the journey, but it's just because my p.e. teacher told me and my classmates that he's retiring in June, so he won't be with us during our last school year. And I'm honestly shattered, he has such an important role in my life. I've cried during the practice and I'm crying right now. Thank you, Adriene, for making January a special month and for teaching me something new every day, you're so special and I can't wait to keep practicing with you in the next 11 months. I'm proud of myself for practicing yoga every single day, no matter what. It's been a unique, challenging, beautiful experience and I'll carry with me what I've learnt. Namaste, I love you so much.

This is my 3rd “January with Adriene” and I always cry on day 30.  It’s a sacred experience - an such a GIFT to so many. I have to say this was my favourite practise of the month, for many reasons. Primarily, it showed me the ability I have to put together the vocabulary I have learned in a meaningful way.
I was able to give my body exactly what I needed. Before I started, I saw the practise was 40 minutes long, and I was worried about being able to create enough flow on my own for that long. I did use Adriene as a reference a couple of times, but I typically practise with my eyes closed unless I am really confused. I found myself near the end hoping there would be enough time left to fit everything in that I still had in my head.
I cried through the first almost 10 minutes, then a couple more times throughout. It hit me because I have been going to the same yoga class (my first and only studio thus far) with the same guide for over 2 years now, and this week we found out that at the end of February, she is moving, therefore this is our last session of yoga with her. There are so many emotions attached for me because I joined this class two months after moving to the country to live with my fiance, and I was worried I would become lonely and isolated. This class gave me somewhere to go that I felt like I belonged, and I built some beautiful kinship in this class.
I do know that I am lucky enough to work in a city nearby-ish and will be ale to pick up classes there. This just hit me so hard because it is the end of HOME and nearing the end of the last session of yoga with my first ever studio and group.
I am grateful there are more YWA videos and more yoga studios to join.
Namaste. <3
THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!!!!! Words cannot express the feeling <3 so grateful for you & this journey & myself!
Thank you for guiding us on this journey, it has allowed me to feel proud of myself for the first time in years.

What. A. Journey! I always dread the 30th day of these challenges, but decided to face it with an open mind today. I'm also proud of everyone who tried it (no matter if you completed it or not), and proud of Adriene (and super Benji, of course), for keeping us company and guiding us with love, compassion and delicious laughs. On to february we go, ready for new adventures! <3

This last day was a challenge for me, to be honest. I did not understand the 'no voice' concept and I got very frustrated. All my poses were forced and rushed as I kept looking at my screen.
Halfway through I decided to stop and read the comments. They made me realise I did not need to follow every move, but try and make my own practice based on the last 29. So I picked up where I left of and finished!
Even though it did not leave me calm and content, I am glad I really finished the journey. Also there is a lot of learning potential here for me :)

Adrienne, thanks for the past 30 days of yoga and many future days of yoga. As someone who is healing in many ways, including bad elbow tendonitis, this has been my gym. At times, I could barely support my weight, however, with your gentle coaching and "my version" I've been able to hobble my way through the wrist/arm heavy poses. This is the first time in the past few months where my elbows feel stronger and I have hope of getting back to where I was.

I've been here since day one, having tried in the past to carry out different 30 days YWA sessions. This time I've practiced until day 7 and then stopped because of a severe urinary tract infection.
I laughed to myself, because the next day, day 8, was called Heal. So I listened to my body and took my time to heal what was to be healed with pills, because the body knew better that it was the perfect time to begin or continue my healing.
Now I'm coming back and starting the trip again today, when it officially ends. But now, after this month, I do trust myself and Adriene's voice.

Many thanks, Adriene! The seeds you've planted now bear fruit.

Oh my goodness! Where to even begin?! I have done all of your 30 day journeys. Dedicate and now Home are the two that I have done “live” and this one just really resonated with me. True and Yoga Camp have been my two favorites, but Home now has a special place in my heart ♥️ I am so inspired by your love and dedication to the YWA community. I love scrolling through the comments and seeing how everyone is doing in their little corner of the world....it’s truly amazing! As always, Day 30 was emotional, we did it, together 😊 I loved hearing the previous 30 day music themes in this video, brings a smile to my face to know “hey I did that!” Shoutout to Benji for being extra cute and lovable in this video, he needs some treats for being such a good assistant 💕 A huge thank you to Adriene and her entire team, this was an incredible journey Home. I know not only me, but the entire YWA community felt the love and commitment in this series 🥰 I intend to journey Home again in the spring, once baby is born 🤰🏻for now my yoga practice will get more and more simple as this last part of my pregnancy wraps up. Thank you again to Adriene, Benji and the YWA team! Namaste to everyone in their corner of the world 🌎🙏 I will be here in Virginia, on my mat tomorrow...hope to see you there 🙏🥰♥️

Day 30 always has me in tears. There is something so beautiful about surrendering to our most unstoried selves. Today being my 23rd birthday I woke up in a good mood and as soon as I hit the mat I was crying out of sheer joy, at the beauty of the divine grace I have cultivated in these past 30 days and at the collective energy everyone practicing at home is sending by showing up for themselves. We are always growing, but today we are blossoming and thriving. This journey has been such a gift and this particular practice was an amazing way to start my birthday right! Namaste all! I honor the light, grace and beauty within each of you! Thank you for helping me to walk myself home and for letting me walk hike with you as well. Blessings 🙏🕉💖🎉

Just finished. ♥️ I always get apprehensive in the beginning of day 30 like uhh what the heck should I do? How do I transition from this pose to that pose? But I always surprise myself with how much I recollect and really learned throughout the 30 days. And sure sometimes I take a break in child’s pose or look up for guidance. But that’s really such a great metaphor for life, isn’t it? It’s really a beautiful, strengthening, spiritual experience to just trust your mind and your body and surrender to the practice. Thank you adriene. You and your passion for yoga have blessed my life. ♥️ namaste.

I was a bit upset I had to come onto the mat today with the flu and not gonna lie I was in corpse pose for AWHILE but it was the very definition of find what feels good and listen to your body. I’m so much stronger. 4. There’s always time for self care and I need to listen to when I need it. 5. There’s love everywhere !
Well done everyone. We did it ! And thank you Adriene for all you do for us ! ♥️

This was the best session, an hour felt like just a snap. There's always your little voice in a corner of my head :
"Remember, the breath always come first."
"We'll meet in downward facing dog, move at your own pace."
"Here you can a little vinyasa, cobra, or straight to downward dog."
"Hug the lower abs in. You are strong."
"Inhale, halfway lift, exhale, head back down."
"Get back to your breath."
"Hands together at the heart."
"As a globe, as a community, let's take a big breath in, exhale out through the mouse. And we'll end this practice by whispering -Namaste."
Also, I did the boat pose with you -had to pause the video so we were moving together!

I did it all 30 days, everyday despite a lot of things coming in the way of it. Thank you Adriene for the journey you took me on this month.

But I always have a love-hate relationship with day 30 because i really rely on audible instructions because i easily get distracted so this dsy might be the greatest challenge for me especially doing it after a busy day. I managed in a way but it's always my least favorite day sadly. Maybe that will change someday but not this time around.

Same. This was my first day 30, and I think I spent maybe the middle 10 minutes just watching because I was so tired of craning my neck to see what she was doing. It's much more relaxing and gratifying to move smoothly from post to pose by her verbal guidance than to stop each pose and watch to see if she is on to the next thing or not.

Cathy Jean I totally agree. I think my neck ends up hurting from having to watch for cues to move instead of listening to the audio. Halfway through I was ready to quit this video and just do day 1 as my day 30
I'm crying. Thank you, thank you

I started today's practice knowing what to expect but still worried I wouldn't be able to get through a full 40 minutes alone with just my thoughts and my breath. But friends, I did it! Thank you Adriene for having my back and for helping me journey Home! This has been a real one <3

This practice was so eye-opening! I started out trying to follow Adriene pretty closely, but after about 20 minutes, I felt worn out and decided to do my own thing. I had lined up with the video without meaning to!
These last 30 days have taught me so much. I have learned so much about myself, my capabilities, and listening to my body more deeply. I am so grateful to Adriene for all that she is doing for us, and so grateful for the practice of yoga. Congratulations everyone, we made it Home ❤

Wow! What a lovely, healing ride. It's amazing how good it feels just to know I have it in me to follow all the way through, not to mention the physical and psychological warmth that comes along with daily practice :)


I'm grateful to myself for managing to show up, even when it was rough, and for being kind myself on the days when I couldn't give 100%. HOME - day 30/30:
For me, this was honestly probably the most difficult day of this journey out of them all. Last year, I loosely followed both the Dedicate and True 30-day yoga journeys, but skipped the last day when I realised they were silent because I was in a place where I couldn’t be alone with myself... This year, I’m not much better, but I made a commitment and decided to show up for myself even though I knew it wouldn’t be easy. And I did it! Granted, I spent the last 10 minutes lying on my back while thinking about stuff I probably shouldn’t have been thinking about while doing yoga, but I still did it.🤷‍♀️ However, I’ll be looking forward to being guided by your lovely voice again, Adriene.😊 Thank you so much for this experience, and I’m sending love to everyone who completed this journey with me.❤️
Lea Jacobsen your love is received

It is so awesome that you can be honest and know where you truly are, but also not give up completely. Keep going...We gotchu!
Love.

My third year doing this and you never cease to amaze me with your seamless process and heartfelt words of encouragement and guidance. Thanks for sharing your gifts and talents with all of us. Peace. Give Benji my best.

Adriene!!! I'm in tears. I've been participating in your 30 days programs for 5 years now. Every time day 30 comes around I have historically gotten SO FRUSTRATED that the mic is off and you're voice is not there to guide me. This time was different. I took a deep breath and listened to my breath and just had an amazing practice. My gratitude to you and your team is endless. The change you are inspiring is profound. Namaste. <3
Namaste <3

Life goes by so fast. As I read the e-mail "Day 30" my mind rushed: "wait... is that today??? what???? Adriene what". As I hoped on the mat something happened, I started crying like a baby. Relief, pride, a lot of disbelief that I actually pulled that off - but in a good sense, plus all the stress I've been going thru this month moving out of my mother's house (yeah, I've been literally searching for a home)...  It all just came running in tears. This practice really was a journey. I cried, laughed, fell on my ass, tried to do a inversion for the first time (not even close, but we will get there), slipped in sweat, rested. Every single second was pure bliss. It's weird to feel this kind of connection digitally, but I'm so thankful for being a part of this community. And I'm so thankful to be united with me again. Thank you all. Thank you Adriene 💜 I'm truly home :)

Thank you Adriene! Thank You so much for this experience. I will miss mornings with Your loving mails of encuragement.

ahhhh I had such a difficult time today! not having any verbal cues meant I was constantly craning to try and see the video from a variety of weird positions -- downward dog, triangle pose, forward fold... I felt like I could never relax into any posture because I wouldn't know when to come out of it :( part way through I wondered if the point was not to try to follow, since that's so difficult without verbal cues, but to do my own thing? but then I'd look over and see you doing something and wish I was following along properly. I feel like I really would've enjoyed this session with the normal voice over a lot more, although I hear you when you say this is apparently a day 30 tradition.  nevertheless, I am grateful for the HOME series and proud of myself for completing it :)

Dearest Adriene and Benji, Dearest Fellow YWA HOME explorers,
Thank you. What a revelation, what a true, true honor it has been practicing with you all. This series feels special in so many ways and has an enormous impact on my day to day. Normally I am nervous on the self-led Day 30, but I basically ran to the mat this morning. And felt every second. How lucky we are to have Adriene and each other. There is max power in US, yall. Love every one of yous. NAMASTE 💞🙏🏼

I am so proud of myself and everyone else that has gone on this amazing journey home 💜 today has really shown me the power of yoga and daily practice. As today’s practice was closed, I became overwhelmed with emotion because of just how powerful yoga is and makes you feel. Thank you Adriene for guiding me towards something that empowers me to not only take care of my body, but my mind and feel so whole within myself ☮️💜
Wooo go benji excellent downward dog 6:26 show us how it’s done :P

Haven't done day 30 yet, but i wanna say that i'm so honored to be here and i can't believe it's over, i had so much during those 30 days, i laughed, i smiled, i cried, i broke down, but i know that Adriene and the yoga mat have my back, whatever i step on the mat with i step off without, it feels like i'm exploring myself day by day, i know myself more than i used to before this journey. Home where everything begins, the past us created the present us and will create the future us, as you always say that we don't become something that we're not, it's already in us, that meant a lot to me and it kept me thinking "Who's this amazing person inside me? what's new to explore every day? is there a wonderland inside this person that's lost and feels she's missing something?" it's deep to think about but also logical, we have what we need, we don't have to look for it somewhere else. I always tell myself that i basically can't know everything, and it's okay to not know something, i learn, i analyze, i understand, i do, what's the point of life if we don't have something to live for? something keeps us alive everyday, something that we wake up for, and i'm so so so glad to have yoga, to have you and your amazing wisdom, i hope that my words reach you with all my emotions, may my love to yoga, my desire to built strength and blanket myself with love, my ability to be grateful to every little moment, to savor it, to take up space, to take a deep breath, could show you how much i love you Adriene. Thank you for always working hard, you made it happen, and we all did it with love and appreciation, 30 days of Home, is over, and something beautiful will show up after, it's already inside, we just gave it a chance. Love you Adriene, and congrats for 6M, i'm so happy for you😄🎉🎊❤❤
Thank you, Adriene and Benji, for guiding us on this beautiful and soulful journey home. Your words of wisdom and encouragement definitely struck a chord. Namaste.

Oh my, I LOVED this journey Home! I cried on several days throughout the 30 days. It’s as if my body and soul and mind are connecting again. When I cry it’s like my body is saying “YES! Thank you! I needed this! Thank you for loving me enough  to do this and to listen to me.” So good!
So thankful for you, Adriene.  Sobbed when I finished today as it was my first time completing an exercise practice at age 59!

Day 30 is my favorite DAY! You're right. We have all the tools in our bodies. A shout out to everything I've learned here - a new yoga studio opened down from house and my home practice with Adriene enabled me to saunter right in there and fit right in. The two things together right now make me feel like a superhero. I really thank you and your team and Benji, of course, enough! Much love to you and see you on the mat!

When I first pressed play, I was filled with fear. I have never trusted myself or my body; how could I do this without guidance? After a few tearful and panicky moments at the start, I realized that I DID know what to do; my body knew. So, I let go of the fear and trusted my body and mind to guide me where I needed to go. And at the end, I was sobbing in gratitude. My body has always known what to do, I was just too afraid to listen to it. I will NOT forget this powerful lesson. Perhaps I am truly coming home. Thank you so much for this incredibly journey, Adriene, and everyone who worked behind the scenes, and everyone who also came along on our journeys home. Daily yoga will continue, and I'm looking forward to February's playlist. Namaste.

I completed the journey.... it took me a few attempts but I followed a full 30 day from start to finish in the 30 days, which means I’ve practiced yoga every day this year, I’ve made some changes and recognised my worth

I love the moments Adriene pauses to play or kiss Benji, it reminds me that yoga is about being not achieving an outcome

Thank you to the entire crew who makes this happen.  Benji is the real star! I am BEAUTIFUL.  I am HOME"!  Thank you!  Namaste

Adriene, this is my fourth year doing your 30 Day Yoga Journey. Tears rolled down my face as I listened to Dedicate, Revolution and Yoga Camp theme songs throughout this practice. First of all, thank you Adriene for the incredible journey. I've never thought i'll be able to do yoga every single day for 30 days in a roll. I feel stronger everyday. My form is better that than 1. Thank you self for knowing that I wanted to twist a lot today. I added a twist in to every posture, then went to the ground early to support my back. At first I was anxious leaving Adriene's flow, but I knew what I needed and I feel so good for doing it.
Lessons I've learned that I want to thank Adriene for: I don't need to rush into a difficult posture - I just need to revisit it daily and before I even know it, I'll be comfortable and happy there; my days are best when I visit yoga in the morning before work rather than in the evening; I can find my own best practice while still having a guide to be there with me. Namaste and thank you for this beautiful time together.
Thank you, thank you  I so much loved the 30 day challenge. The last day brought tears to my eyes.. Much love🕉🙏❤️🐾

Dear Adriene,

Love the peaceful music and the visual of just you and Benji with the white walls and plants around you. Am going to watch a bit before I practice this last day of HOME

Thank you for this journey, Adriene! You are amazing! I love your channel and your videos, thank you for everything. I’ve been following you and your videos for years now, and I love you.

Thank you Adriene!! This journey was lovely!! In just 30 days I've noticed both physical  and mental benefits. My posture has improved a lot and it's easier for me to connect with my breath and calm down. So I'll keep going! Lots of love from Spain!

What a Beautiful way to start my year💜 Thank you so much Adriene, for this beautiful experience! Today was really emotional for me, I had tears on my eyes throughout the practice! I’m proud of myself, and I’m so thankful... Thank you for what you do Adriene, you make this world a little better✨

I cried the whole time. I didn’t expect to but when you said we already have everything we need, I knew you were right but more so I could feel it in my body. Thank you, thank you! 🙏

I just wanted to say thank you, Adrienne. Your commitment to sharing the beauty of your practice is commendable.
I have always wanted to be able to fit yoga into my routine because I have been rendered very inflexible from four years of lifting with little to no mobility routine.
But I live on a military base in the desert, so needless to say the accessibility of a yoga class is... absent.
That being said I had tried previous practices on youtube but yours was the only one to stick!
With this new year, I finally said to myself I'm going to do this every day, and this journey has been exactly what I needed.
Thank you again!


IF I COULD IMPART SOME CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM THOUGH:
I can't complain about any of the other days but to be frank, this finale was a huge let down for me. Without the audial guided talking us through movements, I found myself constantly cranking my neck in every position to make sure I didn't miss a change or I didn't check enough and was left way behind. Not to mention that all that distraction made it very hard for me to maintain my conscious breathing. All in all, it made me feel very discouraged because I refused to quit. But I just couldn't handle this tempo as a beginner with no audial guide...
I know it is tradition to get rid of mic for last day I just figured you were owed some food for thought :)


Like I said it's been life-changing though and you've earned a routine view EVERY morning now, thank you
Baby Joe The idea is, that you DON’T follow Adriene in this video, you make it your own.

I seriously injured my left knee when I was 14,after that I had to stop most of my physical activities. Long journey of healing began but today on the mat a sharp pain arose from my left knee. I stopped everything, set down with it and allowed the energy to come up into my heart. I could finally feel the sorrow and unloved-ness that was in there, stored. Today the feeling vould come up and I cried all the way to the end of the practice (and finished it fully meanwhile!). I was crying not because of the pain but because now love started to pour in where there was pain before. This is true healing.
We love you Adriene, no words for your beauty, loving heart, sweetness and truth. Thank you and thank you All ❤❤❤❤

This was what I needed, although this year I did the journey watching it on my phone so I had a hard time following along today. I ended up doing my own thing including lizard, pigeon pose, and wide legged forward pose. Another one in the books!
I do a weigh-in every morning. Since January 1st, I've lost 13.2 pounds. Thanks Adriene!
I don't know if I did it right or wrong but for first time in my life I committed to something and finished it thank you for these wonderful 30 days.

This is my fourth (!!!) 30 Day journey with Adriene...wow. I loved hearing the old theme music from past years in the background of this practice. Day 30: Journey. Sniff sniff...Gosh I can't believe that I am a little emotional. But then again, not so much because I am going to continue the journey in February as well. This healing process is not over for me just yet. This was a yummy practice. I stuck with it. I was less shaky today. There was a kind of resolute that I felt in my body and my mind. And I must mention that the music is so amazing. Kudos to the people behind such creation. The pieces were perfectly timed. There were moments where I was slowing down and then the music would rise and give me the much-needed inertia along with bursts of excitement. Thank you so much, Adriene, for taking me through this journey....this journey HOME. I am HOME and I will see you tomorrow. Namaste. ;D

Wow! Thank you. This is the first 30 day journey where I followed my intuition the whole way home. It only took 6 years....

Thank you Adriene for an incredible month of yoga! I am currently making the trip from Western Canada to California and you have been with me on the journey. Seemed fitting that the last day of Home, I finished in the hotel room on the last stop until our destination. This was my first challenge and I will start a previous year tomorrow.

I must say, I almost panicked when you said no microphone but I stayed with it.  I did miss your voice and you reminding me to breathe! I reminded myself halfway through. I also thought it would keep me healthy through the holiday season and winter.  I made it through the holidays with just a short-lived cold.  I feel healthy and stronger now because of it. Thank you so much for this amazing experience, I did it🙌 Day 30 got me, there’s something magical in this way of practicing with you, challenging but touching my heart, tearing up at the end of it 4th year in a row 🥰😆 Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! ❤️💖💕

30 days. Day 30. We did this. I never felt alone. It wasn't always easy. It wasn't always fun. But it was always necessary. And each day brought a growth I didn't even understand. Thank you, Adriene. The last Namaste` is dedicated to all of you. Peace and love.

Thank you Adriene for these 30 days! I'm so grateful for this experience which has made feel at home in my body and in my mind again after a couple of stressful years. 💕 You have reminded me of how powerful yoga can be.

Am practising from Kenya, I have really enjoyed the journey home especially this time for me it's an actual transition in my life and this 30 day yoga practice has really prepared me as I take up a new change in my life.Thank Yu so much 💓💓

This has been the most amazing 30 day challenge I have ever done.  Usually my challenges, or goals that I set around fitness, have been centered around things like running a marathon, biking 150 miles and enduring some kind of pain or burn out.  This challenge has been all about learning to listen to my body and giving myself permission to take a break if needed.  I have taken the skills that I learned off the mat into my daily life and have not looked to be perfect but rather to take time to listen to what I need.  As a mother, wife, and survivor of abuse I have not put much stock into my needs and tend to "stuff it down" to the point where there is no more room for stuffing.  I plan to repeat this entire 30 days and continue to learn how to  listen to my needs and nourish my body and soul.  Thank you Adriene for all you have taught us and for helping me to start the journey home!!!
Love when Benji joins you <3

I’m writing this with such a full heart. When I first started yoga 5 years ago, I was too afraid to practice without a teacher, without a voice, because it would force me to deal with my thoughts and emotions during yoga. But today’s practice took my hand and made me understand that it’s okay. That I’m okay. That my thoughts are just thoughts and they pass, like a cloud in the sky.
Adriene, thank you so much for being there for me. Thank you for teaching me how to be strong and soft, for teaching me how to be alive and unwind. Thank you for this journey, it has been life changing. Namaste from me to you. x

even yesterday i've already noticed so much growth within myself. all thanks to you (and my wish to stick around). and i'll continue sticking around.

Breathe deeply, mindfully, and slowly... and you will find your way HOME 💗 Thank you so much Adriene for sharing this beautiful experience to us all ☺️ May we continue to find growth and happiness on and off the mat 😉 We are HOME now... Namaste 🙏🏻✨

I'm really thankful for this journey 🙏 It's the first ever 30-day journey I stick to, only falling behind when the flu got me. It really was an enjoyable ride back home. At the end of this journey, I really feel like I finally got to know the real me and the full potential of my body. It's great to see the progress along the way, and to feel all emotional at the end. Adriene, Thank You!  Thank You!  Thank You!  For this awesome journey over the past 30 days.  I've grown stronger not just in my body but my mind and spirit.  I'm so grateful to have discovered you last year and to have discovered yoga nearly 15 years ago. Woah, I am so honoured to have been with you on this journey. I even had a little cry from gratitude at the end. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
I stuck with this journey for the full 30 days and now I can't see my day without fitting in my yoga somewhere, definitely a daily practise.

The concept of "finding what feels good" and "leaving the rest" really comforts me. It's like permission to be yourself with no need to fit a square peg in a round hole. I started YWA last year around this time. I alternated between the same 2 beginner videos for about two months straight. I didn't think I was "ready" for a 30 day series. The first series I did was the Dedicate series. It took me around 40 days to complete it. I did the Dedicate series again and this time it took something like 50 days. A lot was going on in my life. I found myself a stranger in a new home. So, then I started the True series. The first time around was about 35 days and the second time doing True was about 32. How long it takes doesn't matter, what is important is how I gripped on to those series during a difficult time in my life. I had a roof over my head but I was never home until I was on the mat. So you can see, as the beginning of Home approached, I felt an intense closeness to it. The mat, my head, my breathing, these are where Home lies within me. Here I am, 30 days in 30 days. It's a small accomplishment in this vast world of yoga but I am so grateful to you, Adriene. You didn't buy me a house but you taught me a Home. Thank you. Namaste.
This is my first time finishing 30 days in 30  days and I totally understand how you feel! Thank you for sharing

I did it! 🎉  When I got to Day 30 of the 30 days of yoga in December, I did not feel confident enough to do the video without the cues, so on that day i picked another video instead of trusting myself. Not sure if I was the only one that kept hearing Adriene  through the practice, "forward fold, half way lift your version, create space, come back to your breath, pedal it out". Many tears this morning. After reading the comments it looks like I have a second helping :) I laughed a little, cried considerably, and said "I am strong" many times (particularly during boat pose). At the beginning of this morning's practice, I was frustrated. I kept turning my mat trying to find a good angle so I could follow you. So frustrating! I even considered just doing another video to end the 30 days. Then I realized that I was stuck on getting it right. I'm new to yoga and thought that there was no way I could get through 40 minutes without following every move as perfectly as possible. Then I surrendered. I followed when I could, caught up when I could, did what I could--trusted myself. I was surprised to see the comments about people getting emotional at the end. Ah, now I understand.

Can't wait for today's practice! I have just LOVED every session these 30 days, and how fitting that I received my Home tank in the mail yesterday! Can't wait to wear it for this final Home practice. Thank you Adriene for all the work you do to help us in our yoga journeys!

Edit after I finished the practice: WOW, I don't know where to begin... When Adriene said, "I'm taking off the mic, you're on your own.", I was unsure what would it turn out to be. But let me tell you this, as soon as I sat down crossed-legged, I had the BEST flow ever! Being able to really focus on my breath and movements in truly my OWN time, because my breath and time are slower than Adriene's, was amazing. I have never felt more open and balanced, and aware during practice until today. That just shows how extraordinary and special Adriene's teachings are. I'm really glad I found her because during this 30 days yoga journey I feel like she's become a close friend. And I'm looking forward to meeting her every day. Again, thank you Adriene for choosing to spread the light you carry in you! Hope to be able to meet you one day. I'll see you tomorrow. Namaste.

I’ve been a longtime lurker but this year I actually did the challenge. I’ve been loving it and falling in love with yoga again.
However... This one freaked my out! I’m so scared of doing flows of my own creation, because I forget so quickly what I’ve just done. Which is why I need someone telling me what to do! I can’t stay with my breath or feel my body properly if I’m constantly checking the screen for where you are, because there are no cues...
So yeah, I didn’t complete the 30 days. But I started.
Take what you need and leave what you don't. I moved so slow today. I showed extra love to my lower back and hips! I'm home 🙏🏾💙

I did two whole seconds of bakasana!! I haven’t been able to make that leap off confidence off the floor...ever. But today it felt right and it was right. Thank you Adriene for being a guiding voice even without the mic.

Today’s practice was incredible... I’ll admit I was a little terrified at the thought of having to guide myself through an entire practice, however I didn’t realise how much I needed it until I began. I could take everything I needed and follow my body through it’s own flow, all the while I still had Adriene’s voice guiding me through in my mind, reminding me to soften, breathe, notice... I have never been more excited for what my yoga journey holds next. Namaste 🙏 💗

I am a wreck. Started crying at the beginning, cried in the middle, cried at the end. I’m so thankful  for this journey, even though I was ready to quit in the middle. My husband encouraged me to keep going, and I’m glad I did. I’m not just stronger physically, but mentally, too. I regained strength that I lost last year due to a herniated disk, and am practicing my inversions again. Work is incredibly stressful this time of year, but I am able to manage my anxiety. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!
Very emotional end to this Journey today.  It's been a long road.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking me through.

Dearest Adriene,
There aren’t words enough to express my gratitude for the light you share with so many of us. The past 30 days have meant so much and I am so thankful. Your kindness and warmth extend so far off the yoga mat, the ripples are felt all over the world. Sending love from Barcelona, Namaste ❤️

I’ve been doing this challenge (my first) every morning before I start my day. It’s become a healthy routine to start the day with, unlike lying in my bed on my phone for an hour. I’ve also been suffering with lower back pain since October, and I can’t tell you how much this daily movement practice has made my back so much stronger and pain-free. I can finally start to get back to my normal activities like strength training. This challenge is the first thing I’ve ever done consistently every day, and I’m so grateful. Thank you!
It was all so sweet. Namaste, everyone.

I started following YWA since last September when my sore back was getting annoying, friends suggested that yoga could help. Over the time I sweat less and less (weather change is one of the reasons of course) , this 30th day of Home have me sweated through my shirt despite it’s 13°c here in Hong Kong (most of the time we’re above 25°c, believe me, it’s cold for us), now I feel warm, refresh and alive, thank you Adriene, namaste 🙏

This was amazing, thank you so much Adriene.

Have you ever felt like nobody was there?
Have you ever felt forgotten in the middle of nowhere?
Have you ever felt like you could disappear?
Like you could fall, and no one would hear?


Well, let that lonely feeling wash away
Maybe there's a reason to believe you'll be okay
'Cause when you don't feel strong enough to stand
You can reach, reach out your hand


And oh, someone will coming running
And I know, they'll take you HOME
Even when the dark comes crashing through
When you need a friend to carry you
And when you're broken on the ground
You will be found


So let the sun come streaming in
'Cause you'll reach up and you'll rise again
Lift your head and look around
You will be found


-You will be found, dear evan hansen


I was listening to this wonderful song fro my favorite musical as I heard the keyword "home" and I had to think right away at this journey. After I finished this one-left-step to enter the home, I have gone through the comment section, reading one by one, make it to some point, slowly and carefully. And first of all, I can tell you, dear soul, these pals truly love you. :) Besides all these delicate and precious love notes, it seems that there is not much left to add. I have chosen this segment of 'Great Dictator’s' speech:
“We have developed speed, but we have shut ourselves in.
Machinery that gives us abundance has left us in want.
Our knowledge has made us cynical.
Our cleverness, hard and unkind.
We think too much and feel too little.
More than machinery, we need humanity.
More than cleverness, we need kindness and gentleness.
Without these qualities, life will be violent, and all will be lost.”
I can also tell that there is one rare contemporary social phenomenon that keeps these precious qualities still running in human beings. That and much more... Don’t you think? ;)
Namaste people <3

Thank you so much Adrienne! I think this is the third time i am doing your 30 days januaries. Everytime i learn something new!
First time i learned that i am able to do daily Yoga for a whole month and realize that even though it only takes half an hour per day, i can observe how my body is changing!
Second time i Sticked with the daily practice into June so i learned that if you make yoga and health a priority, it is pretty easy to stick to it as it so quickly becomes a habit and even if on some days you only squeeze five minutes of practice in, all of them count towards a better mind and body!
This time around i learned to let go and be more okay with it If a posture does not feel well and listen to my body when something is too intense. I realized that the biggest judge of myself was actually me. Thank you so much for taking all of us on your journey Home! Much love ♥️♥️♥️
I always get emotional with you!  you made yoga a part of me!  thank you for everything !  🦋 🧘🏽‍♀️✨🌹💖

I found myself emotional as I just finished this last day of practice and thought I would share. If I have personally learned anything over the last 30 days, it is daily yoga is more a state of mind and less a state of my body. Thank you so so much lovely Adriene. This is my second year of 30 days - last year kicked off practicing yoga (almost) every day. I am on a recovery journey from Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, the benefits to my mind, body and spirit have been truly incredible. Home has been such a magical experience and I have loved every minute of it, yes, even those plank side dips!! I was also crying at the end of today's, with such love and gratitude, and sadness that this beautiful journey has come to an end. But tomorrow is another day, and I look forward to practicing KISS with this beautiful community. From my heart to yours, a huge thank you to you, your team, and everyone else who's been practicing on this beautiful journey to home. Namaste 🙏🏼💚

My home is my favorite place to be so when I decided to do the Home 30 day challenge, it just felt like the right thing to do.  I was not sure if I would make it because I had never committed to 30 days of any physical activity.  I’ve tried a lot but never stuck with them.  Each day was like opening a present at 4am.  Each day I showed up I was amazed at what my body did, each day I showed up I was amazed at the clarity in my mind and each day I showed up I was amazed at myself.  The free flow of today’s practice was great I let my body lead and my mind followed. I did 35 minutes of practice and the last 5 minutes I meditated and gave grateful thanks.  This community has been great and supportive.  Thank you Sweet Adrian and Benji for all you do to inspire, equip and guide us.  Namaste
Thank you for bringing us HOME. This 30 day journey has been exactly what I needed to re-ignite my yoga practice. I will continue to grow my at home practice daily. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
