Thank you so much again for these past 30 days Adriene. Every year during the last practice, when the music from the other 30 days are playing I think back to where I was when I started doing yoga, and all the years since. The first year I did the 30 days in realtime in January was in 2017. I was doing fieldwork abroad in a country where people were very reserved, and had just celebrated Christmas and NYE all alone. The start of the 30 days marked the end of that fieldwork and of being lonely, with my family coming to visit me and traveling with them. I didn't know it at the time, but it would also be the last time traveling with both my parents together, because by the next 30 days in 2018, they were mid-divorce. It was a sad time, but also full of surprises. I had moved back home temporarily after my fieldwork of the year before, and because of the divorce I had to find an apartment. The first day of the 30 days that year, January 2nd, I got the news that I got an apartment. I felt like I was rescued, although that apartment never really started to feel like home. By last year's 30 days, I had just submitted my master thesis, and my defense was during that month. I finally obtained my masters degree and finished university forever. What I didn't know was that I would be here, this year, in a new city in a new country, as a PhD student at a new university and in an apartment that finally feels like home. Although I am far away from my family, my apartment feels like it's mine, and like I belong. That is why this year's theme is so beautifully fitting for my situation. And today is also the day that my sister comes to visit me, so family is not always that far away after all. Again, thank you Adriene for organising this beautiful journey for us every year. As during all the past 30 days, I learned a lot about myself, I laughed and I cried, but this year those were mostly years of happiness and joy.
Lots of love to you and Benji, thanks for this challenge of 30 days all my gratitude

Thank you for another great journey. I have taken part of 30 days of yoga for several years now, however I always fail at the last day. My brain is constantly busy and anxious and only time I can properly silence it is during the guided yoga practice. Trying to do it by myself always leaves me frustrated, I just need someone to tell me what to do. But I'm going to jump straight into older 30 days practices and keep doing them through the spring, as these sessions are so helpful not only to my physical self but the mental well being aswell  specially during winter months.

So beautiful - #fwfg finally got me! thank you Adrienne for your giving spirit, the trust you ask for and the gift you share. Wow. What a final session. Got a little choked up knowing that someone else was up at 6.30am and doing yoga with us. Well actually woke at 6am and got my fairy lights ready, my incense and my candle ready....

I listened to my body and it felt out what I needed. Was super cool to check with Adriene and Benji as he came to get some TLC. You were cuddling him for all of us Adriene. Did a few extra warrior 3's and did my own variation of deep yoga squat with cactus arms in my knees and starfish hands (not sure what to call that variation but it FG) also did some boat dips and some extended legs twists (lit that 🔥 in the tummy). Was in the cuctus armed squat and looked over and saw Adriene doing the boat dips I was rooting her on then she looked at the camera as if she could hear me haha #magic. Then Benji came back for his own downward dog I had to watch him for a second all cute and stuff hehe hope whatever time you do this home session that you enjoy it and love doing it.

Thank you Adriene, and thank you everyone who breathed and sweated together with me. Those last 30 days were very hard for me with a 5-year long relationship that ended and the emotional and organizational turmoil that followed. The word 'home' was difficult because my old flat felt hostile and sad, my friend's place where I stayed felt foreign and empty. But whenever I stepped on the mat, I felt home. I let go of which was no longer serving me and even if it was dreadfully painful I knew it was right and this journey had my back all along. Tomorrow I move into my new apartment and I am just overflowing with thankfulness. You are all amazing and I felt your heartbeats with mine every time I bowed in the end. Love to you all.

I got really overwhelmed about a week ago trying to keep up with the daily practice and i noticed my body and mind growing resentful of it. It started to feel like any other chore. What threw me off completely, was that it the practice wasn't as helpful as it used to be (f.e. the 30 day yoga journey one year ago)... i just couldn't seem to shut my mind up. I know this sounds like a cheap excuse but there was just too much on my plate.. or is at the Moment.
So i started skipping days. I still plan on doing every video in this journey, simply not by its assigned day. 
Because I'm not giving up and I haven't failed just because I adjusted my tempo.... daily yoga is the most beneficial, but know there is still value in doing these practices on my own timeline. Now i just have to let go of my nagging guilt, that i didn´t do what i set out to do. 
Thank you for everything Adriene. You are the best Yoga teacher i could wish for.
Thanks a lot, Adriene. Namaste, everyone.

Day 30! We made it! The intro made me really emotional! This is my first time being consistent in my yoga practice and allowing self care time for myself everyday.
When I started this journey I was packing up my old apartment in my hometown of Stockholm, Sweden, I was stressed out and over worked. Today - 30 days later I’m waking up in my new apartment in a small mountain town in northern Sweden, looking out over the mountains and starting to feel like myself again. This journey really took me Home. Thank you, Adriene!
Welcome home!💕

This journey has been about so much more than the yoga for me. It's been about dancing to my favourite songs every morning, deleting instagram on my phone and journaling every night. It's been about intense growth in ways I wasn't expecting. I came to the mat 30 days ago feeling a bit lost about career choices, life choices, the future. But something happened just a few days ago: I listened to my intuition and realised that I already had it within me. For the first time in like forever I feel like I'm on the right path, the path home, and I've decided to just go for it. Boldly. Thank you Adriene for being the best humble guide anyone could ask for, thank you Benji for being such an icon, and thank you to everyone in this beautiful community for making it feel like home! ❤🏡 Let's take on the world! ✨

I just wanted to hop on and say a big thank you for this incredible gift that you give to us all. My 'Namaste' at the end of each session is so deeply heartfelt.
I am recovering from a neurological condition, I have numbness and crazy neurological sensations in my feet and legs along with some loss of control and weakness. Generally when I step back on my yoga mat my heart sinks and I fill with frustration as I struggle to move in the same way that I use to.
With the 'Home' theme it has been the first time that I can get on my mat and meet myself exactly where I am without all of the frustration. I am enjoying yoga again, which is huge and have enjoyed the daily practice.
I am only half way through, but I wanted to send you my heartfelt thanks. Your work is a blessing to so many people Adriene, thank you for shining your light 💞🌈🌞💞

Adriene, I have a travel day today but hope to complete day 30 from a hotel room in Dublin later. I just wanted to thank you for this experience. I have surprised myself, firstly for getting up at 6am every morning to come to the mat (unheard of) but also by how this has made me feel - I haven't always been able to complete everything but I've had a good shot and it's made me feel much better in body and mind and not just during practice, for the whole of the rest of the day. I am definitely going to continue and have subscribed now to FWFG. Your calm, encouraging manner is so important and your love for yoga shines through. I have enjoyed the 'community' feel too even though I haven't met any of you - I've loved finding out how everyone else is getting on! I am not one bit surprised that you have exceeded 6 million subscribers - you are very good at what you do and you are making a huge difference by offering this gift of free yoga to people across the globe - it's amazing! And then there's Benji who is adorable too. Anyway, thank you again Adriene and namaste xx😍🙏🧘‍♀️
